The second full-length release for the British indie rock singer-songwriter was produced by Bramwell Bronte.
The second release from the Californian indie singer-songwriter has more of a pop feel than her 2011 debut, Tragedy.
The third full-length release from Kevin Martin as The Bug features guest appearances from Copeland, Death Grips, Flowdan, Gonjasufi, Liz Harris, Manga, Miss Red, and Warrior Queen.
The Canadian garage rock duo's second full-length album includes a cover of The Gun Club's "For the Love of Ivy."
The debut full-length release for the Brooklyn indie rock band was mixed by Dan Carey.
The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles jazz saxophonist features his ten-piece band, as well as a 32-piece orchestra, and a 20-person choir.
The latest full-length solo release for the Sonic Youth guitarist features contributions from Deb Googe, Jem Doulton, James Sedwards, Sonic Youths Steve Shelley and Negativland's Jon Leidecker.

recordname: New Amerykah Part Two: Return of the Ankh
description: Unlike New Amerykah Part One: 4th World War, the follow-up is the opposite of the 2008 release, with songs about relationships and love and with a more analog sound.
The debut full-length release for Brittney Parks as Sudan Archives features influences from electronic, R&B and African music.
The mixtape was released as a free download on Frank Ocean's Tumblr.
The blues legend releases his latest album produced by T Bone Burnett.
The full-length debut release for the Philadelphia rock quintet was produced by the band's bassist Hart Seely.
The third full-length album for the metal quartet from Miami was produced by the band's guitarist, Kurt Ballou.
The fifth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was inspired in part by a 2009 short story by Lebanese-American poet and essayist Etel Adnan.

recordname: In The 7th Moon, The Chief Turned Into A Swimming Fish And Ate The Head Of His Enemy By Magic
description: The latest album for the supergroup of 25 musicians from the Democratic Republic of the Congo features both traditional and contemporary instruments.
The fourth full-length release for the Kristin Hayter solo project was inspired by the religious communities in rural Pennsylvania.

recordname: I've Been Trying to Tell You
description: The 10th full-length release for the British trio of Sarah Cracknell, Bob Stanley and Pete Wiggs was recorded remotely with field recordings and samples from 1997-2001.
The five-track EP is the debut release from the collaboration between Hudson Mohawke and Lunice.
The latest solo release from the former Husker Dü singer was written in solitude.
The second full-length studio release for the Memphis singer-songwriter was self-produced and mixed by Craig Silvey.
The sixth and final studio release for the rapper was completed with the help of Jon Brion.
The third full-length studio release for the country singer-songwriter was produced by Jay Joyce.
The first solo outing for Portishead's Beth Gibbons finds her teaming up with former Talk Talk bassist Paul "Rustin' Man" Webb on a largely acoustic, melodic collection of 10 tracks.

A former member of Billy Childish's band Thee Headcoatees, Holly Golightly has gained a wider following in recent months due to her guest appearance on The White Stripes' 'Elephant.' New devotees will have a lot to discover: this is her ninth solo album since 1995.
The sixth studio release for the Boston singer-songwriter is her first on the Sacred Bones label.
The fifth full-length studio release from the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from Blood Orange, JPEGMAFIA, Obongjayar, and Run The Jewels.
The latest full-length studio release for the Los Angeles post-hardcore quintet was produced by Ross Robinson.
The debut solo release for the Pipettes' Gwenno Saunders is sung in Welsh except for one track in Cornish.
The fourth album for the Minnesota-based artist features guests David "Stokley" Williams, Chuck D, Freeway, and Joell Ortiz.
The fourth full-length release for Toronto punk band PUP was produced with Peter Katis.
The seventh release for Berlin-based IDM producer Chris Clark was recorded in a barn in rural England.
The second full-length release for Julie Campbell as LoneLady is her first in five years.

recordname: My Father Will Guide Me Up a Rope to the Sky
description: Releasing their first album in 1983, the New York City post-punk band's new album picks up where they left off with the dark vision, intense rhythms and musical intensity that made them trailblazers for the industrial music movement.
The sixth full-length release for the Colombian experimental producer features spoken-word sections she created with Henry Andersen.
The first live release for the indie rock band was recorded at Paris' La Cigale on March 20th, 2015.
Stockholm-based Alex Willner continues his ambient techno style on his third album.
The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame producer/musician from New Orleans releases his first major jazz album produced by Joe Henry.
The third full-length release for the Washington DC punk duo of Amy Farina and Ian MacKaye is their first album in six years.
Steve Albini produced the fifth album for the New Jersey punk trio.
The third full-length solo release for Harry Styles was recorded in Los Angeles, Tokyo and the United Kingdom.
The 12th full-length studio release for the Chicago indie rock band Wilco was recorded live at their loft with little overdubs.
The first album for Costello with the Imposters since 2008's Momofuku was co-produced Sebastian Krys and features a guest appearance from Burt Bacharach.
Championed by Jay-Z and Kanye West, the Chicago MC finally makes his full-length debut with this 16-track disc.
The sixth full-length release for the folk-blues band is a concept album focuses on a young woman named Navita as she travels through a burning city and learns who she really is.
The ninth solo album for the former punk rocker was produced by Tony Visconti.

The fifth full-length studio release for the Canadian punk band continues the story of David Eliade (the character in the song "David Comes to Life") and features contributions from Jennifer Castle, J Mascis, Owen Pallett, and Lido Pimienta.
The third full-length release for the Detroit rapper features Ab-Soul, A$AP Rocky, Charli XCX, Freddie Gibbs, Purity Ring, Schoolboy Q, Scrufizzer, and Zelooperz as guests.
The 10th full-length studio release for Arizona duo Calexico was recorded at Sergio Mendoza's home studio and features vocals from Gaby Moreno and Jairo Zavala.
The tenth full-length studio release for the North Carolina Alternative rock band led by Mac McCaughan is said to be a darker album than 2010's Majesty Shredding.

recordname: Trust in the Lifeforce of the Deep Mystery
description: The second full-length release for the London-based jazz trio of Max Hallett, Shabaka Hutchings and Dan Leavers features a guest appearance from Kate Tempest.

Originally recorded in 2000 for A&M Records, the "lost" album (including "Top of the World" and "Truth #2" covered by the Dixie Chicks on its 2002's release) is newly mixed by Glyn Johns and features Emmylou Harris on "Truth #2".
The collaboration between Mavis Staples and Levon Helm was recording at his Woodstock studios during the summer of 2011.
This is the second album for the Peter Silberman-led band.

recordname: Like the River Loves the Sea
description: The seventh full-length solo release for the Kentucky-based singer-songwriter was produced with Sir James Elkington and recorded in Iceland.
the third full-length release for the New York indie rock band was self-produced and recorded.
The surprise release for Donald Glover features guest appearances from 21 Savage, Ariana Grande, and SZA.

recordname: We Rose from Your Bed with the Sun in Our Head [Live]
description: Originally released as a limited 1,000 copy run, the live album features recordings from the band's 2010-11 tour for its 2010 release, My Father Will Guide Me up a Rope to the Sky.
The hip-hop collective's eighth album is their first for Def Jam records, and also features the return to the group of rapper Malik B.
The fourth full-length studio release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from BBK, D Double E, ASAP Nast, JME, Novelist, Wiley, Pharrell Williams and Young Lord.
The fourth full-length solo release from the Manchester-based electronic producer features Alison Skidmore on vocals.

The saxophonist worked with a 12-piece band that included such artists as Arcade Fire's Sarah Neufeld, Saltland's Rebecca Foon, Greg Fox of Liturgy, Megan Stetson on his reimagination of Górecki's Symphony No. 3.
The latest release from GBV is a continuation of the band's new, more polished sound introduced on 1999's 'Do The Collapse.'
Produced by Jack Frost, the 35th studio album from the singer-songwriter was released in 2012, the 50th anniversary of his debut album.
The third full-length release for the Austin duo of Charlie Martin and Will Taylor was produced with Ben Littlejohn.
The fifth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter features new sparser recordings with just her voice and guitar of several tracks from 2019's All Mirrors.
The fourth full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was self-produced.
The rap album for the Black Hippy member is his debut full-length solo release on the Top Dawg Entertainment label.
With the end of The White Stripes, Jack White releases his debut solo album about love and relationships gone wrong.

The debut full-length release from the band that includes Smith Westerns' Max Kakacek and Julien Ehrlich as well as Will Miller, Malcolm Brown, Print Chouteau, Josiah Marshall and Charles Glanders was produced by Foxygens Jonathan Rado.
The Montreal band's Sub Pop debut was co-produced by Modest Mouse's Isaac Brock.

If the concept of "The Beatles, remixed" saddens you, know that original Beatles producer George Martin was at the helm for this project, which serves as the soundtrack to the Vegas-based Cirque du Soleil show of the same name. The 26 mashed-up tracks here were augmented with additional instrumentation and vocals performed by The Beatles themselves, culled from hours of original demo and master tapes, with pieces of 130 songs ultimately represented in some form.
Erykah Badu, Laura Darlington, Niki Randa, Thundercat, and Thom Yorke guest on the fourth release for the California electronic producer.
The first full-length album of new material in 17 years from the country legend was produced by Brandi Carlile and Shooter Jennings.

recordname: Stranger Things, Vol. 1 [Original Television Series Soundtrack]
description: The first volume of the soundtrack to the Netflix show from Kyle Dixon & Michael Stein feature 36 tracks.
The first solo releases in nine years from electronic producer Stefan Kozalla features guest appearances from Caribou, Apparat, Hildegard Knef, Matthew Dear, Ada, Milosh, and Dirk von Lotzow.
The second full-length major studio release for the Massachusetts indie rock band led by Sadie Dupuis was produced with Nicolas Vernhes.
The third album from the Brooklyn quartet includes influences from country, psych, and rock music.
The second full-length release for Washington D.C.-based Bartees Strange is his first on the 4AD label.
The second album for Cleveland's Cloud Nothings was produced by Steve Albini.
The country singer's second 2006 album is another change-of-pace: a disc full of love songs produced by Alison Krauss.

The eighth full-length release from the rock band led by Ryan Key and produced with Neal Avron features guest appearances from Alex Gaskarth of All Time Low, Tay Jardine of We Are The In Crowd, and Cassadee Pope of Hey Monday.
The third album for the Los Angeles-area punk-rock band.
The latest full-length release for country singer-songwriter Miranda Lambert features a guest appearance from The B-52's.
The eighth full-length release for the Australian psychedelic rock group was created to flow seamlessly to each following track and be able to be played in a infinite loop.
The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Neko Case, k.d. lang and Laura Veirs was produced by Tucker Martine.
The second full-length release for the British R&B artist features guest appearances from Kwabs and SiR.

The second full-length studio release for the Compton rapper features guest appearances from Bricc Baby, Burnt Out, Drake, The Homegirl, Kamaiyah, Lil Wayne, Joe Moses, Nipsey Hussle, Sad Boy, and Slim 400.
The latest release for the alternative rock artist features guest appearances from Josh Homme, Greg Dulli and Duke Garwood.

The second full-length release for the Australian electronic band comes 16 years after its debut album Since I Left You with features guest appearances from Ariel Pink, David Berman, Jean-Michel Bernard, Biz Markie, Danny Brown, Camp Lo, Jonathan Donahue, Warren Ellis, Jennifer Herrema, Father John Misty, MF Doom, Paris Pershun and Toro y Moi.
The debut full-length release for Whatever the Weather, the side project for London-based electronic producer Loraine James features more ambient sounds.
The first full-length studio release in eight years for the British punk collective was recorded near the Joshua Tree desert.
The first new full-length solo release in six years for the guitarist was produced with his son, Joachim Cooder.
This is the debut four-track release for black metal/post-metal project that includes Colin Stetson, Liturgy's Greg Fox, Shahzad Ismaily, and Toby Summerfield.
The third release for the British musician is a companion piece to the film he wrote and directed, also named Ill Manors.
The Brooklyn-based hip-hop legends return with their eighth studio album.
The Christian rockers return with their fifth album of metalcore, the first release without founding member Aaron Gillespie.
This is the third LP for the German electro-pop outfit led by vocalist Valerie Trebeljahr and guitarist Markus Acher (also of The Notwist).
The third album for the Scottish rockers is already a big hit with UK music fans, helped by the success of lead single "You Held the World in Your Arms."

recordname: White Men Are Black Men Too
description: The follow-up for the Edinburgh trio's Mercury-winning debut release was recording while on tour.
The full-length collaboration between Anderson .Paak and Bruno Mars was inspired by 1970s funk, soul and R&B music.

recordname: Visions of Us on the Land
description: The 12th release for the Seattle indie singer-songwriter is the final album in his trilogy of albums that began with 2012's Maraqopa and was produced by Richard Swift.

The fifth full-length release for Philadelphia artist features guest appearances from BFLY, Black Quantum Futurism, Brother May, Elucid, Antonia Gabriela, Dudù Kouate, lojii, Maassai, Elaine Mitchener, Nappy Nina, Pink Siifu, Saydah Ruz, Orion Sun, and Yatta.

recordname: Between My Head and the Sky
description: The first album credited to the Yoko Ono Plastic Ono Band since 1975 features Keigo "Cornelius" Oyamada, Yuka Honda (of Cibo Matto), and her son/producer Sean Lennon.
The second full-length release for Elizabeth Bernholz as Gazelle Twin includes production from Benge.
The third full-length release for the singer-songwriter features influences from electronic, folk, pop, surf and punk music and was co-produced with Paul Butler.
The latest release for the Michigan noise rock band includes contributions from former members Aaron Dilloway, Mike Connelly, and new guitarist James Baljo.
The debut full-length release for the pop singer-songwriter features production from Dan Nigro, Alexander 23, and Jam City.
The third album for the British rock quintet was produced and recorded by the band.
The 10th full-length studio release for the Scottish post-rock band was produced by Dave Fridmann and features contributions from Atticus Ross and Colin Stetson.
The former lead singer of the Britpop band Gene returns with his debut solo album.
Bassist Stephen Bruner collaborated with Flying Lotus on his second release infused by jazz, soul, and electronic music elements as Thundercat.
The longtime New York indie band returns with another album of garage-rock and experimental instrumentation with its album, Lisbon.
The 12th full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was inspired by the highway that runs through Florida and Texas.

The latest solo release for the Afrobeat artist features influences from jazz music with the backing of an 11-piece ensemble that included Damon Albarn, Mathias Allamane, Indy Dibongue, Jean Phi Dary, Jean Jacques Elangue, Nicolas Giraud, Yann Jankielewicz, Remi Sciuto, Vincent Taurelle, and Daniel Zimmermann.
This is the third full-length release from Ren Schofield's electronic project named LP.
The sixth solo release for the singer-songwriter was self-produced and includes contributions from Doug Wieselman and Indigo Street.
The fourth full-length studio release for rapper Push T features guest appearances from Jay-Z, Kid Cudi, Labrinth, Lil Uzi Vert, Malice, Don Toliver, Pharrell Williams, and Ye.
The second full-length solo release for the Kentucky singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Yelawolf and was co-produced with Oran Thornton.

recordname: Pick Me Up Off the Floor
description: The seventh full-length solo studio release for the singer-songwriter features songs that were not included on 2016's Daylight Again.
The New York quintet release an experimental and electronic-heavy fifth album.
The first album in over a decade for the duo of Catherine Irwin and Janet Beveridge Bean features contributions from such artist as Sarah Balliet, Warren Ellis, Morgan Geer, and Evan Patterson.
The fourth full-length release for the Danish post-punk band features a guest appearance from Sky Ferreira and was produced by Nis Bysted.
The third solo release for the former Delgados band member was produced by her husband, Paul Savage.
This is the second full-length studio release for the Edinburgh-based hip-hop trio of Alloysious Massaquoi, Kayus Bankole, and Graham Hastings.
The debut full-length release for the Washington, DC punk band was produced by Kevin Erickson.
The debut full-length release for Chicago noise rock trio Horsegirl was recorded by John Agnello.

recordname: The Besnard Lakes Are The Dark Horse
description: Album number two for the Canadian indie-rockers is their first for Jagjaguwar.

Nick Cave brings the experiences and sounds of his 30-year career to the table with the second release from his latest musical project since the Bad Seeds, with more of the trademark soaring piano, crunchy guitar, violins and mandolins to create an experimental new album.
The ninth full-length studio release for British alternative rock band Elbow was recorded at the Theatre Royal Brighton.
The third full-length release for the New Zealand singer-songwriter was produced by Trey Pollard and Matthew E. White.

The debut full-length studio release for the Australian rapper features guest appearances from Alien, Blue Lab Beats, Boadi, Jace XL, Krown, Lori, Mandarin Dreams, SILENTJAY, Steam Down, Sunburnt Soul Choir, Thando, Mwanje Tembo, Theresa Mutale Tembo, Whosane, and Ecca Vandal.
The fourth full-length release for Margaret Chardiet as Pharmakon was recorded live in studio by Uniform's Ben Greenberg.
The latest solo release for the singer-songwriter is his first on the Matador label.
The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced with Fabian Prynn.
Originally released in 2010 on Secret City Records, the debut full-length album for John O'Regan of the D'Urbervilles is rereleased on Astralwerks.
The British rock band uses a vast variety of musical instruments and styles for its second album.
After several years in Spain, Jace Clayton returns to New York with his latest album of electronic mixes.

recordname: New Amerykah: Part One (4th World War)
description: Erykah Badu's latest album was produced by 9th Wonder, Madlib, Mike "Chav" Chavarria, and Bilal.
After both rapping and producing on other artists' records, double-threat Blueprint finally combines his talents on his first solo disc. Aesop Rock, Illogic and Vast Aire guest.

The Brooklyn-based collective (on this release, reduced to the duo of Avey Tare and Panda Bear) combine vocal harmonies, a pair of acoustic guitars, and diverse influences into a unique sound on this latest release.
'Escondida' marks the first solo studio disc for the Texas-born folk singer-songwriter who also co-founded the Canadian group The Be Good Tanyas.

recordname: Good News For People Who Love Bad News
description: Produced by Dennis Herring (Camper Van Beethoven), the latest release from the Seattle-based indie rockers sees a return of guitarist Dann Gallucci (last with the band on Sad Sappy Sucker) and a new drummer (Benjamin Weikel) as well as a guest spot from the Dirty Dozen Brass Band.

This 3-disc attractively-packaged retrospective on the groundbreaking New York band includes completely remastered tracks from each of their studio LPs as well as the same previously-unreleased-on-CD demos and new tracks included on the earlier 2-disc Sand In the Vaseline complilation. Also included are never-before-released alternate versions of five songs. The set also contains a DVD with an updated version of the Talking Heads music video compilation Storytelling Giant, with three additional videos not found on the original VHS release.
The duo of Kix Brooks and Ronnie Dunn return with a follow-up to 2001's 'Steers and Stripes.'

recordname: Me & Giuliani Down By the School Yard (A True Story) [EP]
description: Search engines hate them, but !!! (pronounced "Chik Chik Chik," of course) are popular with live audiences for their funkier, dancier (yes, that's a word--trust us) approach to indie music. The Sacramento band shares three members with Out Hud, and this is their 2-song debut for Touch And Go (with a full album to follow in 2004).

This is the debut album for in-demand hip-hop production duo The Neptunes, recording with Shay under the name N.E.R.D. (for "No One Ever Really Dies"). Note that there are two different versions of this album in circulation. The original version, featuring mainly electronic instrumentation, was intended for release in August 2001 but was shelved by the band (only to be released in the UK over the band's objection). This new version, released March 2002, was completely rerecorded, and features live instrumentation by Minneapolis funk band Spymob.
Brothers Nick and Stephen "Tin Tin" Duffy return for the Lilac Time's sixth LP. The Barenaked Ladies' Stephen Page also contributes to the album.
The ninth full-length studio release for the German electronic composer/producer was recorded in his studio in the East Berlin Funkhaus building.
London-based singer-songwriter Nilüfer Yanya worked with Wilma Archer, Jazzi Bobbi, Bullion, and Andrew Sarlo for her second full-length release.
Sweden's Lykke Li continues to disarm listeners with her distinctive voice on her second album, keeping in tune with her tough sensuality and pop whimsy.
The third full-length release for the indie rock band led by Lawrence (frontman for Felt and Denim) was produced with Papernut Cambridge's Ian Button.
Released separately in 2010 as three vinyl records, Forest of Evil, Liberation Through Hearing, and Voices of Dust are released together with additional tracks as a three-CD set for 2011.
J. Tillman, the former drummer for Fleet Foxes releases his debut solo album as Father John Misty.
The seventh full-length release for the Jason Quever-led project Papercuts was self-recorded.
The second full-length release for the British folk quintet led by singer Nicola Kearey was produced by the band's guitarist Ian Carter.
This is the first studio album in nine years for the Chapel Hill, North Carolina, indie rock band Superchunk.

recordname: And Then Nothing Turned Itself Inside-Out
description: Aside from the noisy "Cherry Chapstick," the tracks on And Then Nothing showcase a mellower sound for the Hoboken, NJ three-piece, which disappointed some long-time fans but certainly won over critics.
The second full-length release for the Meg Duffy project was produced with Brad Cook.
The debut full-length release for the Canadian DJ/producer features a guest appearance from Alexa Dash.
The New York rapper produced ten of the 15 tracks on his second full-length solo album that also features production from The Alchemist, The Arch Druids, Q-Tip, and Ray West.
This is the debut full-length release for the Los Angeles trio of Sade Sanchez, Ellie English and Irita Pai.
The Detroit techno artist's latest release includes guest appearances from Amp Fiddler, Andres, and José James.
The rapper's follow-up to 2002's love-it-or-hate-it 'Electric Circus' was produced largely by Kanye West. For some reason, John Mayer guests.
This is the fourth album for the North Carolina rock trio who at one time were in a band with Justin Vernon named DeYarmond Edison.
The third full-length studio release for R&B singer-songwriter Kehlani features guest appearances from Ambré, Justin Bieber, Blxst, Jessie Reyez, Syd, and Thundercat.
This is the second full-length studio release for the Melbourne, Australia-based post-punk band formed by Dan Stewart and Mikey Young.
The eighth full-length studio release for the British indie rock trio was recorded at the Foo Fighters' Los Angeles studio and was self-produced.
The debut full-length release for the British band led by Sydney Minsky-Sargeant was produced by Ross Orton.
The sequel to 2011's Something About April features guest appearances from Bilal, Karolina, Raphael Saadiq, and Stereolab's Laetitia Sadier.
This is the first album to feature DJ Quik and Kurupt together.
The sixth release of acoustic instrumentation and electronics for the Brooklyn-based duo was self-recorded, edited, and mixed.
The sixth full-length release for New York City indie artist Mitski was produced by Patrick Hyland.
The second full-length release on Warner Music Nashville for the country artist was produced by Jay Joyce.
This is the first album since Jason Isbell left the band to pursue a solo career.
The Atlanta metal band's first album that is not a concept release was produced by Mike Elizondo.

recordname: A Winged Victory for the Sullen
recordauthor: A Winged Victory for the Sullen
description: The duo of Dustin O'Halloran and Stars of the Lid's Adam Wiltzie release their debut album as A Winged Victory for the Sullen.
The retro-soul rock quartet, featuring an eight-piece horn section, offers up a funky blend of R&B and blues reminiscent of early J. Geils Band, James Brown, and Otis Redding.
The debut full-length release for the indie pop/rock quartet formed at the University of Auckland was produced by the band's guitarist Jonathan Pearce.
The latest full-length covers release from the Welsh artist was co-produced by Ethan Johns and Mark Woodward.
The second full-length release for the Scottish singer-songwriter was recorded by Julie McLarnon.
The eighth solo release for the Nashville-based California singer-songwriter was self-produced and was recorded at Dan Auerbach's Easy Eye Studio.
The debut full-length release for the Malian band was co-produced by Yeah Yeah Yeahs Nick Zinner and Marc-Antoine Moreau.
The indie supergroup, featuring Carrie Brownstein and Janet Weiss of Sleater-Kinney, releases its debut power pop album.
The Norwegian band led by Jorgen Munkeby has a sharper metal edge than Jaga Jazzist, which was Munkeby's previous band.
The Canadian electronic artist releases his follow-up to his Polaris Music Prize-winning album Andorra.
The third album for the son of Steve Earle was produced with Skylar Wilson.

Don't be fooled by the title: While 'Identity Crisis' would have perfectly suited her poorly-received predecessor, 2001's Glen Ballard-produced 'Love, Shelby,' that's not the case here, as these 12 self-produced tracks are more likely to connect with fans of her breakthrough disc 'I Am Shelby Lynne.'
The Ontario, Canada band makes its Sub Pop (and U.S.) debut with this, their second LP, which mixes alternative rock with punk and soul.

The veteran Britpop outfit's first new album in four years is the result of tumultuous recording sessions in Morocco with producer Fatboy Slim, which saw a growing dispute between co-founders Damon Albarn and Graham Coxon culminate in Coxon's departure from the band. Fatboy Slim only wound up producing two tracks, with William Orbit handling some of the others.

Don't know Bonnie "Prince" Billy? You may know him better by his given name, Will Oldham, who recorded under his name as well as Palace Music throughout the 1990s. This is his third album under the Billy moniker, and features contributions from members of Lambchop.
Beck's "official" follow-up to 'Odelay' is an even more eclectic mix of soul, electro, funk, folk, rock, and hip-hop, including more than one song that sounds an awful lot like Prince.
The London-based art-rockers led by Eddie Argos make their official debut with this 12-song effort.

This self-titled disc is the first release for the new project from Nick Cave, who adds "guitar player" to his CV. Seeing as how most of the Bad Seeds join in as well, we're still not sure why the new name was necessary. (Actually, it sounds even more like their earlier band, The Birthday Party.)
The second album for the producer/singer was produced with Chrstopher "Tricky" Stewart and features guest appearances by Kanye West, Mariah Carey, and Lil Jon.
The debut solo release for the lead singer of Antony And The Johnsons was produced by Oneohtrix Point Never and Hudson Mohawke.
The third album for the Brooklyn-based duo who met at the School of the Arts Institute of Chicago.

recordname: Down Where the Spirit Meets the Bone
description: Produced with Tom Overby and Greg Leisz, the 11th studio release for singer-songwriter includes a song based on a poem by her father, Miller Williams.
The eighth studio release from the Nashville singer-songwriter was co-produced with Doug Lancio and Barry Walsh.
The third release for the Malian Tuareg group features former Tinariwen's singer Wonou Walet Sidati.
This is the first release of Latin soul with Alice Russell and Quantic.
The second full-length solo release for Talk Talk's Paul Webb as Rustin Man contains music from the same sessions as Drift Code.

The second full-length release in 2019 for the British jazz trio was recorded at the same sessions as Trust In The Lifeforce Of The Deep Mystery and features a guest appearance from poet Joshua Idehen.

recordname: Twenty-Five for the Rest of Our Lives
description: This is the second full-length album for the Los Angeles rock band led by brothers Andy and Joey Siara.
The third album for the German techno artist features Animal Collective's Noah Lennox (aka Panda Bear) and !!!/LCD Soundsystem's Tyler Pope as guest artists.

recordname: You Could Have It So Much Better
description: The Scottish band's eagerly-awaited follow-up to their acclaimed self-titled debut is preceded by yet another insanely catchy single, "Do You Want To."
The latest release for the band led by Steve Wynn features a guest appearance from The Long Ryders' Stephen McCarthy and was recorded in an 80-minute studio session.
The second full-length release for the Detroit post-punk band was recorded in one weekend by Bill Skibbe and Jessica Ruffins.
The Bronx's Joby Ford produces the Sacramento-based hard rock band's third full-length album.
The Southern rockers make their major-label debut with this 12-track effort.
The eighth full-length studio release for the Oakland, California-based metal band led by Matt Pike was produced by Kurt Ballou.
Alejandra Deheza and Benjamin Curtis were working on the Brooklyn band's fourth (and now final) album when Curtis died from lymphoma in December 2013.
The debut full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Jay-Z, Travis Scott and The-Dream.
The San Francisco, California-based duo releases its sophomore album.
The third full-length release for the Memphis R&B/soul singer-songwriter was produced by Scott Bomar.
The seventh full-length studio release for British indie electronic group features production from Rodaidh McDonald and Philippe Zdar.

The fifth full-length release for the Malian folk band features guest appearances from Majid Bekkas, Afel Bocoum, Abdoulaye Diabate, Casey Driessen, Dom Flemons, Yasel González Rivera, Habib Koite, and Michael League.
The second full-length release for the New York post-punk band led by John Eatherly was produced by Patrick Wimberly.
The first solo release in nearly 20 years for the British singer-songwriter who was also the frontman for Haircut One Hundred was produced with his son Oliver, Ian Shaw, and Phillip Taylor.
The fourth full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Nile City Sound and recorded live to tape in five days.
The third album for the country duo of Jennifer Nettles and Kristian Bush.

The fourth full-length release for Josh Tillman as Father John Misty was written mostly in New York, including a two-months at a hotel and features contributions from Dave Cerminara, Haxan Cloak, Natalie Mering of Weyes Blood, Jonathan Rado, Trevor Spencer, and Jonathan Wilson.
This is the debut full-length release for the British septet was recorded live over seven days with producer Andy Savours.
Remixed by Jamie XX, R&B and hip hop samples are added to Gil Scott-Heron's 2010 album I'm New Here, creating this latest release.
The latest full-length release from Elvis Costello And The Imposters features a guest appearance from Nicole Atkins.
John Darnielle recorded this 13-track Mountain Goats disc with the help of musicians John Vanderslice, Peter Hughes, Franklin Bruno and Scott Solter.
The second full-length release for Berlin-based experimental electronic artist Joe Seaton features the clarinet and oboe played by his father, David Seaton.
The second full-length release for the the Toronto-based rock band led by Shehzaad Jiwani was produced by Mike Rocha.
The third full-length release for the music project of Merrill Garbus was produced by John Hill and Malay.
The soul singer tackles 14 country tunes with the help of producer Buddy Miller and guests Emmylou Harris, Gillian Welch, Dolly Parton, Patty Loveless And Patti Griffin.
This is the debut full-length release for the British post-punk quintet that includes Charlie Steen, Sean Coyle-Smith, Eddie Green, Josh Finerty, and Charlie Forbes.
The second collaboration between Scott Walker and Sunn O))) is a five-track album produced by Scott Walker and Peter Walsh.
The German electro-experimenters return with a follow up to last year's 'Niun Niggung.'
The second and final full-length release for the Australian garage punk band with its lead singer Shogun, who left the band in 2014, but agreed to finish this sophomore album.
The ninth full-length release for producer Daniel Lopatin features contributions from Anohni, James Blake, Eli Keszler, Kelsey Lu, and Prurient.

recordname: A Brief Inquiry into Online Relationships
description: The third full-length release for the British rock band was produced by the band's own Matthew Healy and George Daniel.
The aptly titled fourth album for the country singer features a duet with her husband, Blake Shelton.
The latest full-length solo release for the Big Thief frontwoman was produced by Luke Temple.
The debut full-length release for the Toronto punk band that originally was named Topanga (a reference to the Boy Meets World character).
The Italian trio that mixes metal, jazz, and punk influences in its music releases its first album on the Ipecac label.
The second full-length release for the British pop artist was inspired by her own long-distance relationship.
The debut full-length studio release for the British indie pop trio of Jessica Weiss, Daniel Falvey (Guitar), and Michael Miles is a follow-up to its 2012 single compilation, "Early Fragments."
The first full-length release not credited under the actor/rapper's MC name was produced by Swet Shop Boys' Redinho.
The second full-length release for the British trio that includes producer Luke Abbott, Triosk/PVT's Laurence Pike and Portico Quartet's Jack Wyllie was improvised and recorded live.
This is the debut full-length release for the electro-soul trio of Anita Bias, and sisters Paris and Amber Strother.

The third full-length release for Chicago rapper Saba features guest appearances from 6LACK, Black Thought, Cheflee, Daoud, Fousheé, G Herbo, Eryn Allen Kane, Krayzie Bone, Mereba, Pivot Gang, Smino, and Benjamin Earl Turner.

The 12th full-length release for the Welsh alternative rock trio was recorded at the same time as 2013's Rewind the Film and features guest appearances from Cian Ciaran, Green Gartside, Nina Hoss, and Georgia Ruth.

recordname: What a Time to Be Alive
description: The 11th full-length studio release for the indie rock band led by Mac McCaughan features guest appearances from David Bazan, Katie Crutchfield, Sabrina Ellis, Skylar Gudasz, and Stephin Merritt.
The fifth full-length studio release for the Danish post-punk band was produced with Nis Bysted and Sonic Boom.
The 11th full-length studio release for the British punk duo features Billy Nomates and Amyl and The Sniffers' Amy Taylor.
The debut full-length release for the German pop artist was produced by Dr. Luke, Aaron Joseph and Brandon Hamlin.
The second full-length release for the New Zealand singer-songwriter was produced by John Parish.
The debut full-length black metal solo release for Ex Cops' Amalie Bruun was produced by Kristoffer Rygg.
The second full-length release for the New York indie pop band previously known as Twin Sister was produced by Jonathan Low.

recordname: Angels of Darkness, Demons of Light, Vol. 2
description: The second volume in the Angels of Darkness, Demons of Light series from the Seattle-based quartet led by Dylan Carlson comprises five songs.
The third full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced with Matt Hales, Beni Giles, and Mura Masa.
The third full-length release for the Texas self-described-"stone gaze" trio was produced by Matt Pence and is its first on the Relapse label.
The sophomore album already has one Grammy-nominated single, "Woman."
The fourth full-length release for the Oklahoma indie rock band was recorded in Oregon and was self-produced.
The rock quintet moves to Atlantic Records for its third album, which was produced by David Bottrill.
The first full-length studio release in six years for the Canadian alt-country/folk rock band led by Michael Timmins.
The final album for the Pelt member, who passed away in December 2009, contains 10 instrumental tracks.
Produced by Jeff Tweedy and Tom Schick, the ninth release was a surprise free release on the Chicago band's website for a limited time.
This is the debut full-length release for grime producer Louis Carnell.
Julian Koster used a variety of antique and unusual recorders to achieve his unique sounds.
The latest full-length release from singer-songwriter Anaïs Mitchell features contributions from Thomas Bartlett, JT Bates, Aaron Dessner, Josh Kaufman, Michael Lewis, and Nico Muhly.
The 16th full-length release for the John Darnielle indie project features no guitars and was produced by Brandon Eggleston.
The surprise release for the Canadian artist is his first solo release in six years and was recorded at Abbey Road Studios with the London Contemporary Orchestra.
The first new release in eight years for the Canadian instrumental post-rock band was self-produced and mixed.
Jamie Teasdale of Vex'd releases his debut solo album as Kuedo.
Jay-Z's 10th studio album features Beyonce, Lil Wayne, Kayne West, Beanie Sigel, Nas, Bilal, and Pharrell Williams.
The fifth full-length release from the Los Angeles post-hardcore band led by Joe Cardamone is the first with new drummer Ben Hallett.

recordname: How to Stop Your Brain in an Accident
description: The fourth studio release for the Welsh alternative rock band was funded by fan donations through PledgeMusic.

This is the solo debut for Adem Ilhan of the English electronica/post-rock band Fridge (whose lineup also includes Four Tet's Kieran Hebden). Unlike in Fridge (which is an instrumental outfit), Adem sings over these ten quiet, folksy tracks.
This is the Steely Dan vocalist's first solo disc in over a dozen years.
The Iowa songwriter releases a full-length album of alt-rock, blues, and folk.
This is the second full-length release for the Chicago singer-songwriter.
This Alan Moulder-produced disc from the Kazu Makino-fronted band follows three years after 'Misery Is A Butterfly.'
The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Gianluca Buccellati.
The debut full-length solo release for the Hop Along singer was recorded with her Hop Along bandmate, Joe Reinhart.
The debut full-length release for the British techno producer includes influences from acid house, drone, IDM, and shoegaze music.
The latest release from the Australian composer features guest appearances from such artists as Mark Fell, Jim O'Rourke, and Ricardo Villalobos.
The six-movement suite from the composer/trumpeter was inspired in part by Ken Burns' documentary series "The National Parks: America's Best Idea" and Smith's own research.
This is the debut full-length album for the Los Angeles producer/DJ.
Produced by Ewan Pearson, the fourth full-length studio release for the Swedish singer-songwriter features bossa nova, disco, and samba rhythms.
The second full-length solo release for the Manic Street Preachers singer/guitarist features lyrics based on poems by Patrick Jones about Chilean activist/poet Victor Jara.
The latest release for the Chicago-based experimental rock band was inspired by Elizabeth Kolbert's book "The Sixth Extinction: An Unnatural History" and was produced by Greg Norman.
The Seattle-based project, including Ishmael Butler of Digable Planets, is Sub Pop's first hip-hop signing.
The first full-length release for British rock band Loop in over 30 years features a new line-up led by Robert Hampson.

recordname: If You See Me, Say Yes
description: The debut full-length release for the Jenn Wasner solo project was self-produced and mixed by mixing John Congleton.
This is the third full-length solo release for the banjo player who worked with Steve Gunn and was part of Black Twig Pickers.
The release of unaccompanied kora duets from the father and son duo of Toumani Diabaté and Sidiki Diabaté was produced by Nick Gold, Jerry Boys, and Lucy Duran.
The fourth full-length release for the R&B band that includes Syd, Matt Martians, Steve Lacy, Patrick Paige II, and Christopher Smith was self-produced.
Previously known as Manitoba, Daniel Snaith returns with his latest album.
The experimental jazz quintet led by Grammy-nominated John Hollenbeck invites Gary Versace for its fifth album.
Husband T Bone Burnett produced this latest effort for the singer-songwriter, her first in three years.
Toronto-based singer/songwriter Hayden (Paul Hayden Desser) returns to his bedroom-recording indie-label roots, after two previous releases for Geffen.
The third full release from French DJ Garnier consists of original compositions mixing techno and jazz.
The second album from Ohio singer-songwriter Joseph Arthur, who was originally discovered and signed by Peter Gabriel.
The sixth full-length solo studio release for the Philadelphia-based indie rock singer was recorded in several places including Joshua Tree.
Described by Evangelista singer as her pop album, the first solo release in six years under her real name was co-produced with John Eichenseer.
The second full-length release for the North Carolina rock sextet was produced by Oakley Munson of the Black Lips.
The Chicago alternative rock band releases its eighth studio album on its own label dBom.

One of two Kickstarter-funded releases [Bulldozer was also released on the same day] for the Brooklyn indie rock singer includes his backing band, The Goddamn Band and was produced by Brand New's Jesse Lacey.
The sixth full-length studio release for the punk band led by Laura Jane Grace (who came out as transgendered in 2012) explores gender dysphoria.
The third full-length for the quartet from Baltimore was produced by J Robbins.
The Atlanta metal band's third album marks their major-label debut.
The New York electronic producer worked with Patrick Higgins on his latest full-length release under his own name.
Recorded over three days, the latest full-length release of blues covers for the rock band features Eric Clapton on guitar on two tracks.

recordname: At the Party with My Brown Friends
description: The second full-length release for the solo music project of Katherine Paul was self-produced.

recordname: When I Say to You Black Lightning
description: The second full-length release for the Montreal-based singer-songwriter Brigitte Naggar was co-produced with Devon Bate and mixed by Hamish Mitchell.
The CD/DVD set features the first album on Sub Pop for the dream pop duo from Baltimore.
Levon Helm releases a live album from his 2008 Nashville show featuring songs from The Band, as well as original songs and rock covers.
The autobiographical The Foundling is a concept album produced by Mike Timmons of the Cowboy Junkies.

The very, very distinctive Icelandic band generated an enormous amount of positive press (and deservingly so) for their previous effort, 'Ágætis Byrjun,' which led to a major-label deal and this album, which, like each of its eight tracks, does not have a real title.
The fourth album for the rock band is its first on its Season of Mist label and with drummer Billy Rymer (Gil Sharone left to concentrate on his band Stolen Babies).
The third full-length release for the singer-songwriter was recorded with Peter Broderick and Alasdair Roberts.
The South African trio of Okmalumkoolkat, Ruffest, and Mathambo return with a follow-up to its 2011 debut, Routes.
The Brooklyn art-rock quintet releases its fourth studio album.
The second release for the solo side project of Matmos' Drew Daniel is an electronic black metal covers album.
The Southern California rock band releases their seventh album of melodic alternative rock.
The fourth album for the Portland, Oregon-based artist features Tara Jane ONeill, Lori Goldston, and The Decemberists' Chris Funk as guest musicians.
The posthumous release of the collaboration between Tony Allen and Hugh Masekela was recorded by Nick Gold in 2010.
Produced by Andrija Tokic, the latest release for the Colorado singer-songwriter was recorded in Nashville with Micah Hulscher, Victor Herrero, Tommy Perkinson, and Chris Scruggs.

recordname: Whatever People Say I Am, That's What I'm Not
description: Not only the most-hyped band of early 2006, Sheffield, England's Arctic Monkeys (led by 19-year-old Alex Turner) managed to accomplish what the likes of Franz Ferdinand and The Libertines couldn't do before them: set the UK record for fastest-selling debut album of all time.
The debut full-length release for the Former Chairlift singer under her own name features production from A.G. Cook, Danny L Harle, and Valley Girl.
The country star's ninth studio album features the legendary group, Alabama, as well as other special guests.
The former Moloko singer returns with her second solo album.
Dan Lissvik produces the second solo album for the Concretes' former lead singer.
The 19-year-old East London "grime" MC makes his debut with this LP which features contributions from Mike Skinner (The Streets), Diplo and Paul Epworth.
The seventh full-length studio release for the Canadian post-punk band was produced by The Besnard Lake's Jace Lasek.
The first release since 2009's Love and Curses for the garage rock band led by Greg Cartwright is also its first on the Merge label.
The debut full-length release for the Canadian hard rock band was recorded in a barn by Graham Walsh and Alexandre Bonenfant.
The fourth full-length release for the British punk band was recorded with co-producer Kenny Beats.

The first full-length release in five years for the Tennessee rapper features guest appearances from 4r Da Locals, 6LACK, Amindi, Kal Banx, Duke Deuce, Iamdoechii, Lil Uzi Vert, Jay Rock, Smino, SZA, Jay Worthy, and YGTUT.
This is the 24th full-length studio release for the sibling art-rock duo of Ron and Russell Mael.
The debut full-length studio release for the Compton rapper features guest appearances from 6LACK, Snoh Aalegra, Christian Scott aTunde Adjuah, Eminem, and JID.
The second full-length release for the North Carolina-based alt-country band is a follow-up to her 2015 self-released debut (that was re-released in 2017 by Bloodshot).

The fourth full-length release for the rapper features guest appearances from Jhené Aiko, Drake, Gucci Mane, Swae Lee, Migos, Nicki Minaj, Monica, Pharrell, Quavo, Travis Scott, Trey Songz, and Ty Dolla Sign.
The seventh full-length solo studio release for the guitarist was recorded by Brian Haran.

recordname: The Peace & Truce of Future of the Left
description: The fifth full-length release for the Welsh alternative rock band was also funded through PledgeMusic like its 2013 release, How To Stop Your Brain In An Accident.
The fourth full-length release for the Portland, Oregon-based metal duo of Chip King and Lee Buford features contributions from Maralie Armstrong and Providence's Assembly of Light Choir.
The third full-length release for the Swedish singer-songwriter features a 9,000-pipe organ.
The tenth full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced with Craig Ross.
Laurie Anderson, the performance artist, releases her first album of new material in nearly a decade, which was produced with her husband, Lou Reed, and Roma Baran.
The Swedish metal band's ninth album is the first with Martin Axenrot and Fredrik Akesson, who replaced Martin Lopez and Peter Lindgren.

The fifth and final of Cash's sessions with producer Rick Rubin was recorded shortly before the singer's 2003 death. Included among two Cash originals are covers of songs by Bruce Springsteen, Hank Williams, and more.

The Songs: Ohia leader offers seven new tracks on this completely solo release, the first he has recorded under his own name. It is the result of a single session in Omaha with engineer Mike Mogis (who worked with Molia on the 'Ghost Tropic' album).

Linebacker large, white, and very country, Bubba Sparxxx nevertheless became an overnight success with his 2001 hip-hop debut 'Dark Days, Bright Nights,' which was co-produced by Timbaland. This follow-up LP was also helmed by Timbaland and Organized Noize.

Recording under his own name for the first time rather than his usual Third Eye Foundation (definitely not to be confused with Third Eye Blind), Bristol, England's Matt Elliott returns with a dark, moody collection of lo-fi, sample-based electronica.

The debut album from 22-year-old Bilal Oliver features production work from Raphael Saadiq, Dr. Dre, Mike City and James Poyser. The first single is "Soul Sista," which originally appeared on the Love and Basketbal soundtrack.

The follow-up to his 1998 self-titled debut (which gained the Canadian singer-songwriter "Best New Artist" honors from Rolling Stone), 'Poses' contains 12 new tracks from sessions with five different producers. He also has songs on the soundtracks for "Shrek" and "Moulin Rouge."
Following 1998's successful collaboration Mermaid Avenue, Billy Bragg and Wilco have reunited to bring more of Woody Guthrie's unrecorded lyrics to life.

recordname: When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go?
description: The debut full-length debut for the 17-year-old Los Angeles pop singer-songwriter was produced by her brother Finneas O'Connell (who also co-wrote).
The ninth full-length studio release for the Icelandic artist was produced with Arca and Rabit.
The third full-length release for the Los Angeles pop-punk band formed by Barry Johnson and Chase Knobb was produced by Joe Reinhart.
The second album for the singer-songwriter from New Jersey is just seven tracks long.
The lives of those who lived during the early middle ages in the Anglo-Saxon kingdom of Bryneich is the concept behind the sixth full-length solo release for British singer-songwriter.
The sixth full-length release for the Chicago rapper was inspired by the low income public housing projects he once lived in and was finally demolished in 2007.

A collection of scores Nick Cave and Warren Ellis have recorded for The Proposition (2005), The Assassination Of Jesse James By The Coward Robert Ford (2007), The Road (2010), The Girls of Phnom Penh, and The English Surgeon as well as theatrical music for Woyzeck (2005) and Metamorphosis (2006).
The fourth album from the Atlantia, Georgia rock band features songs about the murder of Rasputin.
The second full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie pop trio was co-produced by Dan Grech-Marguerat.
The fifth full-length release for the Texan singer-songwriter features piano-driven songs that recall such artists as Billy Joel, Elton John or Leon Russell.

The second album from the Polaris prize-nominated saxophonist was recorded solo, live, and in a single take. Stetson employed circular breathing and used approximately two dozen microphones, placing them on the studio walls, throughout his bass saxophone, and on his throat to produce this otherworldly-sounding album.
The debut full-length studio release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from Ghetts, J HUS, Kehlani, MNEK, Raleigh Ritchie and Wretch 32.

The second release for the Atlanta R&B singer continues the story of her alter-ego Cindi Mayweather with guest appearances from Erykah Badu, Big Boi, Cee Lo Green, Solange Knowles, Miguel, Prince, and Esperanza Spalding.
The third full-length release for Brooklyn-based electronic artist Maya Bouldry-Morrison was recorded in New Hampshire.
The second full-length release for the Nandi Rose Plunkett project that includes two of her Pinegrove bandmates was co-produced with David Tolomei.
The third solo release for the Parts & Labor co-founder was written after the birth of his son.

recordname: Panda Bear Meets the Grim Reaper
description: The fifth full-length studio release for the Animal Collective co-founder was co-produced with Peter Kember.
The debut full-length release for the British indie rock trio was self produced.

The sixth full-length studio release for the Josh Homme-led rock band includes Dave Grohl on drums as well as guest vocals from Brody Dalle, Alain Johannes, Elton John, Mark Lanegan, Trent Reznor, Jake Shears, Alex Turner, and former bassist Nick Oliveri.
The third studio full-length release from the hard rock/metal band from Virginia was produced by John Congleton.
This debut album is a collaboration between dance veterans Praveen Sharma and Travis Stewart.
The fifth full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by John Parish and features guest appearances from Justis, Lucius and Kate Stables.
The third full-length release for Dev Hynes was self-produced and released three days ahead of its scheduled release date.
The fourth solo studio release for the Canadian composer features contributions from Brian Eno and the Czech FILMharmonic Orchestra.
The Baltimore trio's first release on the 4AD label was produced by Chris Coady.
Peter Brewis wrote the songs as part of an imaginary crime thriller for his debut concept album.

After taking 12 years off prior to 2000's 'The Friends of Rachel Worth,' the legendary Australian indie-pop band is suddenly undergoing a bout of creativity as evidenced by yet another release this very same decade.

Crooked Fingers is a side project for Archers of Loaf frontman Eric Bachmann. This third album follows in the dark, drunken-blues/Americana tradition of the first two, which drew Bachmann comparisons to Tom Waits and Leonard Cohen, among others.

Alt-country singer-songwriter Neko Case returns with her third solo album, after last appearing on the New Pornographers' acclaimed 'Mass Romantic" album. Here, the moody, cinematic music is provided by members of Calexico and Giant Sand.
The fifth album (and first in three years) for the bassist/singer features 16 new tracks (including a bonus remix of "Pocketbook" by Missy Elliot and Rockwilder) in an eclectic mix of styles.
This debut LP brought the much-hyped Liverpool band frequent comparisons to (and a tour with) Radiohead.
The first full-length release of new material from the singer-songwriter in eight years features contributions from Nathan Salsburg, Mike Hyman and Joan Shelley.
The second full-length release for the German DJ/electronic producer features less layers and instruments than previous releases.
The fifth full-length solo release for the Super Furry Animals/Neon Neon member was self-produced and features Stephen McNeff and the National Orchestra of Wales.
The second full-length release for the Australian trio of Georgia McDonald, Kelly-Dawn Hellmrich and Sarah Thompson was recorded in two-and-a-half days.
The singer-songwriter recorded this fourth LP in New Orleans.
The fifth full-length studio release for Long Beach rapper Vince Staples features guest appearances from Lil Baby, Mustard and Ty Dolla $ign.
The second full-length release for the Michigan indie pop artist features production and writing from Jake Aron, David Pramik, and Keith Varon.
Matt Sweeney and Bonnie "Prince" Billy reunite after 16 years for a follow-up to 2005's Superwolf features contributions from Mike Coltun, Souleyman Ibrahim, Ahmoudou Madassane, and Mdou Moctar.
This is the 25th full-length studio release for British psychedelic rock band led by Nick Saloman.
The final release for the singer-songwriter who passed away in May 2017 was produced by Don Was.
Three months before the full-length album for the New York reggae group produced by Victor Axelrod was released, lead singer Dan Klein passed away from ALS.
The seventh full-length release for the Oakland heavy metal trio was produced by Kurt Ballou.
The second full-length release for the Massachusetts hardcore band including members of Bloodhorse, Converge, and The Hope Conspiracy was produced by Kurt Ballou.
The second self-titled (2008's was the first) release for the garage rock artist was recorded as a live band that included Ben Boye, Mikal Cronin, Emmett Kelly, and Charles Moothart.
This is the second release for former Jackie-O Motherfucker member Natalie Mering as Weyes Blood.
Simon Trought returns to produce the second album for the London-based indie pop band led by Elizabeth Morris.
The debut full-length release for the London-based artist features guest appearances from Johannes Persson, Fredrik Kihlberg and Tom Fleming.
The first new studio release for the pop singer-songwriter in nine years was produced by Mitchell Froom, Lenny Waronker, and David Boucher.
The eighth release for the Los Angeles-based Canadian composer features contributions from Kara-Lis Coverdale, Grímur Helgason, The Icelandic Choir Ensemble, and Jóhann Jóhannsson.
The latest release for the rock band is a concept album about a family going through the Depression in Ohio.
K-OS, Jason Tate (The Weakerthans) and Murray Lightburn (The Dears) guest on the Canadian collective's follow-up to 'You Forgot It In People.'
The debut full-length release for the Irish post-punk band was produced by Flood.
The second full-length release for the Bristol-based rock band was produced by Andrew Hung of Fuck Buttons.
The fourth full-length studio release for the country rock artist was produced by Jay Joyce.
The debut full-length release for the British grime rapper features guest appearances from Jaykae, Mura Masa and Skepta.
This is the 10th full-length studio release for the electronic duo of Ed Handley and Andy Turner.
The second full-length release for the Toronto-based rock band was recorded in Los Angeles with producer Rob Schnapf.
This is the debut full-length album for the Scottish producer Russell Whyte.
Sam Beam's latest release is a 6-track EP recorded with Brian Deck.
The debut full-length release for Kentucky-based singer-songwriter Sarah Beth Tomberlin was produced and mixed by Owen Pallett.
The Manchester five-piece alt-rock band's fifth album follows up their Mercury Prize-Winning album, The Seldom Seen Kid, and further showcases their poetic, lyric-driven, atmospheric music.
The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie folk singer-songwriter was produced by Tony Berg and Ethan Grusk.
The 13th release for the Norwegian experimental rock trio was self-produced.
The 10th full-length studio release for the British indie rock band features guest appearances from Jehnny Beth of Savages and Lhasa De Sel.
The French black metal band led by Neige releases its third album.
The fourth full-length release for Cardiff-based New Zealand singer-songwriter Aldous Harding was recorded in Wales and produced by John Parish.

recordname: Quarter Turns Over a Living Line
description: This is the debut full-length release from the British duo of Tom Halstead and Joe Andrews.

Recorded during five weeks of travel by train throughout Mexico, El Tren Fantasma is a sonic portrait of the "ghost train" captured by sound recordist and co-founder of Cabaret Voltaire, Chris Watson.
Elbow's Guy Garvey and Craig Potter produced the fifth album for the Manchester indie rock trio.
The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Auerbach
San Francisco, the hometown for the country rock singer-songwriter, was the inspiration behind Chuck Prophet's 10th studio album.
The sixth full-length studio release for synth-pop artist Zola Jesus was produced by Randall Dunn.
The ninth album for the singer was produced by Joe Henry and features appearances by Chris Connelly and Benji Hughes.
The singer-songwriter's latest album was coproduced by Barry Walsh and features Calexico, Augie Meyers, Van Dyke Parks, and Lucinda Williams as guest singers.
This is the debut solo album for the former Pedro The Lion/Headphones singer-songwriter.
The second full-length studio release for the Nashville-based country artist features a guest appearance from Willie Nelson.
Nino Rojo, the eccentric singer-songwriter's second release of 2004, was recorded during the same sessions that produced 'Rejoicing In The Hands.'
The debut solo release from the former leader of indie-rock legends Pavement.
This live recording features 10 tracks, mainly consisting of material from the band's first two albums.

recordname: Angels of Darkness, Demons of Light, Vol. 1
description: The pioneers of drone doom return with part one of its latest concept album (Volume 2 is scheduled for 2012).
The debut full-length release for the R&B singer-songwriter features contributions from Khalid and SG Lewis.

When the comic supergroup's 2001 debut sold an astounding 6 million copies worldwide, a sequel became necessary. Hence 'Demon Days.' Returning leader Damon Albarn (Blur) and new producer Danger Mouse are joined by guests Shaun Ryder (Happy Mondays), Ike Turner, MF Doom, De La Soul and Dennis Hopper.
The debut full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band was produced by Aaron Goldstein and mixed by Holy Fuck's Graham Walsh.
This is the first full-length studio release in seven years for the Boston alternative rock trio of Kristin Hersh, David Narcizo and Bernard Georges.
The ninth full-length solo release for the Norwegian trumpeter under his name was recorded live in a studio.

recordname: We are Beautiful, We Are Doomed
description: The second release for the Welsh indie-pop band was recorded in two weeks.
The latest album from Dan Deacon is his first on Domino and was inspired by his travels across America and as an American in Europe.
The latest release for the Ben Chasny project features contributions from Chris Corsano, Haley Fohr, Alex Nielsen, Ryley Walker and Damon and Naomi.
The first of a planned re-recording of the singer-songwriter's six albums released on the Big Machine Label features six tracks not on the 2008 album and a track for the 2010 film, Valentine's Day.
The latest full-length release for the Ben Chasny project was was self-recorded.
This is the second full-length release for the collaboration between Tunng's Mike Lindsay and Laura Marling.
The latest full-length release for the Texas-based experimental artist features contributions from Ben Baker Billington, Alex Cunningham, Lia Kohl, Macie Stewart, and Dani Toral.
The sixth full-length solo release for Eric Goulden under the Wreckless Eric name is his first in three years.
The latest album for the British artist features singer Lavinia Blackwell, John Contreras on cello and Joolie Wood on violin.
The ultrahyped British rockers return with a quick successor to their Mercury Prize-winning 2006 debut.
The fourth release for the soul singer features production from Babyface, James Poyser, Kelvin Wooten, and Salaam Remi.
The ninth full-length release for Phil Elverum as Mount Eerie was written soon after the release of 2017's A Crow Looked At Me.
The second full-length release for the Canadian electronic artist was produced with Junior Boys' Jeremy Greenspan.
The latest release from the San Francisco rock band led by John Dwyer is its first on the Castle Face label.

recordauthor: Amanda Palmer & the Grand Theft Orchestra
description: The third solo studio album for the former Dresden Doll singer is her first with her new band, The Grand Theft Orchestra and was recorded in Australia with producer John Congleton.
The rock band's third album was produced by Brian McTernan.

recordname: You're A Woman, I'm A Machine
description: 'You're A Woman' is the first album for the Canadian duo of vocalist/drummer Sebastien Grainger and bassist Jesse F. Keeler. It's a drum 'n' bass album in the literal sense of the term, as those are the only two instruments (aside from a very infrequent synthesizer) on the record.

recordname: I Had a Dream That You Were Mine
description: This is the debut full-length release from the collaboration between the Walkmen's Hamilton Leithauser and ex-Vampire Weekend's Rostam Batmanglij.
The unfinished recordings from the blues guiatrist was completed with the help of his daughter Mavis Staples and producer Jeff Tweedy.
The fourth solo release for the electronic artist/producer includes a guest appearance by King Creosote.
Pianist Robert Glasper guests on the Philadelphia singer's jazz, soul, and funk-infused third full-length studio album.
This is the second full-length solo release for the Canadian singer-songwriter.
The third full-length release for Melina Duterte as Jay Som was written after her move to Los Angeles.
The first full-length album on XL Recordings for the rock band from New Jersey was named after a warship that fought during the American Civil War.
The 10th full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Tucker Martin and features contributions from Jim James and Sufjan Stevens.
The sixth full-length studio release for the New York rock band was produced by Danger Mouse.
The latest full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Pierre Marchand.
The second full-length release for the indie rock trio was self-produced except for one Brian Eno-produced track.
Dominick Fernow's latest release as Prurient is a double album produced by Arthur Rizk and Kris Lapke.
The fifth full-length release for the Kentucky hardcore trio was produced by J. Robbins.
This is the second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based seven-piece instrumental group.
The latest full-length solo studio release for the soul singer was produced by Ben Harper.
The fourth album for the French rock band was produced with Philippe Zdar.
This is the full-length debut for the Ohio-based duo of acclaimed hip-hop producer RJD2 and emcee Blueprint.
This is the third studio album for the Denver-based indie pop band led by Tammy Ealom.
Known for their loud, angry, and extreme take on metal (well, even more so than your average metal band), The Blood Brothers return with their third album in as many years.

Chan Marshall's first album of new material since 1998 was recorded in Los Angeles with Adam Kasper (Queens of the Stone Age, Foo Fighters, Pearl Jam), who in turn brought in friends such as Dave Grohl and Eddie Vedder.

recordauthor: Bruce Springsteen & The E Street Band
description: The Boss' first studio album with the E Street Band since 1984's 'Born In The U.S.A.,' 'The Rising' contains 15 new Springsteen songs produced by Brendan O'Brien.
Pop/jazz vocalist and pianist Norah Jones, the daughter of Ravi Shankar, picked up 5 Grammy awards for this debut album, produced by Arif Mardin.
The solo debut from The Indigo Girls' Amy Ray is a bit of a departure from her band's folk sound, instead offering a harder, punk-rock edge. Joan Jett is among the guests appearing on the album.

The eight full-length release for the Oregon metal trio was co-produced with Billy Barnett and written after frontman Mike Scheidt recovered from a near fatal illness caused by the intestinal disease, acute diverticulitis.
The second release (but first major label album) for San Francisco Bay Area artist Melina Duterte was self-recorded and produced.

The third full-length release for the British art rock band experiments with avant garde and classical music elements arranged with conductor André de Ridder and featuring guest appearances by Henry Lowther, Adrian Peacock, Elisa Rodrigues, and Michel van der Aa.
Q-Tip returns to release his first solo album in nine years with guests such as D'Angelo, Amanda Diva, Norah Jones, and Raphael Saadiq.
The fifth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based rapper was executive produced by Jacknife Lee.

recordname: Sometimes I Wish We Were An Eagle
description: Previously known as Smog, Bill Callahan releases only the second album under his real name.
the latest full-length release for the Los Angeles-based Canadian artist was self-produced and mixed.
The latest solo album from the Black Dice band member continues his experimental electronic sounds over six tracks.
Said to be the final album from the British singer-songwriter, the third full-length studio release was produced by Joe Boyd.
The second full-length release for Los Angeles R&B artist Syd features guest appearances from Kehlani, Lucky Daye and Smino.
The first studio release in 10 years for the German metal band was produced with Olsen Involtini.
Produced by Jack Frost, the 36th studio release for the singer-songwriter features pop standards popularized by Frank Sinatra.
Experimental electronica artist Stefan Betke returns with his first full-length in four years.
The eighth full-length studio release for the Atlanta metal band was produced by David Bottrill.
The debut full-length release for the London singer-songwriter features influences R&B and electronic music.

recordauthor: Lukas Nelson & Promise of the Real
description: The latest full-length release for the country rock band was produced by Dave Cobb.
The fourth full-length release for the pop artist was created with executive producers A. G. Cook and BJ Burton through Zoom calls and asking fans for their preferences.
The debut full-length release for the Manchester-based Angolan artist was inspired by his visits to his homeland and his father's memoirs about the Angolan civil war.
The second full-length release for the Detroit-based indie rock artist was produced by Car Seat Headrest's Will Toledo.
The first release for the artist better known as The Bug under his real name was influenced by the birth of his son and the subsequent life-threatening complications that followed.
The second full-length collaboration between Mark Lanegan and Duke Garwood was recorded in Los Angeles, Pasadena and Joshua Tree.
Produced by Jim Sutherland, the debut release for the British folk artist and her 12-piece band The Wayward Band features guest appearances from Damien Dempsey, MC Dizraeli, and Teddy Thompson.

recordname: All Our Gods Have Abandoned Us
description: The seventh full-length release for the British metalcore band was produced by Henrik Udd and Fredrik Nordström.

recordname: The Most Important Place in the World
description: The second full-length release from Bill Wells and Aidan Moffat features a theme with the city of Glasgow as a femme fatale.
The third album for the British quartet was produced by Graham Sutton and the band.
14 years after 2007's Raising Sand, Robert Plant and Alison Krauss reunite for their second full-length collaboration, with T-Bone Burnett also returning to produce.

recordname: A Small Turn Of Human Kindness
description: The Athens, Georgia-based band releases its seventh full-length album.
The debut full-length release for Amber Bain was produced with BJ Burton and George Daniel.
The fifth full-length release for Josh Tillman as Father John Misty was produced with Jonathan Wilson.

The debut full-length release for the music project from Mazes/ex-Ultimate Painting member Jack Cooper and Beak>'s Will Young features contributions from Rupert Gillett, Woods' Aaron Nevue and Sunwatchers' Jeff Tobias.
The third full-length release for the Brooklyn-based duo of Che Chen and Rick Brown features contributions from Sue Garner, Cheryl Kingan, Steve Maing, and Karen Waltuch.

recordname: Before Love Came To Kill Us
description: The debut full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter features guest appearances from 6lack and Eminem.
The Texas psych-rockers led by husband-and-wife team Tom and Christina Carter return with this six-track follow-up to 2004's 'Joy Shapes.'

recordname: This Is It & I Am It & You Are It & So Is That & He Is It & She Is It & It Is It & That Is That
description: The sophomore album for the New Yorker was produced by Zach Hill

recordname: Analog Fluids of Sonic Black Holes
description: The third full-length solo release for the Philadelphia-based artist features guest appearances from Reef The Lost Cauze and Saul Williams.
The fourth solo release for the Steely Dan frontman was co-produced with Michael Leonhart.
The latest full-length release for Dan Bejar-led band Destroyer was produced and mixed by John Collins.
The fifth full-length release for the Oakland-based duo was mostly recorded before the COVID-19 pandemic, but was mixed remotely.
The British electronic pop trio return after seven years to work with producers Ian Catt, Richard X, and Nick Coler on its eighth studio album.
Tortoise's John McEntire takes over as producer from Roger Moutenot (who worked on the band's releases since 1993) on the 13th release from the New Jersey indie rock trio.
This is the first full-length studio release in over eight years for the British indie rock band.
The latest release from the Berlin-based singer-songwriter was inspired by a German legal term Gläserner Bürger, or glass citizen, about the level of privacy we have in the world today.
The fifth full-length release for the electronic producer again features the vocals of his piano teacher Alison Skidmore.
The debut full-length solo release for the Swearin' co-founder was produced with Jeff Zeigler.
The trio's seventh album (their first for Sub Pop) features production work from Dave Fridmann and an atypically energetic sound.

recordname: Ascending a Mountain of Heavy Light
description: The second collaboration between The Body and Full Of Hell features contributions from Brian Chippendale, Ben Eberle, and Chrissy Wolport.
The 12th full-length solo release for the Texas-based singer-songwriter was produced by Peter Buck and Scott McCaughey.
The second full-length studio release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from Aitch, Burna Boy, H.E.R., Headie One, Ed Sheeran, Tiana Major9, and YEBBA.
This is the third of the Balloon Trilogy mixtapes offered for free via download by Canadian artist, Abel Tesfaye.

The 13th full-length solo studio release for the rapper was produced by No I.D. and features guest appearances from Beyoncé, daughter Blue Ivy, Gloria Carter (his mother), Damian Marley, Frank Ocean and The-Dream. It was a one week exclusive for Sprint customers and Tidal subscribers before a physical CD release (July 7) was announced that includes three bonus tracks (which features a guest appearance from James Blake).
The debut full-length release for ScratchaDVA as [Hi:Emotions] features guest vocals from Rae Rae and Roses Gabor.
The son of novelist Larry continues his critique of the world on his latest album.

The follow-up to the Jaxx' critically-acclaimed 1999 debut album, 'Remedy,' 'Rooty' finds the British house duo adding to the party vibe with elements of pop and R&B thrown into the mix. The lead single is "Romeo."
The live album from the Philadelphia-based indie rock band led by Adam Granduciel features 10 songs recorded from the past six years of touring.
The latest release for the composer features Buchla synthesizers, more vocals and woodwinds from Rob Frye of Bitchin Bajas.
The songs for Aly Spaltro's debut full-length were written over a four year period while working at Bart's & Greg's DVD Explosion in Brunswick, Maine.
The latest album for the band led by Phil Elverum features Julie Doiron and Fred Squire.
This solo disc from the co-founder of New Zealand rockers The Clean includes backing by members of Lambchop.
The third full-length for the Chicago-based art-rock four-piece was produced (like its predecessor) by John Congleton.

recordname: I Am The Fun Blame Monster
description: The quirky, Portland, Ore.-based indie rock trio recorded this highly-regarded genre-twisting debut album with the aid of a homemade software program.
The Leeds, England band celebrate their 25th anniversary with this 11-track release that veers from country to punk.
One of the preeminent practitioners of the style of electronica labeled "Intelligent Dance Music," Autechre (consisting of Sean Booth and Rob Brown) returns with its first album in three years.

recordname: Public Domain: Songs From the Wild Land
description: Former Blaster Dave Alvin offers an album of traditional American music (each song having passed into the public domain).
The fifth full-length studio release for the San Francisco band was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.
The debut solo studio release for the Odd Future rapper includes guest appearances from such guests as Domo Genesis, Mac Miller, Frank Ocean, RZA, Vince Staples, and Tyler, The Creator.
The third full-length solo release for the Animal Collective co-founder was recorded on a 1980s Tascam 48 half-inch reel-to-reel tape machine.

The singer-songwriter who has written songs for such artists as Reba McEntire, Trisha Yearwood, Patty Loveless, Faith Hill, and Martina McBride amongst many others returns with her first album in more than a decade.
The sixth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was recorded by Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs' Sam Grant.
The sixth full-length solo studio release (and third credited with the 400 Unit) for the Grammy-winning singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.
The fourth full-length release for the Kentucky singer-songwriter was produced by Jeff Tweedy.
The soundtrack for Luca Guadagnino's remake of the 1977 film of the same name is the first feature film soundtrack for the Radiohead singer.

The debut release for the collaboration between Freddie Gibbs and Madlib features guest appearances from such artists as Ab-Soul, BJ the Chicago Kid, Danny Brown, Domo Genesis, Mac Miller, Raekwon, Scarface, and Earl Sweatshirt.
