The Detroit garage rockers make their major-label debut with this sophomore album, which was produced by Jerry Harrison.

In his sixth decade of recording, Johnny Cash reunites with producer Rick Rubin for a third consecutive outing. Like its two predecessors, 'III' consists of a mix of Cash originals and covers, this time from the likes of Nick Cave ("The Mercy Seat"), Tom Petty ("I Won't Back Down"), and U2 ("One").
The third album from the Portland, Ore. indie-rock band failed to elevate their standing in their home country, although they continue to sell well (and receive favorable press) in Europe.

recordname: All Of A Sudden I Miss Everyone
description: The instrumental post-rock band from Texas returns after a four-year wait with this fourth studio album.

recordname: Give the People What They Want
description: The fifth full-length studio release for the Brooklyn soul band was originally scheduled for an August release but was delayed due to the cancer diagnosis of singer Sharon Jones.
The Los Angeles-based electronica artist's fifth album has a bit of a Brazilian feel.
Produced by Jim Vollentine, The sixth full-length studio release for the Austin band includes two tracks produced by Wilco's Jeff Tweedy.
Samples from early blues records are used in the sixth studio album for the Canadian DJ.
The third full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper was named after his 2011 mixtape Dirty Sprite and features a guest appearance from Drake.
Mark E. Smith & Co. return with their full-length follow-up to 'The Real New Fall LP.'

Heavily influenced by hip-hop, rock, blues, funk, and jazz, the New Orleans "Bounce" quintet Galactic enlists vocal legends for its sixth studio effort. These include Rebirth Brass Band and Irma Thomas, as well as such up-and-coming Bounce artists as Cheeky Blakk, Big Freedia, and Sissy Nobby.

recordname: The Angels Of Light Sing 'Other People'
description: Michael Gira's post-Swans project Angels Of Light returns with a fourth release of mostly acoustic folk/rock, backed by musicians from Akron/Family.
This is the fourth full-length studio release for the electronic solo project of Fuck Buttons' Benjamin John Power.
The latest release for the folk ensemble led by Alynda Lee Segarra is its first on the ATO label.
The 11th full-length release from the British electronic duo of Sean Booth and Rob Brown is over two hours long.
The latest full-length release for the collaboration between Taj Mahal and Ry Cooder features covers of songs from Sonny Terry & Brownie McGhee.
The third full-length studio release for the Indiana retro-soul group features synths and disco influences.
This is the fifth full-length release for the duo of Tessa Murray and Greg Hughes.
The first full-length release in seven years for the British post-punk band was self-produced.
The third full-length release for the British post-punk trio is its first in five years.
The third full-length release for the Boston-based indie rock trio led by Ellen Kempner was co-produced with Gabe Wax.
This is the debut full-length release for the Australian rock band that includes The Drones' Gareth Libbiard and Fiona Kitschin; High Tension's Lauren Hammel; and Harmony/Palm Springs' Erica Dunn.
This is the sixth full-length release for Swedish electronic producer Axel Willner as The Field.
The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in 12 days with Alex Burey and Foxygen's Jonathan Rado.
The debut full-length release for British rock band was produced by Dan Carey.

The third and final part of Tadd Mullinix's trilogy features guest appearances from Danny Brown, Clear Soul Forces, Denmark Vessey, Doom, Fatt Father, G & D, Guilty Simpson, Ghostface Killah, Silas Green, Intricate Dialect, Kadance, La Peace, Roc Marciano, Georgia Anne Muldrow, Nolan The Ninja, Dudley Perkins, Phat Kat, Quelle Chris, Shigeto, and Jon Wayne.
The 23rd full-length release for the Australian singer-songwriter features guest appearance from Linda and Vika Bull.
The third release (and the first under just his name) for the guitarist/producer features Gillian Welch as well as Brittany Haas, Paul Kowert, Ketch Secor, and Willie Watson.

The ninth full-length studio release for the Slovenian avant-garde group was originally made for a theatrical production of Thus Spoke Zarathustra (Also Sprach Zarathustra) for the Anton Podbevek Theatre (APT) in Slovenia.
The latest solo studio release for the blues-rock guitarist who played with such artists as Canned Heat, John Mayall, and the Rolling Stones, was recorded in two days.
The latest release for the British rock singer-songwriter was co-produced with Andy York and features Dandy, a tribute to David Bowie.
Originally released on Black Friday Record Store Day in 2015, the Mekons and Robbie Fulks went to the Scottish island of Jura to record the album of acoustic folk songs.
The full-length debut for the British artist who worked with Kwes and Kate Tempest was self-produced.
This is the sixth full-length studio release for the New Zealand six-piece band.
Produced by Joe Henry, the latest release for the soul singer includes songs by the Beatles, Beth Nielsen Chapman, Bob Dylan, Mary Gauthier, and the Rolling Stones.
Graham Parker reunites with his British rock band, The Rumour, after more than 30 years for this 12-track album produced with Dave Cook.
Brad Mehldau's second album in 2012 with his jazz trio is a covers album of songs by such artists as Sufjan Stevens, Alice in Chains, Elvis Costello, Nick Drake, and Jimi Hendrix.

Portishead's Geoff Barrow (under the name Fuzzface), 7-Stu-7 (Portishead's studio engineer, Stuart Matthews), and Katalyst produced the hip-hop album featuring 35 rappers contributing rhymes to the 41-track release.
This is the second album of mariachi music for El Bronx's alter ego band.
The third teaming up of British guitarist Justin Adam and Gambian singer Juldeh Camara now includes Billy Fuller on bass and Dave Smith on drums.
The debut LP for the British rapper features production from Micachu, Hot Chip's Joe Goddard, Kwes and Roots Manuva.
The Cleveland-born transgender singer-songwriter's latest album was produced by Andrew W.K.
The British boyband welcomes Robbie Williams back to the group on its sixth album.
The veteran musician is backed by REM and/or Minus 5 members Peter Buck, Scott McCaughey, and Bill Rieflin (together, the Venus 3) on his first release since 2004's 'Spooked.'
This debut disc showcases the 50s and 60s pop stylings and three-part harmonies of the pair of brother-sister duos (Romeo & Michelle Stodart and Sean & Angela Gannon) that make up The Magic Numbers.
The Canadian illustrator and musician makes his Sub Pop debut with this self-recorded album.
The latest solo studio album for the former Hüsker Dü and Sugar singer is his first on the Merge label.
The debut full-length release for the Australian dream pop artist Harriette Pilbeam was produced by John Castle.
The debut album for the trio from New York.
The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based footwork producer features guest appearances from DJ Lucky, DJ Manny, DJ Paypal, Chuck Inglish, Odile Myrtil, Fabi Reyna, and UNIIQU3.
The 12th full-length release for the Massachusetts rock trio was produced with Kurt Vile.
The first full-length solo release for the Sun City Girls guitarist in five years.

recordname: The Take Off and Landing of Everything
description: The sixth full-length release for the British alternative rock band was again produced by Craig Potter.
The fourth full-length release for the Staten Island rock band led by Joseph D'Agostino was produced by John Congleton.
The first studio release of original songs since 2005's Freedom And Weep from the Chicago alt-country band led by Jon Langford was produced by Mike Hagler.
The debut full-length studio release for the R&B singer features guest appearances from A$AP Rocky, Future, Devonté Hynes, and ScHoolboy Q.
The Canadian rockers follow 'Shine A Light' with this 10-track set.

The third full-length studio release for the British pop artist was produced by A.G. Cook and features guest appearances from Big Freedia, Brooke Candy, Christine and the Queen, Clairo, CupcakKe, Haim, Lizzo, Kim PetrasTroye Sivan, Sky Ferreira, Tommy Cash, Pabllo Vittar, and Yaeji.
The seventh full-length release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Ed Buller.
The fifth full-length release for the Canadian folk band led by Taylor Kirk and was produced by Simon Trottier.

recordname: If I Can't Have Love, I Want Power
description: Produced by Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross, the fourth full-length studio release for the alternative pop artist is a concept album about pregnancy and giving birth.
The sixth full-length solo release for the Super Furry Animals frontman was produced and mixed by Muzi.
Canadian singer-songwriter Dan Mangan returns as Dan Mangan + Blacksmith for his fourth overall full-length album and it was produced by Colin Stewart.
The Fleetwood Mac guitarist's first solo outing in over a dozen years features bandmates Mick Fleetwood and John McVie on two tracks of a largely acoustic set.
The second solo full-length release for the Babies/Woods member was inspired by his move from New York to California.
The quintet from Madison, Wisconsin self-releases their debut album.
The soul-influenced release for the Brooklyn-based rapper-producer features guest appearances from Gary Clark, Jr., Nick Hakim, Tranqill, and Maimouna Youssef.

recordname: Give a Glimpse of What Yer Not
description: The 11th full-length release for the rock trio features nine songs written by J. Mascis and two by Lou Barlow.
The Beta Band's Steve Mason releases his first solo album under his name.

The latest full-length release for the MC Taylor indie folk project features contributions from Griffin and Taylor Goldsmith of Dawes, Josh Kaufman of Bonny Light Horseman, Buddy Miller, and Zach Williams of The Lone Bellow.
This is the 15th studio release from the experimental Ohio rock band led by David Thomas.
The is the debut full-length release for the Chicago trash metal trio.
The second full-length release from the Irishman Conor J. O'Brien was self-produced and includes his touring band: James Byrne, Cormac Curran, Tommy McLaughlin, and Danny Snow.
This is the second album for San Francisco-based graphic design/electronic artist Scott Hansen as Tycho.
The Gossip singer releases her solo EP produced by Simian Mobile Disco.
This is the debut album for the band formed by Conor Oberst, Jim James, Mike Mogis, and M. Ward.

This five-EP box set collects holiday-themed lo-fi and impromptu tracks (a mix of standards and originals originally intended as gifts for his friends and family) recorded by Stevens over the past five years.
The group's first release on its own AOI label features guests such as Ghostface, MF Doom, Sean Paul, Common and that noted MC Spike Lee. Production assistance comes from Madlib and 9th Wonder.
The inventive but challenging hardcore outfit returns with their first full-length studio recording since 1999's 'Calculating Infinity.'

recordname: Wig In A Box: Songs From & Inspired By Hedwig & The Angry Inch
description: Exactly what the title says it is, this 16-track disc features songs from the Hedwig soundtrack (as well as new compositions inspired by the musical) interpreted by your favorite indie artists, including Yo La Tengo (with Yoko Ono!), Spoon, Robyn Hitchcock, The Polyphonic Spree, Frank Black, The Breeders, Bob Mould, and more.

This full-length debut for the Irish singer/songwriter has moved beyond his home country (where it was a massive hit) to attract critical praise and strong sales worldwide. Mostly self-produced and recorded, the disc also comes in specially-designed packaging including text, artwork and photographs.
The dour Glasgow-based duo of Aidan Moffat and Malcom Middleton return for their fifth studio album, with guest contributions from members of Bright Eyes and Mogwai.

On his fifth album, the underground rapper ventures more into the rock, soul, and jazz territory of his influences, with production help from the Soulaquarians. An eclectic array of guests includes Prince, Erykah Badu, Jill Scott, Bilal, Mary J. Blige, and Stereolab's Laetitia Sadier.
The seventh full-length studio release for the Alabama-born singer-songwriter was recorded in Nashville and self-produced.
The debut album for the son of Crowded House's Neil Finn.
The debut full-length release for the Dutch indie-pop singer was produced by Ben Greenberg.
The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Anderson .Paak and Knxwledge features two tracks from their 2015 EP.
The ninth full-length studio release for the rock trio was produced by St. Vincent and is the final one with drummer Janet Weiss, who announced her departure from the band in July 2019.
The sixth full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock band was produced by Will Yip.
The latest release from the ambient artist is a 40-minute piano tape loop.
The Brooklyn four-piece (not to be confused with MEN, the JD Samson-led band) releases its third album on new label Sacred Bones.
The seventh album for indie rock band was produced by Phil Ek.
This is the debut album for the San Francisco-based duo of Christopher Owens and Chet White.
The third full-length solo release for Erika Anderson was co-produced with Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Jacob Portrait.
The debut release for Bikini Kill founder Kathleen Hanna's Julie Ruin project includes Carmine Covelli, Sara Landeau, Kenny Mellman of Kiki And Herb, and Kathi Wilcox of Bikini Kill.
Released a day earlier than expected as a digital download on February 18th, this is the eighth album from the epic, experimental UK five-piece.
This is the full-length debut for the Dallas, TX trio of brothers Benjamin and Brandon Curtis and Josh Garza.
The debut full-length release for the country supergroup that includes Brandi Carlile, Natalie Hemby, Maren Morris, and Amanda Shires was produced by Dave Cobb.
Dan Snaith brings 23 new tracks under his DJ alias for the latest Fabriclive mix release.
The San Francisco rap duo of Gift of Gab (aka Timothy Parker) and Chief Xcel (Xavier Mosley) return with a third album.
This is the first release in three years for the husband-and-wife duo of Brett and Rennie Sparks.
This is the San Francisco rock singer's third release in 2012 (the other two were: Hair with White Fence and Slaughterhouse with his own band).
The first full-length solo release for the indie singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Joseph "JoJo" Clarke.
The English rock band moves to Domino for their third album.

recordname: A Flame My Love, a Frequency
description: The latest full-length release for the French artist known for using a viola da gamba changes to electronic instruments that include Moog effects pedals and Critter and Guitari synthesizers.
The fourth full-length release for the British psychedelic rock band was produced by Jason Falkner.
Richard Hawley, Cate Le Bon, and Lucy Rose guest on the 11th full-length studio release from the Welsh alternative rock band.
This is the second full-length release for Berlin-based experimental electronic producer J'Kerian Morgan.

recordname: Monkey Minds in the Devil's Time
description: The Beta Band singer self-produced 11 songs and Dan Carey worked on the other nine songs on Mason's politically-influenced second solo release.
The sixth album for the indie rock band led by Archer of Loaf's Eric Bachmann was recorded at The Bakery with Matt Yelton.

The singer-songwriter follows his acclaimed effort '1972' with another album produced by Brad Jones. Don't be fooled by the title: it's not a country album, but rather, a farewell to the city Rouse has called home for the past decade (before moving to Spain).
This is Will Oldham's first Bonnie "Prince" Billy album to credit the Cairo Gang, who performed on the previous three Billy albums.
The debut full-length release for the Montreal-based indie rock band was produced by Jonathan Schenke.
The Scottish electronic artist releases his debut full-length album.
The 10th full-length solo release for the former lead singer of American Music Club was produced by Bernard Butler.
The tenth studio release from Liz Harris as Grouper was mainly recorded in Portugal in 2011 on a 4-track.
The follow-up to the British singer-songwriter's Mercury Prize-nominated debut was produced by John Congleton.
Faith Hill and Tim McGraw guest on Lori McKenna's first album with a major label.
This is the third full-length release for the British indie punk band.
The second full-length release for the ambient duo of Spencer Doran and Ryan Carlile features guest appearances from Matt Carlson, Miyako Koda, and Motion Graphics.
The debut release for the Isle of Wight brother duo was recorded at a former water tower.
The third full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.
El-P's long-anticipated second solo disc features collaborations with Cat Power, Trent Reznor, Matt Sweeney, Aesop Rock, and The Mars Volta.
The latest solo release for the artist was produced with Brendan Benson with a full studio band that included Grant-Lee Phillips, Pat Sansone, Emma Swift, and Gillian Welch.
The first full-length studio release for the British alternative rock band in over 10 years was produced with Dan Austin.
Recorded over four days, the 13th release for the singer-songwriter feature guest appearances from Lisa Hannigan as well as Kenneth Pattengale & Joey Ryan of The Milk Carton Kids.
This is the first album on K Records for the Portland, Oregon, singer-songwriter.
The second solo release for The White Stripes/The Raconteurs/The Dead Weather musician/producer shows influences of blues, country, folk, hip-hop, and rock music.
The fourth release for the Canadian artist Claire Boucher is her first on the 4AD label.
The debut surprise release for the side project of Alabama Shakes' Brittany Howard features members from Nashville rock bands Fly Golden Eagle and Clear Plastic Masks.
The sixth full-length release for the Norwegian singer/songwriter was produced with Jørgen Træen.
The third full-length solo release for the Irish singer-songwriter was produced with Aaron Dessner.
The folk artist reworks Mariah Carey's "Shake It Off" and Tim McGraw's "My Old Friend" on his debut release with the Nonesuch label.
The fourth full-length solo release for the former Woods bassist was inspired by cities and music of the mid-70s.
Produced by Chester Endersby Gwazda, the second album for the trio features cello, marimba, and violin instrumentation.
The latest release from the band led by Ben Chasny was inspired by a dream about constructing a spacecraft on the moon.
The sixth full-length solo release for the New Orleans electronic/R&B artist was produced with Ila Orbis.
The fourth full-length release for the Australian psychedelic rock band was partially recorded at lead singer Jack McEwan's home studio.
The debut full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Aminé, Gucci Mane, ppcocaine, Rubi Rose, Sukihana, Don Toliver, and Trippie Redd.
The 15-track surprise release is one of the two new albums (Ghosts V: Together being the other) that continues Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross' instrumental Ghosts series.
The third full-length release for the South Korean post-rock group is its first with former live band members Jaehyuk Choi and B.K Yu joining as regular members.
The second full-length release for the Los Angeles duo of Harmony Tividad and Cleo Tucker was recorded and mixed by Drew Fischer.

The soundtrack to the sequel to the 1996 film Trainspotting features a Prodigy remix of Iggy Pop's "Lust for Life," as well as tracks from classic artists such as Blondie, Queen, Run DMC, The Clash and newer artists such as Fat White Family, Rubberbandits, Wolf Alice, and Young Fathers.
The Oakland, California band formed by Marielle Jakobsons and Gregg Kowalsky adds bassist Ben Bracken, tanpura player Michael Elrod, and guitarist Noah Phillips for its third full-length release.
The sixth album for the experimental indie rock band was recorded in Delaware County in New York state and produced by the band's lead singer, Dave Longstreth.
The sophomore album gathers music from two discs for the North Carolina-based band.
The debut album for guitarist/vocalist Marc Ribot as Ceramic Dog, who heads up the experimental rock trio.
The fourth album for the Oakland, California metal band.
The producer of Spoon's Gimme Fiction, explore 9/11 and politics again.
The California alt-metal outfit finally returns with a successor to the smash hit 1999 album 'Issues.'

Former London club DJ Richard Fearless (now working with Tim Holmes) returns for a follow-up to 1997's 'Dead Elvis.' Guest vocals are provided by Bobby Gillespie (Primal Scream), Jim Reid (Jesus And Mary Chain), Dot Allison (One Dove) and Iggy Pop.
The first album on the Nonesuch label for the trio of Rhode Islanders.
The eighth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter features production from Zach Dawes, Mike Dean, Dean Reid, and Gabe Simon.
They're either a bit early or a bit late with their new year's tidings, but the experimental Brooklyn band is back with 11 new tracks.

recordname: All This I Do for Glory
description: The sixth full-length solo release for the saxophonist was recorded live with no overdubs or loops and was self-produced.
The third full-length release for the Meg Duffy project features a guest appearance from Perfume Genius and was produced by Sasami Ashworth and mixed by Chris Coady and Kyle Thomas.

recordauthor: Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs
description: The second full-length release for the British rock band led by Matt Baty was recorded by John Martindale and Sam Grant.
The ninth full-length solo studio release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Guy Sigsworth.
The debut full-length release for the London-based brothers of Ben and Tom Page was self-produced.
The Nottingham artist was only 18 when this debut album was released.
The acoustic version of the singer-songwriter's 2017 Masseduction was recorded over two days and features just Clark's vocals and Thomas Bartlett on piano.
This is the self-produced debut release (originally self-released in May 2012) for Brooklyn artist Nick Principe.

recordname: Nothing Is True & Everything Is Possible
description: The sixth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by ts lead singer, Rou Reynolds.
The latest full-length release for the French poet and experimental artist was created largely while she was pregnant and on tour.
The third full-length solo release for the former Supergrass frontman features some tracks co-produced with Ian Davenport.
The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was self-recorded and produced.
The tenth release for the Minnesota indie rock band featuring Alan Sparhawk and Mimi Parker was produced by Jeff Tweedy of Wilco.
The fourth full-length release for the trio led by Maynard James Keenan was mixed by Mat Mitchell.
The jazz vocalist mixes originals with covers of songs by the likes of Tom Waits and Leonard Cohen for her third album, a follow-up to 2004's "Careless Love."
The first new studio release in nearly seven years for the Eddie Vedder-led rock band was produced with Josh Evans.

recordauthor: Thao & the Get Down Stay Down
description: The fourth full-length release for the San Francisco-based band was produced by Merrill Garbus of tUnE-yArDs.
The latest full-length studio release for the Oh Sees features a 14-minutes and a 21-minutes long tracks.
The third full-length release for the London electronic duo of Andrew Hung and Benjamin Power was self-produced.
This double-disc live set features 21 tracks (many from last year's 'Z') recorded at The Fillmore in San Francisco.
The latest full-length release from the Canadian trio features guest appearances from Laraaji, Terrace Martin, Karriem Riggins, Brandee Younger, and Arthur Verocai.
The fifth full-length release for the Nandi Rose solo project was produced with Zubin Hensler.

recordname: I've Seen All I Need to See
description: After several collaborative releases, the experimental metal duo returns with with a solo album with contributions from Chrissy Wolpert and Ben Eberle.
The 11th full-length studio release for the British rock band produced by Tony Doogan.
The fifth full-length release for the Savannah, Georgia-based sludge metal band is its final album with bassist Jonathan Athon, who died in a motorcycle accident in November 2014.
The debut full-length release for the Atlanta-based singer was self-produced.
The latest release for the Chicago experimental rock trio is its first on the Relapse label.
This is the latest album for the power pop singer-guitarist who has worked with Robert Pollard.
The second album for the bluegrass five-piece band led by Chris Thile is the first to feature Paul Kowert who replaced Greg Garrison in November of 2008.
Recorded in 2005-2006, the live set is based on a poem about the famed photographer, Robert Mapplethorpe, who was also Patti Smith's friend.
The latest studio album from the hip-hop group features Common, Malik B, Talib Kweli, Mos Def, Styles P, Wale, and DJ Jazzy Jeff, amongst others guest artists.
The rapper from Houston releases his latest album, which features artists such as Lil Wayne, T.I., and Wacko.
Stuart Price co-produced the 47-year-old Anglophile's latest dance-oriented effort.
The fourth album for the Portland, Oregon group is the first on the Sub Pop label.

recordname: Golden Sings That Have Been Sung
description: The third full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Wilco's Leroy Bach.
The 12th full-length release for the Chicago alternative rock band that includes Janet Bean, Mark Greenberg, Doug McCombs, and Rick Rizzo features the addition of guitarist Jim Elkington.
The fourth full-length release for the Connor Murphy-led trio was produced by Andy Hull of Manchester Orchestra.
The debut full-length studio release for the rapper from Virginia features guest appearances from Erykah Badu, Lil Yachty, and Young Thug).
The third solo full-length release for the artist who was one half of Everything But the Girl features contributions from Bernard Butler, Martin Ditcham, and Rex Horan.
The Kansas City electronic producer Brian Leeds releases his debut full-length release as Huerco S.
This is the fourth studio album for the electronic artist from Austria.
This is the debut full-length studio release for the Detroit techno producer.
Brian Deck (Modest Mouse) produced the Idaho singer-songwriter's fourth album and major-label debut.
The third full-length release for the Turkish psych-folk band from Amsterdam was mixed by Jacco Gardner.

recordauthor: Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs
description: The third full-length release for the British band began recording the album with the songs only about 80% complete.
The debut full-length release for Brooklyn-based Max Clarke was recorded in Los Angeles and New York.
The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features The Big Moon as her backing band and was again produced by Charlie Andrew.

recordname: Bobby Fuller Died for Your Sins
description: The latest release was inspired in part by the mysterious death of rock artist Bobby Fuller in Los Angeles in 1966 as well as songs about the death of David Bowie, and a San Francisco security guard named Alex Nieto.

recordname: In and Out of Youth and Lightness
description: The third full-length album for the hard rock band from Louisville, Kentucky, which began as mathcore band Breather Resist before its sound changed, was produced with Kevin Ratterman.
The Canadian rock band led by Carey Mercer release its latest album on new label Dead Oceans.

The New York-based foursome of Paul Banks, Carlos D., Sam Fogarino and Daniel Kessler took indie rockers worldwide by storm (and made Matador a lot of money) with 2002's 'Turn On The Bright Lights,' which introduced their neck-stabbing guitar-rock mix of Joy Division, The Cure, The Smiths, and all of your other favorite 80s bands. That captivating sound returns on this sophomore release, which features many of the new tracks ("Narc," "Length Of Love," etc.) which first debuted live during their relentless touring over the past two years.

This three-disc box set, subtitled "10 Years of B-Sides and Rarities," is just that, collecting 56 tracks from the Duluth, MN slowcore trio. Also included in the set is a 32-page booklet and a DVD with videos, concert footage and documentaries.

The Americana collective founded and led by fronted by Robert Fisher returns with a fifth LP. Co-founder/guitarist Paul Austin is no longer a full-time band member, but he appears on some tracks, as do Kristin Hersh, Chris Eckmen (The Walkabouts) and a variety of other guests.

The one constant in the Seattle indie band The Long Winters is Alaska native John Roderick, who is joined on this sophomore effort by a host of musicians including Peter Buck (REM), Scott McCaughey (Minus 5) and Sean Ripple (American Analog Set), with Chris Walla (Death Cab For Cutie) and Ken Stringfellow (The Posies) co-producing.

Boards of Canada's very first release--once limited to just 100 self-released vinyl copies in 1995--has finally been reissued on CD. (So if you've been holding on to your 12-inch to sell on eBay, tough luck.)

The Leeds, England band follow their acclaimed 2001 release 'Cold House' with this 10-track effort which, like its predecessor, combines acoustic guitars and some glitchy electronica elements into moody indie rock.
LaVette's latest features the Drive-By Truckers as her backing band.
The sixth solo release for the Cul de Sac guitarist was recorded by Laura Baird.
The semi-acoustic release for the rock musician was written after the death of his father.

Inspired by the 2020 elections, the latest release from the guitarist and his band features songs by Georgia artists and includes guest appearances from Julien Baker, Brandi Carlile, Bela Fleck, Steve Gorman, Peter Levin, Brittney Spencer, Amanda Shires, Chris Thile, Sadler Vaden, Adia Victoria, and John Paul White.
The soundtrack to the film about a hard-living country music singer (Jeff Bridges) features the Golden Globe-winning song "The Weary Kind."

recordname: The Further Adventures Of Lord Quas
description: Madlib's somewhat bizarre alter-ego returns with a 27-track set.
This second major-label release from Doug Martsch and company (following 'Perfect From Now On') features shorter, cleaner-sounding songs than that previous release.
The third full-length release for the Brooklyn synth trio is its first with John Also Bennett and features acoustic instruments.

Named after the 23rd letter of the Greek alphabet, <U+03C8>, the third full-length release for the British experimental duo's album was inspired in part by industrial, club, '80s goth, pop, and British electronic music.
Producer Static Selektah and rapper/chef Action Bronson's second album together is liberally sprinkled with humorous food references and features guest appearances by both Nina Sky and Meyhem Lauren.
The third album features the return of founding member, Jamie Thompson.

recordname: A Black Mile to the Surface
description: The fifth full-length studio release for the indie rock band led by Andy Hull and Robert McDowell was produced by Catherine Marks and John Congleton.
The debut full-length release for the collaboration between guitarist Dave Harrington and electronic producer Nicolas Jaar took two years to record.

The sixth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based hip-hop collective features guest appearances from A$AP Rocky, A$AP Ferg, Baird, Danny Brown, JPEGMAFIA, SoGone SoFlexy, and Charlie Wilson.
The first full-length album from the band is featured in the HBO series of the same name.
'Reflexxions' marks the first full-length collaboration between The Fall's Mark E. Smith and Mouse On Mars' Andi Toma and Jan St. Werner.
Shye Ben Tzur, Jonny Greenwood, and the Rajasthan Express collaborate on an album produced by Nigel Godrich and recorded in a 15th-century Mehrangarh Fort.
The German-born British composer consulted with neuroscientist Dr. David Eagleman for his eight-hour "lullaby for a frenetic world." There is also an one-hour version called From Sleep.
Jazz pianist Neil Cowley's latest release includes a strings group and guitarist Leo Abrahams.
The first album of new studio material in nine years for the singer-songwriter was produced by Richard McLaurin.
The ninth full-length release for the British electronic duo features only Japanese rapper Nene and Norwegian singer-songwriter Aurora.
The ninth full-length release for the Seattle drone duo of Dylan Carlson and Adrienne Davies was recorded and mixed by Mell Dettmer.

The "playlist" project for the Canadian hip-hop artist features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Black Coffee, Giggs, PartyNextDoor, Quavo, Sampha, Travis Scott, Jorja Smith, Kanye West, and Young Thug.
The fourth full-length release for the outlaw country artist was recorded in Michigan with Bobby Emmett, Chuck Bartels, Miles Miller, and John Hill.
The fourth full-length release for daughter of Will and Jada Pinkett Smith features guest appearances from Travis Barker, Cherry Glazerr, Ayla Tesler-Mabe, and Tierra Whack.
Trans-Global Underground's Nick Page gathered a group of Ethiopian musicians to record this album that mixes African and dub reggae music.
With their fourth album, Antony Hegarty and the rest of his New York City band infuse atmospheric intonations, innovation, and heartfelt emotion into their experimental music.
The second full-length release for the California singer-songwriter was home recorded on a four track.
This is the first album in over five years for the rock trio from New York.
The debut full-length album for the British singer-songwriter and her band, the Hooves of Destiny, was produced by Ben Hillier.
Part of the third full-length release for the Alan Palomo's project was recorded on a cruise ship with his brother.
The fifth album for the Los Angeles rock band was produced by Joe Barresi.
Produced by Four Tet's Kieran Hebden, the official debut studio release for the Syrian dabke singer was recorded in Brooklyn with keyboardist Rizan Sa'id.
The debut full-length release for the Norwegian electronic producer features a guest appearance from Bryan Ferry.
The Montreal band led by Murray Lightburn is a little more rocking and a little less orchestral on this follow-up to 'No Cities Left.'
The third full-length release for the Houston trio was produced by Steve Christensen.
The debut full-length solo release for the Factory Floor artist is a concept release with the 14 tracks forming a story about a night out to a dance club.
Originally a limited release on the Melters label, the debut full-length solo album from the San Francisco Bay Area hardcore artist is reissued by Slumberland.

recordname: Felt 3: A Tribute To Rosie Perez
description: The third album from the side project of Slug and Murs was produced with Aesop Rock.
The first album released in the US for the Barcelona, Spain-based artist.

Originally self-released by the band in 2003, this debut album for Rogue Wave (basically just namesake Zach Rogue, plus additional musicians on some songs) was remastered and re-released by Sub Pop in 2004.
The latest solo release was inspired by the Titanic and features experiments with "three dimensional recording techniques."
The second album for the indie rock band from Staten Island was produced by John Agnello.
The latest release for the country singer-songwriter was produced by Buddy Cannon and features guest appearances from Jamey Johnson, Leon Russell (in one of his final recordings), and Tony Joe White.
The third release for the Brooklyn rock band led by Paul Major sees the addition of guitarist Matt Sweeney.
The latest release for the psychedelic rock band originally formed by Ryan Rousseau with Jay Reatard and Alicja Trout, now features Rousseau, his brother Rusty, N. Nappa, J. Aurelius, and A. Flores.

recordname: In Advance Of The Broken Arm
description: New York guitarist Stern (who blends harder, experimental rock with more typical indie-rock tunes) makes her debut with this 13-song set co-produced by Zach Hill (Hella).
The latest release for the Syrian dabke artist features contributions from Hasan Alo, Moussa Al Mardood and Azad Salih.
The fourth full-length release for the British psychedelic jazz collective features the vocals of Barbora Patkova.

recordname: Near to the Wild Heart of Life
description: The third full-length release for the Canadian noise rock duo was mostly recorded/produced by Jesse Gander (track three was recorded/produced by Damian Taylor).
'Beyond' is the alt-rock band's first album with its original lineup--including J. Mascis and Lou Barlow--since 1988.
The 18th release for the Sydney-based experimental jazz trio features one 44-minute long track.
This is the second album for the Welsh rock band.
The fourth full-length release for the Norwegian artist was produced by Lasse Marhaug.
The eighth full-length studio release for the Cincinnati alternative rock band led by Greg Dulli was recorded in New Orleans.
This is the latest solo album for the singer/songwriter.
The acclaimed Argentinean artist returns with her fourth album of moody, electronica-infused indie-folk.
The first release in four years for the supergroup that includes Dan Bejar, Kathryn Calder, Neko Case, and AC Newman was produced by Newman and John Collins.
The second full-length solo release for the Irish singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Sam Amidon, Sam Beam, and John Sheahan and was produced by Thomas Bartlett and David Odlum.
The latest album for the nephew of the Allman Brothers Band drummer Butch Trucks features other blues artists such as Doyle Bramhall II, Oteil Burbridge, Susan Tedeschi, and Warren Haynes.
The French band releases a concept album based on the sounds of brass and woodwind instruments.

DJ Danger Mouse's bootleg hit, which mixes together vocals from Jay-Z's 'The Black Album' and music from The Beatles' 'The White Album,' has brought legal action from Beatles record label EMI, preventing record stores from selling the album.
Another somewhat strange indie-pop band from Oklahoma (Flaming Lips, anyone?), the Starlight Mints return with 11 catchy new tunes on this sophomore release.
The Australian instrumental trio, known for their dark, minimalist, atmospheric sound, includes Bad Seeds' violinist Warren Ellis, guitarist Mick Turner, and drummer Jim White.

Which Beck is it? The party-loving Beck of 'Odelay' and 'Midnite Vultures,' or the more serious, singer-songwriter Beck of 'Mutations.' On this latest release, it is the latter, as Beck reunites with Mutations' producer Nigel Godrich (Radiohead) for a set of darker, atmospheric, more acoustically-oriented tracks.
This is the debut full-length release for the collaboration between Yeah Yeah Yeahs' Karen O and Danger Mouse.

recordname: Older Than My Old Man Now
description: The 21st release for the singer-songwriter features songs about growing older, family and death. It includes guest appearances from his children (Rufus, Martha, Lucy Wainwright Roche, and Lexie Kelly-Wainwright), Ramblin' Jack Elliott, John Scofield, Suzzy Roche, Chaim Tannenbaum, Chris Smither, and Dame Edna Everage.
The band releases its self-titled fourth album before it heads out on tour with Interpol this fall.
The latest release for the experimental rock band was recorded in seven days in an abandoned office space in New Mexico.
The sixth full-length studio release for the pop artist features guest appearances from BLACKPINK, Ariana Grande and Elton John.
The first release from the San Francisco alternative metal band led by Mike Patton in 18 years was produced by Billy Gould.
After serving as Roky Erickson's backup band on True Love Cast Out All Evil, the Texas-based band return with their self-produced sixth studio album of indie-folk.

recordname: All That You Can't Leave Behind

description: The debut full-length release for the British pop artist was produced with Greg Kurstin and Joel Pott.
The first studio album for the rock band in more than 12 years was produced by Brian Paulson.
The third full-length release for the London-based electronic producer is his first on the Tri Angle label.
This is the second release for the Washington, D.C. electronic producer Andrew Field-Pickering.

recordauthor: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
description: The eighth studio release from the Austin rock band was inspired by various social and political issues like war and apathy.
This is the second album for the acclaimed Canadian electronica outfit led by Jeremy Greenspan.
The second full-length release for Los Angeles-based artist SASAMI features elements of classical, country-pop, folk rock, and nu-metal music.
Blink-182's Mark Hoppus produces the punk band's fourth album.
The debut release for Mike Donovan's mew music project was produced by Ty Segall.
The second full-length release for the Nashville-based singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Auerbach.
Produced by Buddy Cannon, the latest release for the country singer-songwriter features nine original songs and a duet with Jamey Johnson.
For the first time, Georgia Anne Muldrow hands over the producing reins to someone else, in this case to rapper/producer Madlib.
The Icelandic actress/singer-songwriter's latest album of experimental music was partially recorded on an iPad.
The fourth full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Hazel Wilde was recorded in Yorkshire.
The final Serge Gainsbourg covers release from the Bad Seeds member features guest appearances from Sophia Brous, Channthy Kak, Jess Ribeiro, Andrea Schroeder, Lyndelle-Jayne Spruyt and Xanthe Waite.

recordname: Blisters in the Pit of My Heart
description: The second full-length release for the British pop-punk band was produced by MJ from Hookworms.
The third full-length studio release for the British electronic group is its first in over 16 years.
This is the fourth full-length release for the British mathcore quintet.
The third studio release for the Canadian indie band led by Afie Jurvanen was produced with Robbie Lackritz.

This is the first release in a dozen years for the San Francisco-based experimental rock band now led by guitarist Helios Creed with Anne Dromeda, Steve Trash Fishman, Tommy GrenasKeith Thompson, Aleph Omega, and Lux Vibratus.
The debut release for the British folk father-daughter duo of Martin & Eliza Carthy was produced by Oliver Knight.
The ninth full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter was drawn from Harvey's travels to Kosovo, Afghanistan and Washington, D.C.
For the indie band's 10th release, Sam Prekop used a synthesizer to develop some songs before the other band members contributed their own ideas.

The fourth full-length release for the Oregon singer-songwriter features contributions from Peter Broderick, Death Cab for Cutie guitarist Dave Depper, Alela Diane, Neko Case drummer Dan Hunt, and Nate Query of the Decemberists.
The singer-songwriter releases his latest solo album featuring guests such as The Decemberists' Rachel Blumberg, Lucinda Williams, DeVotchKa's Tom Hagerman, and Zooey Deschanel.

recordname: No More Stories Are Told Today I'm Sorry They Washed Away No More Stories the World Is Grey I'm Tired Let's Wash Away
description: The fifth album for the Danish band was produced by Rich Costey.
The surprise release from the Canadian pop artist features contributions from such artists as Jack Antonoff, Bleachers, JOhn Hill, Dev Hynes, and Ariel Rechtshaid.
The rapper once again collaborates with producer 9th Wonder on this follow-up to 3:16.

recordname: I Am a Problem: Mind in Pieces
description: The Detroit experimental noise rock/trip metal band releases its latest album on Jack White's Third Man Records.
The latest full-length album for the Brooklyn band features the debut of new drummer Aaron Neveu.
The ex-Soft Machines band member returns with his first solo studio album since 1992.
The third full-length release for Brooklyn-based Mackenzie Scott as Torres was produced by Rob Ellis.
Written and recorded in Los Angeles, the fourth full-length release was produced by the Mississippi artist and features a guest appearance from Frankie Cosmos.
This is the first release of new music from the Memphis garage rock trio of Jack Yarber, Greg Cartwright, and Eric Friedl in over 15 years.
The latest full-length solo release for the Brooklyn-based singer-songwriter was produced by James Elkington.
The third full-length release for the Swedish dream pop band is its first without guitarist Gustav Andersson.
The fourth full-length release for the indie-pop artist was produced with Jorge Elbrecht.
Death Cab For Cutie's Ben Gibbard covers all 12 tracks from Teenage Fanclub's 1991 album Bandwagonesque.
The fourth full-length release for the California pop-punk band led by Barry Johnson was produced by Rob Schnapf.
The sixth full-length release for the British experimental jazz band led by Seb Rochford was produced by Ken Barrientos.

The eighth studio album for the rapper/producer from Compton features guest appearances by Bizzy Bone, BlakKazz K.K., Bun B, Dwele, Ice Cube, Kurupt, Jon B., Gift Reynolds, Gary Shider, and Suga Free.
This is the third album for the Winnipeg, Canada-based group led by former Propagandhi member John K. Samson.

'Twice,' which, yes, follows 2001's 'Once,' is the second album for the Los Angeles-based band that features three members of Beachwood Sparks. While the Sparks employ a 60's California pop sound, the Tyde tend to echo somewhat more recent British groups such as Felt.

recordname: How I Long To Feel That Summer In My Heart
description: The Welsh Britpop band returns with its second album in 2001 and sixth U.S. release overall. The first single is "Stood On Gold."
The first new album from Cave and his band since 1997's well-received 'The Boatman's Call.'
The second release for the British indie pop band was inspired by club music.
The singer-songwriter releases a live CD with tracks recorded from various cities on his 2008 tour. The second disc contains 35-minutes of stories and antidotes as told by Waits.
After eght years Pharoah Monch returns with his new album.
The debut full-length collaboration between Courtney Barnett and Kurt Vile was recorded and mixed by Callum Barter.
The sixth full-length release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from D Double E, Ghetts, Kojo Funds, Lil Silva, and Popcaan.
The ninth full-length studio release for the Scottish post-rock band was produced by Dave Fridmann
The third full-length for the solo project of Chicago indie rock artist Evan Weiss was produced by John Vanderslice.

Brooklyn art-rockers TV On The Radio make their full-length debut with this release. The trio consists of vocalist/animator Tunde Adebimpe, multi-instrumentalist/producer David Andrew Sitek (who produced the Yeah Yeah Yeahs debut) and guitarist Kyp Malone.
This is the debut full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock artist Alex Giannascoli. [This album was originally credited under the name Alex G]

The poems Brandon Flowers wrote about the small Utah town he grew up in were the basis for the Las Vegas rock band's seventh full-length studio release that also features a guest appearance from Phoebe Bridgers.
British electronic producer Paul Woolford's debut full-length release as Special Request includes a remix of Lana Del Rey's Ride.
This debut release from Anaïs Mitchell and Jefferson Hamer was inspired by the Francis J. Child Collection of Ballads books and was produced by Gary Paczosa.
The nine-track release from the New York hip-hop artist and producer Harry Fraud features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Chinx, Fat Joe, French Montana, Rick Hyde, and Jim Jones.
The latest full-length release for the R&B/soul singer includes country music influences and features guest appearances from Polica's Channy Leaneagh, Jenny Lewis, John Prine, and Justin Vernon.
The second full-length release for the Dutch indie trio of Jaap van der Velde, Erik Woudwijk and Elias Elgersma was recorded in Amsterdam.

The latest release for the British dubstep/grime producer features guest appearances from Andrew Ashong, Etta Bond, Kiko Bun, D Double E, Daley, Nubya Garcia, Ghetts, Knucks Eva Lazarus, P Money, Kojey Radical, and Rider Shafique.
The second full-length release for the British post-hardcore band was produced by Gil Norton.
The fourth full-length release for the Philadelphia rock band is its first without drummer Dan Finnemore with pianist Adam Weiner taking over lead vocals.

One of the highlights of Dntel's 2001 debut album was "This Is the Dream of Evan & Chan," where Dntel electronica mastermind Jimmy Tamborello was joined by Death Cab For Cutie's Ben Gibbard on vocals. Satisfied by those results, the two continued to collaborate (by mail), eventually resulting in enough material for this full album that ventures more into synth-pop/new wave territory than their previous single.

recordname: Micah P. Hinson And The Gospel Of Progress
description: The Memphis-born singer-songwriter is backed by The Earlies on this debut disc.
The fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn-based post-punk trio was produced by Drew Vandenberg.
Terius "The Dream" Nash has crafted countless hit songs, including Rihanna's "Umbrella," and returns with his third solo album of hip-hop hits.
The latest stripped-down, somewhat political rock effort from Ted Leo was produced by Chris Shaw (Dashboard Confessional, Bob Dylan).
Martin Terefe returns as producer for this sixth LP from the Canadian singer-songwriter, which includes appearances by Ed Harcourt and members of Travis.
"Ten Pieces" is the fourth album for Swedish psych-rocker Gustav Ejstes, who is joined here by guitarist Reine Fiske.
The first full-length solo release since her self-titled debut in 2010 for Berlin-based artist was recorded with Martin Thulin.
The San Francisco-based duo releases their sophomore full-length album.
This is the fifth album for the Swedish rock band led by Gustav Ejstes.
The fifth full-length studio release for the sister duo of Rebecca and Megan Lovell features a guest appearance from Tyler Bryant.
The latest release from the solo project of Kenny Anderson was recorded in Ireland, the Isle of Mull and in Glasgow with co-producer Paul Savage.

The 17th solo studio release for the rock artist was produced by Josh Homme of Queens of the Stone Age and features contributions from Homme, QOTSA's Dean Fertita, and the Arctic Monkeys' Matt Helders.
The third album for the R&B singer features songs produced by Stargate, Stereotypes, and Polow da Don.
The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based duo of Cleo Tucker and Harmony Tividad.
This debut album from the British singer (and daughter of actor Keith Allen) mixes pop with ska and reggae.
The second full-length release for the Canadian quartet was self-produced and mixed by Graham Walsh.
The latest release for the London grime artist is said to be his last.
The debut full-length release for the member of the PC Music collective was produced by A. G. Cook.
The sixth full-length release for the California rock was produced by Dave Cobb and is its first on the Atlantic label.
The second full-length collaboration between Adrian Sherwood and Rob "Pinch" Ellis features guest appearances from Martin Duffy, Skip McDonald, Lee "Scratch" Perry, and Taz.
The debut full-length release for South African singer Yannick Ilunga features influences from 80s pop, Afrobeat, house and rock music.
The trio of rappers from Cincinnati, Ohio and Brooklyn, New York, releases its second full-length album.
Thom Monahan (Pernice Brothers) co-produced the singer-songwriter's fourth album, which finds him singing in Spanish on a few of the disc's 22 tracks.

The gospel/soul singer attempts to capitalize on on her reemergence on the pop scene (thanks to a 2004 compilation) with this disc of a dozen brand-new tracks, one of which was written by Will Oldham. Lambchop's Mark Nevers produced.
The fourth studio release from the Scottish indie band led by Scott Hutchinson is its first on the Atlantic label.

The eighth full-length studio release for the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from Oswin Benjamin, Beny The Butcher, Cyhi The Prynce, Conway the Machine, G Perico, Grafh, Kid Vishis, KXNG Crooked, Ashley Sorrell, Sy Ari Da Kid, T.I., Westside Gunn, White Gold, and YBN Cordae.

recordname: One of Us Is the Killer
description: The fifth full-length studio release for the New Jersey hardcore rock band was produced by Steve Evetts.

recordname: What We All Come To Need
description: This is the fourth album for the metal band from Chicago.
The ninth studio album for the Seattle-based alt rock band was produced with Brendan O'Brien.
This is the latest full-length release for the Melvins line-up that includes Buzz Osborne, Dale Crover, and Mike Dillard (also known as "Melvins 1983").
The first release on the Anti- label for the Nandi Rose project was co-produced with David Tolomei.

recordname: Come Over When Youre Sober, Pt. 2
description: The posthumous release of the New York rapper's second full-length album was completed with the help of his mother, Liza Womack and producer Smokeasac.
The debut release for the collaboration between Bat For Lashes' Natasha Khan and the British rock band Toy features six 1970 psych and folk cover songs from different countries.

recordname: Take Me to the Land of Hell
description: The latest release for the widow of John Lennon/Japanese avant garde artist was produced with Sean Lennon and Yuka Honda. The album includes guest appearances from Nels Cline, Lenny Kravitz, Questlove, and Andrew Wyatt.
The Australian group's sophomore album hit number one on the Australian charts when released in their home country.
Dr. Dre, Kanye West and will.i.am are among the producers for the rapper's follow-up to 'Street's Disciple,' which marks his first release for Def Jam.
The 10th full-length studio release for the Chicago alt-rock band was recorded during the same sessions for 2015's Star Wars.

recordname: Just Dropped In (To See What Condition My Rendition Was In)
description: The posthumous release features covers of songs by such artists as Bad Medicine, Woody Gutherie, Janet Jackson, Gladys Knight, Bob Marley, The Marvelettes, Shuggie Otis, Prince, Kenny Rogers, Dusty Springfield, and Stevie Wonder.

recordname: Tiny Changes: A Celebration of Frightened Rabbit's The Midnight Organ Fight
description: Recorded in 2018 before Scott Hutchison's death in May 2018, Julien Baker, Biffy Clyro, Daughter, Aaron Dessner, Craig Finn, Fiskur, Benjamin Gibbard, Katie Harkin, Inletts, Manchester Orchestra, Lauren Mayberry, Oxford Collapse, The Philistines Jr., Piano Bar Fight, Right On Dynamite, Josh Ritter, Sarah Silverman, The Twilight Sad, and Wintersleep cover all the tracks from the Scottish band's 2008 album.
This is the second full-length solo release for the London-based Iranian electronic artist.
The first new full-length release in over 30 years for the Alt-country/Americana band was produced by Ed Stasium.
The fifth album for the metal band from Santa Barbara was produced by Mark Lewis.
The Fiery Furnaces member makes her solo debut of emotionally-moving experimental pop.
The latest full-length solo release for the Brooklyn-based indie artist was produced with Adam Brisbin and Julian Fader.
The second full-length release for the British pop quartet led by Juliette Jackson was produced by Ben H. Allen.

The debut full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper features guest appearances from 21 Savage, J. Cole, Doe Boy, Future, Gunna, Juice WRLD, Lil Baby, Lil Duke, Lil Keed, Lil Uzi Vert, Machine Gun Kelly, NAV, Quavo, and Travis Scott.
The trio becomes a quartet with the addition of second guitarist Austin Jenkins on its latest album of indie rock.
The latest album for the band led by singer/songwriter Stephin Merritt.
This is the sophomore disc for the Texas five-piece featuring former Bedhead co-founders (and current brothers) Matt and Bubba Kadane. The album was recorded in Chicago with Steve Albini.
The first album in seven years for the UK punk outfit founded in 1978 features newly reunited members Jaz Coleman, Youth and Paul Raven, with Dave Grohl filling in on drums.

The new group led by Billy Corgan of The Smashing Pumpkins features a lineup including fellow Pumpkin Jimmy Chamberlin on drums and guitarists Matt Sweeney (Chavez, Skunk) and David Pajo (Slint, Tortoise).
The legendary (and quirky) English band fronted by Robyn Hitchcock follow their 2001 reunion tour with this, their first new studio recording in 22 years.
Recorded live at a March 2002 show in Toronto, this 22-track, 2-disc set includes songs from Hayden's three previous albums, as well as three new tracks and a cover of Neil Young's "Tell Me Why."

This latest installment in Thirsty Ear's Blue Series of progressive/experimental jazz recordings is the work of turntablist DJ Spooky (Tha' Subliminal Kid), whose own mixing, bass, and kalimba are joined by jazz notables such as Matthew Shipp, Guillermo Barreto Brown, William Parker, and Medeski, Martin & Wood's Billy Martin.
Steve Albini was behind the boards for the Chicago-by-way-of-Seattle band's third album for Touch & Go Records.

The fourth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles experimental rap trio features guest appearances from Ted Byrnes, Cam, China, Michael Esposito, Ho99o9, Jeff Parker, SICKNESS, and Greg Stuart.

recordname: Brothers and Sisters of the Eternal Son
description: The Shins' Richard Swift returns to produce the sequel to Damien Jurado's 2012 album, Maraqopa.
The fourth full-length release for the Miami metal band was mixed by Converge's Kurt Ballou.
The 14th full-length studio release for the Welsh rock band features guest appearances from Julia Cumming and Mark Lanegan.
This is the second full-length collaboration between Phil Elverum and Julie Doiron.
The six-track release for the electronic producer was recorded during the same session as 2018's Konoyo.
The fifth full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter features guest appearances from JID, Monica Martin, SwaVay, and SZA.
The sixth full-length studio solo release for the San Francisco-based rapper features guest appearances from the Moldy Peaches' Kimya Dawson, Allyson Baker of Dirty Ghosts, and Rob Sonic.
The second full-length studio release for the Black Hippy rapper features guest appearances from Black Hippy, Busta Rhymes, Kendrick Lamar, Isaiah Rashad, Sir, and Lance Skiiiwalker.

The alternative rock supergroup comprised of Duane Denison, Mike Patton and John Stanier returns with its fourth release and a new member in Trevor Dunn, who takes over bass duties from Kevin Rutmanis.
Chad VanGaalen returns from producing Women's 2010 album Public Strain to release his fourth full-length solo album.
This is the debut full-length solo release for Late Of The Pier's Sam Dust.
The fourth full-length release for the New York industrial metal trio was mixed by Randall Dunn.
The debut full-length collaboration between Aidan Moffat and RM Hubbert features a guest appearance from Siobhan Wilson.
The major label debut full-length release for the music project of Will Toledo features new recordings of his older songs previously released on Bandcamp.
The latest release for the Meg Remy project was produced by Onakabazien and features guest appearances from Ben Cook, Amanda Crist, and Remy's husband Slim Twig.
This is the first solo release of new songs from Aaron Freeman since leaving Ween.
The second release for British producer Kieran Hebden in 2013 as Four Tet is his first full-length since 2010's There Is Love in You.
The band's first album on the Kill Rock Stars label was produced by John Congleton.
Well, they certainly aren't the most prolific of artists, but the acclaimed Scottish electronica duo of Michael Sandison and Marcus Eoin finally return with a third album.
The second album for the Brooklyn rock band is its first on Mute Records.
The follow-up to Axel Willner's 2007 album, "From Here We Go Sublime" features Battles drummer John Stanier.
Kimya Dawson teams up with Aesop Rock to combine their music styles on their debut music project together as The Uncluded.
The tribute album to Bob Willis by the country-jazz trio from Austin, Texas, was recorded over three days in London.
The latest album for the metal band from Savannah, Georgia is its second featuring two drummers.
The debut full-length release for the Danish indie pop band was co-produced with Anders Boll.
The debut release for the collaboration between Sam Beam and Jesca Hoop was produced by Tucker Martine.
The second full-length release from the alternative R&B duo features guest appearances from Taylor Brown, Meshell Ndegeocello, Porter Ray, and Shabazz Palaces.
Not-so-prolific Welsh singer-songwriter Green Gartside returns with his first Scritti Politti album in seven years.
The fifth full-length solo release for the frontman of The Charlatans was produced with Grumbling Fur's Daniel O'Sullivan.
The debut full-length release for the British indie-pop trio of Poppy Hankin, Iris McConnell, and Sophie Moss was recorded over two weeks by the band's touring guitarist, Mike O'Malley.
The first new studio release for the Afro-Cuban band from Senegal in 10 years is a tribute to singer Ndiouga Dieng, who passed away in November 2016.
The debut solo release for the Race Horses singer is described as a collection of songs about what happened to him in 2013, including a trip to Rome.
This is the first full-length release of new songs from the British post-punk band since 1989.
The seventh full-length release for the indie rock band features contributions from Steve Shelley and a majority of it was recorded in San Francisco.
The rock band from Tennessee releases their first album on the Universal Republic label.
The debut full-length release for Irish singer-songwriter Andrew Hozier-Byrne features a guest appearance from Karen Cowley.
This is the debut full-length release for British electronic producer Stuart Howard.
The second full-length release for the Northern Ireland singer-songwriter was recorded with Ant Whiting.
The first new release from the indie rock artist in six years was self-produced, mixed by Rob Schnapf and features a guest appearance from Lana Del Rey.

recordname: S/T II: The Cosmic Birth and Journey of Shinju TNT
description: The experimental trio's fifth album was produced by Chris Koltay and features former band member Ryan Vanderhoof as a guest vocalist.
The fourth album for the R&B singer features artists such as Joss Stone, Stevie Wonder, and Jay-Z.
The three-disc release from the saxophonist includes a six-track live set recorded in 2016 and a graphic novel.
The first album in seven years for the Go-Betweens co-founder features contributions from the John Steel Singers and his wife, Karin Baumler.
The debut full-length release for the British indie pop group led by Asha Lorenz and Louis OBryen was produced by James Dring.
Ty Segall is on drums for the debut full-length release with this side project with Charlie Moothart and Roland Cosio.
This is the latest album for the North Carolina-based band led by Greg Cartwright.
In an attempt to avoid the "one-hit wonder" label, the Brooklyn five-piece that brought "Cameltoe" into the world returns with a second album.
The eighth full-length studio solo release for the British rock singer-songwriter features contributions from Pulp's Jarvis Cocker, Nancy Kerr, Martin Simpson, and Slow Club's Rebecca Taylor.
The singer's latest album produced with Darryl Neudorf features guests such as M. Ward and members of The New Pornographers, Los Lobos, Calexico, The Sadies, and Giant Sand.

The latest solo release for the Los Angles-based rock artist features no guitars, instead instruments such as the bouzouki, drums (played by Charles Moothart and Segall), koto, harmonizer, mandolin, recorder, and saxophone were used.
The debut full-length release for the Australian electronic rock duo of Jono Ma and Gabriel Winterfield was recorded in France and mixed by Ewan Pearson.
The British indie rock band led by Stuart Staples releases its ninth album.
This intricate second album for the Brooklyn-based band led by Edward Droste is their first for Warp Records.
The last recordings of the country/rock legend features songs from 2006's "American V: A Hundred Highways" recording sessions and was again produced by Rick Rubin.
This is the appropriately-titled second release for the Philadelphia acid-folk group.
The American rock, country, folk and blues singer-songwriter crosses genres and breaks from her traditional songs of heartbreak on her tenth studio offering.
The second release in 2012 for Neil Young and Crazy Horse is its first album of original music since 2003's Greendale.
This is the seventh full-length release for the British band previously known as British Sea Power.
Richard H. Kirk returns solo for Cabaret Voltaire's first studio release in 26 years.
The fifth full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Jim James.
The second full-length release for the British electronic pop artist was self-produced.
The fourth full-length studio release for Kevin Parker's project was recorded in Los Angeles and Australia.
The 39th studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter with his Crazy Horse band is his first with Nils Lofgren since 1971 and was produced with John Hanlon.
The second full-length release for the Atlanta-based singer-songwriter was co-produced by Randy Michael and Jonah Swilley.
The third and final part of the The Hold Steady frontman's solo trilogy of albums that began with 2015's Faith In The Future was produced by Josh Kaufman.
The sixth full-length release for the Nashville-based Texas-born singer-songwriter was co-produced by Brad Jones and Allison Moorer (who also co-wrote several songs).
The live recording from the soul singer's two-night performance at London's Union Chapel was self-produced.
This is the debut full-length release for the collaboration between Field Music's Peter Brewis and Admiral Fallow's Sarah Hayes.
The fifth full-length release for the Cleveland indie rock band was recorded over eight days with producer Randall Dunn.
The second full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.
This is the second full-length release for the Swiss-born Nepalise-Tibetan electronic artist.
The third full-length release for the Massachusetts indie rock band led by Sadie Dupuis was mixed by Mike Mogis.
The second full-length collaboration from James Yorkston, Suhail Yusuf Khan and Jon Thorne was self-produced.
The debut full-length studio release for the Canadian electronic producer features a guest appearance from How To Dress Well.
The 19th full-length release for the Australian experimental jazz trio was self-produced.
The sixth full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Strat Barrett.

recordname: Good Luck and Do Your Best
description: The third full-length release for the British electronic producer was influenced by his visits to Japan.
The third full-length release for Arthur Ashin as Autre Ne Veut is the second part of a planned trilogy of albums.

The fifth full-length for the Boston-based hardcore band led by Derek Archamault continues its conceptual albums about a New Jersey blue-collar family with a focus on a Catholic priest who is having a crisis of faith due to his time in World War II.
The latest release from the alt-country rock band led by Howe Gelb was inspired by the Arizona desert and features contributions from Ilse DeLange, Grant-Lee Phillips, and Steve Shelly.
The fourth full-length solo release for the former Super Furry Animal was inspired by his 18th century ancestor, explorer John Evans, who mapped the Missouri River.
Jack Cooper of Mazes and James Hoare of Veronica Falls each wrote five songs on their debut full-length release together.
The debut solo release for the violinist best known for her work with Arcade Fire and Bell Orchestre was produced with Nils Frahm.
The sixth studio release for the Massachusetts metalcore band sees the return of original lead singer Jesse Leach, who had left in 2002.
The second release from the collaboration between Alasdair MacLean of the Clientele and Lupe Núñez-Fernández of Pipas was produced by Brian O'Shaughnessy.
The fifth release for the Japanese experimental pop artist was recorded by Tokumaru and mastered at Abbey Road Studios.
The R&B/jazz singer-songwriter's fourth full-length was co-produced with Pino Palladino and Brian Bender.
The second solo release for Ahmed Gallab as Sinkane includes influences from Afro-pop, funk, jazz, krautrock, and soul music.
Produced by Richard Swift, the second release for the music project led by Laura Burhenn is said to be both a concept and protest album.
The British folk band Trembling Bells collaborates with Kentuckian Bonnie "Prince" Billy.

Originally proposed as a three-piece with Metronomy's Joe Mount, Hot Chip's Joe Goddard and Raf Daddy went ahead with the idea without Mount to become The 2 Bears. After three EPs, the duo releases its debut full-length of original songs.

recordname: What Day Is It Tonight? (Trans Am Live 1993-2008)
description: The three-disc set contains live recordings that span the 15-year career of the rock trio.
This is the debut album for the Canadian singer-songwriter Merrill Garbus.
The fourth album for the Boston-based singer-songwriter was produced by Chris Coady.
The first studio album in five years for the Scottish rockers was produced by Tortoise's John McEntire.

A bit more upbeat-sounding than its predecessors, 'Elk-Lake Serenade' is the fourth studio disc for Toronto singer-songwriter Hayden Desser (who draws frequent Neil Young comparisons, and not just for being Canadian).
This is the debut full-length for the Nashville-based rock band consisting of three brothers (the sons of a preacher) and their cousin.
The debut album from Canadian/Portugese singer-songwriter Nelly Furtado is an ecelctic mix of musical styles.

Producers Prince Paul and Dan "The Automator" Nakamura assembled a varied cast of collaborators, including Miho Hatori (Cibo Matto), Del Tha Funkee Homosapien, DJ Shadow, Sean Lennon, Josh Hayden (Spain), De La Soul, and, of all people, Father Guido Sarducci. The band's name comes from an episode of the Chris Elliott sitcom "Get A Life."
The third full-length studio release for the Canadian artist features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Big Sean, Jay-Z, and Majid Jordan.

Recorded at the same time and released on the same day, 'Aw, C'Mon' and 'No, You C'Mon' are actually intended as separate albums, rather than two parts of a double album. The Nashville String Machine lends strings to each.
Climate change is theme for the fifth full-length release from the Canadian artist.
The ninth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced with Dan Horne.
This is the solo debut for the veteran turntablist / DJ / producer, formerly of Jurassic 5.
The 17th full-length studio release for the Australian hard rock band was produced by Brendan O'Brien.
This is the second album for the Los Angeles-based indie band.
Boom Bip and Super Furry Animals' Gruff Rhys come together to release a concept album about the life of John DeLorean.
The third album for the now Berlin-based experimental trio includes a DVD with (count 'em!) three videos for each of the dozen songs on the CD.
This CD collects tracks from the Swedish artist's most recent EPs and singles.
The New York trio's short but highly anticipated sophomore set--which features a mellower, more polished sound--was produced by Squeak E Clean and mixed by Alan Moulder.
The latest full-length release for British electronic producer Jon Hopkins was inspired by the Tayos Caves of Ecuador.
The first releases in seven years from the Los Angles electropop trio is not the previously announced (and still unreleased) Dear Tommy, but a surprise release of 12 new songs.
The debut full-length release for the Virginia singer-songwriter was recorded in one day.
The latest album from the folk singer features gospel songs recorded in a church.
The third full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was written after he moved from New York to Los Angeles.
The sixth full-length release for the Arizona-born singer-songwriter was produced by Mark Howard.
The third full-length release for the British indie rock quartet was produced by band member Paul Gregory.
The British rock band releases their fourth album, featuring production by Dan the Automator.
Costello's second album with producer T-Bone Burnett is both reminiscent of his earlier work and experimental in sound, with a foray into finger-picking country and eclectic folk-rock tunes.
The 16th full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was influenced by his divorce from singer Mandy Moore.
The latest release for the Los Angeles-based composer features a three-part piano-based suite.

The fourth full-length release for the Los Angeles electronic artist was recorded over a period of four years with Cole M.G.N. and features contributions from such artists as Dâm-Funk, Droop-E, and Julia Holter.
The Scottish alternative band returns after six years for its 10th full-length studio release recorded in France, Scotland and mixed in Germany.

The second full-length release for the Minnesota-based rapper artist was produced by BJ Burton and features contributions from Bionik, Doomtree's Lazerbeak, Alex Nutter, N.A.S.A.'s Sam Spiegel, and Bon Iver's Justin Vernon.
The fifth full-length studio release for the Texas-based singer-songwriter was co-produced with Ted Young.
One of two releases [the other is a live album] in March 2017 for the avant-garde singer, the studio album features jazz and traditional standards.

The second solo release for the indie pop singer, who is one half of The Fiery Furnaces with her brother Matthew, was co-written with songwriter Wesley Stace (a.k.a. John Wesley Harding) and produced by Eric Broucek.
The rock quartet from Alaska, now based in Portland, Oregon, releases its fourth album.
This is the third full-length release for the Australian avant-punk band led by Gareth Liddiard.
Long championed by the White Stripes' Jack White, fellow Detroit singer-songwriter Brendan Benson follows his 2002 disc 'Lapalco' with this set co-produced by Tchad Blake.
The sixth full-length release for the New York-based band led by Kassie Carlson includes influences from 70s krautrock and experimental rock.
The debut full-length release for the dream pop project of Paris-based singer Melody Prochet was produced by Kevin Parker of Tame Impala.
Carey Mercer recorded his second album under the name Blackout Beach by himself.
The debut album for the band led by Florence Welch was produced by Paul Epworth, James Ford and Steve Mackay.
The follow-up solo release to ex-Talk Talk bassist Paul Webb's 2002 collaboration with Portishead's Beth Gibbons was home-recorded with Lee Harris on drums.
The latest album for the singer-songwriter was inspired in part by the town of La Grande, Oregon.
After his well-received debut album released by Swedish label Gravitation, Kristian Matsson returns with his follow-up on the US-based label Dead Oceans.
The genre-mashing Londoners return with a quick follow-up to last year's debut 'Coming On Strong.'

recordname: The Moon Rang Like a Bell
description: This is the second full-length release for the experimental pop group led by Nicole Miglis.
Glen Hansard and Marketa Irglova release their follow-up to the soundtrack of the Academy Award-winning film "Once."
The ex-Orange Juice singer survived two strokes in 2005 and returns with his first album of new songs since 2002.
Brian O'Shaughnessy produced the atmospheric UK band's second studio album.

The third full-length studio release for the hip hop/R&B artist features guest appearances from 6LACK, Jhené Aiko, Anderson .Paak, Big Sean, FKA twigs, Future, Gunna, Tish Hyman, Kid Cudi, Kehlani, Lil Durk, Nicki Minaj, Musiq Soulchild, Mustard, Post Malone, Quavo, Roddy Ricch, Skrillex, Thundercat, Kanye West, and Young Thug.

recordname: The Real Thing: Words And Sounds Vol. 3
description: The third album for the soul singer.
The San Diego indie rock band releases their fourth album.
This is the second full-length release for the Thee Oh Sees under its shortened name.
The score for the crime drama televsion series released on Canal+, Sky Atlantic and SundanceTV is the first for the British electronic producer.
This is the second full-length release for the instrumental soul group last heard backing Charles Bradley's 2011 album, No Time for Dreaming.
The debut full-length release for the collaboration between R. Stevie Moore and Jason Falkner was recorded in two weeks in Los Angeles.
The seventh full-length release for the punk band led by Laura Jane Grace is said to be a relationship album.
The eighth full-length studio release for the Mike Kinsella solo project was produced by S. Carey.
The second full-length release for the Jenn Wasner solo project was recorded at her North Carolina studio.

As their name suggests, Fujiya & Miyagi are an English trio who make German electronic rock. (OK, so maybe it doesn't suggest that.) 'Things' compiles some of the Brighton band's previously-released singles.

recordname: City Sun Eater in the River of Light
description: The ninth full-length release for the Brooklyn psychedelic folk group is only its second recorded in a real studio.
The second release for the British indie pop quartet was produced by David Kosten.
Canadian singer-songwriter (and Broken Social Scene member) Leslie Feist returns with her third album and major label debut. Jamie Lidell guests.
They might sound Britpop (and at the very least, a bit like The Smiths), but this collective led by Murray Lightburn hails from Montreal, Canada. This is their second album and first U.S. release.
Missy Elliott reunites with producer Timbaland for her fifth album, which features vocal contributions from Nelly, Jay-Z, Mary J. Blige, Fabolous and R. Kelly.

The Montreal, Canada-based quartet (basically, 2003's version of Interpol) follows its acclaimed, 80s-influenced EP "Rememberese" with this debut full-length. "Still In Love Song" is the only song from that EP to reappear here.
The Chicago-based emo band returns with their fourth full-length.

Instead of a real follow-up to "The Hour of Bewliderbeast" (look for that later in 2002), Damon Gough returns with the score to the film adaptation of the Nick Hornby novel. The 16 new tracks here are split between short instrumental pieces and full songs.

Damon Albarn's breakup album (he split with his longtime girlfriend, Elastica's Justine Frischmann, prior to recording) was produced by William Orbit and features the singles "Tender" and "Coffee & TV" (although it failed to produce an American hit along the likes of the previous album's "Song 2").
The debut full-length release for the Washington, DC post-punk band was produced by Nicolas Vernhes.

Craig Street produced the latest release from the R&B singer featuring songs originally made by The Black Keys, Bob Dylan, Gnarls Barkley, The Pogues, Sly & the Family Stone, Tom Waits, and Neil Young.
