The fifth album for the British singer was produced by Beck and features a guest appearance by Chris Taylor of the band Grizzly Bear.
Actors Ryan Gosling and Zach Shields team up to release their debut album as Dead Man's Bones.
Actress Zooey Deschanel teams up with M Ward on this debut album.
This is the debut full-length album for the British indie five-piece band.
This is the fourth album for the improvisational, instrumental, genre-defying four-piece, which shares a guitarist (Bryce Dessner) with The National.
This is the first album from the Swedish duo of Marcus Joons and Daniel Tjader (formerly of The Radio Dept.).
The second full-length studio release for the rapper is the third for his Blue Chips trilogy and features guest appearances from Big Body Bes, Jah Tiger, Meyhem Lauren and Rick Ross.
David Fridmann produced the debut full-length album for the New York-based band.

recordname: Son of Rogues Gallery: Pirate Ballads, Sea Songs & Chanteys
description: Johnny Depp and Hal Willner's second collection of pirate/sea songs includes vocals from such artists as Dr. John, Marianne Faithfull, Iggy Pop, Courtney Love, Keith Richards, Patti Smith, Michael Stipe, and Tom Waits.
The debut album for the Brooklyn electronic duo of Zach Steinman and Sam Haar includes three previously released tracks.

recordname: The Story of Sonny Boy Slim
description: The second full-length release for the Austin guitarist was self-produced.

Originally conceived to perform The Eraser, Thom Yorke's 2006 debut album live, the supergroup comprised of Thom Yorke, Nigel Godrich, Mauro Refosco, Joey Waronker, and Flea toured for two weeks in 2010 with some new material. After the success of the tour, the band decided to work on an album and recorded the debut in three days.
The 16th full-length studio release for the indie pop band led by Kevin Barnes features a guest appearance from Locate S,1.
The full-length debut studio release for the London-based producer features a guest appearance from Chairlift's Caroline Polachek.
The debut full-length release for the British jazz artist features a guest appearance from Mansur Brown and influences from drum 'n' bass, hip hop and R&B.

The fifth full-length release for the indie rock duo of Sam France and Jonathan Rado features a full symphony orchestra conducted by Trey Pollard and contributions from Matthew E. White, The Flaming Lips' Steve Drozd and The Lemon Twigs.
The eighth solo release for J. Geils Band lead singer features four songs co-written with Grammy/Academy Award-winning songwriter Will Jennings.
The debut full-length release for the Philadelphia electronic producer features guest appearances from such artists as Future, Leikeli47, M.I.A., Novelist, Pusha T, Rustie, and Tirzah.
This is the second full-length release for the New York post-punk quartet.
The seventh full-length release from Berlin-based producer Stefan Betke was inspired by his walks in the Alps forest.
This is the debut full-length release for the Oklahoma singer-songwriter.
The latest album for Pat Metheny features an ensemble that includes Antonio Sanchez, Ben Williams, and Chris Potter.
The alt-country band's latest album tells of a dark and violent love affair set in an unnamed Oregon logging town.

Produced by the singer-songwriter-producer, the album was recorded between tours and other producing jobs on analog tape. It includes Andy Cabic and Otto Hauser of Vetiver; Chris Robinson and Adam McDougall of the Black Crowes; and Brian Geltner, Barry Goldberg, Josh Grange, Gerald Johnson, Gary Louris, and Gary Mallaber as guest musicians.
The Tennessee-based band release their second album of folk, country and garage punk and draw comparisons to bands like The Ramones to the Carter Family because of their genre-bending style.
The British jazz quartet's follow-up to Knee-deep In The North Sea, its Mercury Prize-nominated debut album, was recorded at Abbey Road Studios with producer John Leckie.
The dance-hall artist returns with his latest album, including one song with Akon.

recordname: ...And They Have Escaped the Weight of Darkness
description: The second full-length album for Icelander Olafur Arnalds continues to meld classical music with pop and rock music.
The second full-length release for the Scottish indie-pop duo of Cat Myers (taking over for Shona McVicar, who left shortly after their debut release) and Stina Tweeddale was produced by James Dring.
The debut studio release for the British pop singer includes some tracks from her two previous mixtapes "Heartbreaks and Earthquakes" and "Super Ultra."
The debut full-length solo release for the Seekae co-founder was produced with Fanny B.

Alan Maman moves from the producer chair to the mic for his third solo album as The Alchemist that includes guest appearances from such artists as Action Bronson, Danny Brown, Guilty Simpson, Fashawn, Roc Marciano, and Schoolboy Q.
The latest full-length release for the Arizona alternative rock band led by Joey Burns and John Convertino was recorded in New Orleans with producer Craig Schumacher.
The band's fifth album was produced by Guy Piccioto and John Goodmanson.
The latest release for the country singer-songwriter is a tribute to Frank Sinatra featuring songs made famous by the the man called the Chairman of the Board and a guest appearance by Norah Jones.
This is the debut full-length release for the Australian electronic-pop duo of Chloe Kaul and Simon Lam.
Even with more than 20 years in the industry, British DJ/producers Conrad McDonnell and Dan Tyler have not released a full-length album of their own until now.

Portugal's Buraka Som Sistema, best known for blending African kuduro with European techno and dubstep, presents its second album. Komba is named after an Angolan religious ritual celebrated seven days after someone passes away.
The singer-songwriter behind Smog [and its more parenthetical offshoot, (Smog)] returns with his first release under his given name.
Ending a multi-year hiatus, The Kills return with another album of minimalist garage punk.
The third full-length release for the Nigerian Afro-electronic band led by London-born Eno Williams was produced by Max Grunhard.
The first release in four years for the Brooklyn synth-pop trio was produced by the Violens' Jorge Elbrecht.
This is the second album for the band led by American Analog Set's Andrew Kenny and includes Sean Haskins, Matt Pond and Leslie Sisson. Death Cab For Cutie's Ben Gibbard features as a guest.
The rapper who was a member of Blackalicious releases his second solo album.
The latest full-length release from the British synth-pop duo was self-produced and recorded in Atlanta.
The five-track mini-LP from the collaboration between Royksopp and Robyn includes two tracks from Röyksopps upcoming album.
The first release in three years for the Japanese psych-rockers contains just six tracks, including one that clocks in at nearly half an hour.
The debut side project for Gaslight Anthem lead singer Brian Fallon also features his guitar tech, Ian Perkins.
The fourth album for the rapper includes Metronomy as a guest artist.
The Canadian band's fourth studio album, again produced by Ian Blurton.
The fourth solo release from the Norwegian artist/producer is a two-disc (or four LP) album of instrumentals influenced by 90's ambient music.
The debut release for Liturgy's Greg Fox and Oneida's Kid Millions was recorded in two separate sessions.
The solo debut release for the Blur frontman features guest appearances from Brian Eno, Bat For Lashes' Natasha Khan, and The Leytonstone City Mission Choir.
Ryan Hadlock helped produce the fifth studio album for British singer-songwriter, Ed Harcourt. The UK edition includes a seven-track bonus disc.
The first album for the band without Franz Nicolay, who left the band in January 2010, was produced by Dean Baltulonis.

recordname: What Do You Think About the Car?
description: The debut full-length release for the British alternative pop singer-songwriter was produced by James Ford of Simian Mobile Disco.
The fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn-based New Jersey indie rock band is its first with new guitarist, Julian Lynch (Matt Mondanile left to concentrate on Ducktails).
This is the debut full-length release from the Danish post-punk band led by Adrian Toubro.
The debut full-length release for the British producer/singer includes elements of R&B, pop and electronic music.
The second album for duo of Andrew Phillips and Marcus O'Dair was inspired by places in United Kingdom and features a guest appearance by Robert Wyatt.
The 27-member Swedish band's third album was recorded live during two recording sessions.

Leonard Cohen's first album of new material since 1992's 'The Future' contains, oddly enough, ten new songs. Sharon Robinson co-wrote each of the tracks, as well as providing instrumentation and backing vocals.
The darker second album for the indie band was produced by Paul Epworth.
The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based South Korean electronic artist was self-produced.
Kanye West is among the producers on this major-label debut for the 21-year-old Oakland, Calif. native.
Dr. Dog officially adds Dimitri Manos to the band for its live tracked seventh album coproduced with Nathan Sabatino.
With influences ranging from Sonic Youth to My Bloody Valentine, this Los Angeles trio's second album mixes melodic dream pop, electronica, and rock.

The 15th full-length studio release for the experimental rock band led by Michael Gira features contributions from such artists as Baby Dee, Ben Frost, A Hawk and a Hacksaw, The Necks, Anna and Maria von Hausswolff, as well as former Swans members: Thor Harris, Christopher Pravdica, Phil Puleo, Paul Wallfisch, and Norman Westberg.
The Swedish pop duo of Henrik Martensson and his friend Johan Angergard of Labrador Records, as well as such bands as Club 8, Acid House Kings, and the Legends, releases its debut album.
Nigel Godrich (Radiohead) produced this third studio LP for the French duo, who handle all the vocal duties themselves for the first time.
This is the first new studio release in six years for the rock band led by Jim James (who also produced the album).
Although still a solo album, 'Woke Myself Up' finds the singer-songwriter backed by her former bandmates in the Canadian group Eric's Trip for the first time in a decade.

The fourth full-length release for the collective that includes Damon Albarn, Gruff Rhys, and Moonchild Sanelly was recorded in a week with guest appearances from such artist as Ghetts, Mahotella Queens, Mr. Jukes, Phuzekhemisi, Radio 123, and Nick Zinner.
The first release in a decade for the British punk rock band was recorded live over nine days by producer Tony Visconti.
The fifth full-length solo release produced by Scott Amore comes after a series of setbacks including a studio fire, a car crash, and a bout of the measles for the singer-songwriter.
This is the full-length debut release for the British singer-songwriter first discovered in Paris, France.
This is the third full-length release from the Mexican Mariachi music side project formed by the Los Angeles punk band The Bronx.
The recording is the live improv performance of Christian Fennesz, David Daniell, and the Necks' Tony Buck at the Knoxille, Tennessee, Big Ears Festival in February 2009.
The debut album for the supergroup composed of the Foo Fighters' Dave Grohl, Queens Of The Stone Age's Josh Homme, and Led Zeppelin's John Paul Jones.
The rapper, also part of Mobb Deep, returns with a continuation to his debut solo album, "H.N.I.C.," after last year's "Return of the Mac."
The first album in more than 15 years features guest appearances by Booker T. Jones, Kris Kristofferson, Wayne Kramer, Marcus Miller, and a song originally cowritten with Bob Dylan.
The soundtrack to Berberian Sound Studio, Peter Strickland's homage to Italian horror films, is the final album for Trish Keenan, who passed away in January 2011.
The 23-track release from British electronic producer Paul Woolford was recorded over a period of three years.
The 13th studio release for the British synth-pop duo was produced by Stuart Price.
This is the third full-length album for the Canadian rock duo.
After taking a year off, Kevin and Anita Robinson wrote and recorded this album in a month.
The Swedish singer previously based in New Orleans releases her latest solo album.
The California-born, Portland, Oregon-based singer-songwriter releases her follow-up to her debut album, "The Pirates Gospel."
This is the sophomore album for the Kenyan and American group.

In 2011, DJ Gilles Peterson asked British dubstep producer Mala to come to Cuba to help on his "Havana Cultura: The Search Continues" album. Mala integrated the sounds he heard on his first official solo full-length debut release.
This is the fourth full-length album for the Long Island, New York, rock band.
This solo release (somewhere between a mixtape and a true album) for the Mobb Deep rapper was produced by the Alchemist.
This is the second full-length for the adventurous Canadian rapper, who mixes jazz, reggae and rock with hip-hop. He produced the album himself, and even plays guitar and piano on several tracks.
The second full-length release from Emmylou Harris and Rodney Crowell features six co-written songs and was produced by Joe Henry.
The 11th full-length release for the Swedish progressive rock/metal band was produced by bandleader Mikael Åkerfeldt and mixed by Porcupine Tree's Steven Wilson.
The New York City band releases its latest EP ahead of its full-length album, "The Crying Light."
The 17th full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Richard Bennett and features guest appearances from Johnny Bush, Miranda Lambert and Willie Nelson.
The Canadian indie rock trio return with their second release of lovelorn, nostalgic, anthem-heavy pop songs.
The ninth full-length release for Eric D. Johnson's indie folk project was produced and engineered with Josh Kaufman.
the 11th full-length release for the Los Angeles-based experimental band led by Jamie Stewart and was co-produced by Angela Seo and Deerhoof's Greg Saunier.
The fifth full-length release for the Southern California pop-punk band was produced by Kurt Ballou.
The 11th full-length studio release for the British extreme metal band led by Dani Filth features a line-up with two guitarists: Marek "Ashok" merda and Richard Shaw.

recordname: We Come from the Same Place
description: This is the third full-length release for the indie pop band.

recordname: No One's First, And You're Next
description: Modest Mouse releases an album with tracks from the "We Were Dead Before the Ship Even Sank" and "Good News for People Who Love Bad News" recording sessions.
The debut full-length solo release for the Real Estate frontman was produced by Woods' Jarvis Taveniere.
This is the debut full-length release from the collaboration between Julianna Barwick and Helado Negro (aka Roberto Lange).
The third album for the Washington-based metal band was produced by Randall Dunn.
After a number of mixtapes, the rapper from Louisiana releases his debut full-length studio release that includes guest appearances from Juicy J and Wiz Khalifa.
Leon Taheny produced the debut solo album for Holy Fuck's Brian Borcherdt as Dusted.
The first new full-length studio release in seven years for the German band features guest appearances Angel Bat Dawid, Ben LaMar Gay, Juana Molina, and Zayaendo.
The debut full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Jules Jackson was co-produced with Catherine Marks.

The second full-length release for Australian electronic producer Harley Streten features guest appearances from AlunaGeorge, Beck, Kai, Allan Kingdom, Kucka, Little Dragon, Tove Lo, Vic Mensa, MNDR, Raekwon, and Vince Staples.

British folk rock artist Teddy Thompson collaborates with his father Richard, his mother Linda, his sister Kami, his half-brother Jack Thompson, and nephew Zak Hobbs on this debut release produced by Teddy.

The fourth studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Christopher Thorn and features guest appearances from Ben Nichols of Lucero, Dave Hause of The Loved Ones, Jenny O., Chad Price, and John Snodgrass of Drag The River.
The full-length debut for the British indie rock band includes a song dedicated to World War II scientist Alan Turing.

recordname: I Was a Cat from a Book
description: Dave Wrench helped produced the album with the British singer-songwriter that includes contributions from members of The Cinematic Orchestra, Lamb, and Sparrow & The Workshop.
An apocalyptic future is the central theme for the 15th album from the British post-punk rock band.

recordname: I Love You. It's a Fever Dream
description: The first release in four years for Kristian Matsson as The Tallest Man On Earth was recorded in his Brooklyn apartment.
The second full-length solo release for The Killers lead singer was produced with Ariel Rechtshaid.
Mi Ami's Daniel Martin-McCormicks releases a five-track album of house music under the name Ital for Planet Mu.
This is the debut full-length release for the Brooklyn ambient pop band led by Greg Gonzalez.
The first studio release in more than five years [not including the Year Zero soundtrack] for the Vancouver rock band was produced by Randall Dunn.

The third full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter features songs co-written with such artists as Brian Burton, Samuel Dixon, Paul Epworth, Tobias Jesso Jr., Greg Kurstin, Bruno Mars, Max Martin, Karl Johan Schuster, and Ryan Tedder.
The ninth studio album sees the return of founding member Deakin and co-producer Ben Allen.
The Japanese experimental group's latest album features guest musicians Michio Kurihara of Ghost and Stephen O'Malley of Sunn O))).
The fourth self-titled release for the Los Angeles punk band is its first since 2008. They previously released two albums under the name Mariachi El Bronx in 2009 and 2011.
The latest album for the duo is a series of love songs to celebrate their 20 years of marriage.
This is the debut full-length album for the upstate New York indie rock band.

The final release for the Norwegian electronic duo of Svein Berge and Torbjørn Brundtland as Röyksopp features guest appearances from Ryan James of Man Without Country, Jamie McDermott of The Irrepressibles, Robyn, and Susanne Sundfør.
The third album for the British band was co-produced by Josh Homme and James Ford.
The fifth full-length release for the sister duo of Bianca and Sierra Casady was produced with Valgeir Sigurðsson.
The Bay Area indie-pop band returns with a second LP.
More "rocking" than recent LP 'Summer Sun,' this six-track EP includes four new songs plus alternate versions of "Cherry Chapstick" and the title cut.
Perhaps the most successful Dirty South rapper, Ludacris returns with his third Def Jam release.

Mixing post-rock and emo with punk edigness and experimentalism, Chicago's Joan of Arc features members of the Owls and Cap'n Jazz, including Owls vocalist Tim Kinsella. On this fourth album, they are also joined by members of Califone, Isotope 217, and Ugly Casanova, among others.
The latest installment in Thirsty Ear's Blue Series (which mixes cutting-edge jazz with elements of electronica and hip-hop), 'Equilibrium' showcases the talents of avant-garde pianist Matthew Shipp.
This is the debut full-length release for the Manchester electronic producer.

Andre Williams and the Canadian alt-country rock band the Sadies worked together in 2008, however due to Williams' legal and personal problems the project was shelved until they reunited recently to finish the album.
This is the Brooklyn indie rockers first full-length album on Dovecote.
The second full-length release for the Chicago-based singer-songwriter was written after a series of events including "a home invasion, deaths of loved ones and general violence."
The fifth full-length release for the Australian electro-rock trio (previously known as Pivot) was recorded in London and Sydney.
The third full-length release for the Northern Irish post-punk band was self-produced and mixed by Dan Rejmer.

After former Mr. Feelgood guitarist Wilko Johnson learned he had terminal pancreatic cancer, he went on tour and soon heard from Who singer Roger Daltrey about recording an album together. The collaboration was recorded in a week and was produced by Dave Eringa.
Mitchell Froom produced the latest for the duo of Amy Ray and Emily Saliers.
The fourth full-length release for the indie rock band was produced by Ross Orton.
This is the debut full-length studio release for producer Eddie Ruscha, who previously released music under the name Secret Circuit.
The self-titled release for the garage punk band from Australia was produced by Mikey Young of Eddy Current Suppression Ring.
Shelby Lynne's 10th album has her covering some of Dusty Springfield's biggest hits.
The second release for the Texas folk band was co-produced by band member Jason Reimer and producer Stuart Sikes.

recordauthor: You Say Party! We Say Die!
description: Released in their native country last fall, the third album for the Canadian rockers finds the quintet adds new variations to their sound.
Five years since her last release (Christmas album withstanding), country singer Kelly Willis returns with a new album.
Brian Eno's debut solo release on Warp (two previous releases were collaborations with other artists) was originally composed for a sound art exhibit in Italy.
The first studio release in seven years for the R&B/pop singer features guest appearances from Missy Elliott and J. Cole.

recordname: We Must Become the Pitiless Censors of Ourselves
description: This is the latest album for the experimental composer from Minnesota.
The four-track album from the Norwegian ensemble was self-produced and created over two weeks in Sweden.
The first full-length release for the Late Of The Pier frontman as LA Priest since 2015's Inji was co-produced with Erol Alkan.
The first new studio release in eight years for the E Street Band member features six songs co-written with Lou Reed.
The second full-length release for the British electronic producer Ross Tones includes natural field recordings from around the small English village he held the recording sessions at.
The British rock band return from its three-plus year hiatus to release its third full-length album produced by Sam Pura.
The full-length debut for Vetiver's Daniel Hindman and Sarah Versprille was produced by Richard Swift of The Shins.
The second full-length album for the electronic duo of Anateus Roy and Bryant Rutledge includes influences from such music genres as techno, footwork, and drum 'n' bass.

The singer-songwriter's 11th studio album's focus is funding There's Always Another Girl (previously known as Speeches Delivered to Animals and Plants), in conjunction with the Pledge Music website, and she's also donating a percentage of the money put up by the fans to a pair of animal shelters.

recordname: A Woman, A Man, Walked By
description: PJ Harvey and her producer John Parish team up again with a new album produced by Flood.
The fifth album for the Atlanta rock band is the follow-up to its 2007 album "Good Bad Not Evil."
The Brooklyn trio's third album, produced by John Agnello (Dinosaur Jr.), marks their debut for Sub Pop.
The third album for the indie rock duo of Alison Mosshart and Jamie Hince.
The rock band from New York releases its first album in a planned three-album trilogy the band is calling Thank Your Parents.
The first full-length release in five years for the Seattle-based alternative rock band was recorded by Johnny Sangster.
The tenth studio album for the alternative rock band is its third since reuniting in 2005.
This self-titled release is the full-length (well, 33-minute) debut for the teen garage-rockers from Nashville fronted by the Karen O-esque Jemina Pearl.
The sixth full-length studio release for the British electronic duo features London's Deep Throat Choir.

recordauthor: Thao With The Get Down Stay Down
description: The San Francisco-based trio releases its fourth studio album.
The Brazilian electronica artist utilized a different technique for his first non-soundtrack album in five years, building his tracks out of field recordings and found sounds.
David Grubbs and Laura Cantrell guest on Forrest's latest cut-up offering.

The second volume of Fela Kuti cover songs for the Red Hot Organization featuring African artists as Baloji, Angelique Kidjo, Kuku, Akua Naru as well as Western artists including Brittany Howard of Alabama Shakes, Merrill Garbus of tUnE-yArDs, Jim James, and My Morning Jacket.

Produced by T Bone Burnett, Elvis Costello, Rhiannon Giddens of Carolina Chocolate Drops, Taylor Goldsmith of Dawes, Jim James of My Morning Jacket, and Marcus Mumford of Mumford & Sons, helped complete and record the unfinished lyrics written in 1967 by Bob Dylan.
The first full-length release on the Anti- label for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was produced by Phoebe Bridgers.
The eighth full-length studio release for the alternative rock band is its first studio album in seven years.
Actress's Darren Cunningham is the latest artist to contribute to !K7's DJ-Kicks series.
This is the third album for the Oakland, California-based group.
Tortoise's John McEntire produced this fourth album for the New York-based Afrobeat outfit.
The debut album for the Swedish singer was produced by Bjorn Yttling.
The third album for the band led by Black Mountain's Stephen McBean includes contributions from nearly a dozen other musicans.
The indie pop band experiments with sound structures and textures on its ninth album.

Brakes is an often-jokey, garage-rock side project for British Sea Power keyboardist Eamon Hamilton, who here steps to the forefront, playing guitar and handling lead vocals. Joining him are members of Electric Soft Parade and Tenderfoot on 16 tracks that range from six seconds to 3:39 in length.
The 11th full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter features contributions from his Commotions bandmates Blair Cowan and Neil Clark as well as Fred Maher.
The Australian singer-songwriter's first solo release in seven years was influenced by his time at Joshua Tree.
The third full-length studio release for the British indie folk band was produced by Jimmy Robertson.
This is the ninth solo release for the former Gorkys Zygotic Mynci singer.
The third album for the Canadian rapper who also was named Edmonton's poet laureate in 2009 was self-produced.

recordname: A Bureaucratic Desire for Extra-Capsular Extraction
description: The first official release for the drone metal band was recorded in 1990 and features Kurt Cobain as a guest vocalist.
This is the second album for the Baltimore duo formally known as Monarch.
The fourth full-length release for the Portland, Oregon-based project of Ruban Nielson was recorded in several locations including Iceland, Mexico, New Zealand, South Korea, and Vietnam.
This is the first solo release for the British electronic producer/Planet Mu founder Mike Paradinas since 2007's Duntisbourne Abbots Soulmate Devastation Technique.
John Darnielle follows 'The Sunset Tree' with this equally personal 12-song set.
The second full-length release for the ex-Smith Westerns duo of Julien Ehrlich and Max Kakacek was produced by Bradley Cook and Jonathan Rado.
The first solo release in 23 years for the Rolling Stones' guitarist was produced with Steve Jordan.
The seventh full-length release for the singer-songwriter-producer was produced by Ryan Adams and feature guest appearances from Johnny Depp, Bob Mould, and Mike Viola.

The eighth release for the Los Angeles indie rock band led by Jim Putnam released only on Vinyl and digitally features new band members: Stevie Treichel, Be Hussey, Dan Iead, Brian Cleary, and Ethan Walter.
The debut full-length album for the South African indie rock band was recorded in three weeks.
The first release for the singer-songwriter on Nonesuch Records includes contributions from First Aid Kit, Blake Mills, Macey Taylor, and was produced Jonathan Wilson.
British rapper Rodney Smith's latest studio album features guest appearances by Toddla T, DJ MK, Daddy Kope, Ricky Ranking, and Rokhsan.
Showcasing his depth as a rapper, singer, and songwriter, Drake's debut album secures his place among hip-hop's elite with emotionally charged lyrics and dynamically produced beats.
Bibio, the moniker for UK producer Stephen Wilkinson, is a danceable, electronic music project with pop and chillwave undertones.
The Brooklyn, New York, band moves to Vice Records for its latest album, which is also the first with new band member Sadie Laska.
The live CD features live recordings after the release of 2007's "Volta."
This is the third full-length release for the psych supergroup formed by Sir Richard Bishop, Ben Chasny and Chris Corsano.
The third full-length release for the Brooklyn-based band was produced by Daniel Schlett.
This is the second solo album for the former Verbena lead singer.
Produced by Butch Walker, the fifth full-length studio release from the pop punk band is its first album since the quartet announced an indefinite hiatus in 2009.

recordname: The Million Things That Never Happened
description: The latest full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Izumi and Romeo Stodart.

After several album name changes (So Help Me God, SWISH, Waves, and T.L.O.P.), the seventh studio release for the rapper finally was set with guest appearances from Vic Mensa, Post Malone, Sia and Ty Dolla $ign.
This is the second full-length for the dance-oriented Sacramento/New York seven-piece (down from eight), who share several members with the band Out Hud.

Savath & Savalas is a side project from avant-garde hip-hop producer Scott Herren (aka Prefuse 73) that here incorporates elements of post-rock, Latin pop and jazz rhythms, and other world music elements. Aiding him are drummer John Herndon (Tortoise) and vocalist Eva Muns.
Christian-indie rocker David Bazan follows 2000's 'Winners Never Quit' with this full-length album. This time out, Casey Foubert (Seldom) lends a hand with the instrumentation.
This is the debut album for the former Mazzy Star chanteuse's new band.
These eleven tracks were recorded during the same sessions that produced 2000's 'Kid A,' but are a bit more song-like and a bit less electronic.
A Frenchman, a Swiss and an Argentine walked into a band, and the result was the tango-tronica sound of Gotan Project, who return with a follow-up to their 2002 debut.
This is the sophomore set from the Texas-founded (and now New York-based) band known for its epic, proggy, psychedelic sound.

The debut full-length solo release for the ex-S.C.U.M. frontman chronicles his life between 2012 and 2015 with songs influenced by his marriage to Peaches Geldof, the birth of their children, and her sudden death at 25.

The second release from Dev Hynes as Blood Orange includes guest appearances from such artists as Adam Bainbridge of Kindness, Clams Casino, MC Despot, David Longstreth of Dirty Projectors, Caroline Polachek of Chairlift, Skepta, and Samantha Urbani of Friends.
The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based artist features influences from funk, hip-hop, house, and pop music.
Produced by guitarist Ivan Duran, the latest album for Aurelio Martinez was recorded in Senegal.
The second full-length album for the Chicago pop band finds it with a new lineup after the loss of two of its founding members.
This is the third album for the New York-based rapper.
The fifth full-length solo release for the Norwegian singer who previously released music under Susanna And The Magical Orchestra.
The Raconteurs surprised much of the music industry by announcing the release of its sophomore album a week before it was released.
The sophomore solo album for The Kinks' lead singer was recorded in Nashville, Tennessee.
This is the debut full-length collaboration between Minneapolis electro-pop band Poliça and the Berlin-based orchestra collective Stargaze.
The posthumous release is the rapper's full-length studio album and features guest appearances from Halsey, Marshmello, Polo G, The Kid Laroi, and Trippie Redd.
The second full-length release for the California composer/multi-instrumentalist was recorded in part in an empty two million gallon underground water tank.
The four-track release from the Chicago duo of Cooper Crain and Dan Quinlivan is their first on the Drag City label.
The former 10,000 Maniacs singer releases a 26-track solo album based on poems about childhood.
This is the sixth album for the Japanese instrumental post-rock band.
The eighth full-length release for the Texas artist was recorded in his home studio.
This album contains several live and studio recorded songs from the Grammy-winning jazz singer.
This is the second Pink Mountaintops album for Vancouver, Canada's Stephen McBean.
This is the guitarist's first solo acoustic album in nearly 25 years.
The psychedelic prog-rock outfit led by Cedric Bixler Zavala and Omar Rodriguez return with a second ambitious album, which follows the death of band member Jeremy Ward.
The debut solo release for the former My Chemical Romance singer was produced by Doug McKean.
The second full-length ambient release for the California producer (who also released albums under the name Lee Bannon) was recorded in Berlin, California, Cambridge, and New York.
Produced by Lee Townsend, the latest release from the Austin singer-songwriter features covers of Mexican classics and originals influenced by those songs.
The fourth full-length release for the California indie rock band was produced by Ben Allen.

recordname: Belle and Sebastian Write About Love
description: The Glaswegian indie pop band returns after a four-year hiatus with an eighth studio album, featuring its trademark down-tempo ballads and jangly guitar rock.
The sophomore album for ex-Comets on Fire frontman is the first jointly released on Birdman and Rick Rubin's American label.
The seventh Mark Lanegan Band album features guest appearances by Josh Homme, Greg Dulli, Jack Irons, and Alain Johannes.
The seven-track album is the third studio release for the singer-songwriter since dropping the name Smog.
The third full-length release for the British psychedelic pop band led by Dave Bayley (who also produced the album) was executive produced by Paul Epworth.
The first new studio release in five years for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in California at producer Joe Henry's house.
The latest solo album for the Rilo Kiley singer features guests such as Elvis Costello and Chris Robinson.
The soundtrack for the short horror film Massachusetts electronic duo Boy Harsher also wrote and directed features guest appearances from Cooper B. Handy (aka Lucy) and Mariana Saldaña of BOAN.

The debut full-length studio release for the Arizona alternative rap group features guest appearances from Aminé, Dylan Brady, Cakes Da Killa, DRAM, Freddie Gibbs, JPEGMAFIA, Pro Teens, Rico Nasty, and Tony Velour.

The debut full-length release for the Norwegian indie rock trio of Mads Baklien, Stian Brennskag, and Christian Løvhaug was produced by Tord Øverland Knudsen of The Wombats and Team Me's Marius Drogsås Hagen.
The third album for the Baltimore band was created as a musical project with Charles Long, a visual artist.
The troubadour offers his take on a dozen 1980s alternative-rock classics, including songs by R.E.M., The Cure, New Order, The Smiths, Echo & The Bunnymen and The Pixies.
The fourth full-length solo release for the Sonic Youth guitarist/singer sees the return to guitar rock with backing from Steve Shelley, My Bloody Valentine's Debbie Googe, and James Sedward.
The latest full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was recorded in Montreal with Arcade Fire's Tim Kingsbury and Richard Reed Parry, and with production from Craig Silvey and Teddy Impakt.
The Brooklyn neo-psychedelic pop trio of Sasha Bell, Jeff Baron, and Christopher Ziter return for their first full-length release since 2006's Cannibal Sea.
The ninth full-length studio release for the Canadian indie sister duo was produced by Alex Hope.
The sixth full-length release for the Brooklyn-based rock band was recorded in six days with producer Bob Mould.
The sixth full-length studio release for the Philadelphia-based punk band was produced by Will Yip.
The fifth full-length release for the husband-and-wife duo of Aaron Coyes and Indra Dunis was produced by Coyes.

recordname: We Knew It Was Not Going to Be Like This
description: The second full-length release for the New Zealand psychedelic pop band was recorded in New York, New Zealand, and South Korea.
The seventh release from the Canadian singer-songwriter is his first on the Arts & Crafts label.

The third full-length release (her first was not commercially released) for the British pop artist features songs written and/or produced by such artists as Ariel Pink, Vampire Weekend's Rostam Batmanglij, Patrik Berger, Bloodshy & Avant, Cashmere Cat, Weezer's Rivers Cuomo, Markus Krunegård, Greg Kurstin, Justin Raisen, Stargate, and Steve Mac.
The Oklahoma band makes its Barsuk debut with this third album of quirky indie-pop.
The second solo release for the Saint Etienne singer features guest appearances from The Rails and Manic Street Preachers' Nicky Wire.

The duets album from the experimental band led by Jaime Stewart includes Alice Bag, Valerie Diaz, Drab Majesty, Haley Fohr, Liz Harris, Liars, Owen Pallett, Fabrizio Modonese Palumbo, Susanne Sachsse, Greg Saunier, Angela Seo, Shearwater, Twin Shadow, Sharon Van Etten, and Chelsea Wolfe.
The hip hop collective follow their first #1 album, 2018's Iridescence, with this self-produced 12-song set.
The fourth full-length release for the British indie rock band features contributions from such artists as Thomas Bartlett, Jamie xx, Sampha, and Tobias Jesso Jr, Kelsey Lu, and Kamasi Washington.
This is the debut album of the collaboration between Magnolia Electric Co.'s Jason Molina and Centro-matic's Will Johnson.
This is the sophomore album for the New Zealand band led by ex-Californian Ryan McPhun.
The second studio release for the Syrian electronic artist features production from Four Tet, Legowelt, Modeselektor, Gilles Peterson and Black Lips' Cole Alexander.
This is the third album for the San Diego-based band led by Ray Raposa.
With all but the vocals recorded live to tape, Wolf Parade's new release promises massive sound and heavy-hitting lyrics, which is what we've come to expect from this innovative indie-rock quartet.
The debut album for the British band was produced by Matthew Herbert.
Trevor Horn produced the duo's first album in four years, hailed by some critics as a return to their peak 1980's form.
The second album from South African artist Spoek Mathambo includes hip-hop, R&B, native African, electronic, and rock elements on the debut with the Sub Pop label.
Now credited without the Outs, Frankie Rose's second solo album looks toward the 1980s for sound influences.

recordname: I Won't Care How You Remember Me
description: The sixth full-length release for the Pennsylvania indie rock band was produced by Will Yip.
The fifth full-length release for the New York duo was produced by Shane Stoneback.
The second full-length studio release for the Oregon rapper features guest appearances from Injury Reserve, JID, slowthai, Vince Staples, Summer Walker, Charlie Wilson, and Young Thug.

The debut full-length release for Exit Calm guitarist Rob Marshall features vocals from Joel Cadbury, Dave Gahan, Mark Gardener, Carl Hancock Rux, Jim Jones, Mark Lanegan, Ilse Maria, John Robb, and Ron Sexsmith.
The 15th full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Charlie Andrew and Beni Giles.
The debut full-length release for the collaboration between John Grant and Wrangler (Stephen Mallinder, Phil Winter and Benge Edwards)
The second full-length release for the electronic pop duo of Amelia Meath and Nick Sanborn was written in North Carolina, Wisconsin, and Los Angeles in 2016.
The third release for the British folk duo feature two covers including Gillian Welch and David Rawlings' "Dark Turn of Mind."

The debut full-length release for the alternative rock group that includes Slowdive's Rachel Goswell, Mogwai's Stuart Braithwaite, Editors' Justin Lockey and his brother, James Lockey of Hand Held Cine Club features guest appearances by The Twilight Sad's James Graham and Mark Kozelek.
The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter Rebecca Jones was produced by Bill Ryder-Jones.
This is the debut full-length release for the music project from LCD Soundsystem's Pat Mahoney and the Juan MacLean's Dennis McNany.
The first release in 13 years for the punk band led by Jad Fair was produced by John Dieterich of Deerhoof.
The second release for the daughter of Sex Pistols drummer Peter Cook was produced by Prince Fatty and features guest appearances from Dennis Bovell, George Dekker, Winston Francis, and Omar.
the ninth studio release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Johann Scheerer and is its first with new bassist Leo Kurunis.

The debut full-length release for the British DJ and producer includes guest appearances from such artists as Hercules And Love Affairs Kim Ann Foxman, Miss Kittin, Karin Park, Alpines Catherine Pockson, Nadine Shah, and Tricky.
The second full-length release for the soul-punk British four-piece led by Al Kershaw was recorded in Georgia with producer Mark Neil.
The unedited second live release for the electronic duo was recorded at a 2012 show in Philadelphia.
The debut release for the Dutch musician was inspired by the music of the 1960s.
The debut full-length release on Sub Pop for the Seattle hip-hop duo of Stasia Irons and Catherine Harris-White features Shabazz Palaces' Ishmael Butler as a guest singer.
Originally a solo project for Swede Sebastian Armstrong, the debut full-length album is the first for the band as a trio.
This is the first album in 30 years for the British post-punk band who reunited in 2008.
The Celtic folk rock band led by Mike Scott release an album of songs based on the poems of W.B. Yeats.
This is the debut release for the jazz quartet made up of Joshua Redman, Aaron Parks, Matt Penman, and Eric Harland.
The singer-songwriter recorded the album live over three days with the Magik*Magik Orchestra.
The latest album for the rock band was recorded live at Levon Helm's barn. The CD comes with a code to download "Until The Freeze," which contains a second set of songs.
The latest album for the country singer produced by Tony Brown features three songs cowritten with his son, George "Bubba" Strait, Jr.
The electronic artist/producer who previously worked on Coldplay's Viva La Vida releases his first album on the Domino label.
The second album for the British indie-rock quintet was produced by Markus Dravs.
This is the third album for the Minnesota rapper, who is also a member of punk band Building Better Bombs.

recordname: Everything That Happens Will Happen Today
description: The sophomore album for the two rock legends was released digitally on their Web site, with a physical CD due later in the fall.

The Swedish group (originally formed 9 years ago as an all-girl trio, but now featuring 8 full-time members) make their international debut with an album that manages to combine elements of classic Motown, Mazzy Star and the Velvet Underground.
The Reverend returns to his roots, reuniting with the same producer (Willie Mitchell), Memphis studio (Hi Records' Royal Studios) and session musicians that made him a legend during the 1970s.
Berlin's Stefan Betke (aka Pole) makes his debut for Mute with this 4-track disc, the first in a planned series of EPs.

This seven-track EP recorded during the sessions for 'Romantica' includes covers of the Rolling Stones' "Waiting On A Friend" and Kraftwerk's "Neon Lights," as well as five new songs and videos for "Lovedust" and "1995."
The ever-popular contemporary country act returns with their sixth album.
This is the former Beatle's first album of original recordings since 1997's 'Flaming Pie.'
The second solo release for the Stereolab singer features guest appearances from Sam Prekop of Sea & Cake and fellow Stereolab band member Tim Gane.
The latest solo release for the Dinosaur Jr. singer/guitarist features guest vocals from Black Heart Procession's Pall Jenkins, Mark Mulcahy and Luluc's Zoë Randell.
The two years Canadian artists Alex Zhang Hungtai spent on the road is the concept behind his double album as Dirty Beaches.
The lyrics for each of the songs on this rock-oriented disc are based on the teachings of Jesus (Christ).
This is the third full-length solo release for the former Emeralds guitarist.
Health's 2009 album "Get Color" is remixed by such artists as Crystal Castles, Tobacco, CFCF, Javelin, and Little Loud.
The 15th full-length studio release for the San Francisco indie/experimental pop band was self-produced.

recordname: I Have to Feed Larry's Hawk
description: Released under the expanded name, Tim Presleys White Fence, the seventh full-length solo release for the California rock artist was recorded in San Francisco by Jeremy Harris.
The sixth full-length release from the electronic duo is an cinematic-inspired album that will be accompanied by a film directed by Lisa Gunning.
The 18th full-length studio release for the San Francisco-based experimental rock band is self-described as "baroque gone DIY."
My Morning Jacket's Jim James releases his tribute EP to the late George Harrison.
This is the debut full-length collaboration between Adrian Sherwood and Rob Ellis.
The third album for the Canadian band was recorded in a barn and is the first with new member Matt Schulz.
The debut full-length release for the Austin-based indie pop singer from Los Angeles was recorded in two days with co-producer Dan Duszynski.
The first new release in 12 years for the Southern California punk quartet was produced by the band's guitarist Stephen Egerton and drummer Bill Stevenson.
This is the latest album for the Canadian rock-pop quartet.
This is the fourth full-length release for the Swedish singer-songwriter Kristian Matsson.
This is the first album for the British rock band to feature the Smiths' Johnny Marr as lead guitarist.
Kieran Hebden releases a 30-minute, four-track minialbum.

The Chicago pop-punk band face high expectations for this fourth album after its predecessor, their major-label debut 'From Under The Cork Tree,' brought their first taste of mainstream success. Jay-Z (briefly) guests.
The fifth full-length release for the Austin psych rock band was produced by Phil Ek.
The fifth release for electronic producer Simon Green features guest appearances from Erykah Badu, Cornelia, Grey Reverend, and Szjerdene.
This California rap group at one time had Xzibit as a member, but now, the group is a trio, and releasing its first album in three years produced by Madlib.
The Los Angeles-based band that mixes Cambodian pop to rock music releases its third album.
Known primarily as a rapper, Ben Drew releases his soul singer concept album, exploring different sounds and an alter ego.
The debut full-length album for the British 22-year old singer-songwriter was produced by Matt Hales (also known as Aqualung).
The second album for the American electronic artist Thomas Meluch.
The third album from the electronica-influenced UK band.
Internationally acclaimed rockers release their sixth album since Neil Finn first formed the band 25 years ago, featuring production by Jim Scott from Wilco.
Self-produced, the first release of new music from ELO since 2001's Zoom was completely a one-man project except for Jeff's daughter Laura Lynne on backing vocals.

recordname: It's Hard for Me to Say I'm Sorry
description: The collaboration between Christian Fennesz and Jim O'Rourke is a two-track full-length release.

recordname: When You're Through Thinking, Say Yes
description: The Jacksonville, Florida, pop-punk band returns with its seventh album of catchy melodies and sing-along choruses--its first release in almost three years after its reformation in 2010.

A sequel to the rappers debut 2005 album is part one of a double album (The Documentary 2.5 was released October 16th) features guest appearances from such artists as Ab-Soul, Diddy, Dr. Dre, Drake, Fergie, Ice Cube, Kendrick Lamar, Q-Tip, Snoop Dogg, Kanye West, and will.i.am.
The latest release from the Miami-based metal band is its second without guitarist Juan Montoya who left the band in 2008.
The debut full-length release for the Philadelphia rapper features The Weeknd and Pharrell Williams.

The fifth full-length solo studio release for the British producer features guest appearances from Camila Cabello, Miley Cyrus, Diana Gordon, Ilsey, Alicia Keys, King Princess, The Last Artful, Dodgr, Lykke Li, Angel Olsen, and YEBBA.
The second full-length release form the rap brother duo from Mississippi features guest appearances from Gucci Mane, Juicy J, Kodak Black, and Lil Jon.

recordname: Nothing Is Precious Enough For Us
description: Joel Thibodeau's sophomore album was recorded in New Jersey and produced by Pete Donnelly.
This is the first full-length album in more than four years for the British experimental rock band.
The latest solo release for the Earth frontman was recorded by Kurt Ballou.

The third full-length studio release for producer Ryan Lott as Son Lux includes contributions from Gem Club's Ieva Berberian Mutemath's Darren King, Lily & Madeleine, The Antlers' Peter Silberman, DM Stith, The Punch Brothers' Chris Thile, and yMusic.
The third release from the Austin soul and blues-rock band includes production from Stuart Sikes and John Congleton on three tracks.

recordauthor: Margot & the Nuclear So and So's
description: Jon Congleton produced the fourth album for the indie pop group led by Richard Edwards.
This is the full-length debut album for the New Zealand indie rock quartet.
This is the third album for the side project of Wilco members Pat Sansone and John Stirratt.
Scott McCaughey's seventh Minus 5 album includes contributions from members of Wilco, R.E.M., The Decemberists, Ministry, The Posies and more.

The Ohio native (now based in Nashville) worked with such artists as Pat McLaughlin, John Prine, Jerry Douglas, Duane Eddy, Gene Chrisman and Bobby Wood of the Memphis Boys for his second solo release.
John Mellencamp latest album was produced by T Bone Burnett who also developed a new audio format promised to help the album sold sound like master tapes.
The first new full-length studio release in seven years for the New York rock bad was produced by Rick Rubin.
The second full-length release from the Los Angeles-based psych rock band was produced by Chris Woodhouse.
The fourth full-length release for the Baltimore post-hardcore band was produced by by Will Yip.
The third release for the British folk-rock band led by Kate Stables was produced by Aaron Dessner.
The second full-length studio release for the Canadian duo of Sebastien Grainger and Jesse F. Keeler was produced by Dave Sardy.
The third full-length release for the Katy Goodman's project was produced by guitarist Tod Wisenbaker.
The seventh release for the New York noise rock band was produced by Andrew Schneider.
The indie rock band from Milwaukee, Wisconsin, releases its fourth full-length album.

recordname: The Inevitable Past Is the Future Forgotten
description: The San Diego indie rock band returns with its first studio full-length album in more than 13 years.
Working once again with producer Dr. Dre, Marshall Mathers returns with his third album.
The first full-length studio release for the Brooklyn-based rock band in five years was produced by Josh Kaufman.
The latest ambient solo release for the British artist consists of one 54-minute track recorded in one live take.
The debut full-length release for the Spanish band formed by four teenagers was recorded in two days.

The fourth full-length release for the British bedroom project-turned-band sees Ian Parton taking the reins as a solo project once again: writing, producing and performing all the songs with guest vocalists.
The 14th full-length studio release for the alternative rock band led by Rivers Cuomo was produced by Jake Sinclair.

Alva Noto, Arca, Cornelius, Electric Youth, Fennesz, Jo´hann Jo´hannsson, Motion Graphics, Oneohtrix Point Never, Andy Stott, S U R V I V E and Yves Tumor remixed some of the tracks from Ryuichi Sakamoto's 2017 release.

Sunn 0)))'s Stephen O'Malley is joined by Michio Kurihara of Ghost, Boris drummer Atsuo, and William Herzog from Jesse Sykes & the Sweet Hereafter, plus Eyvind Kang and Timba Harris on Ensemble Pearl's debut release.

The Los Angeles indie-rockers make their major label debut with 'More Adventurous.' In the two years since their previous outing together, the band's Jenny Lewis contributed vocals to the debut from the Postal Service, while Blake Sennett and Jason Boesel released an album from their own side project, The Elected.
The 14th full-length studio release for the British synth-pop duo features a guest appearances from Years & Years and was produced by Stuart Price.
The fourth album for the Grammy-winning rapper features Young Jezzy, Lil Wayne, Mr. Hudason, and Kid Cudi.
The 16th full-length studio release for the Australian hard rock band was produced by Brendan OBrien and its first with Stevie Young, who took over his uncle's role in 2014.
The first solo album in nearly eight years for the dB's Chris Stamey includes acoustic arrangements.
The latest album for the R&B singer features guest performers Drake, T.I., and Trey Songz as well as a song from the film "Precious."
The quintet from Jacksonville, Florida, releases its debut album produced by Bernard Butler.
The debut full-length release for the Scottish indie pop duo of Stina Tweeddale and Shona McVicar was produced by Peter Katis.

The first release since 1997s Illumination for the Scottish indie pop band was produced by John McEntire and includes guest appearances from the Tenniscoats; Norman Blake and Gerard Love of Teenage Fanclub; and Stefan Schneider and Ronald Lippok of To Rococo.
The third full-length release for the Australian trio was recorded in Bristol by producer John Parish.
The ninth full-length release for Sarah Lipstate as Noveller was recorded in Los Angeles.
The third full-length studio release for the New Orleans-based duo of Grant Widmer and Ted Joyner is the first album on the Polyvinyl label.
The debut release for the Welsh noise pop band was produced by MJ of the Hookworms.
The second full-length studio release for the Maryland rapper features guest appearances from Big Lenbo, Jesse Boykins III, Dria, and Lucy Rose.
The fifth full-length studio release for the R&B/soul singer features production from 9th Wonder, David Banner, and Andre "Dre" Harris.
The first full-length studio release from the emo band in 16 years was produced by Will Yip.
The debut full-length release for the California indie pop singer-songwriter was influenced by 1960s music.
The latest album from the Indiana rock duo, now based in Berkeley, California.
This is the debut album for the Candian producer/DJ.
The singer-songwriter takes a stab at country music with this collection of a dozen covers and three originals.
The 10th full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Jason Isbell and features contributions from Amanda Shires and members of Isbell's the 400 Unit.
The debut full-length release for the Scottish indie pop band was produced by Edwyn Collins.
The sixth full-length release for the Los Angels group was self-produced.
The Icelandic singer-songwriter worked with Gunnar Orn Tynes of mum and Skuli Sverrisson on her fourth full-length release.
This is the second release for the year from the collaboration between Jozef Van Wissem and guitarist Jim Jarmusch.
The latest release for Benjamin John Power's solo electronic project features two 20-minutes long tracks.
The latest release for the Slovenian group includes three songs originally released on its 2013 EP S.
The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Ben Hillier.
The second full-length release for the Chicago rock band was produced with R. Andrew Humphrey and Colin Croom.
The latest full-length release for R&B artist Mary J. Blige features guest appearances from DJ Khaled, Dave East, Fivio Foreign, Anderson .Paak, and Usher.
The fifth full-length release for the indie folk band led by Zach Condon was produced by Gabe Wax.
The follow-up to the Oakland artist's Grammy Award-winning 2016 release was influenced in part by divisive political and social issues.
This is the second full-length release for the Washington state electro-pop duo of Khaela Maricich and Melissa Dyne.
The third full-length studio release for the experimental rap group was self-released and posted as a free download. It was official release on iTunes on 14 January 2014.
The third release for the Brisbane, Australian band is a mix of pop and psychedelic rock.
The rapper who worked with Gucci Mane on a few mixtapes releases his first official album.
The fifth album for the Japanese experimental rock band was produced by Steve Albini.
The Norwegian group led by Lars Horntveth continues its jazz fusion of music styles on its latest album.
The latest album for the Brooklyn rock band led by Dave W. features a 17-minute-long track.
The Brazilian superstar takes a stab at rock, backed by a much younger band and co-production by his son, Moreno.
John Hill produces the Kentucky alt-rock band's fifth album, which features a collaboration with Beck.
The debut album for the London based indie pop band includes two Australian and two British members.
The second full-length release for the Paris-based British singer features guest appearances from Iggy Pop and Lakeith Stanfield.
This is the second full-length release for the Australian, LA-based singer-songwriter.

recordname: Vaxis - Act I: The Unheavenly Creatures
description: The Amory Wars epic continues in the self-produced ninth full-length studio release for the progressive rock band.
The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Rich Cooper and Cam Blackwood.
The latest release for the Japanese pop-punk band sees the return of original drummer Atsuko Yamano.
The third full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Marcus Paquin.
The seventh full-length release for the rock trio was produced by band member, Angus Andrew.

The first release on the Blue Note label for the jam band is a double album with the second disc of the same songs as the first disc with guest singers including Elvis Costello, Dr. John, Toots Hibbert, Glenn Hughes, Ben Harper, Jim James, Myles Kennedy, Dave Matthews, Grace Potter, Ty Taylor, and Steve Winwood.
Canada's favorite prog rockers return with their first album of new material in six years, eh.
Inspired by Italian film scores from the 1960s and featuring guest vocalists Norah Jones and Jack White, Rome is producer Danger Mouse's pet project with Daniele Luppi.
The third full-length studio release for the Welsh artist was recorded with a live band.
Velocity Girl's Sarah Shannon guests on Eric Bachmann's fourth Crooked Fingers release, which was co-produced by Martin Feveyear.

2 Chainz, Action Bronson, Big K.R.I.T., Danny Brown, Drake, Joey Bada$$, Kendrick Lamar, Santigold, Schoolboy Q, Skrillex, and Yelawolf guest on the official debut studio release for the New York rapper.

The posthumous release from the drummer features beats recorded before he passed away in 2020 and completed by producer Vincent Taeger and co-producer Vincent Taurelle with vocals from Nate Bone, Danny Brown, Nah Eeto, Jeremiah Jae, Koreatown Oddity, Lava La Rue, Lord Jah-Monte Ogbon, Marlowe, Ben Okri, Sampa The Great, Skepta, Tsunami, and Zelooperz.
The debut full-length solo release for the Frontier Ruckus/Failed Flowers member was mixed by Collin Dupuis.
This is the debut full-length release for the Australian producer, songwriter, and singer Nick Murphy.

The German elecronica duo of Andi Toma and Jan St. Werner are back with their first LP in three years, combining distorted vocals and samples with their glitchy yet melodic--and sometimes even humorous--instrumentation.
Wagon Christ is the alter-ego of prolific English electronica artist Luke Vibert (who also records under his own name and Plug).

The follow-up to 2000's 'Bloodflowers' sees Robert Smith & co. working with metal producer Ross Robinson (Limp Bizkit, Korn) for the first time (and apparently, he ate up so much of the recording budget that they couldn't afford an album cover artist).

If you think the concept of a guitar-drums blues duo from Detroit sounds a bit, well, familiar, consider this: Soledad Brothers guitarist Johnny Walker allegedly is responsible for teaching the White Stripes' Jack White how to play guitar. This is the Brothers' third studio LP.
A reunited Jane's Addiction (sans bassist Eric Avery) is back with their first studio recording in 13 years.

Bassist Britta Phillips and guitarist Dean Wareham (each a member of the band Luna) offer a mix of originals and covers, including takes on songs by Madonna, the Silver Jews and the Doors, all produced by Tony Visconti (David Bowie, T. Rex).
Already being heralded as 2003's version of The Streets, the suburban London duo who compose the Audio Bullys combine everything from punk, ska, new wave, and house on this debut.

'Beauty Party' represents experimental hip-hop artist Mike Ladd's second album in a planned trilogy, the first being 2000's 'Gun Hill Road' by The Infesticons. Unlike its predecessor, the Majesticons disc ventures into commercial rap territory (albeit with a satirical bent), attempting to skewer contemporary hiphop by beating it at its own game.

The San Diego-based band returns with their fourth album of dark, atmospheric music, following previous albums '1,' '2,' and, yes, '3' (c'mon guys, what happened to '4?'). This one is a concept album of sorts, about a murder mystery.
This is the fifth LP for the French-pop-influenced, Berlin-based duo of Francoise Cactus and Brezel Goring.
This is the third solo album (and first since 1996) for neo-soul singer Joi Gilliam.
The fourth full-length studio release for the North Carolina hip-hop artist includes co-production with such producers as Elite, Cardiak, Chargaux, Ron Gilmore, and Elijah Scarlett.
The sixth full-length release for the alternative rock band led by Shirley Manson was produced by Billy Bush.
This is the debut full-length release for the Memphis band that includes former Ex-cult bassist Natalie Hoffmann.
The debut full-length release for the Brooklyn indie pop band includes some tracks from its 2008 EP of the same name.
This is the second full-length for the Seattle-based band which consists solely of David Terry (and his drum machine) and has drawn comparisons to Grandaddy and the Flaming Lips.
The debut full-length release for Kim Gordon's post-Sonic Youth project is with guitarist Bill Nace.
This is the debut full-length release for the indie rock project that includes Interpol's Paul Banks, The Walkmen's Matt Barrick, and Bonny Light Horseman's Josh Kaufman.
The 16th studio release for the Scottish pop band features production from Gavin Goldberg, Steve Hillage, Steve Osborne, Owen Parker, and Andy Wright.
The third release for the London-based Japanese quartet features King Midas Sound's Roger Robinson and Savages' Jehnny Beth.
Joe Barresi produced the latest album for the southern California punk band who celebrates its 30th anniversary in 2010.

recordname: The Creatures In The Garden Of Lady Walton
description: This is the first non-instrumental album for the group and features My Brightest Diamond's Shara Worden, The National's Matt Berninger, and Sufjan Stevens as guest singers. The songs were written in 2005 while Padma Newsome was working in Italy.
This is the third album for the Chicago-based duo of Josh Eustis and Charlie Cooper (who passed away on January 22, 2009).
The debut full-length album for the British trio was self-produced.
The fourth release for singer-songwriter Meghan Remy was produced by Slim Twig.

recordname: I Like It When You Sleep, For You Are So Beautiful Yet So Unaware of It
description: The second full-length release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Mike Crossey.
The debut full-length solo release for the former member of Cherry Glazerr was recorded by Thomas Dolas and her brother JooJoo Ashworth.
The White Rabbits switch from Spoon's Britt Daniel to Mike McCarthy for production duties on its latest album.
The Australian psychedelic rock band's debut album won the Australian Music Prize award when the album was released in its native land in 2010.

recordname: Lost Themes III: Alive After Death
description: Director/composer John Carpenter returns with son Cody Carpenter and godson Daniel Davies on his first non-soundtrack release in five years.
The second release for King Tuff was produced by Bobby Harlow and is his first on the Sub Pop label.
'Soldiers' marks the debut for the new band consisting of the White Stripes' Jack White, fellow Detroit musician Brendan Benson, and members of the Greenhornes.
The seventh full-length studio release for the Utah rock band was influenced by the death of Rob McCracken's friend and was produced by Ross Robinson.
The Wallflowers' lead singer releases his debut solo album.
Guided by Voices' Robert Pollard and Chris Slusarenko and Decemberists' John Moen release their debut album as the Boston Spaceships.

recordname: With Strings Live At Town Hall
description: This 22-song live recording (taped at a New York City show in June, 2005) finds Mark Oliver Everett backed by a variety of instrumentalists and, yes, a string quartet.

The sixth full-length release for Timothy Showalter as Strand Of Oaks features contributions from My Morning Jackets Tom Blankenship, Carl Broemel, Patrick Hallahan, Bo Koster, as well as Jason Isbell.
The Canadian rock band's 10th album was released on the 20th anniversary of its first show.

recordname: How About I Be Me (And You Be You)?
description: The Irish singer-songwriter's ninth studio album was produced by her first husband, John Reynolds.
The fourth full-length release for Kyle Thomas as King Tuff was self-produced and features contributions from Mikal Cronin, Jenny Lewis, Charles Moothart Kevin Morby, Greta Morgan, and Ty Segall.
The first full-length collaboration between Czarface [Wu-Tang Clan's Inspectah Deck and 7L & Esoteric] and MF Doom features guest appearances from Kendra Morris, Open Mike Eagle and Vinnie Paz.
This is the second full-length release for Ryan Hunn as Illum Sphere.
The third full-length release for the Brooklyn punk rock band was produced by John Reis.
The fourth full-length release for London-based experimental artist Luke Younger was inspired by balearic disco, industrial, and dub techno music.
The second album for the R&B/soul Canadian singer features guest appearances by J. Cole, B.o.B, John Legend, and T-Pain.
The third album for the British band was produced by Dan Weller.
Mathew Adam Hart's quirky one-man bedroom-pop band (think Magnetic Fields) returns with a third album.

The latest album for the Welsh rock band was recorded in Connecticut and Seattle, with Xiu Xiu's Jamie Stewart, Parenthetical Girls' Zac Pennington, and Dead Science's Jherek Bischoff appearing as guests.
The music project of Wolf Parade's Dan Boeckner and his wife Alexei Perry releases a third album influenced by Eastern European synthesizer sounds and noise pop.

The second full-length release for Brian and Michael D'Addario is a concept musical album about a chimpanzee named Shane raised a human boy and features guest appearances from Todd Rundgren and the D'Addario brothers' mother.

recordname: Fingers, Bank Pads and Shoe Prints
description: This is the second full-length release for the Chicago footwork artist who is considered the founder of the style.
The third full-length release for the Los Angeles indie rock band was recorded in Hawaii, Malaysia, Nicaragua, Ojai, and Thailand.

The concept behind the full-length debut release from the French house producer Vincent Belorgay is how a man who crashed his Ferrari Testarossa in 1986, arises as a zombie in 2006 to make music and race cars.

A somewhat unusual signing for Warp Records, the guitar-oriented Maximo Park (who sound not unlike a cross between the Futureheads and Franz Ferdinand) make their full-length debut with this Paul Epworth-produced disc.
This is the second full-length studio release for Kim Gordon's post-Sonic Youth project with guitarist Bill Nace.
The third solo release for the pop singer is his first in nearly seven years and was produced by Timbaland (two tracks with Timberlake and Jerome "J-Roc" Harmon).
This is the 14th studio release for the British post-punk band led by Colin Newman.
The second full-length release for the London-based punk band led by Charlie Manning Walker was produced by Fucked Up's Jonah Falco.
The debut full-length collaboration between sisters Shelby Lynne and Allison Moorer features one original co-written song and was produced by Teddy Thompson.
The second full-length release for the San Francisco Bay Area garage-pop band was produced by Kelley Stoltz.
Sheryl Crow returns from an eventful few years with her latest record produced by Brian Bottrell, who also produced her debut.
The Icelandic group known for touring with Sigur Ros releases their debut album.
The seventh full-length release for the indie singer-songwriter is a 22-track double-album featuring blues, country, folk, and jazz styles.

M. Ward returns with his solo album featuring such guests as Howe Gelb of Giant Sand, Toby Leaman of Dr. Dog, Tom Hagerman of Devotchka, Mike Mogis of Bright Eyes, Steve Shelley of Sonic Youth, and She & Him collaborator Zooey Deschanel.
The first release in eight years from the blues-rock trio was produced by frontman Jon Spencer.

The fourth full-length release for the New Zealand electro-pop band was recorded remotely with some in-studio sessions in Los Angeles, London, Florence, New York and New Zealand due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
The second full-length release for the Glasgow-based indie rock band is the first with Rachel Taylor, who took over for the departing Cal Donnelly.
The second full-length studio release for the New York rapper features guest appearances from Chronixx, Nyck Caution, Meechy Darko, J. Cole, Kirk Knight, Schoolboy Q, and Styles P.
The German industrial band's latest release is music planned for a live performance commissioned by the city Diksmuide to commemorate the 100 year anniversary of the start of the First World War.
The sixth full-length release for the gypsy punk band led by Eugene Hütz was produced by Andrew Scheps.
This is the US release of the debut solo album for the Constantines frontman.
The blues rock band returns with its first new album in nine years.
Growing older is the major theme of Nick Lowe's latest release, coproduced by Neil Brockbank and Robert Treherne.
With a follow-up to his 2007 I'll Sleep When You're Dead still in the works, El-P releases an album of instrumental tracks.

The fifth full-length release for the Australian experimental artist was recorded over 10 days with contributions from Steve Albini, Lawrence English, Nico Muhly, Valgeir Sigurðsson, and Skuli Sverrisson.
The latest album for the indie rock band features Quasi's Sam Coomes, Treepeople's Scott Schmaljohn, Butthole Surfers' Paul Leary, John McMahon, and Roger Manning as guest musicians.
Tony Visconti (David Bowie) produced the suddenly prolific Moz's third release of the past two years.
This is the second full-length solo release for the singer who has worked with Alela Diane, Efterklang, Laura Gibson, Horse Feathers, and Sharon Van Etten.
The front woman of X-Ray Spex returns with her first solo album, staying true to her punk, reggae, and pop roots.
The third album for the English band was produced by Black Francis (aka Frank Black).
This is the third album for the James Baluyut-led indie rockers.
Dan Auerbach and Patrick Carney recorded covers of Mississippi hill country blues songs in Nashville over two sessions with Kenny Brown and Eric Deaton.
The latest album for the Icelandic singer was produced by Dan Carey.
The debut full-length release for the Irish singer-songwriter was produced by Pete Robertson.
Ben Greenberg and Michael Berdan add drummer Greg Foxfor for the band's third full-length release.

The New York City indie rock band return after breaking up in 2005 with an album of covers that includes songs by such artist as David Bowie, The Cure, Bob Dylan, Fleetwood Mac, Mercury Rev, Rolling Stones, and YES.
The latest studio release for the Welsh singer was produced by Ethan Johns.
This is the second full-length release for the Australian psychedelic rock band.
This is the second album of electronica-meets-indie-pop (falling somewhere between Manitoba and the Postal Service) from Mark Mitchell.
This solo disc from the Posies member features guest appearances from Jill Sobule and members of Velocity Girl, Oranger and the Posies.
This self-titled disc (the band's fifth studio recording) was recorded in Arizona with Calexico/Giant Sand producer Craig Schumacher.
This is the third LP for the Louisville-based emo band known for their strong live shows.

The sixth solo release for Yo La Tengo bassist James McNew finds him playing all of the instruments on 13 tracks that veer from style to style but share a certain lo-fi charm. There are ten originals and three covers, including the unlikely album-closing take on Thin Lizzy's "Cowboy Song."
Southern California native Harper has gained a cult following for his jam-band-like approach to roots rock. This is his fifth studio LP.
The Toronto, Canada punk outfit returns with a follow-up to their successful 2001 debut, 'All Killer No Filler.'

Former Nirvana drummer (and sometime Queens of the Stone Age drummer) Dave Grohl returns to the front of the stage for his role as vocalist, guitarist, and bandleader of the Foo Fighters on this, their fourth studio recording.
This is the fourth album for the London-based, Brazilian-born jungle/breakbeat producer and DJ, following 2000's well-received 'Supermodified.'

You know him from his days supplying the beats to the Fresh Prince, but DJ Jazzy Jeff has finally stepped into the spotlight with this solo debut. Vocals are supplied by a variety of guests, including Jill Scott, Raheim, ?uestlove and J-Live.

The British house trio has been performing, producing, and remixing for ten years, but 'Muzikizum' represents their first album, highlighted by the breakout UK hit single "Lazy" featuring guest vocals from David Byrne.

Alison Krauss and her band have gained popularity in recent months, thanks to the success of the O Brother, Where Art Thou? soundtrack (which featured the band's version of "I Am A Man Of Constant Sorrow" among other contributions). This is their first album since 1999's 'Forget About It.'

Luna's first live recording compiles performances from New York's Knitting Factory and Washington D.C.'s 9:30 Club, including the band's final show with bassist Justin Harwood and one of its first with Harwood's replacement Britta Phillips. The disc includes songs from each of Luna's five studio albums, as well as one track ("4th of July") from frontman Dean Wareham's previous band, Galaxie 500.
Born in England but leaning, musically, toward Americana, the 21-year-old singer-songwriter follows her 2017 EP, "Something American," with this full-length debut.
The debut full-length album for the band led by Swedish-born Petter Ericson Stakee and Terry Wolfers was produced by Mike McCarthy.
The third full-length release for the British duo of Ryan Needham and Liza Violet features a guest appearance by Brix Smith and was produced by Matt Peel.
The debut full-length release for the Russian shoegaze quintet was recorded in 2013.
The sixth album from the Dutch-Israeli singer-songwriter is a mix of choral arrangements, guitar, piano, and clarinet.
The duo of Chuck Inglish and Mikey Rocks, aka Sir Michael Rocks, releases its long-awaited album that was more than two years in the making.
For you Nick Cave completists out there, this three-disc box set compiles 56 tracks spanning both decades of his work with the Bad Seeds, including some previously unreleased material.

This second 2004 disc from singer-songwriter Ned Oldham (brother of Palace Music's Will Oldham) offers country-tinged folk that recalls bands such as the Grateful Dead, Neil Young and the Meat Puppets.
The third full-length release for the Welsh singer-songwriter was produced by Noah Georgson and Josiah Steinbrick.

recordname: Blue Eyed In The Red Room
description: This mainly instrumental disc (which, rather than being sample-driven, features live instrumentation from Boom Bip himself) also includes two vocal tracks, with Nina Nastasia and Gruff Rhys (Super Furry Animals) handling the singing.
The folk singer from New York releases her latest album, which features songs written by Steve Earle, Elvis Costello, and T-Bone Burnett.
The second full-length release for the indie pop band led by Aaron Maine was recorded in his apartment.
The latest release from the duo of Ripley Johnson and Sanae Yamada includes drummer John Jeffrey.
Hans-Peter Lindstrøm's fourth release was recorded right after Six Cups of Rebel was mixed by Todd Terje.
The second album from the duo of African-born singer Esau Mwamwaya and British producer Radioclit features guest appearances by Baaba Maal, DJ Mo-Laudi, and K'naan.
The debut full-length album for the Brooklyn, New York, duo.
The fourth full-length solo studio release for the Los Angeles singer-songwriter was recorded live with Ty Segall's Freedom Band by Jason Quever of Papercuts.

recordname: If I Should Go Before You
description: The fifth full-length release for the Dallas Green project features his touring band Matt Kelly, Jack Lawrence, Doug MacGregor, and Dante Schwebel.
The seventh full-length release for the indie rock duo of Sune Rose Wagner and Sharin Foo was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.
The sixth album for the indie rock band from Indiana was produced by John Congleton.
This is the debut album for the rock band from Vermont.

recordauthor: Willie Nelson And Asleep At The Wheel
description: Willie Nelson and Asleep at the Wheel team up to release an album of Western Swing music.
The third full-length release for the brother duo of Brian and Michael D'Addario was self-produced and recorded.

recordname: Before We Forgot How to Dream
description: The full-length release for Northern Ireland singer-songwriter Bridie Monds-Watson was produced by Tommy McLauglin.

The debut full-length studio release for the California R&B artist features guest appearances from Chris Brown, Cordae, Lil Baby, DJ Khaled, Thundercat, Bryson Tiller, Ty Dolla $ign, Y.G., and Yung Bleu.
The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based artist was produced by Andrew Sarlo.
The fourth full-length release for the Evan Weiss project was produced by Brian Deck.
The Sea and Cake singer challenged himself to create something different with his third solo album.
The seventh full-length studio album from Miley Cyrus features guest appearances from Dua Lipa, Billy Idol and Joan Jett.
