description: The fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn rock band was produced by band leader, Jon Philpot.

recordname: Love at the Bottom of the Sea
description: Synthesizers and Stephin Merritt return to the Magnetic Fields with the first album of new material for the band since 1999's 69 Songs.
The 13th full-length studio release for the Northern California punk trio was produced with Chris Dugan and Butch Walker.
The second full-length solo release for Adam Bainbridge features guest appearances from Ade, Devonté Hynes, Kelela, M.Anifest, Robyn, and Tawiah.
The third full-length studio release from the Scottish indie pop band was self-produced.
This is the sixth release for the indie project formed by Raymond Raposa.
Originally released on Bandcamp in 2011, the debut full-length release for the Minneapolis indie rock trio was rerecorded by producer Thom Monahan for its release on the Domino label.

recordauthor: And So I Watch You from Afar
description: The second album for the Belfast rock band was produced with Ricky O'Reilly.
The second full-length release for the British trio features production from Tim Bran, Paul Epworth, Jon Hopkins, Roy Kerr and Greg Kurstin.
The band, originally started as a side project, releases it's second album.
Inspired by the Summer of Loves (1967 in San Francisco and 1988-89 in the UK), the fourth full-length release for the Australian dance-rock quartet was mixed in New York by Dave Fridmann.
The 14th full-length studio release for the Kevin Barnes-led indie rock band was inspired by music from such artists as Arca, Chairlift, and Jack Ü.
The first album in four years for the rock band led by David Gedge was produced by Andrew Scheps.
The debut solo project for fun.'s Jack Antonoff was co-produced by John Hill and features guest appearances from Grimes and Yoko Ono.
The band's third album finds producer/songwriter Andy LeMaster once again joined by Azure Ray's Orenda Fink and Maria Taylor, plus drummer Clay Leverett.
The 12th studio album for the California punk rock band was produced by Bill Stevenson.
The former System of a Down singer once again merges progressive rock with orchestral magnificence to create a symphony of electronically influenced sound on his follow-up solo album.
Nanci Griffith's 20th album was recorded at her Nashville home with co-producers Maura Kennedy, Pete Kennedy, and Pat McInerney.
The son of Grammy-winning singer Steve Earle releases his debut album.
The Berlin duo's third album includes Radiohead's Thom Yorke as a guest vocalist.
Jonas Stein returns to his side project after leaving Be My Own Pet.
The second album for the Stars/Broken Social Scene singer features guest appearances by Stars' Evan Cranley, The Stills' Liam O'Neil, and Feist.
This is the debut album for the Canadian indie rock quartet from Vancouver.

recordname: Of The Blue Colour Of The Sky
description: The latest album for the rock band from Chicago features the track "Shooting The Moon" which appeared in the "New Moon" movie soundtrack.
The fourth release for the Athens, Georgia rock band was produced by John Agnello.

The third full-length studio album from the New York rapper was a surprise release and features guest appearances from FKA twigs, French Montana, Juicy J, Kid Cudi, Kodak Black, Moby, Frank Ocean, Skepta, and T.I.
The Kinks frontman's follow-up to his 2017 Americana features The Jayhawks, as well spoken word, and reworked versions of some of his work with the Kinks and as a solo artist.
Produced by Max Dingel, the 13th full-length release for the Manchester band was written after the passing of Tim Booth's mother and best friend.

Miley Cyrus, Daft Punk, JoJo, Alicia Keys, and Justin Timberlake are featured guests on the second full-length solo release for the rapper/producer that includes the Academy Award-nominated song "Happy" from the Despicable Me 2 soundtrack.
The Manchester rock band reunited with singer Stephen Holt return with its first release in 20 years.
The third full-length studio release for the Canadian artist features guest appearances from Daft Punk, Lana Del Rey, Future, and Kendrick Lamar.
This is the debut album for the singer-songwriter who won the Brit's Critic Choice Award for best new artist in 2012.
The second solo full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Drake, Fergie, Lil Wayne, Ma$e, Chrisette Michele, Pharrell, Pusha T, and T-Pain.

Two months after the release of the first collaboration between Brian Eno and Underworld's Karl Hyde (Someday World), the duo release a second disc of songs recorded soon after the announcement of the first.

Forget retirement. The legendary rapper and Def Jam head has resurfaced after a three-year hiatus, with an album that finds him joined by some of the biggest names in hip-hop (Dr. Dre, Timbaland, Pharrell Williams, Kanye West) and alt-rock (Coldplay's Chris Martin).

Tom Hagerman of Devotchka, Pierre de Reeder of Rilo Kiley, Joey Spampinato of NRBQ, Tilly and the Wall, and Mike Watt are some of the guest musicians on the third release for the indie pop duo of M. Ward and Zooey Deschanel.
The four-track EP from producer Kwes. is his first on the Warp label.
This is the debut full-length album for the Detroit indie pop singer-songwriter.
The artist previously known as Wooden Wand releases his debut solo album.
The Depeche Mode vocalist's first solo release finds him working with Sigur Ros producer Ken Thomas.
Al Jourgensen is back, and, apparently, angrier than ever. Included here on the industrial band's eighth album is a cover of Magazine's "The Light Pours Out of Me."
The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features collaborations and production from Benny Blanco, Johnny McDaid, Pharrell Williams, and Rick Rubin.

A member of Subtle, Themselves and 13 & God, Jel (aka Jeffery James Logan) makes his true solo LP deubt with this 12-track effort. Ms John Soda's Stefanie Bohm, Fog's Andrew Broder, and cLOUDDEAD's Odd Nosdam are among the guests.
The Twisted Brown Trucker band return on Kid Rock's ninth studio release that he also produced himself.
The sophomore album for the indie Canadian band led by Graham Van Pelt is its first in more than four years.
Jadakiss guests on the R&B vocalists third disc.
The 20th studio release for the rock band led by Gene Simmons and Paul Stanley was recorded on analog equipment.
This is the debut full-length release for the British electronic trio of Kev Kharas, Pat King, and Tom Watson.
The 14th studio release for the British black metal trio was produced by the band's bassist Cronos.
The reggae artist's latest album was produced with Bill Laswell.
The latest album for the singer was produced with her husband Justin Stanley.
The follow-up to the horror filmmaker's non-soundtrack release features more electric and acoustic guitars.
The fifth studio album for the rock band from Kentucky was produced by Joe Chiccarelli and Jim James.
This B-sides, rarities and covers compiliations includes 16 Conor Oberst tracks of varying fidelity from the past eight years.
The California-born singer-songwriter who has had much more success overseas, releases his fourth album.

recordname: Looking into You: A Tribute to Jackson Browne
description: The tribute album to singer-songwriter Jackson Browne features such artists as Shawn Colvin, Ben Harper, Don Henley, Bruce Hornsby, Indigo Girls, Keb' Mo, Lyle Lovett, Bonnie Raitt, J. D. Souther, Bruce Springsteen & wife Patti Scialfa, Sean & Sara Watkins, and Lucinda Williams.
The second full-length release for the Vienna-based electronic artist Christopher Taylor was written and recorded in California.

Produced by Nick Raskulinecz, the second release for the mysterious Swedish doom metal band previously known only as Ghost, welcomes a new lead singer Papa Emeritus II (although some believe it is the same singer from its 2010 debut, Opus Eponymous).
The fifth full-length studio album for the duo of Al Cisneros and Amos continues its guitar-less music.
This is the latest release for the New Zealand rock band.
The fourth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Eminem, Jeremih, Migos, The-Dream, and Twenty88.
The album recorded at King's Place in May 2010 has Micachu collaborating with the London Sinfonietta Orchestra.
The eleventh solo studio release for the British trip hopper features guest appearances from Francesca Belmonte, Mykki Blanco, Blue Daisy, Bella Gotti, Nneka, Oh Land, and Tirzah.
The third album for the duo features guest appearances by members of Tilly and the Wall as well as The Faint.
This is the major-label debut for the Brooklyn-based indie-rock trio fronted by Keith Murray.
Zooey Deschanel and M.Ward tackles songs from the 1930-50s on their latest covers release.
This is the fourth album for the Wisconsin-based indie/emo trio.
Former One Dove vocalist Dot Allison returns with her second solo release, following 1999's 'Afterglow.' Here, she works with members of Two Lone Swordsmen, Mercury Rev, and Death In Vegas.

Matthews' first collaboration with producer Glen Ballard (who has produced albums by Alanis Morissette, No Doubt, and Wilson Phillips) results in a collection of shorter, more focused tracks than DMB fans may be accustomed to.
The first release in eight years for the Nebraska rock band led by Cursive's Tim Kasher was mixed by John Congleton.
The fourth studio release for the rapper inspired by Seinfeld feature guest appearances from J. Cole, Jeremih, SZA, and Usher.
The third full-length release for the Canadian quartet was produced by John Congleton and recorded in three weeks.
The third full-length release for the Barcelona-based Western Sahara singer-songwriter was produced by Chris Eckman.

The second full-length release for the British quartet features guest appearances from Anne-Marie, Ella Eyre, Sinead Harnett, Lianne La Havas, Will Heard, Mahalia, MNEK, Dizzee Rascal, Ed Sheeran, Foy Vance and Bobby Womack.
The third full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band is its first to with the line-up of Dan Lee, April Aliermo, Lane Halley, and D. Alex Meeks.
The 12th full-length release for the California nu metal band was produced by Nick Raskulinecz and features a guest appearance from Slipknot's Corey Taylor.
This is the third album from the British electronic music artist.
The British singer-songwriter's debut full-length album was produced by Jake Gosling and No ID.
The British singer-songwriter pairs up with Lawyer Dave for the third release of retro country rock and rockabilly.
The British singer-songwriter pairs up with Lawyer Dave for the third release of retro country rock and rockabilly.
A double album featuring live performances recorded from 2005 to 2007.
The latest "American Idol" winner releases her debut album.

recordname: I Thought I Was Over That: Rare, Remixed And B-Sides
description: The title tells the story of this two-disc set, which includes remixes by Dntel, Boom Bip and Two Lone Swordsmen.

recordauthor: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
description: This is the fourth album for the critically-acclaimed Texas-based band.
The digital-only album was recorded by Damon Albarn on his iPad while on tour in 2010 is released on CD.
More than 20 musicians contributed to the third release from North Carolina-based Stuart McLamb's music project, The Love Language.
The title of this ninth Divine Comedy album for Neil Hannon echoes back to the band's debut, 'Fanfare For The Comic Muse.'
The fifth full-length studio release fro the rapper includes production from DJ Khaled, DY, Metro Boomin, Southside, Tarentino, Tre Pounds and Zaytoven.
This is the sixth album for the IDM duo of Ed Handley and Andy Turner.
The sixth album from the veteran electronica act includes guest appearances by Willy Mason, The Klaxons, Fatlip and Midlake.
The debut release for the Senegal-born and now Brooklyn-based artist is a concept album of a futuristic China.
This is the second LP for the ever-growing prog-rock collective that calls both England and Texas home.
The Japanese trio releases its latest album of punk rock music.
The country singer's latest is his first collaboration with producer Lari White, and also marks his first release on his new record label (Show Dog).
The Brooklyn, New York, band releases its first full-length album of singles, B-sides, and remixes.
The singer-songwriter's first album in three years was produced by Steve Jordan and, for the first time, by Mayer himself.
The ninth full-length release for the British post-punk band led by Andy Gill was co-produced with Ben Hillier and Ross Orton.
The second full-length release from the Portland-based band was produced by Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Jacob Portrait
British DJ/producer Andy Carthy's latest release as Mr. Skruff features vocals from Vanessa Freeman and Robert Owens.
Produced by band member Jacob Portrait, the second full-length release sees the Portland indie trio moving away from drum machines and synths to a more guitar-oriented sound.
The debut album for the quartet of Marie Nixon of Kenickie, Jennie Redmond, Cath Stephens, and Liz Corney was co-produced with Peter Brewis.
The third album for the British singer features guest appearances by Chris Brown, Janelle Monae, Rick Ross, and Trey Songz.
After two cover albums, the former Mavericks singer releases his first album of original songs on the Fantasy Records label.
The fourth album for the French metal band features Lamb of God's Randy Blythe as a guest vocalist on one track.
This sixth album for Rjyan Kidwell's Cex project finds him joined by Joan of Arc's Cale Parks and his wife Roby Newton.

recordname: Big Whiskey And The GrooGrux King
description: The rock band's latest album was produced by Rob Cavallo and is its first album without saxophonist LeRoi Moore, who died in the summer of 2008.
The Knife, along with Mt. Sims and Planningtorock, created a 90-minute opera about Charles Darwin.
The fifth full-length release for the pop artist features a duet with Florence Welch.
The fifth full-length solo release for the Berlin-based Finnish artist was inspired by his time in Greece.
the debut full-length major studio release for the rap trio features guest appearances from Chris Brown and Young Thug.
The eight-track EP contains songs from the "Viva La Vida" sessions, including one track featuring Jay-Z.
This is the full-length debut release for the Montreal duo of Xavier Germain-Poitras and Louis Guillemette.
Chris Clark's sixth album featuring Martina Topley-Bird and acoustic guitars was recorded around the world, including Australia, Belgium, Germany, Norway, and the UK.
The 15th full-length studio release for the alternative rock band finally arrives after being delayed by nearly a year.

recordname: Organ Music Not Vibraphone Like I'd Hoped
description: Spencer Krug (of Wolf Parade fame) releases his solo album under his Moonface moniker.
The Long Island trio moves away from a major label for this album.
The hip-hop trio's first album in five years is also their final outing as a group.

Released on the same day as 'Suit,' 'Sweat' is the more club-oriented of the pair, with production handled by The Alchemist, The Neptunes, and more. Christina Aguilera, Mobb Deep and Missy Elliott guest.
The Atlanta-based singer-songwriter (who is frequently compared to Dave Matthews) attempts to duplicate the unexpected success of 2001's 'Room for Squares' with this third album.
The duo of 764-HERO guitarist/vocalist John Atkins and Black Heart Procession drummer Joe Plummer return with a second LP.
This self-titled effort is the California band's third album.

This is Laurie Anderson's first music release since 1994's 'Big Red.' Originally conceived as a studio verision of her recent theatrical production "Songs and Stories from Moby Dick," the thirteen-song album contains only three tracks from that show, supplemented with newer material. Guest musicians include Lou Reed, Dr. John, Bill Frisell, Mocean Worker and Van Dyke Parks.
The second album on the Paw Tracks label for the Brooklyn-based experimental group.
The fifth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Jacquire King.
This is the 19th full-length studio release from the Japanese pop punk trio.

recordname: What Did You Expect from the Vaccines?
description: The debut album for the British indie rock band was produced by Dan Grech.
The second release for the Southern California indie rock band was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.
Youngster Ryan Adams produced this 11-song mix of originals and covers, which also includes musical backing from Adams' band The Cardinals.
The British indie rock band's fifth album was recorded in Austin, Texas and was produced by Dan Carey.
This is the debut full-length album for the San Francisco psychedelic rock quintet.

The Mark E. Smith-led band's 26th studio album (give or take) features yet another new lineup of musicians (who also play in Los Angeles outfit Darker My Sweet), as the previous set mutinied on tour last year.
The third full-length studio release for the Norwegian pop artist is her first in 11 years and was produced by Stefan Storm.
Kyle Little and Ross Brown join Collin Rausch, Kyle Rausch and Konnor Ervin for to the group for Kansas City indie rock band's second full-length release.
This is the sixth and final release for the experimental project of Alex Zhang Hungtai.
This is the first album on the Vanguard label for the Los Angeles-based band who had previously worked with Jenny Lewis.
This is the debut release for the project from Cedric Bixler-Zavala, Omar Rodriguez-Lopez, Dave Elitch, and Flea on this new release.

The second album for the New Orleans jazz artist who not only plays the trombone, trumpet, piano, and drums, but also sings features such guests as Jeff Beck, Warren Haynes, Kid Rock, Lenny Kravitz, and Ledisi.

The second full-length release for the Australian pop-punk band features songs co-written by such artists as Duran Duran, All Time Low's Alex Gaskarth, Good Charlotte's Benji and Joel Madden, with production by John Feldmann.
Atlanta's Usher Raymond returns with his third studio release. The Neptunes, Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis are among the producers.
The indie rockers' second release of 2006 is a song-for-song recreation of Harry Nilsson's alcohol-fueled, John Lennon-produced, 1974 album.
The seventh studio album by the English producer and rapper was written, produced, and mastered entirely by Wiley.
James Iha (Smashing Pumpkins) guests on the former Belle & Sebastian singer's second solo outing, which finds her reworking traditional British folk songs.
The fifth full-length release for the Swedish electronic quartet was produced with James Ford.
The British electronic duo return with an album featuring production from such names as Appleblim, Dubfire, Paul van Dyk, and High Contrast.
The latest album for the Grammy-winning artist features Andre 3000, Brandy, Estelle and Kanye West as guests.
The father of fellow musicians Rufus and Martha Wainwright reworks some of his songs in his latest release produced by Joe Henry.
Paul Westerberg's blues-playin' alter ego returns with a second album (following 'Mono,' which was packaged with Westerberg's 'Stereo' release).
The Seattle folk trio's new album is their first foray into a more driving, rock sound -- adding a heavier dimension to their folk sound.
The first new full-length release for the British electronic duo features a guest appearance from Prof. Brian Cox and a deluxe edition includes another eight tracks.
The first release in six years for the British rapper features guest appearances from Damon Albarn, Giggs, JME, and Wiley.
The second full-length release for the British hip-hop duo of Harley Alexander-Sule and Jordan Stephens includes a guest appearance from actor Dominic West.
This is the first solo release for the leader of The Psychedelic Furs (and, for those with a really good memory, Love Spit Love).
The first new release in five years for the Rhode Island psych-folk trio is a concept album about a group of children whose lives are changed after a fire burns down one of their houses.
Sheffield producer Tom Bell's second album features J2K, Roots Manuva, and Shola Ama as guests.
The second full-length release from the Brooklyn duo of Tom Van Buskirk and George Langford was recorded at a traditional recording studio.
The rap group brings some of its mixtapes together for its first studio album.
The legendary anarchic '70s proto-punk band that began the glam era return with their fifth album of swaggering, sleazy rock 'n roll.
The covers album for the alt-rock band features Liv Tyler and Kate Moss as guest singers.
The eleventh studio album for the British electronic duo was produced with Andrew Dawson.

The fourth full-length release for the Florida indie rock band is its first without guitarist Thomas Fekete, who passed away from cancer and bassist Kevin Williams, who left the group for other opportunities.

The sixth full-length studio release for the Yoni Wolf-led indie rock band was co-produced by brother Josiah and features guest appearances from Gabbys World, Christian Lee Hutson, Gia Margaret, and Lala Lala.
With the help of producer Frank Black, lead singer Eddie Argos tries out his new singing techniques on the band's fourth release.
Moldy Peaches' Adam Green and Binki Shapiro of Little Joy come together on this debut release of 1960s-inspired songs about heartbreak.

The 10th full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from A Boogie Wit da Hoodie, Ball Greezy, Denzel Curry, Dej Loaf, Drake, Gunplay, Jeezy, John Legend, Lil Wayne, Meek Mill, Nipsey Hussle, Swizz Beatz, Teyana Taylor, Wale, Summer Walker, and YFN Lucci.
The first true solo album for the Cypress Hill DJ includes vocal appearances by Amy Trujillo, Everlast, Josh Todd (Buckcherry), and Greg Dulli (Afghan Wigs).
The second album from the band founded by Stuart David of Belle and Sebastian.
Bandleader Charles Fink and the rest of the London five-piece release a new album of indie pop with an eccentric, melodic folk flair.
The debut release for Robert Pollard Ricked Wicky solo project was produced by Todd Tobias.
The third album for the duo who graduated from the University of Pennsylvania was co-produced with Just Blaze and Picnic Tyme.
The fifth album for the Irish band was produced by Jacknife Lee.
The debut full-length solo release for the ZZ Top frontman features influences from Afro-Cuban music.
The second full-length release for the Grammy-nominated folk-rock band was produced by Ryan Hadlock.
The fourth studio release for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Jennifer Lopez, Matoma, Julia Michaels, K. Michelle, Meghan Trainor, Keith Urban, and Stevie Wonder.
The ninth studio release for the Swedish death metal band was produced by Andy Sneap and includes a guest appearance from former Candlemass singer Messiah Marcoli.
Ryan Adams, Bruce Springsteen, Jakob Dylan and Josh Homme guest on the New York singer-songwriter's rootsy third album.
This is the debut full-length R&B release from the Los Angeles brothers Andrew and Daniel Age.
Guests on the Pink Floyd guitarist's first solo album in over 20 years include Jools Holland, Robert Wyatt, David Crosby, and Graham Nash.
The latest album for the rapper/actor/director/producer features guests such as Musiq Soulchild, Nas, Scarface, The Game, and Young Jeezy.
The third release for Josh Hodges' indie electronic project was written collaboratively between the Portland, Oregon-based band members.
The fourth studio release for former Alexisonfire singer Dallas Green as City And Colour was produced by Alex Newport.
The fifth album for the Norwegian singer-songwriter was produced by Kato Adland.

The Barbadian pop star's fifth album is boasted as her rebirth, showcasing her vocal and lyrical range as a versatile artist. It carries more than just club-ready cuts and includes collaborations with Nicki Minaj and Eminem.
The famous pop artist's seventh album promises a sleekly produced, seductive sound, perfect for a disco party with her signature dance floor pop.
This is the debut release from the collaboration between from Bishop Nehru and MF Doom.
This is the fifth solo album from the prolific English singer-songwriter.
The second release for the Philadelphia rock quintet was produced by John Agnello.
Producer Barry Lynn, who is better known under his Boxcutter alias, releases his first album under the Host name.
The ninth studio release for the British punk band was produced with Dave M. Allen.
This is the debut release for Philadelphia alternative rap group Chiddy Bang.
The fourth album for the rock band includes the Wire's Colin Newman, Scanner's Robin Rimbaud, and former members of Minimal Compact, Malka Spigel and Max Franken.
The sophomore album for the Los Angeles-based group is led by Jack Splash.
Before he was in The Decemberists, singer-songwriter Colin Meloy fronted a Montana alt-country/alt-rock outfit known as Tarkio. This set collects that band's entire output of 27 tracks.

recordname: A People's History Of The Dismemberment Plan
description: This final release from the now disbanded Washington, D.C. group is a remix album, but with a twist: all of the tracks were remixed by fans in response to an invitation on DP's website, with the best entries selected for inclusion on this disc.
The former member of Throwing Muses, Belly, and the Breeders returns with her second solo album, following 1997's 'Lovesongs for Underdogs.'
The second full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter features songs co-written by Babyface, Kid Harpoon, and Bastille's Dan Smith.
The third full-length studio release for the British psychedelic rock trio was recorded at the home studio of band's singer James Bagshaw.

The second full-length release for the Irish electronic producer Marcus Lambkin features contributions from Holly Backle. the Rapture's Luke Jenner, Museum of Love, Lidell Townsell, Nancy Wang, and Reggie Watts
Produced with Ron Aniello and featuring Rage Against The Machine's Tom Morello on guitar, The Boss' 18th studio release includes covers, outtakes, and new takes of previously released songs.
This is the final release of the Swedish electro-pop duo's Archer trilogy.

The third studio release for the rapper was named after the address of his childhood home in North Carolina and was self produced with !llmind, Cardiak, CritCal, Omen, Phonix Beats, Vinylz, and Willie B.
This is the first solo release on Woodsist for the Real Estate guitarist Matthew Mondanile.
Their second album finds sisters Bianca and Sierra Casady joined by Antony and Devendra Banhart.
This all-instrumental disc is the score for the upcoming Canadian film of the same name.

recordname: The Secret Life Of The Veronicas
description: Australian identical twin sisters Jess and Lisa Origliasso make their teen-pop debut as The Veronicas with this 12-track set, produced by Max Martin (Britney Spears), Clif Magness (Avril Lavigne), and others.
The fifth release from the the side project of Wilco members John Stirratt and Patrick Sansone includes contributions from James Hags Haggerty, Greg Wieczoreck, and John Pirrucello.
The 43rd full-length studio release for the country singer-songwriter was self-produced and features songs with writing credited solely to her.
The third full-length release for the Australian pyschedelic pop/rock band was produced and recorded by its lead singer Jake Webb.
The moody Los Angeles-based four-piece returns with a fourth album.
The debut album for the New York City-based band was produced by S*A*M* and Sluggo.
Shelby Lynne's sister releases a covers album of some of her favorite female singers.
This is the second full-length album for the British electronic artist.
This third collaboration between jazz drummer Reid and Four Tet's Hebden was again recorded live, without any edits or overdubs.

recordname: Me. I Am Mariah... The Elusive Chanteuse
description: The first original studio release in five years for the R&B/pop singer features guest appearances from Fabolous, Miguel, Nas, Wale, and her twins.
The debut release for the Libertines' co-frontman's side project Carl Barât & The Jackals was produced by Joby Ford of the Bronx.
Enlisted as composer for boyfriend Matthew Barney's latest experimental film (which loosely concerns whales and Japan), Bjork responded with a largely instrumental score. Will Oldham guests.

recordauthor: Conor Oberst And The Mystic Valley Band
description: Conor Oberst's latest solo album is the first to be credited with The Mystic Valley Band.
The 11th full-length studio release for the California rock quartet led by Davey Havok was produced by the band's guitarist, Jade Puget.
Recorded in Brooklyn, the sixth full-length solo studio release for the British singer-songwriter is his first since 2011's Bella.
The fifth full-length release for the Canadian electro-funk duo features guest appearances from D.R.A.M., French Montana, Amber Mark, Stefflon Don, and The-Dream.
The sixth full-length release for the British rock quartet was co-produced with Tom Schick.
The second full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Ryan Needham and Liza Violet was recorded with Ross Orton.
The debut full-length solo release for Ed Nash, the bassist of Bombay Bicycle Club, features guest appearances from Tom Fleming, Marika Hackman, Liz Lawrence, and The Staves.

recordname: Youth Is Only Ever Fun in Retrospect
description: The debut full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Oscar Lulu was produced by Larry Hibbitt.
The fourth full-length release for the British trio was self-produced while the band was without a label.
This is the debut full-length release for the Danish pop-punk band.
The second full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced with Dev Hynes, Duncan Mills, and Adam Jaffrey.
The second full-length solo release for the Broken Social Scene frontman was co-produced with Dave Hamelin.
The debut full-length release for the folk-inspired rock band led by Dashboard Confessional's Chris Carrabba was produced by Ammar Malik and Robopop.
The fourth full-length release for the San Francisco psych rock now led by Bret Constantino was produced with Tim Green.
The sixth studio release for the Canadian indie pop collective led by Joel Gibb is its first in five years.
The eighth full-length studio release for the Finnish alternative rock band was produced by Hiili Hiilesma.
The latest release for Belfast-based producer Jack Hamill is a concept album about Mr. 8040 and his return to his home planet Mikrosector-50.
The sixth full-length release from the British singer-songwriter was recorded in one day at Abbey Road.
The second release from the New York indie pop artist was self-produced in Asheville, North Carolina.
The debut release for the 19-year-old British pop singer features guest appearances by Ne-Yo, Rita Ora, and Pharrell.
The third full-length studio release for the German-born electronic producer Alexander Ridha features Snoop Dogg as a guest artist.
The second release for the Brooklyn-based indie pop trio was produced by Matt Boynton.
The debut album for the one-man band project for Michael Lovett blends together R&B and pop styles.
Rob Campanella produced the fifth album for the Kansas-born and London-based singer-songwriter.
This is the second album for Davye Hawk as Memory Tapes.
This is the second album for the Manchester, England, indie-pop quartet.
The album of Eastern-influenced music is the fourth release for the trio from Florida who met at a Hare Krishna commune.
The Northern Ireland duo who remixed the Phoenix track "Lasso" releases its first full-length album produced by Eliot James.
The British singer-songwriter who has worked with the Pussycat Dolls and Sugarbabes releases her debut album.
The debut solo album for the former singer of The Servant features a sampling from Rihanna's "Umbrella," as well as the soundtrack to the film, "Starman."
The Welsh rock band recorded its first album for Sony in Los Angeles, and it is the last for drummer Ilan Rubin, who left to join Nine Inch Nails.
The compilation contains b-sides from his past three albums.
The fourth album for the singer/actor features Jeff Beck, Sheila E., Nas, Raphael Saadiq, and David Sanborn as guest artists.
The debut album for Ben Esser was produced by Lexxx.
The Los Angeles punk band releases its second full-length album.
This is the Swedish indie rock quartet's second full-length album.
The Harvard graduate releases his debut American album.
This debut full-length for the UK five-piece recalls 1980s synth-pop.
Justin Stanley produced and co-wrote the R&B singer's second album, which also includes collaborations with ?uestlove, Lenny Kravitz and Jon Brion.
This is the fourth LP for the trio of Jim Putnam, Senon Williams and Steve Goodfriend.

'I Dreamed' is the debut for the duo of Stars vocalist Torquil Campbell and electronic musician Chris Dumont (his music is electronic, that is; Dumont is not). Included is a cover of Pet Shop Boys' "Love Comes Quickly."
The English trip-hop outfit led by vocalist Louise Robinson (nee Rhodes) and producer Andy Barlow return for a fourth album.

This debut album for the Icelandic band (who draw more comparisons to Coldplay than to their countrymates Sigur Ros) was released in the UK in 2002 to some acclaim, prompting a major label deal with DreamWorks and a U.S. rerelease in 2003.
This is the debut LP for the Weezer-esque Los Angeles band led by Robert Carmine (otherwise known as the younger brother of actor/Phantom Planet bandmember Jason Schwartzman).

One of the many side projects of Stephin Merritt (Magnetic Fields, The 6ths), the Future Bible Heroes features lyrics by Merritt, low-fi electronic music by Christopher Ewen, and vocals by Claudia Gonson. This is their second LP.
The fourth album for the dance band led by Jake Shears includes production by Diplo, Calvin Harris, Dean John Horton, The Neptunes, Stuart Price, and Alex Ridha.
The sixth full-length release for the British electronic band features guest appearances from Flux Pavilion and Sleaford Mods.
The second album for the Australian indie-pop rock band was produced by Dan Grech-Marguerat.
Jim Eno of Spoon produced the third album for the Austin, Texas rock group.

recordname: From The Valley To The Stars
description: This is the sophomore album for Swedish singer Sarah Assbring.

The Los Angeles trio, making their recording debut with this self-titled release, have attracted a growing fanbase over the last two years via their live shows, which highlight their atmospheric, vaguely Stereolab-esque music. The group (who met via want ads in the L.A. Weekly) is led by singer/drummer Gena Olivier.
The fifth full-length studio release for the British trio is more heavily electronic than its previous release.
The second release for Peter Pisano and Brian Moen was written after their 2010 tour.
The fourth album for the rock band was its final one with drummer Jerry Fuchs, who passed away just prior to the release date.
This is the fifth album for the R&B singer/actor born in South Carolina.
This is the fourth album for the Chicago-based duo, who previously worked with Jim O'Rourke.
This is the third album for Montreal's Olivier Alary, who previously worked with Bjork and Cat Power.
The fifth album for the R&B singer is her first with the Epic label.
Chris Taylor of the Brooklyn band Grizzly Bear releases his solo side project.
The South London grime artist becomes Def Jam's very first female MC with the release of this solo debut LP.
The third full-length release for the Oklahoma indie rock trio was co-produced with Joey Waronker of Atoms Of Peace.
This is the debut full-length release for the Scottish rock trio of Dale Barclay, William Coombe, and Jordan Hutchinson.
The Swedish trio's fourth album was released as digital- and vinyl-only.
Sufjan Stevens, David Bazan, and Damien Jurado are among the numerous guests on the Seattle singer-songwriter's fourth album, which includes a cover of R.E.M.'s "The One I Love."
TAL's fourth disc is almost a Jimmy LaValle solo recording, with the band leader handling the bulk of the instrumentation, vocals, and production.
This is the debut full-length release for the collaboration between former Girls drummer Darren Weiss and Daniel Presant.
The Nashville-born and New York-based folk singer releases his debut album recorded by Kyle Spence of Harvey Milk.
After two EPs, the Brooklyn duo of Thomas Mullarney and Jacob Gossett releases their debut full-length of R&B-influenced electro-pop.
The second album for the British rock band is its first with new lead singer Henry Tremain (Stuart Smart left in 2011). The band announced they were transitioning to the name TTNG with this record.
The quartet led by Freddy Ruppert that includes Zola Jesus/Nika Roza Danilova, Xiu Xiu's Jamie Stewart, and Yasmine Kittles releases its second album together.
The second full-length studio release for Portland, Oregon-based indie rock singer-songwriter was produced by Chris Funk of the Decemberists.
The 25-track fifth studio release for the Canadian hip-hop artist features guest appearances from Jay-Z and Ty Dollar $ign as well as vocals from Michael Jackson and Static Major.
The seventh full-length release for the Australian singer features songs originally written for other artists such as Adele, Beyoncé, and Rihanna.
The ninth full-length studio release for the pop-punk trio features production by John Feldmann, The Futuristics and Tim Pagnotta.

recordname: The Ecleftic 2 Sides II a Book
description: The second solo release from the former Fugee features guest appearances by Mary J. Blige, Youssou N'Dour, and Kenny Rogers (yes, that Kenny Rogers).
The country singer latest album features American jazz standards with Norah Jones and Diana Krall as guest singers.
This is the eighth album for the Elephant 6 affiliated band from Athens, Georgia.
The debut full-length release for the British alternative rock band from Manchester was produced by Mike Crossey.
The Australian pop singer returns with more dance-floor slammers and pure pop hits that have kept her career going for over twenty years.
The second solo release for the Babyshambles/The Libertines frontman was produced by Johann Scheerer.

recordname: Another Day, Another Time: Celebrating the Music of "Inside Llewyn Davis"
description: The two-disc compilation features songs from a one-night concert of songs from the Coen brothers film "Inside Llewyn Davis" by such artists as The Avett Brothers, Joan Baez, Elvis Costello, Rhiannon Giddens, Colin Meloy, The Milk Carton Kids, Keb Mo, Marcus Mumford, Punch Brothers, Dave Rawlings, Secret Sisters, Willie Watson, Gillian Welch, and Jack White.
After gaining attention with their vinyl single Hey Boy, the Tennessee five-piece band releases its debut album produced by Shane Stonebeck.
KRS-One and Buckshot team up for their first album together.
Rick Rubin produced this second album for the Chris Cornell-meets-Rage Against The Machine supergroup.
This is the second collaboration between the Depeche Mode frontman and the British electronica duo Soulsavers.
The debut full-length release for the alternative rock trio from Olympia, Washington, was produced with Jackson Long.
The fourth full-length release for the Pennsylvania producer was recorded on cassette and then into a sampler to create the 12 tracks.
The alternative rock trio returns with its Pledgemusic fan-funded release produced by Beastie Boy Adam Horovitz.
The ex-Grandaddy singer releases his debut solo album.
Following the influence of artists such as Iggy Pop and David Bowie, !!! went to Berlin to produce their texturally full-bodied--pop yet still heavily brooding--new album.
The 13th full-length release for the indie rock band led by Kevin Barnes was influenced in part by his separation from his wife and 1970s music in New York.
Pearl Jam's lead singer goes solo with music based on his works for the film of the same name.

"Scratch My Back" is Peter Gabriel's first album in eight years--and the first in a series of releases--in which Gabriel covers the works of his favorite artists in exchange for his own collection of covers by those artists in the forthcoming album, "I'll Scratch Yours." The tracklist includes Arcade Fire's "My Body Is a Cage," Bon Iver's "Flume," David Bowie's "Heroes," Lou Reed's "The Power of the Heart," Paul Simon's "The Boy in the Bubble," and Radiohead's "Street Spirit (Fade Out)" to name a few.
This debut full-length for the London group headed by Joe Goddard and Alexis Taylor is a (semi-)tongue-in-cheek mix of diverse styles such as fake-gangsta-rap, R&B, soul, electronica, and more.
The debut album for the New York indie pop artist finally reaches the US after a successful release in the UK in 2010.
The 12th solo release for the British rock artist was produced by Martin Kierszenbaum and is his first pop/rock album since 2003's Sacred Love.

recordname: Seth Avett and Jessica Lea Mayfield Sing Elliott Smith
description: Seth Avett and Jessica Lea Mayfield's cover album features 12 songs from Elliott Smith's seven releases.
The fifth album for the indie rock band led by Jake Snider was produced by former keyboardist Matt Bayles.
Dan Auerbach of the Black Keys produced the seventh album for the garage rock duo.
Gil Norton produced this second album for the Paul Smith-fronted UK rock outfit, who debuted in 2005 with the Mercury Music Prize-nominated 'A Certain Trigger.'
This is the third album for the Jamaican dancehall star.

recordname: The Girl In The Other Room
description: New husband Elvis Costello co-wrote six of the tunes on this latest disc from platinum-selling jazz vocalist Diana Krall.

The Icelandic band is quite a bit different from the one that released 1999's varied 'This Is Normal,' losing most of its members and changing its name (now, officially, "gusgus") and record label in the interim. Now consisting of just 4 members--three DJs and a new vocalist--gusgus offer up a more focused sound on 'Attention,' which tends toward stripped-down electronica and early-'80s electro sounds.
The second full-length from the Atlanta rapper features contributions from Timbaland, Swizz Beats, Nate Dogg, Mystikal, Jagged Edge and Twista.
Robert Diggs, aka Bobby Digital, aka RZA, aka (well, we could go on... but we won't), best known for his production work with Wu-Tang Clan and the Gravediggaz, returns with his second solo album.

Originally released in 2012 as a collection of sheet music, this studio recorded version includes vocals from Beck, Jack Black, Jarvis Cocker, Bob Forrest, Eleanor Friedberger, Fun., Jason Isbell, Gabriel Kahane, David Johansen, Norah Jones. Juanes, Lord Huron, Laura Marling, Marc Ribot, Sparks, Moses Sumney, Swamp Dogg, Tweedy, Loudon Wainwright III, and Jack White.
Singer-songwriter Matthew Sweet joins The Bangles' Susanna Hoffs for a collection of 15 covers, including takes on Bob Dylan, The Who, The Bee Gees and the Velvet Underground.
The first release in a planned trilogy for the punk rock band was produced by Rob Cavallo.
The latest release from the Ben Chasny solo project is based on a new composition method Chasny invented.
Dave Grohl and the Dixie Chicks guest on the singer-songwriter's third album.
This is the second full-length release for the indie folk band that includes Iain Archer, Peter Buck, Richard Colburn, Jacknife Lee, Gary Lightbody, Scott McCaughey, and Troy Stewart.
The former Band guitarist returns with an album that looks back on his five-decade long career, featuring guests such as Eric Clapton, Steve Winwood, Tom Morello and Trent Reznor.
The debut full-length release for the Atlanta, Georgia, native features guest appearances from such artists as Lupe Fiasco, T.I., Weezer's Rivers Cuomo, Paramore's Hayley Williams, and Eminem.
The seventh album for the New York rock band was produced with Dave Fridmann.
Martha Wainwright and Ken Stringfellow are among the guests on Gary Lightbody's fourth Snow Patrol album.

An Apple streaming exclusive for two weeks before releasing wider (and physically) on 12 August, the ninth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, Big Sean, Chris Brown, Busta Rhymes, J. Cole, Drake, French Montana, Future, Gucci Mane, Jadakiss, Jay Z, Jeezy, Jeremih, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne, Nicki Minaj, Nas, Rick Ross, Meghan Trainor, YG, Yo Gotti, Wale, and Wiz Khalifa.
The David "Moose" Adamson-led band changes its name to just Jookabox for its third album.
The first album on the Valory label for the queen of country was produced by Tony Brown and Mark Bright.
The fifth album for Prefuse 73 was recorded on analog tape first.
The ninth full-length studio release for the British indie rock band was produced with Rich Turvey.
The second album for the British electronic duo features such guests as Plan B, Tinie Tempah, Dizzee Rascal, Cee-Lo Green, and White Lies.
The Finnish hard rock band's sixth album includes one song that is over 10 minutes long.
The second full-length release for Montreal electronic producer Michael Silver was inspired from his travels.
The second full-length solo release for Kele Okereke was recorded in London and New York.
The fourth full-length release for the electroclash duo was produced by R.E.M.'s Michael Stipe and features guest appearances from Andy LeMaster, Johnny Magee, Holly Miranda, and Caroline Polachek.
The full-length solo release for Deerhoof drummer Moses Archuleta was written after the end of his marriage and recorded over a 10-year period.
Produced by Rich Costey, the eighth full-length release for the alternative rock band is its last with Chris Walla, who left the group in September of 2014.
The sixth full-length release for the folk band led by Fin Greenall was produced by Billy Bush.
The fourth release for the Sacramento hardcore band is its first on the Odd Future label.
Genres such as hip-hop, soul, dubstep, electronic, and West African music are featured on the debut album for the New York-based trio, who come via Australia and Indonesia.
The latest album for the multi-award-winning country artist was produced with Dann Huff.

If it sounds like The Jesus And Mary Chain fronted by a woman, well, that's precisely because it is. JAMC's Jim and William Reid join sister Linda (as well as Freeheat's Ben Lurie) for this first Sister Vanilla album, which has been in the works for a decade.
The quartet from San Diego, California, releases its sophomore album.
The debut full-length release for the new solo project from Hooray For Earth frontman Noel Heroux was self-recorded.
The first release from the Scottish indie pop trio in 13 years contains tracks from when they recorded under the name Data Panik and songs from their previous attempt at their fourth Bis disc.
The Brooklyn trio releases its third album of '50s girl-group-style garage rock.
The sixth studio album for the English rock quartet was recorded in Germany.
The debut solo album for The Hold Steady's Franz Nicolay.
The fourth full-length release for the Canadian experimental electronic band is its first with new singer Edith Frances.

recordname: I Am Not a Human Being
description: With Southern sounds, spacey themes, and smooth rhymes, the rapper returns from incarceration with his latest release of hip-hop hits.
Hayley Williams leads her Franklin, Tennessee-based band in their second album.
Produced by Tim Goldsworthy, the second full-length release for the Santa Barbara indie band was inspired by Lake Michigan.
The 20th full-length studio release for the rock band was produced with Julian Raymond.
Jim Scott returns as producer on the second release from the Dixie Chicks' Emily Robison and Martie Maguire as the Court Yard Hounds.
The debut full-length album for the Australian garage rock-pop duo of Alex Wall and Jordan Malane was produced by Devonte Hynes (aka Lightspeed Champion or Blood Orange).
This is the emo-pop band's major-label debut.
The second full-length release for the Scottish electronic producer features guest appearances from Danny Brown, D Double E, and Gorgeous Children.
The British glam/hard rock band returns to record and produce its third album after a five year absence.
The R&B singer's first studio album since 1994 includes a duet with Babyface.

The singer-songwriter's latest is a solo release in every sense of the word, as DiFranco wrote, produced, played, and sang everything on the album (not to mention releasing it on her own record label).

This is the debut full-length release for the New Zealand rockers, who have drawn comparisons to everyone from The Stooges and AC/DC to, of course, the White Stripes, and have been the subject of fawning articles in the UK music press (but then again, who hasn't) in recent months.
The seventh album for the Texas-based rockabilly star and his band features the track "Like a Rocket," selected as this year's official Daytona 500 theme song.
The second full-length album for the Australian duo was produced by Howard Redekopp.
The fifth full-length release for the San Francisco garage/psych rock quartet was partially influenced by Tim Cohen's stay in Arizona.
The third full-length release from the Northern Ireland indie rock band was produced by Jackknife Lee.

recordauthor: And So I Watch You from Afar
description: The third full-length release for the rock band from Belfast was produced by Rocky O'Reilly.
The Grammy-winning singer-songwriter releases her fourth studio album.
Mike Mogis produced the singer-songwriter's first album in three years.

This latest release for Scott Herren's Catalan- and tropicalia-themed Prefuse 73 side project is basically a Herren solo record, with the producer even singing on a number of tracks. Other vocalists include Mia Doi Todd and Jose Gonzalez.
Ken Stringfellow and Jon Auer reunite for their first album as The Posies in seven years. They are joined by Matt Harris (Oranger) on bass and Darren Minwalla (Preston School of Industry) on drums.
The Detroit duo of Joshua Epstein and Daniel Zott release another album of psychedelic indie pop.
This is the third album for the Icelandic artist.
The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was produced by James Ford and Alex Turner.
This is the fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn trio led by Ryan Lott.
The third album for the British indie rock band was produced by Andrew Scheps.
This is the soundtrack for the ballet based on a Hans Christian Anderson story.
Produced by Howard Bilerman, the third full-length release for the Chicago R&B/soul band introduces rock and pop sounds.
The third full-length release for the collaboration between Dave Gahan and Soulsavers is a rock covers.
The second full-length release for the music project of Winston Yellen features influences from R&B and electronic pop.

recordname: I Thought the Future Would Be Cooler
description: The sixth full-length release for the now Los Angeles-based electro-pop duo was produced by Jona Bechtolt and Rob Kieswetter.
The ten-track live acoustic release from the indie rock band features songs recorded at Nashville's Ryman Auditorium in April 2013.
This is the debut full-length album on Sub Pop for the Canadian dream pop duo.

Best known for his film career ("Buffalo '66," "Trouble Every Day"), actor Vincent Gallo has also released a low-fi indie rock album (2001's 'When') and scored several films. This 29-track effort compiles all of his previous recordings for various indie film soundtracks.

recordname: Music to Make Love to Your Old Lady By
description: "Nathaniel Merriweather" is merely the latest incarnation of producer Dan "The Automator" Nakamura, best known for his work with Dr. Octagon and the Gorillaz. Merriweather was last seen on 1999's Handsome Boy Modeling School debut, and here he is joined in his new band, Lovage, by Kid Koala, Damon Albarn, Prince Paul, Faith No More's Mike Patton, and the Elysian Fields' Jennifer Charles, among others.
The sophomore effort from the Los Angeles rockers.
Juliana Hatfield and company reunite for their first album in 8 years.
The debut full-length solo release for the bassist of Warpaint was co-produced with Norm Block.
The second full-length release for the British dance artist features influences of R&B, reggae, and synthpop.
Devendra Banhart and Priestbird's Greg Rogove join up to release their debut album.
The X frontman's fifth solo disc features guests Neko Case, Grant-Lee Phillips, Dave Alvin and Kristin Hersh.
The Hootie & the Blowfish singer's sophomore solo album was produced by Frank Rogers.
The fifth full-length studio release for the DJ/producer features guest appearances from Bleep Bloop, Nils Frahm, Ernie Fresh, Matthew Halsall, G Jones, and Run the Jewels.

The latest full-length studio release for rapper Rick Ross features guest appearances from 21 Savage, Yungeen Ace, Benny The Butcher, Blxst, DreamDoll, Willie Falcon, Future, Wiz Khalifa, Major Nine, Jazmine Sullivan, The-Dream, and Wale.
Originally announced in 2015, the second full-length studio release for the R&B artist features guest appearances from French Montana, Future, Little Dragon, Offset, and Ty Dolla $ign is finally out.
The fifth full-length release for singer-songwriter Nika Roza Danilova was co-produced with Dean Hurley.
The latest album for the Norwegian singer-songwriter.

recordname: Go Go Smear The Poison Ivy
description: The Icelandic group releases their fourth album.
'Hot Fuss' marks the debut for the Las Vegas-based garage rockers led by 22-year old vocalist/songwriter Brandon Flowers.
The second full-length studio album for the quartet from San Francisco.
The second full-length release for the alternative pop artist features guest appearances from Cashmere Cat, Fifth Harmony's Lauren Jauregui and Migos' Quavo.
The second album for the Alabama-born rapper features such guest artists as Lil Wayne, Jadakiss, Piles, Rick Ross, Soulja Boy Tell 'Em, and Usher.
The Canadian DJ who is known for his mouse-head costume releases his third full-length album.
The debut full-length release for William Bensussen as The Gaslamp Killer features guest appearances from such artist as Gonjasufi, Shigeto, Samiyam, Miguel Atwood-Ferguson, and Daedelus.
The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in Nashville and features guest appearances from Dan Auerbach (on guitar) and Noah Cyrus.

U.N.K.L.E. is the pet project of Mo'Wax label head James Lavelle, whose successful 1998 album 'Psyence Fiction' included notable contributions from DJ Shadow, Thom Yorke and Badly Drawn Boy. Guests this time out include Josh Homme (Queens Of The Stone Age), Robert "3D" del Naja (Massive Attack), Brian Eno, Ian Brown (Stone Roses), Mani (Stone Roses/Primal Scream) Joel Cadbury (South) and Jarvis Cocker (Pulp).
The rapper's eleventh album includes six tracks produced by Timbaland. R. Kelly also guests.
Did you know this guy used to be in the Police?
If you prefer your Fleetwood Mac songs written by Lindsey Buckingham, your 16-year wait is over. Joining Buckingham on this brand-new, 18-track album are Stevie Nicks, Mick Fleetwood and John McVie.
The first album of new material in three years for the ever-consistent Cowboy Junkies.
The third full-length release for the Australian electronic duo was produced with Peter Mayes and Jonathan Sloan.
The Los Angeles band's follow-up to their 2004 release, Treble & Tremble.
The Welsh band's seventh studio disc was produced by Tony Visconti and Greg Haver.
Recorded and produced by Rick Rubin at the same sessions as 2012's The Carpenter, the eighth release for the folk rock band is said to be more of a "youthful wonder" feel.
Linkin Park team up again with legendary producer Rick Rubin for its fourth album in attempt to create a genre all of its own.
The Australian pop singer worked with Enrique Iglesias, Greg Kurstin, MNEK, Ariel Rechtshaid, Sia, and Pharrell Williams on her 12th studio release.

The posthumously released eight-track album from the pop singer features unreleased songs completed between 1983 and 1999 with new production from executive producer L.A. Reid, as well as Jerome "J-Roc" Harmon, Rodney Jerkins, John McClain, StarGate, and Timbaland. A deluxe edition includes a disc of songs without the current producers input.

The third full-length release for the Foo Fighters drummer with the Coattail Riders features guest appearances from Dave Grohl, Chrissie Hynde, Perry Farrell, Duff McKagan, LeAnn Rimes, Roger Taylor, Joe Walsh, and Nancy Wilson.
The second full-length release for the British indie-pop singer was written in Berlin, England (London & Norfolk), and France.
Gomez guitarist Ben ottewell releases his debut solo album produced by Will Golden.
The band fronted by Page Hamilton includes yet another new line-up for its seventh studio album.
The fourth album for the Los Angeles-based electronica producer finds him joined by guests MF Doom, Mike Ladd and Prefuse 73.
The fifth full-length studio release for the Canadian indie rock band was co-produced with Daft Punk's Thomas Bangalter, Portishead's Geoff Barrow, Markus Dravs, and Pulp's Steve Mackey.
The third full-length solo release for the Bloc Party lead singer (though the first under his full name) features guest appearances from Olly Alexander and Corinne Bailey Rae.
The San Francisco post-punk band's second album follows five years after their debut.
Patrick Wolf re-recorded some tracks from his various releases, with the double album split with darker songs on one side and the more hopeful tracks on the other.

recordname: Music For Listening To Music To
description: The fourth full-length release for the indie rock band was produced by Ryan Adams.

The first studio release since 1973's Raw Power to be credited under Iggy & The Stooges, reunites Iggy Pop with James Williamson, Scott Asheton, and new bassist Mike Watt (Ron Asheton passed away in 2009) for the band's fifth studio album.
The French electro and house music producer/remixer releases a debut full-length album.
Brendan Angelides releases his debut full-length album as Eskmo.
The legendary singer's first album in ten years combines R&B, soul and hip-hop. Guests include Paul McCartney, Prince and India.Arie.
The latest MTV Unplugged release is from Florence + the Machine and it includes a cover of Jackson with Josh Homme.
The Portland folk-rockers return with a new album of psychedelic roots music.
Bob Rock (Metallica) produced this sophomore album for the Montreal-based pop-punk band.
The rapper's second album was "executive" produced by Dr. Dre, Eminem and 50 himself and includes the singles "Piggybank" and "Disco Inferno."
This is the second album for the Brooklyn-based indie rock trio.
The top female finisher on the eighth season of American Idol releases her debut album.
This is the solo debut for Banks, a member of G Unit.
The Chicago rapper's long-awaited follow-up to 'Adrenaline Rush' features contributions from Kanye West, Toxic, Cee-Lo and R. Kelly.
This electronic-rock effort marks the full-length solo debut for Omaha, Neb.-based Denver Dalley of Desaparecidos.

Don't confuse The Warlocks of the 1960s (who later became the Grateful Dead) with the new band of the same name, who only sound like they come from the 1960s. This Los Angeles-based group favor lengthy, droning songs, evoking groups such as the Velvet Underground and Jesus & Mary Chain.
This new 14-track set from Eric Clapton features a mix of originals and covers (including songs by Stevie Wonder and James Taylor).

recordname: Inside Llewyn Davis [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
description: The soundtrack to the Coen Brothers film about the the Greenwich Village folk music scene in the early 60s includes production from T-Bone Burnett and songs sung by the actors (Oscar Isaac, Carey Mulligan, Stark Sands, Justin Timberlake) of the film.
The Danish duo's fifth studio album showcases much of their original sound -- dark, droning, distorted guitar pop.

recordname: A Crow Left Of The Murder
description: The alt-metal band's first album since their 2001 hit 'Morning View' features a slightly different lineup, with Ben Kenney replacing bassist Dirk Lance. Brendan O'Brien produced.

Actually, they're from Sweden. Numbering a Polyphonic Spree-esque 29 members, the Emanuel Lundgren-led collective made their full-length debut in 2006 with the unusually chipper 'Friends,' which hit the States in early 2007.
The fourth release for the California indie rock band is its first with former Modest Mouse and Murder City Devils guitarist Dann Gallucci, who also co-produced the album with Lars Stalfors.
The sixth album for the Scottish rock band was produced by Emery Dobyns.
The sixth full-length release for the Boston band was recorded in Nashville with Dan Knobler.
The sixth full-length release for the duo of Sierra and Bianca Casady was recorded in the south of France.

recordname: A Picture Of The Three Of Us At The Gate To The Garden Of Eden
description: The debut album for the Washington, DC-based indie rock band.
The debut full-length release for the New York punk rock band was produced by John Hill.
The Floridian heavy metal band releases their fifth studio album.
The 61-year-old rocker returns with his first new album in 11 years.
The literary rapper's second LP features production by the usual suspects (Kanye West, The Neptunes, Just Blaze). Mary J Blige guests.
The indie rock band from Minnesota self-produced its third album.
The fourth studio release for the Knoxville, Tennessee indie rock band was produced by Patrick Carney of the Black Keys.
This is the debut full-length album for the Icelandic folk rock band that won the Músiktilraunir, their homeland's battle of the bands competition, in 2010.
Beck's latest LP, 'Guero,' is remixed track-for-track by the likes of Air, Boards Of Canada, El-P and Subtle.
After a two-year acting stint at The Globe and in the West End, the British singer/actor returns with a self-produced album of Americana.
This is the first album in nearly 20 years since Richard Davies and Eric Matthews released their debut albums as Cardinal in 1994.
The second full-length release for the British alternative pop artist features contributions from Travis Barker, Machine Gun Kelly, and Dan Reynolds.
The second full-length release for the indie rockers was produced by Chris Coady.
The latest solo album for Anticon co-founder Adam Drucker is his first official studio release.
This is the third album for the rock band led by the former Something Corporate singer Andrew McMahon.
This is Orenda Fink's second solo album, after stints with the bands Art In Manila and O+S.
Jason Falkner produced the latest album for the Texas-based artist.
This is the debut album for the Southern California rock quintet.
The first solo release for the singer-songwriter since the break-up of The Civil Wars was co-produced with Matt Morris.
This is the fourth full-length studio release for the Sweden's Sarah Assbring as El Perro Del Mar.
The Clap Your Hands Say Yeah's frontman releases his debut solo album produced by Steve Berlin.
The multi-award winning singer returns to release her first album in seven years.
The 12th studio release for the country singer is his first on the Big Machine label and it includes guest appearances from Taylor Swift and Keith Urban.
The R&B singer's latest is a double album, confining the two sides of his personality to separate discs: the radio- and club-friendly 'Happy People' is backed by the religious-themed 'U Saved Me.'

recordname: Per Second, Per Second, Per Second... Every Second
description: The Massachusetts-based trio's fourth album is their first for a major label. Dave Fridmann produces.

Recorded in just two weeks after Adams (rather, his record company) scrapped plans to release 'Love Is Hell' as his official follow-up to 'Gold' (the former will instead appear as a 2-part EP), 'Rock'n'Roll' features guest appearances from Billie Joe Armstrong (Green Day), Melissa Auf Der Mauer (Hole) and Parker Posey (every indie film in the last 15 years).
This is the second full-length for the German indie-electro-pop duo of Stephanie Bohm (also in Couch) and The Notwist's Micha Acher.
The distinctive Liverpool-based band returns with a third studio LP.
'Beast' marks the debut for Swan Lake, the new collaboration between Destroyer's Dan Bejar, Wolf Parade's Spencer Krug and Frog Eyes' Carey Mercer.
The latest album for the actor/country singer from Louisiana features a song co-written by Brett James and Nickelback's Chad Kroeger.
The San Francisco Bay Area native releases his third album, his first on Epitaph Records.
The fourth release for the Canadian electronic duo features guest appearances from Ezra Koenig, Solange and Toro Y Moi.
The latest full-length release from the Japanese noise-rock group is its first on the Third Man label.
The second full-length Columbia Nashville release for the country singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Brothers Osborne and Brandi Carlile.
The third full-length release for the California artist was self-produced and features contributions from the Cure's Pearl Thompson.
Produced by Chris Heidman, the second full-length release for the Minneapolis rock band is its first with new drummer Rory MacMurdo.
The sophomore album from the Los Angeles quintet fuses Afropop with '80s new wave.
The British rock band releases its seventh album, produced by Dave Sardy.

Another hot, retro-sounding band based in New York? Is there some sort of factory churning these bands out? (Or in the case of The Bravery, a Factory?) The band's self-titled debut, preceded by the requisite buzz, utilizes a new wave-flavored sound which is also reminiscent of, oh, let's just say New Order and The Cure.
Alicia Keys' third album includes guest vocalists Marsha Ambrosius, John Mayer, and Linda Perry.
The four-track release from Mats Gustafsson and Colin Stetson was recorded live at the Vancouver Jazz Festival in 2011.
This is the foruth album for the New York-based singer-songwriter.
The Canadian singer/pianist tackles American standards, backed by a big band on most of the tracks.
Butch Vig produces their sixth studio album.
The second collaborative album by Ty Segall and White Fence features 15 tracks that range from 16 seconds to over five minutes long.
This is the first album in 20 years for the band led by the Sex Pistol's John Lydon. The line-up includes Bruce Smith, Lu Edmonds, and Scott Firth.
This second album for the London quartet was produced by Ethan Johns and recorded at ICP Studios in Brussels, Belgium and the Distillery in Bath, England.
The sixth solo album for the Fleet Foxes member is his second album for the year.
Produced by Jon Brion, the second album for Best Coast is its first since drummer Ali Koehler was let go by the indie pop duo.
The second release on Arts & Letters for the Canadian singer, who also appeared in John Cameron Mitchell's movie Shortbus.
The third solo release for the singer-songwriter features guest vocals from frequent collaborator, Jenny Lewis.
The sophomore release for Adam Lambert features production and co-written songs by Nikka Costa, Dr. Luke, Claude Kelly, Bruno Mars, Sam Sparro, and Pharrell Williams.
The band formed by drummers Shane Aspegren and Lori Sean Berg releases its third album recorded in Paris, France, with Antoine Gaillet.

The fifth studio release for California rapper The Game features guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, Big Sean, Chris Brown, J. Cole, Common, Jamie Foxx, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne, Rick Ross, Tyga, Kanye West, and Wiz Khalifa.
This is the second full-length solo release for the former Yuck frontman.
Neil Michael Hagerty's latest band releases its sixth album, which is only 33 minutes long.

recordauthor: I Am The World Trade Center
description: The 80s-influenced laptop-pop duo of Dan Geller and Amy Dykes return with their third LP.
The current Mojave 3 and former Slowdive member makes her long-awaited solo debut with 'Waves Are Universal,' which features production by David Naughton and drumming by Ashley Bates (Chapterhouse).
This is the second solo disc for Faint bassist Joel Petersen. Mike Mogis produces.

Following a series of three glitchy, minimalist electronica albums entitled "1," "2," and "3," respectively, producer Stefan Betke (aka Pole) changes course and heads into experimental hip-hop and dub on this latest LP, even enlisting Ohio-based rapper Fat Jon for vocals on several tracks.

recordname: From the Cradle to the Rave
description: Full of futuristic synthesizer sounds and analog arrangements, Irish-born Marcus Lambkin's album of house jams features guest vocals from Hot Chip and LCD Soundsystem.
The soon-to-be-incarcerated (for perjury) rapper offers a fourth solo disc. Kanye West and Scott Storch are among the producers.

recordname: Wash the Sins Not Only the Face
description: This is the second full-length release from the Brighton indie rock trio.
Sheryl Crow's seventh album takes a soulful musical direction for the singer-songwriter and features guest appearances from Justin Timberlake and Keith Richards.
This is the debut album for the 11-piece indie rock band led by Alex Ebert.
The fifth full-length (non-Mariachi) release for the Los Angels punk band was produced by Rob Schnapf.

The first new studio release in six years for the pop-punk band led by Joel and Benji Madden was produced by John Feldmann and features guest appearances from Sleeping With Sirens's Kellin Quinn and Biffy Clyro's Simon Neil.
The third release for the experimental rock side-project that included Spiritualized's John Coxon, Hot Chip's Alexis Taylor, and Pat Thomas, is the last with This Heat's Charles Hayward.
This is the debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie rock quintet.
Kyp Malone who has appeared on TV On The Radio and Iran's albums, releases his debut solo album.
The first album of new songs in over 15 years from the queen of disco.

Recorded live in studio with an audience, the debut full-length release for the actor/jazz pianist with his band, The Mildred Snitzer Orchestra and features guest appearances from Till Bronner, Imelda May, Haley Reinhart, and Sarah Silverman.
The debut album for the indie pop trio was produced by Dave Sitek.
The Canadian indie rock trio releases the follow-up to the band's 2008 debut, Red, Yellow & Blue.
The fifth full-length release for the British indie rock band was self-produced and features a guest appearance from Rachel Goswell of Slowdive.
This is the latest children's album for the band and as suggested by the title, it focuses on science.
Blur's Graham Coxon releases his seventh solo album, produced by Stephen Street.

recordname: Adventures In The Underground Journey To The Stars
description: The London-based trio of Joel Cadbury, Jamie McDonald and Brett Shaw return with a third album that finds them relying less on electronica elements than previous efforts.
The second full-length release for the Brooklyn chamber pop band led by Ellis Ludwig-Leone features vocals from Allen Tate and Charlene Kaye.
The collaboration with Lil Wayne (due to contract issues was listed as a 2 Chainz album) includes two tracks from the earlier released mixtape Felt Like Cappin.
The Ying Yang Twins guest on the Southern rapper's first release for Big Boi's Purple Ribbon label.
The New York City five-piece (yes, they're one of *those* New York bands) make their debut with 'Red Bedroom,' mixing dance and punk like it's 2002 all over again.

recordname: Triple F Life: Friends, Fans and Family
description: The second full-length studio album from Waka Flocka Flame features guest appearances from such artists as B.o.B., Drake, Flo Rider, Ludacris, Nicki Minaj, and Trey Songz.
This is the debut release from the rock band formed by former Gallows singer Frank Carter and Hope Conspiracy guitarist Jim Carroll.
The Eurythmics member releases a solo album of rock and blues, recorded at Nashville's famous Blackbird Studios.
The sophomore album for the Sussex, England pop rock band.
The fourth full-length release for the British rock band led by Josh Franceschi was produced by Neal Avron.

recordauthor: Margot & the Nuclear So and So's
description: The second album for the group is its first on the Epic label. A vinyl version named Animal! contains songs they preferred, whereas this album contains songs preferred by Epic.
The second full-length release for the British soul collective was recorded in London and Los Angeles.

recordname: Just Tell Me That You Want Me: A Tribute To Fleetwood Mac
description: Produced by Randall Poster and Gelya Robb, the 17 track tribute album includes such artists as Lee Ranaldo, J Mascis, Best Coast, New Pornographers, Marianne Faithfull, Lykke Li, Bonnie Prince Billy, Washed Out, Tame Impala, Craig Wedren, St. Vincent, The Kills, Gardens & Villa, The Crystal Ark, and MGMT covering Fleetwood Mac songs.
The 22-year-old singer-songwriter makes his Astralwerks debut with this second album.
The debut full-length release for the indie-dance band formed by brothers Will and Matt Ritson was co-produced by Ben Baptie and Leon Vynehall.
The first new studio release in over five years for the French electronic-pop band led by Anthony Gonzalez features guest appearances from beck, Mai Lan, Jordan Lawlor, and Susanne Sundfør.

recordname: I Told You I Was Freaky
description: The second album for the New Zealand-based duo features songs that appeared in the latest season of their HBO series.
Rage Against The Machine and Audioslave guitarist Tom Morello makes his solo debut as The Nightwatchman, with Brendan O'Brien producing this acoustic set.

Released a little over a year after rock-and-roll Hall of Famer Wanda Jackson and White Stripes frontman Jack White teamed up for a cover of Amy Winehouse, this album represents the first full-length album to be unleashed by the iconic singer in years and features appearances by White (who also served as producer).
The fifth album for the band led by Max Bemis is said to be its first true punk rock record.

The producer and Neon Neon cofounder's first solo credited album in six years features appearances from Cate Le Bon, Franz Ferdinand's Alex Kapranos, Red Hot Chili Peppers' Josh Klinghoffer, Money Mark, Mike Noyce, Empire of the Sun's Luke Steele, and Warpaint.
The NY-based band returns with its fourth, self-titled release, which was mixed by Alan Moulder and highlights the band's dark-themed, post-punk style.
Band members claim their fourth studio album was influenced by people they contacted through a Ouija board.
Last seen seen in the Disney Channel movie "Camp Rock," the three brothers return to release their third album to the masses.
The chamber pop music from the singer-songwriter features the Nashville Symphony and yMusic.
The second release for the Louisiana-born singer was written after a breakup and was co-produced with Trina Shoemaker.

The Los Angeles electronica producer/artist's first release on the Anticon label was created while he was dealing with the death of his grandmother, his friend Austin Peralta, and the illness of a family member.
The seventh full-length release for the British electronic trio features guest appearances from Barns Courtney and Ho99o9.
The debut full-length studio release for the rapper was released in the final days of 2013 after she leaked the album on SoundCloud to protest the label's delay of her album.
The 12th album for Tom Jenkinson was recorded over seven months.
The debut full-length release for the Scottish indie rock trio was produced by Rory Atwell of Test Icicles.
Recorded over two weeks, the dark and personal album was released for free on the Internet under his real name.
The collaboration between Savages and Bo Ningen was a 37-minute piece inspired by the Dadaist movement was originally performed in London at the Red Gallery in May 2013.
The collaboration between Savages and Bo Ningen was a 37-minute piece inspired by the Dadaist movement was originally performed in London at the Red Gallery in May 2013.
The latest release from the indie rock group features Robert Pollard playing all the instruments on the album.
Produced by John Congleton, the ninth full-length release for the Jamie Stewart project was influenced by his move to Los Angeles and a Japanese erotic film of the same name as the album.
The Australian band's follow-up after its remix album, "We Died, They Remixed."
The ninth full-length release for the British psychedelic/space rock bandled by Stephen Lawrie features guest appearances from the Scottish band St Deluxe.

Co-produced by Clive Davis, Babyface, and Antonio Dixon, the singer known as the Queen of Soul returns with a covers album of songs from such artists as Adele, Etta James, Alicia Keys, Gladys Knight, Sinead O'Connor, Diana Ross, Barbra Streisand, The Supremes, with guest appearances from Cissy Houston, and Tawatha Agee.
The third studio release for the British singer includes songs written by Mr. Hudson, John Legend, Plan B, Raphael Saadiq, Diane Warren, and Pharrell Williams.
Chris Hughes and Mark Frith return to produce the fourth release for the British indie pop band led by brothers, Alex and Thomas White.
The second release for the California singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Auerbach.
Co-produced with Buddy Cannon, the country singer's latest release includes eight songs written by Chesney and features guest appearances from Elan, Willie Nelson, and The Wailers.
The fifth solo album for the Raconteurs band member is his first on his own label, Readymade Records.
The double album from the French singer features an 11-track live set and seven unreleased studio tracks, many of which were produced by Beck for Gainsbourg's 2009 release IRM.
Recorded at San Francisco's legendary Hyde Street Studios, this Los Angeles quintet's third album continues to cross genres with punk-infused psychedelic jams.
The Swedish band returns with its second full-length album.
The fourth album for the French producer/DJ features such guests as Kelly Rowland, Akon, will.i.am, Ne-Yo, and Estelle.
The fifth album for the rock band is its first with Warner Bros.
The debut album for the new band led by Andrew Kenny of American Analog Set.
The sophomore album for the North Carolina indie rock band was produced with Jacquire King.
The fourth album for the Scottish band was recorded in Los Angeles with producer Tony Hoffer (Air, Beck).

This is the debut album for the Texas teenage home-schooled Christian indie-rock band made up of three DuPree sisters, one DuPree brother, and the other guy, who already have two EPs and a tour supporting Coldplay under their belts.

recordname: Don't Climb On And Take The Holy Water
description: Leaving Sub Pop behind for a different Northwest label (Strange Attractors), the Seattle band returns with a collection of new studio recordings, rehearsal sessions, and a 30-minute live track.
Jason Schwartzman has departed, but the Los Angeles band continues on with a third album.
This compilation consists chiefly of alternate versions of tracks from her recent LP 'Daybreaker,' including live recordings and remixes by Two Lone Swordsmen and Four Tet.

This compilation (whose name borrows from the similar 1978 Brian Eno-curated disc 'No New York') contains 16 tracks from artists at the forefront of the current New York indie scene, including The Strokes, Interpol, The Natural History, Radio 4, The Walkmen, The Rapture, Calla, Longwave, Ted Leo & The Pharmacists, Yeah Yeah Yeahs (credited to "Unitard") and The Rogers Sisters.
