This 30-track, 2-disc set from Richard D. James is his first Aphex Twin album in five years.

recordname: A Rock In The Weary Land
description: This is the first album for Mike Scott and company (well, basically just Mike Scott) since 1993's 'Dream Harder,' although Scott did have two solo albums in the interim.
The Ian McCulloch-led band are re-teamed with producer Hugh Jones (1981's 'Heaven Up Here') on this next step of their reunion.

recordname: I'm Not Bossy, I'm the Boss
description: Produced by John Reynolds, the 10th release for the singer-songwriter is a collection of love songs from different female point of views.
The fourth studio release for the indie-folk group led by Alex Ebert was recorded in New Orleans.
The fourth full-length release for the synthpop duo of Greg Hughes and Tessa Murray was written and recorded in just three months.
The seventh full-length release for the Swedish trio features production from Patrick Berger, Paul Epworth, Emile Haynie, Greg Kurstin, Thom Monahan, and Pontus Winnberg.
The third full-length release for the Australian brother-and-sister duo was produced by Rick Rubin.
The debut full-length release for the British duo of Marcus Pepperell and John Hamson, Jr. was produced with David Kosten.
Members of the Wu-Tang Clan guest on their fellow member's second solo disc. The roster of producers includes Pete Rock and MF Doom.

recordname: It Won't Be Soon Before Long
description: It has been five years, but Maroon 5 finally return with a follow-up to their huge-selling 2002 debut 'Songs About Jane.' The producers include Mike Elizondo, Mark "Spike" Stent, and Eric Valentine.
This is the reissue of Animal Collective's 2003 five-track album.
Hal Cragin produced the rock legend's latest album, influenced by jazz music.
This debut (and, it turns out, final album) from the noisy London trio was produced by James Ford (Simian).
The third album for the Brooklyn synth-psychedelic rock band was produced by David Wrench.

The debut release for the collaboration between The Isley Brothers [Ronald and Earnie Isley] and and Santana features 13 R&B cover songs made famous by such artists as Marvin Gaye, Billie Holiday, Curtis Mayfield, Dionne Warwick, and Stevie Wonder.

The latest release for the Philadelphia producer/singer-songwriter features guest appearances by Moe Berg, John Boutte, Dam Funk, Donald Fagen (of Steely Dan), Daryl Hall, Michael Holman, Bettye LaVette, Trent Reznor, Robyn, Atticus Ross, Joe Satriani, Bobby Strickland, Joe Walsh (of The Eagles), and KK Watson.
This is the debut full length dance release for Italian producer Egisto Sopor.
This is the fourth full-length album for the British rock band.

The Pepsi spokesperson's fourth LP includes guest vocals from Madonna (on lead single "Me Against The Music") and production work from Moby, R. Kelly, the Matrix, and Guy Sigsworth (but no Max Martin).
Legendary 1970s NYC electro-punk duo Suicide, hugely influential on the synth-pop, industrial, and electroclash movements to come in later decades, return with their first new album in ten years.
This is the third album for the country singer who gained stardom following the release of 2005's 'Modern Day Drifter.'
This is the first album in four years for the London-based indie pop group led by Sean O'Hagan.
The fifth full-length release for the Oregon-based New Zealand psychedelic rock band was recorded during the same session as Sex & Food.
The fourth full-length release for the Danish electronic artist features vocals from Marie Fisker, Lisbet Fritze, and the Savages' Jehnny Beth.
The debut full-length release for Yoann Lemoine, best known as the director of videos for Katy Perry and Lana Del Rey, is a concept album about the life of a young boy.
Rob Cavallo and Butch Walker are among the numerous producers on the Canadian pop singer's third album, which is preceeded by the single "Girlfriend."
The fifth full-length release for the indie rock band led by Zach Rogue was produced by John Congleton.
It's been more than six years since Tom Vek released his well received debut album, We have Sound.
This is the second full-length release for Los Angeles producer Matthew McQueen.
The second release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Rick Rubin in Malibu.
The second album for the rock band headed by Marie-Claire Balabanian and Karl Briedrick.
The 11th full-length studio release for the alternative rock band was produced by Danger Mouse.
This is the third full-length studio release for the Swedish dream pop duo.
Katy Goodman, bassist and backing vocalist of the Vivian Girls, releases her first solo project of dreamy, ethereal rock.
The third full-length release for the London-based duo of Elizabeth Sankey and Jeremy Warmsley was self-produced.
While 2013's La Costa Perdida was influenced by Northern California, this follow-up/companion album for the indie rock band is rooted in Southern California.
The third full-length release for the San Diego noise rock band is its first as a five-piece.
The debut full-length release for the Manchester dream-pop four-piece band was self-recorded.
The third release for the British folk-pop band was recorded at Ray Davies Konk studio.
Paul McCartney and Neko Case appear as guest performers on the Travis frontman's debut solo album.

recordname: Alone: The Home Recordings of Rivers Cuomo
description: The album by Weezer's frontman features home demos from 1992 to 2007.
The second disc for Prince Paul and Dan The Automator finds the producer pair joined by Cat Power, RZA, Jack Johnson, Julee Cruise and Pharrell Williams.
'Sun' is the first release in six years for the post-rock outfit whose members include Kieran Hebden (Four Tet) and Adem Ilhan.
The fourth full-length release from the indie rock duo of Bethany Cosentino and Bobb Bruno was produced with Carlos de la Garza and Justin Meldal-Johnsen.
This is the first solo album for the Radiohead drummer.
The British duo return to their folk rock roots with their debut on the Cooking Vinyl label.
The Dublin, Ireland band returns with a follow-up to 2005's 'Burn The Maps.'
Produced by Matthew Cullen, the third full-length release for the Brooklyn indie rock band is its first in five years.
The third album for the UK-based band, led by Tennessee-born Nathan Nicholson, was produced by Ethan Johns and exemplifies their wide-ranging sound.
The third album for the indie band whose biggest hit, "Valerie," was remade by Amy Winehouse.

recordname: Digital Ash In A Digital Urn
description: The more experimental of Conor Oberst's two releases in January 2005 is the electronic-flavored 'Digital Ash,' which includes some help from the Yeah Yeah Yeah's Nick Zinner and the Postal Service's Jimmy Tamborello.

Recorded with the support of the Gershwin estate, this tribute album finds Brian Wilson putting his own stamp on a number of George Gershwin classics, as well as completing two songs left unfinished at the time of the composer's death.

Miley Cyrus, Ghost, Elton John, Juanes, My Morning Jacket, Royal Blood, Darius Rucker, Rina Sawayama, St. Vincent, Chris Stapleton, Corey Taylor, The Neptunes, Volbeat, and Weezer are some of the 53 artists covering songs from Metallica's Black Album.
The second full-length release for the Seattle goth rock band is its first on the Hardly Art label.
Joe Walsh returns with his second release as Dignan Porch, this time as a full band with four new members: Hayley Akins, Ben Goodwin, Stephen Keane, and Sam Walsh.

The alternative L.A.-based hip-hop outfit, known for its positive message and break-dancing prowess, returns with a third LP. Guests Justin Timberlake and Papa Roach join new BEP backing vocalist Fergie (who replaces Kim Hill).
This is the fourth solo LP for the West Coast alternative rapper, who was a founding member of Freestyle Fellowship.

The follow-up to 1999's 'Middle of Nowhere' contains 11 tracks, including collaborations with vocalists David Gray and Naomi Bedford. Among those artists sampled on this disc are Tool, The Cramps, and the late Ian Dury. Longtime Orbital fans will be happy to learn that the theme from "Dr. Who", a staple of the Hartnoll brothers' live act, is included in the track listing.
The trio make the jump to a major label with 'This Island,' which features a cover of the Pointer Sisters' "I'm So Excited."
The debut full-length album for The Distillers' Brody Dalle-led band was produced by fellow band member Alain Johannes.
This is the second album for the North Carolina-based pop duo.
This is the third album for the Britrock-influenced Swedish band.
The sophomore album for the California indie rock band.
The Goo Goo Dolls' Robby Takac produced the Japanese pop group's tribute album to The Ramones.
Life at an all-boys school is the theme behind the fourth release for the indie rock band led by John Orth.
The latest release for Joel Thomas Zimmerman as the mouse head -wearing Deadmau5 is a 25-track double LP featuring a How To Destroy Angels and Nine Inch Nails remix.
The latest release for the multiple Grammy-winning singer-songwriter was inspired by his 2014 Broadway play of the same name about a British shipyard.
The second release for British singer-songwriter Jasmine van der Bogaerde is her first with original material.

The third solo release for the Three 6 Mafia rapper features guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, A$AP Rocky, Big Sean, Chris Brown, Lil Wayne, Trey Songz, Justin Timberlake, Wale, Wiz Khalifa, Yelawolf, and Young Jeezy.
The latest album for the Virginia psych-rock band formed by brothers Jennings, Lain, and Van Carney was recorded at their rebuilt studio using only analog equipment.
The Welsh indie rock band that includes Rhys Ifans and Super Furry Animals' Dafydd Ieuan releases its debut album.
The Faint's Joel Petersen returns with his third Broken Spindles album.
The Ben Gibbard-led group makes its major-label debut with this 11-song disc, produced by band member Chris Walla.
The debut release for the rock band led by The Strokes frontman with Jake Bercovici, Alex Carapetis, Jeramy Gritter, Jeff Kite, and Amir Yaghmai was produced by Shawn Everett.
This solo instrumental disc from the Brian Eno collaborator and U2 producer includes contributions from pianist Brad Mehldau and drummer Brian Blade.
Orenda Fink and Maria Taylor return to release the duo's fourth studio album after disbanding in 2004.
The latest release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was recorded during his 2015 tour with The Promise of the Real and features overdubbed sounds of animals and insects.
The Chemical Brothers bring their electronic skills to the soundtrack of the 2011 film.

recordname: Common as Light and Love Are Red Valleys of Blood
description: The eighth full-length release for Mark Kozelek's music project features songs about a variety of events and issues that occurred in 2016.
This is the debut full-length album for the Chicago-based foursome.
The 26th release for the Canadian electronic artist Aaron Funk is his first full-length in four years.

recordname: The Lives Inside the Lines in Your Hand
description: Indie rock singer-songwriter Matt Pond drops the PA suffix on his ninth full-length release.
Yusuf Islam (who seems to have lost the "Islam" portion of his name), better known by his former name of Cat Stevens, returns with his first album of pop songs since 1978.
This is the second album for Norwegian singer-songwriter Even Johansen, who records under the name Magnet.
The final album from Amy Winehouse was compiled by producer Salaam Remi from demos, covers, and, outtakes recorded from 2002 to March 2011
This is the fifth album (and first in six years) for the Swedish outfit led by vocalist/lyricist Nina Persson and guitarist Peter Svensson.
The roster of this Los Angeles outfit (who make their debut with this self-titled release) includes members of Beck's touring band (Medal-Johnsen and Joey Waronker).

This is the first album for the West Coast production team / hip-hop outfit formerly known as Tha Alkaholiks (and their fourth album to date, including that previous incarnation). Xzibit, Rockwilder, Kurupt and Busta Rhymes are among the guest contributors.
Frontman Jay Farrar produced the band's fifth album.

Following Johnny Cash and, more recently, Tom Jones, the legendary crooner creates his own rendition of his favorites in this collection of covers by artists such as Leonard Cohen, the Beatles, and even his own classic tunes.

recordname: Angelheaded Hipster: The Songs of Marc Bolan & T. Rex
description: The tribute album to Marc Bolan and T. Rex's music from the late producer Hal Willner (who passed away in April 2020) features Marc Almond, Devendra Banhart, BØRNS, John Cameron Mitchell, Nick Cave, Helga Davis, Elysian Fields, Perry Farrell, Father John Misty, Gavin Friday, Emily Haines, Jessie Harris, Joan Jett, David Johansen, Elton John, Charlotte Kemp Muhl, Kesha, King Khan, Julian Lennon, Sean Lennon, Maria McKee, Gaby Moreno, Nena, Beth Orton, Todd Rundgren, U2, Lucinda Williams, and Victoria Williams.
The fourth solo release for the former Destiny's Child singer features guest appearances from Beyoncé, Michelle Williams, Kevin Cossom, Wiz Khalifa, and Pusha-T.
Alec Empire and Nic Endo, the remaining two members of the German band, have reunited to release another album of electronic punk rock.

The guitarist is reunited with the 1970s band members Michael Carabello, Greg Rolie, Neal Schon, and Michael Shrieve along with current members Karl Perazzo and Benny Rietveld on the Latin rock group's latest studio release.
The fifth full-length release for the San Francisco Bay Area post-punk rock group was influenced by lead singer Ross Farrar's recent breakup.

The third full-length studio release from the Washington D.C. rapper features guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, Cee Lo Green, Lyfe Jennings, Meek Mill, Nicki Minaj, Ne-Yo, Rihanna, Rick Ross, Jerry Seinfeld, Wiz Khalifa, and Yo Gotti.
This is the debut full-length release for the Portland, Oregon, electronic duo.
The fourth album for the Canadian indie-rock band was recorded in Brooke Gallupe's parent's house.
This is the second studio album for the Canadian rock band.
Kele Okereke & co. try to avoid the sophomore slump with this highly-anticipated follow-up to their acclaimed debut 'Silent Alarm.'
Named after Charles Manson's getaway driver, the British quartet Kasabian drew comparisons to The Stone Roses, Happy Mondays, and Primal Scream with this debut LP.
The debut full-length release for the collaboration between husband-and-wife duo of Dee Dee of Dum Dum Girls and Brandon of Crocodiles was mixed by Jorge Elbrecht.
The 13th studio release for the synth-pop trio was produced by Ben Hillier and mixed by Flood.
The first full-length studio release in six years for British indie rock band Bloc Party was produced by Nick Launay and Adam Greenspan.
The fourth full-length release for the British indie rock band is its first with second guitarist Lewes Herriot.
The first album of new material from the rapper in seven years tackles political issues.
The fourth album for the folk rock duo of sisters was produced by Guy Berryman of Coldplay and Rik Simpson.
The jam rock band's latest release was produced by Steve Lillywhite.
This is the second full-length album for the rock band led by an Ian Svenonius.
This is the fourth quirky release for the exclamation-point-loving, Devo-esque, Tokyo-based band.
The 2-disc set is the rock band's third actual album.

recordname: Xoxo Panda & The New Kid Revival
description: Marc Bianchi releases his latest album under the Her Space Holiday name.

Breaking away from the Reprazent collective he headed, Bristol, England junglist Roni Size returns with his first true solo album, with no collaborators (or vocalists, for that matter) in sight on these 16 drum'n'bass tracks.
This 15th anniversary release for the rap veterans includes nine new tracks, supplemented by live recordings, remixes, and skits.

This disc collects remixes and B-sides (album title notwithstanding) culled from the singles generated by the animated supergroup's international hit debut album. The 9 songs here (totalling just 38 minutes) include two previously unreleased tracks.
This is Marc Bianchi's second LP as Her Space Holiday, which also includes his girlfriend, Keely.
This is the sixth album (and third on Beggars Banquet) for San Francisco's Swell, which now is a one-man band consisting entirely of David Freel.

This is the third album from London glam-rockers Placebo. The U.S. release adds two bonus tracks: a new version of "Without You I'm Nothing" with David Bowie guesting on vocals, and a cover of Depeche Mode's "I Feel You."

recordname: Songs From An American Movie, Vol. 2: Good Time For A Bad Attitude

description: The 11th full-length release for the Scottish rock band features guest appearances from Haim, Sky Ferreira, and Rachel Zeffira.
The second release for the Illinois indie-rock band led by George Hunter.
The debut full-length album for the San Francisco-born artist features Her Space Holiday as a guest.
The singer's not-quite-acoustic MTV session includes two new songs and collaborations with Common, Mos Def, Damian Marley and Adam Levine.
This is the debut full-length electronic-based album for the Brooklyn duo of Shannon Funchess and producer Bruno Coviello.

recordname: Dark Matter: Moving At The Speed Of Light
description: The legendary DJ and musician's first studio album in four years includes an appearance from Gary Numan.
The sixth full-length release for Alexander Shields was produced and mixed by Misha Hering.

The third full-length studio release for the Maryland rapper is a concept album with themes of race and religion with guest appearances from Black Thought, Big Lenbo, Alessia Cara, Chuck D, Neil deGrasse Tyson, Ansel Elgort, Damian Lemar Hudson, Juicy J, Khalid, Killer Mike, No I.D., and Lucy Rose.

recordname: Where Have You Been All My Life?
description: Recorded live in one day, the fourth full-length release for the indie folk band led by Conor O'Brien re-records some tracks from its previous three albums with new stripped-down arrangements.
The Radiohead drummer worked with Adem Ilhan and Quinta on his second full-length solo release.
The 12th studio release for the singer-songwriter chronicles the past five years, where she overcame challenging moments in her life including divorce, death in the family, and a serious illness.
The compilation contains live, bonus, and collaborations tracks from his 10-plus years of releasing music.
This is the debut LP for Stephen McBean's Black Mountain project, which shares members with Jerk With A Bomb and Pink Mountaintops.
The third album for the alternative-rock band is the first to include the band's new guitarist, Phil Karnats.
The rapper's new album falls somewhere between an official release and a mixtape--his first album following a stint in prison.
Hailing from New York, the experimental rockers release their debut album of electronic, shimmery shoe-gazer rock and dance tracks, comparable to the likes of Cut Copy and New Order.
'Empire' marks the second release for the English dance-rock band.
The latest release for the Jamie Stewart project is a cover album of Nina Simone songs recorded in one day.
The latest album from the singer/songwriter from Kentucky was produced by Eric Bazilian, Rick Chertoff, and Rob Hyman.
This all-covers album includes Smith's takes on songs by Tears For Fears, Stevie Wonder, Nirvana, Paul Simon and Bob Dylan.
The self-produced debut solo release for the Cat's Eyes singer features a guest appearance from TOY.
The fifth full-length release for the solo project for Canadian artist Jamison was recorded and mixed with John Vanderslice.
The fifth full-length release for the indie rock band was produced by Martin Thulin in Mexico City.

The sixth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles alternative rock trio was written in Santa Cruz and includes a cover of The Call's "Let The Day Begin." [Michael Been, the father of lead singer Robert, fronted The Call and passed away in 2010.]
Often compared to Pavement and the Buzzcocks, the London-based quartet release its first full-length debut of lo-fi rock.
Elvis Baskette produces the fourth album for the St. Louis rock band that started out as Big Blue Monkey (an existing blues group by the same name resulted in a name change).
The 11th studio release for the nu-metal band is the first with guitarist Brian "Head" Welch since 2003's Take A Look In The Mirror.

recordname: Adam Ant Is the BlueBlack Hussar In Marrying The Gunner's Daughter
description: The first studio release in 17 years for the British pop singer was produced with Boz Boorer.
The third album for the Norwegian rock duo is its first since 2004's "Riot On An Empty Street."
This is the second LP for the Chicago emo band.
This is album number 19 for Scotland's resident oddball Nick Currie.

This fourth LP for the Los Angeles indie rockers were produced by Jim Fairchild (Grandaddy) and the band's own Aaron Espinoza. The album is dedicated to (and frequently about) the late Elliott Smith, who was Espinoza's neighbor.
The fifth full-length studio release for the boy band is its first without Zayn Malik, who left the group in March 2015.
The debut full-length release for the Atlanta-based artist features guest appearances from Big K.R.I.T. and Tom Morello.
Influenced by a talk he heard by David Lynch, Moby recorded the album at home.
This is the latest album for Randolph Chabot, who had a track on his label's "Adult Swim" album "Ghostly Swim."
The long-delayed debut album for Keri Hilson features Timbaland, Lil Wayne, Keyshia Cole, Ne-Yo, T-Pain, Akon, Lil Jon, and Trina as guest artists.
The Washington, D.C. band's seventh album finds the band in a more political mood, even sampling President Bush (the newer one) on one track.
Mike Patton (Faith No More) returns for his third studio album (which consists of a single, 74-minute song!) with his more experimental outfit Fantomas.
The mercurial singer-songwriter returns with an album of interpretations of 13 traditional Irish songs.
This is the third album for Justin Timberlake & co. But will it be the last?

Much like her 1991 release 'Pop Pop,' this album showcases Jones' vocal talents as she reinterprets an eclectic variety of songs (by everyone from The Beatles and Marvin Gaye to Steely Dan and Gershwin) in her own unique style.
The 11th studio release from the German Krautrock band is said to be an invitation for fans to use the music as " a base on which to build their own music."
The Fall Out Boy singer also wrote and produced this entire debut solo album.
The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Joan As Policewoman & Benjamin Lazar Davis is loosely inspired by the musical patterns of the Central African Republic Pygmies.
The second full-length release for the electronic producer features guest appearances from Clairo, Georgia, Ned Green, Ellie Rowsell, slowthai, Tirzah, and Wolf Alice.

Produced with Don Was and Bob Rock, the album from the Hall of Fame artist features new arrangements of some of his less well known songs as duets with George Benson, Michael Bublé, Natalie Cole, Chris Farlowe, Georgie Fame, Mick Hucknall, Mark Knopfler, Taj Mahal, daughter Shania Morrison, Gregory Porter, P.J. Proby, Mavis Staples, Joss Stone, Clare Teal, Steve Winwood, and Bobby Womack.
The Norwegian band recorded some of this second full-length album in a cave.
The Philadelphia indie pop band Reading Rainbow returns with a new name and two new members: Greg Frantz and Al Creedon.
The sophomore album for the Brooklyn rock band is their first on Frenchkiss Records.

The singer-songwriter returns with her first album of original material in three years, a conceptual work centering on the title character, with its 19 songs divided into six thematic "gardens." Damien Rice guests on one track.
This is the second full-length solo release for the Hot Chip singer/guitarist.
The collection of b-sides and remixes also features Lou Reed on one track.
The latest release for the British drum and bass artist features a guest appearance from José James.
The fifth full-length studio release for the alternative rock band is a concept album about the love story of Mylo Xyloto, set in an alien dystopia.
After four years of being a Brooklyn-based band, the art/music collective formed by Le Tigre's J.D. Samson finally release their debut album of disco punk with a socio-political message.
The season three "The X Factor" winner's first album debuted as the number one album in the UK.
The second release for Turner Prize-winning artist was co-produced with Andy Knowles and Nick McCarthy.

Beseiged by legal problems (he was arrested in Chicago on child pornography-related charges) and rampant bootlegging of an earlier effort ('Loveland') that forced him to abandon that project, Kelly finally returns with a follow-up to 2000's 'TP-2.Com.'
The second album for the Scottish band was produced by Bernard Butler and is the first album with Dino Bardot, who replaced Jamie McMorrow.
The third album for the Wu-Tang Clan member as Bobby Digital features Thea and George Harrison's son as guest artists.
Produced by Richard Swift, the debut release for the indie pop band led by Zach Yudin was influenced by rock of the 1960s and 70s.
This seven-track EP from the Northern California indie pop band led by Justin Vallesteros is a follow-up to its 2011 debut full-length, Idle Labor.

recordname: Don't Act Like You Don't Care
description: Here We Go Magic's Luke Temple releases his third solo album.

The songs on the soundtrack to Dave Grohl's documentary about Sound City Studios (Fleetwood Mac's Rumours, Rage Against The Machine's self-titled debut, Pat Benatar's Crimes of Passion, and Nirvana's Nevermind were recorded there), were composed and recorded with its own 24-hour session using the Neve 8028 recording console from the legendary Los Angeles studio with such artists as Josh Homme, Paul McCartney, Stevie Nicks, Cheap Trick's Rick Nielsen, Trent Reznor, Rick Springfield, Slipknots Corey Taylor, Fear's Lee Ving, members of the Foo Fighters, and surviving members of Nirvana.
The rocker's first album of originals in six years includes the Chevy Trucks themesong "Our Country."
The all-female Scandinavian quartet return with a disc produced by Pelle Gunnerfeldt (The Hives), their third album overall and first for new label RCA.
The third solo album from the former Junior M.A.F.I.A. member utilizes production and vocal contributions from Swizz Beatz, Missy Elliott, Timbaland and Method Man.

recordname: Oxeneers Or The Lion Sleeps When Its Antelope Go
description: The Seattle band (who apparently suffer from either an unusual genetic problem or severe hallucinations) make their full-length debut with this disc.
The fifth full-length album for the Chicago punk rock band was produced by Bill Stevenson and Jason Livermore.
The fourth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based alternative rock band was produced by Jacknife Lee.
The debut release from Planet Mu founder Mike Paradinas and his wife Lara Rix-Martin features Gravenhurst's Nick Talbot on four tracks.
The Birmingham, England group tries to escape the sophmore slump and comparisons to other bands with their second album.
The Los Angeles five-piece--named after a song by the Cure--deliver their debut album of catchy punk rock.
Phil Ek produced the second album for the band (formerly known as Dios) fronted by Joel Morales.
The third album on Jack Johnson's Brushfire label for the Philadelphia trio.
The Los Angeles rock quintet releases its second full-length album produced by Mars Volta's Isaiah "Ikey" Owens.
The fourth studio album for the Georgian-born British singer-songwriter was produced by William Orbit.
The sixth studio release for the nu metal group was co-produced by band members Brad Delson and Mike Shinoda with guest appearances from Page Hamilton, Daron Malakian, Tom Morello, and Rakim.
The sixth full-length studio release for the Canadian indie rock band is its first in three years with another album scheduled for 2016.
The 10th full-length release for the Washington D.C. electronic duo features guest appearances from Lou Lou Ghelichkhani, Shana Halligan, Raquel Jones, Mr. Lif, Elin Melgarejo, Notch, Puma, and Zee.
Recorded in Mexico by Fermin Vasquez Llera, the first release of new material in five years from Rodrigo Sanchez and Gabriela Quinetro was self-produced.
The latest release for British DJ George Evelyn includes influences from funk, hip hop, jazz, reggae, and soul music.
The third full-length release for Alessi Laurent-Marke was produced by Andy LeMaster.
The second electro-pop album from John O'Regan as Diamond Rings was co-produced with Damian Taylor.
This is the second album for the British folk rock band twice nominated for the Ivor Novello award for songwriting.
Scott "Wino" Weinrich, former member of such bands as The Obsessed, Saint Vitus, Spirit Caravan, Place of Skulls, and The Hidden Hand, releases his debut solo album.
The Scottish group returns with its seventh studio album.
Michael's debut album features Wyclef Jean, Lupe Fiasco, Saigon, and Q Tip.
The debut full-length collaboration between The Heat's Charles Hayward and Sonic Youth's Thurston Moore was recorded in an afternoon in London.
The second album for the English indie-rock duo.
The third album for the British indie-rock band was recorded in Berlin.
The Dixie Chicks' Emily Robison and Martie Maguire record a side project as a duo.
The R&B singer's second album is laced with spoken-word interludes. 50 Cent, Lil Jon, and Chamillionaire lend a hand.
The third full-length release for Gabe Fulvimar under the name Gap Dream was recorded over a two year period in California.
The poppy British quartet are joined by a nine-piece orchestra on their sophomore effort.

The third full-length studio release for the Canadian punk rock duo sees Sebastien Grainger and Jesse F. Keeler dropping the 1979 suffix (which was added in 2004 due to a dispute with DFA Records) from the band name.
The all-girl German group's third disc includes collaborations with Peaches and Miss Kittin, plus a remake of the Tom Tom Club's "Wordy Rappinghood."
Ditching the production team (The Matrix) who made her first album a hit, Lavigne turned to fellow Canadians Chantal Kreviazuk and Raine Maida to write and produce this sophomore disc.
The Boston-based singer-songwriter's second studio album features songs written by Nick Saloman (aka the Bevis Frond), as well as covers of Pink Floyd's "Fearless" and Pete Ham's "Baby Blue."
This self-titled disc marks the debut for the quirky Austin/Brooklyn indie-rock trio, whose guitar-keyboard-drums sound is sometimes reminiscent of Spoon.

A veteran of such hip-hop acts as Stetsasonic and Handsome Boy Modeling School and producer of such legendary albums as De La Soul's '3 Feet High and Rising,' Prince Paul returns with his third solo release. Almost a meta-concept album, it is loosely based on Paul's dealings with his (former) record company regarding his previous release, the 1999 concept album 'A Prince Among Thieves.' Among the guests here are Chuck D, Erick Sermon and Ice-T.

recordname: You Can Play These Songs With Chords
description: This collection of B-sides, alternate versions and rarities contains 18 tracks, including an early cover of the Smiths' "This Charming Man."
The first collaboration between singer-songwriter Will Oldham and Chicago instrumental post-rockers Tortoise features 10 covers, including takes on songs by Elton John and Bruce Springsteen.
The Azure Ray singer's second solo set was recorded with Spoon's Jim Eno and Now It's Overhead's Andy LeMaster as well as Memphis producer Doug Easley. Conor Oberst guests.
The sixth studio release for the Canadian folk rock band led by Tony Dekker was partially recorded in Ontarios Tyendinaga Caverns and Caves.
This is the 10th album for the Athens, Georgia, band.
The first full-length album for the British singer-songwriter debuted as number one on the UK album charts. The US version includes three songs not on the UK release.
The posthumous release produced by Mark Hudson features contributions from Jim Keltner, Van Dyke Parks, Jimmy Webb, and Harrys son, Kiefo Nilsson.
The fifth solo release for the Brooklyn rapper features guest appearances by such artists as Marsha Ambrosius, Busta Rhymes, Curren$y, Melanie Fiona, Kendrick Lamar, Miguel, Nelly, and Seu Jorge.
The Scottish rockers fronted by Roddy Woomble reunite with producer Dave Eringa for this follow-up to 2005's 'Warnings/Promises.'
This is the debut full-length release for the Australian psychedelic rock/pop trio led by Jake Webb.
The second full-length solo album for the Interpol frontman is his first under his real name (he released two albums under the name Julian Plenti).
The first solo album for Booker T in 20 years features Neil Young and the Drive-By Truckers.
The buzz band from Adelaide, Australia (notable in part due to their twin-drummer lineup) make their full-length debut with this hard-rocking, psychedelic 10-song effort.
The Scottish band that includes three members of the Beta Band releases its sophomore album.
The third full-length release for the Canadian Juno-award winning band was produced by Dave Schiffman.

recordname: Fifty Shades of Grey [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
description: The soundtrack to the film adaptation of E.L. James' book includes songs from AWOLNATION, Beyonce, Danny Elfman, Skylar Grey, Ellie Goulding, Annie Lennox, Sia, The Vaults, Jesse Ware, The Weeknd, Laura Welsh, as well as classics from Frank Sinatra and the Rolling Stones.
The latest album for the Canadian folk singer-songwriter was produced by Sandro Perri.
The first new solo release in seven years for the Austin singer-songwriter was written in three days.
The Emeralds guitarist releases his second solo album, which includes a nearly 20-minute long track.
The fourth release for the British singer/rapper was written while he was in Australia.
The sophomore album for the London-based band was produced by Danger Mouse.
The third solo release for the System Of A Down singer was self-produced.
The ironic Washington, D.C. post-rockers return with their first album in three years.
The eighth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features an all-female band for songs about 13 women from history (including his mother) and was produced by Catherine Marks.
Produced by Jacknife Lee, the ninth solo album for the British pop singer is his first since 2009's Reality Killed The Video Star.
The indie-pop legends from Glasgow--that had a well-documented influence on Nirvana frontman, Kurt Cobain--keep at it 20 years since their last release with a new album of upbeat alterna-rock.
'Contraband' marks the debut LP for what basically amounts to Scott Weiland (Stone Temple Pilots) fronting Guns N Roses (including Duff McKagan and Slash).

Stephen Street is the producer for the Britpop band's catchy fifth album, their first since singer Brett Anderson's recovery from drug problems. Not surprisingly, it is also happier-sounding than previous Suede efforts.
Jeff Bridges releases the follow-up album to his debut "Be Here Soon" nearly a decade later, which is produced by T-Bone Burnett.

The debut full-length release for the Australian pop-punk quartet includes songs co-written with Yellowcard's Ryan Key, Boys Like Girls' Martin Johnson, All Time Low's Alex Gaskarth, Goldfinger's John Feldmann and Good Charlotte's Benji and Joel Madden.
The EP from the James Mercer and Brian Burton duo includes tracks not released on their self-titled album.
The sixth full-length release for the New York indie pop duo was produced by Max Hart.

recordname: The Breeze: An Appreciation of J.J. Cale
description: The tribute to JJ Cale by Eric Clapton features performances by Mark Knopfler, Christine Lakeland, John Mayer, Willie Nelson, Tom Petty, Derek Trucks, and Don White.
The third studio album for Lisa Marie Presley was produced by T-Bone Burnett and is her first on the Universal Republic label.

recordname: Shiny and Oh So Bright, Vol. 1: No Past. No Future. No Sun
description: Produced by Rick Rubin, the 10th full-length release for the alternative rock band sees the return of original members Jimmy Chamberlin and James Iha, joining remaining members Billy Corgan and Jeff Schroeder.
The fourth album for the singer-songwriter features appearances by Priscilla Ahn, Pieta Brown, James Gadson, Willie Nelson, Lucinda Williams, Iron & Wine's Sam Beam, and Calexico.

recordname: Is That You in the Blue?
description: With Dexter on guitar and his sister Sara on drums, the band releases its sophomore album of blues, jazz, psychobilly ballads, pop songs, and more.

The seventh full-length release for the husband-and-wife duo of Adam Lee Miller and Nicola Kuperus features guest appearances from Robert Aiki Aubrey Lowe, Dorit Chrysler, Light Asylum's Shannon Funchess, Swans' Michael Gira, Nitzer Ebb's Douglas J. McCarthy, and Lun*na Menoh.
This is the third full-length studio album for the rock band from Illinois.

recordname: The Destroyed Room: B-Sides And Rarities
description: Not the most accessible (sound-wise) of Sonic Youth's releases, this 11-track disc compiles some of the least accessible (availability-wise) of the band's obscure recordings, which have been remastered.
Produced with Mike WiLL Made-It, the two-disc release from R&B artist Alicia Keys features piano-based originals and more upbeat versions with drums.

recordname: Anyway You Love, We Know How You Feel
description: The fourth full-length studio release for the blues rock band was self-produced and is its first with new drummer Tony Leone.

The first new solo release for the Scottish artist under his real name in seven years features contributions from De Rosa's Martin John Henry, First Aid Kit drummer Scott Simpson and Beta Band's Gordon Anderson.
This is the second release for the husband and wife team of Keith and Hollie Kenniff.
The latest album for the Grammy-winning artist was produced with Larry Klein.
The man behind the UK hit Is This The Way To Amarillo is back with his latest album which features songs written by Richard Hawley, Jarvis Cocker and the Arctic Monkeys' Alex Turner.
The second album for the Australian rock band was produced by Alan Moulder.
Ryan Hewitt produced the Celtic punk rock band's fifth studio album, which was recorded at a church-turned-recording-studio.
The second album for the Seattle-based indie rock band was produced by Colin Stewart.
The sixth studio album for the Omaha, Nebraska-based indie-rock band.
The rock band reunites (with a new drummer) for a new album.
The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based indie rock band led by Petter Ericson Stakee and Terry Wolfers took three years and three producers to make.

The two-disc tribute album to Paul McCartney songs features such artists as Harry Connick, Jr., Alice Cooper, Roger Daltrey, Def Leppard, Dr. John, Bob Dylan, Barry Gibb, Heart, Billy Joel, Kiss, Jeff Lynne, Steve Miller, Willie Nelson, Corinne Bailey Rae, Smokey Robinson, and Brian Wilson.
The third studio release for the British indie rock band led by Ed Wallis was mixed by Larry Crane.
The seventh release for the British folk artist was recorded in a Cornish church.
The ninth full-length studio release for the punk rock trio was produced by Bill Stevenson and Jason Livermore.
The debut album for the Irish band formed by Neil Hannon and Thomas Walsh was inspired by the game of cricket.
The fourth full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter features a duet with Justin Bieber.
Prince returns with his 24th studio album--but not without a bit of controversy.
The fourth full-length studio release for the London-based pop band features songs co-written by Ed Drewett, Wayne Hector, Jamie Scott, and Ed Sheeran,.
This is the second album for the group led by Bill Doss (formerly of Olivia Tremor Control), which mixes psychedelia and pop.

As the title implies, the metal band is just as, well, angry as ever on their first new studio album since 'Load' and 'Reload' appeared in 1996 and 1997. Just don't try downloading it for free--then you'll see some real anger.
This is the sophomore release for San Francisco's atmospheric noise-pop band led by vocalist Chris Streng, whose previous band shared members with Black Rebel Motorcycle Club.

This is the first album of new material since 1997's 'Ultra' for Depeche Mode, which again sees the band as a trio (consisting of David Gahan, Martin L. Gore, and Andy Fletcher) but also sees them experimenting more with a wider variety of sounds, including acoustic guitar. It is DM's first time in the studio with producer Mark Bell, who has previously worked with Bjork and was a member of the early-90s techno outfit LFO. The lead single from the 13-track album is "Dream On."
The band led by David Gedge releases its latest album, produced by Steve Albini.
Kylie returns after her battle with breast cancer with her latest album.
'Morning' marks the U.S. debut for the Swedish four-piece, who originally formed in 1997.
Joe Chiccarelli produced the Seattle-based rock group's fourth album on new label Dangerbird Records.
This long-overdue second album finds the Montreal band shedding its dark, Joy Division-influenced sound for one that more closely resembles classic rock.

With frontman Liam Gallagher taking the reins sans brother Noel, the debut of the Steve Lillywhite-produced album combines psychedelic rock with Beatles-sounding Brit-pop that shows remnants of early Oasis in it's sound.
The second album for rapper B.o.B. features guest appearances from Morgan Freeman, Taylor Swift, Chris Brown, Lil Wayne, Nicki Minaj, Ryan Tedder, Trey Songz, and T.I.
The debut full-length solo release for the Yeah Yeah Yeahs singer was originally recorded in 2006-07.
After seven years, the final album of his Blueprint series is finally released.
The British electronica duo of Ed Handley and Andy Turner team with visual artist Bob Jaroc for this combination of music and video.
The fourth full-length release for the noise rock band is its first with new drummer Robi Gonzalez.
A reunited Curt Smith and Roland Orzabal return with their first Tears For Fears album together in 15 years.
The first live album for R.E.M. is a recording of the band's Dublin concert in 2005.
The Colorado duo of Andy R. and Craig Nice releases its debut full-length album.
The first release of original material from the multiple Grammy winning singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Sting and was produced with Dave O'Donnell.
The sixth full-length release for the Canadian noise rock trio was produced by Steve Albini.
The debut full-length studio release for British electronic producer James Welch was recorded in four different locations in Berlin.
After a trilogy of mixtapes, the Canadian artist releases his debut studio release that includes a guest appearance from Drake.
The debut release for the hard rock band formed by Thin Lizzy guitarist Scott Gorham with Ricky Warwick, Jimmy DeGrasso, Marco Mendoza, and Damon Johnson was produced by Kevin Shirley.
The seventh release for the band led by Adam Pierce sees the group adding more pop elements to the other music styles heard on previous albums.
Ash singer Tim Wheeler and his singer/songwriter girlfriend, Emmy the Great, wrote this album of Christmas songs after being trapped at an airport by a snowstorm.

recordname: In the Grace of Your Love
description: The New York trio releases their fourth album of dance punk.
This is the debut album for the Brooklyn-based trio.

recordname: A Guide to Love, Loss & Desperation
description: The debut album from the three-piece from Liverpool, England.
The Sacramento duo has transformed into a full five-piece band, fronted by new singer Aaron Ross, for this new LP.
The Wu-Tang star's fourth solo album includes contributions from Ol' Dirty Bastard, RZA, Ginuwine and Raekwon.
Busta is back with 19 new tracks, including collaborations with Mariah Carey, Carl Thomas and The Neptunes.
The British techno pioneer(s) (now down to just one founding member, George Evelyn), return with their first studio album in three years.

Yes, it is a covers album, but with a bit of a twist: all the songs were originally written and performed by men, and Amos has reinterpreted them from a woman's standpoint. This eclectic collection (12 tracks in all) includes versions of Depeche Mode's "Enjoy The Silence," Eminem's "97' Bonnie and Clyde," 10cc's "I'm Not In Love," Neil Young's "Heart Of Gold," Slayer's "Raining Blood," and the Boomtown Rats' "I Don't Like Mondays."
The queen of pop's latest and last release on the Warner Brothers label was produced in part by Nate "Danja" Hills, Timbaland, Justin Timberlake, and Pharrell Williams.
The sophomore album for the English singer.

recordname: The Alchemy Index Vols. I and II: Fire and Water
description: The first of two volumes of EPs produced by their guitarist Teppei Teranishi.
The fifth full-length release for the British indie singer was co-written and produced by Ed Harcourt.
The sophomore album was produced by Tony Hoffer. The British band recently lost its bassist Max Rafferty, who quit earlier this year.
This is the debut full-length release for the San Francisco-based cousins Reese Donohue and Christopher Prudhomme.
The third album for the rapper from California features guest artists such as Common, Ice Cube, Lil Wayne, Ludacris, Nas, Ne-Yo, and Travis Barker.

recordname: From the Hills Below the City
description: The debut release for the folk rock quartet from New Albany, Indiana (near Louisville, Kentucky) was produced by Kevin Ratterman.
The fifth album for the R&B singer features Young Jeezy, will.i.am, Jay-Z, Jermaine Dupri, Beyoncé, and Lil Wayne.
This is the third full-length studio release for the pop rock band led by singer-songwriter/producer Ryan Tedder.
The fifth full-length studio release for the Canadian pop singer features songs co-written with her husband, Chad Kroeger of Nickelback.
The fifth full-length release for the Portland, Oregon indie folk duo was writtened, recorded and produced by The Helio Sequence.
The fourth album for the alternative rock band from San Francisco is its first album since being dropped by Atlantic Records (which had taken over Elektra's roster of bands).
The seventh full-length release for the dance-punk band was produced by Patrick Ford.
The third album for the Brooklyn quartet sees the band turn toward a more pop sound.
Michael Stipe and VW (The Kills) guest on the UK band's first album in three years.
The third full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by Charlie Andrew.
The French duo worked with drummer Joey Waronker on their latest studio album.

recordname: Music to Be Murdered By - Side B (Deluxe Edition)
description: The second surprise release in 2020 from the rapper features guest appearances from Anderson .Paak, DJ Premier, Dr. Dre, Miller Glasgow, Skylar Grey, Juice WRLD, KXNG Crooked, MAJ, Brendan Malloy, Joell Ortiz, Royce Da 5'9", Ed Sheeran, Sly Pyper, Don Toliver, Ty Dolla $ign, White Gold, and Young M.A.
The seven-track mini-album from the noise pop duo of Alexis Krauss and Derek Miller was inspired by Krauss' move to upstate New York.
The neo-soul singer/songwriter/guitarist follows the unexpected mega-success of her 2001 debut 'Acoustic Soul' with this 15-track sophomore effort.

Another eclectic effort from the former Massive Attack member features guest contributions from the likes of Alanis Morrisette, Cyndi Lauper, Ed Kowalcyzk (Live), and members of the Red Hot Chili Peppers.
The English singer-songwriter's latest solo album features four original songs and features Lou Reed on two tracks.
The debut release for the German DJ and producer Marco Niemerski includes vocals from Fiora, Jamie Lidell, MNEK, Stuart Price, and Nile Rodgers.
The second solo LP from Beans features production work from Global Communication's Mark Pritchard.
The noted French DJ and producer returns with his first album since 2000's 'Unreasonable Behaviour.'

recordname: Top Ten Hits of the End of the World
description: Produced by Scott Colburn, the concept album of a compilation release of top hits from ten bands (played by the Brooklyn duo of Taraka and Nimai Larson) who died during an apocalypse on December 21, 2012.
The debut full-length release for the pop singer was produced by Benny Blanco and Passion Pits Michael Angelakos.
The former Bauhaus leader's first collection of new solo material in seven years is his ninth album.
The California alt-metal band returns with its first album in nearly three years.
The debut full-length release for Doherty's latest band was recorded live near a fishing village in France over four days and was produced by Jai Stanley.
The five-track EP from Christopher Dexter Greenspan is his second release as oOoOO.

One of 2004's Next Big Things in the UK music press, Razorlight make their full-length debut with this 13-track disc. Compared to the likes of Oasis and The Libertines, the band is led by self-proclaimed songwriting genius Johnny Borrell.
Adult.'s third LP finds Adam Lee Miller and Nicola Kuperus joined by a new guitarist, Sam Consiglio (Tamion 12 Inch).
The Guided by Voices frontman's latest solo effort balances both noisy rock and melody into a harmonious release.
The fifth full-length studio release for the London artist features contributions from such artists as Blaqstarr, Diplo, and Zayn.
The debut full-length release for the 2016 Brits Critics' Choice award-winner was self-produced.
Mark Kozelek's second SKM album consists entirely of Modest Mouse covers.
The Irish singer-songwriter returns with a second album.
The second full-length studio release for actor/rapper Donald Glover as Childish Gambino features guest appearances from Jhene Aiko, Azealia Banks, and Chance the Rapper.
The fourth full-length studio release for the British post-punk band was produced by Dennis Bovell and Hank Shocklee.
The producer of many albums releases an album of songs from the Sam Shepard musical "The Tooth of Crime: Second Dance."
The fourth release for the folk rock band includes a guest appearance by Anna Calvi.

The newest (and somewhat "pop"-oriented) project from Mike Patton (Faith No More, Fantomas) finds him teamed with an eclectic bunch, including Norah Jones, Massive Attack, Odd Nosdam, Amon Tobin and Kool Keith.
The London band's second album was produced by Jim Abiss and Brendan Lynch.

recordname: Birds In The Trap Sing McKnight
description: The second full-length studio release for the rapper is an Apple exclusive and features contributions from such artists as André 3000, Kid Cudi, Swizz Beatz, Blac Youngsta, Cassie, 21 Savage, Kendrick Lamar, Bryson Tiller, Young Thug, Quavo, The Weeknd, K. Forest and Nav.
The debut full-length release for the lead singer of ...And You Will Know Us By The Trail Of Dead was written partially while on tour and traveling through Cambodia.
The third album from the Oklahoma rock band was produced by Eric Valentine.
One of two April 2006 releases for the former Television guitarist, 'Around' is a 16-track instrumental release.
This double-live album was recorded during a three-night stand at the Fillmore in San Francisco in early 2005.
The fourth album from the Glaswegian rock band is their darkest to date.
This is the debut solo release for former Sebadoh drummer/songwriter Jason Loewenstein. On these 14 tracks, J.Loew handles all instruments and songwriting duties himself.

The singer-songwriter's third album (which comes a full five years after her second, 1997's 'Firecracker') features 12 new tracks, including "We Could Still Belong Together" from the "Legally Blonde" soundtrack.
This is the third album for the Australian rock band, now down to a trio after the departure of bassist Patrick Matthews.
The long-gestating Guns N' Roses album finally sees the light of day.
The second full-length album for the New Zealand singer-songwriter Pip Brown was produced Pascal Gabriel.
The former Destiny's Child singer puts out her third solo effort.
Tricky is a highly acclaimed musician and producer whose eighth album crosses genres by mixing reggae, rap, jazz and rock to blur the lines of definition.
'Continental' is the second solo album for the former Cocteau Twins guitarist.
The debut solo release for the Pretenders lead singer features guest appearances from Neil Young and John McEnroe as well as production from her co-writer, Björn Yttling.
Eric Valentine (Queens Of The Stone Age) produced the emo band's third studio album and major-label debut.
The third full-length album for the Canadian indie rock band was recorded in Paris, France.

recordname: That's Why God Made the Radio
description: The first new album in over 20 years with all of the Beach Boys' original surviving members is produced by Brian Wilson and Mike Love.
This is the second solo album for the Depeche Mode singer.
The third full-length studio release for the Pennsylvania rock band was produced by Will Yip.
The first full-length studio release in nearly 22 years for the Britpop band was recorded by producer Stephen Street.
This is the third full-length release for the dream-pop duo of Greg Hughes and Tessa Murray.
The British singer's latest was produced by Stephen "Tin Tin" Duffy.
The surprise release of the Irish rock band's 13th studio album on iTunes features production from Danger Mouse, Paul Epworth, Flood, and Ryan Tedder. A physical release is scheduled for 14 Oct 2014.
The fourth release for the Las Vegas pop band features production from Daniel Lanois, Steve Lillywhite, Brendan O'Brien, Stuart Price, and Damian Taylor.

The debut release for the prog-rock side project of The Flaming Lips' Steven Drozd and Wayne Coyne with backing by Nashville psychedelic rock band Linear Downfall was produced by David Fridmann & Scott Booker.

The soundtrack to Damon Albarn's opera about Dr. John Dee, a 17th century mathematician, astronomer, and advisor to Queen Elizabeth I, includes influences from West African, modern folk and classical music.
Death Cab for Cutie member and producer releases his debut solo album.
Producer and Beastie Boys collaborator Mark Ramos-Nishita returns with a solo vocal-driven album, his first release in nearly six years (and his first output for Jack Johnson's label).
The alt-country indie-rock band led by Eef Barzelay returns with its long-awaited album, completed back in 2006.
The New York trio is back with their fifth album for Matador (and first since 1998). Here, they work with veteran rock producer Steve Jordan and get some help from Bernie Worrell and Dr. John.
The English electronica duo return with an atmospheric collection of 12 lounge/trip-hop tracks, with vocals provided by Wendy Stubbs, Helen White, and Martin Barnard.

recordname: Halfway Between the Gutter and the Stars
description: The follow-up to 1998's hugely successful 'You've Come A Long Way, Baby' features guest appearances by Macy Gray, Bootsy Collins, and (via sampling) Jim Morrison.
The third full-length release for the pop quartet features a guest appearance from Gucci Mane and is its first since Camila Cabello left at the end of 2016.
The fourth album from the French electro-pop singer-wongwriter was produced by DJ Mr. Flash.
This is the first album since Rob Doran left the group in 2008 as Pit Er Pat continues on as a duo with remaining members Butchy Fuego and Fay Davis-Jeffers.

The cover release from the indie band includes songs with artists they have toured with but not on their own songs including The Baptist Generals, David Thomas Broughton, Clinic, Coldplay, Sharon Van Etten, Folk Implosion, Wye Oak, and Xiu Xiu.
The indie-pop trio from Illinois--making their debut with 'Kindness'--features former members of Maserati and Absinthe Blind.
After five years of working on other projects, including film scores, Underworld returns with their fifth album.
The seventh full-length studio release for the rock band led by Gary Lightbody is its first in seven years and was produced by Jacknife Lee.
The 26th full-length release for the British folk-rock artist is the sequel to his 1975 album, Ommadawn.
The latest solo release from the lead singer of the Ronettes features covers of 1960s British rock songs from such artists as the Animals, the Bee Gees, The Kinks, and the Rolling Stones.
The second full-length release from the solo project of singer-songwriter Jesse Lortz was produced by Greg Ashley and features a guest appearance by Marissa Nadler.
Co-produced with Dan Prothero, this is the eighth release for the Florida blues/funk/soul singer JJ Grey with his band Mofro.
The second release for the Brooklyn-based indie dance trio was co-produced by Le Chec.
The fourth album for the Texas rock band was produced by Joe Barresi.
The second full-length album for the model/actor-turned-singer from San Francisco.
The second full-length solo album for Frog Eyes/Swan Lake's Carey Mercer.
This debut LP for the New York quartet has drawn numerous comparisons to Spoon.
The fourth full-length release for the San Diego duo of Charles Rowell and Brandon Welchez was produced by Sune Rose Wagner of The Raveonettes.
This is the second of two releases from an improvised collaboration between pop and jazz drummer Reid and folktronica artist Hebden (Four Tet, Fridge).
The debut full-length release for the Irish blues-rock band was produced by Chris Thomas.

David Byrne works with Fatboy Slim for his concept album about the life of the former First Lady of the Philippines, Imelda Marcos. The two-disc set includes singers such as Tori Amos, Steve Earle, Sharon Jones, Cyndi Lauper, Natalie Merchant, Allison Moorer, Santigold, St. Vincent, Martha Wainwright, and Florence Welch.
The alternative rock trio's eighth album was produced by Van Rivers and the Subliminal Kid.

The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Serengeti, Son Lux, and Sufjan Stevens (previously known as s/s/s) was commissioned by the Walker Art Center and the Saint Paul Chamber Orchestras Liquid Music series in Minneapolis/St. Paul.

Using material from 1975 to 1993 Bartos created 12 new songs, the latest solo release for the former Kraftwerk member was conceived after techno label Bureau B inquired about archival material he might want to release.
Tore Johansson (Franz Ferdinand) produced this second album for the Chicago power-pop outfit.
This is the debut electronic album for Scottish graphic artist/producer Tom Scholefield as Konx-Om-Pax.
The first release in four years for the indie folk band led by Zach Condon, who found inspiration again with a new girlfriend and spending time in Turkey.
The first new release in five years for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by John Congleton.

recordname: Until The Earth Begins To Part
description: The debut album for the Scottish septet was produced by producer Ian Caple.
?uestlove, Angie Stone and Nile Rogers guest on the 18-year-old soul singer's sophomore effort.
Devo, the New Wave group from Ohio returns with its first album in over 20 years. It not only includes classic Devo but modern dance styles.
The synthesizer is a major component in the first solo album in six years for the German (now London-based) electronic artist.
The follow-up to 2005's "The Emancipation of Mimi" features T-Pain, Damian Marley, and Young Jeezy as guests.
The sixth full-length release for the rap-metal band led by Ice-T features guest appearances from Dave Mustaine, Max Cavalera and Lamb Of God's Randy Blythe
The second full-length studio release for the Alabama rapper features a guest appearance from Eminem.
This big-budget debut album from 22-year-old Detroit-raised rocker Andrew WK took the UK (well, at least its music press) by storm in late 2001.
The debut full-length release for the 2017 BRITs Critics' Choice Award winner Rory Graham was produced by Jonny Coffer, Mark Crew, and Two Inch Punch.
The Los Angeles rock band's latest album introduces new members Be Hussey (bass) and Stevie Treichel (drums).
This is the full-length debut for the somewhat intimidating New York trio, who are frequently compared to Suicide.
After recording two well-received albums of Woody Guthrie covers with Wilco, the anti-folk pioneer returns to recording original material, this time with his touring band, the Blokes.
A collection of previously unreleased Kid Rock tunes and other miscellany, including demos and re-recorded tracks from early in his career.

recordname: Disco and The Half Way To Discontent
description: Clinton consists of the duo behind Cornershop, Ben Ayres and Tjinder Singh. Features the single "People Power In The Disco Hour."
The third album for the German electronica artist.
The ninth full-length release for the New York alternative rock trio was produced by Drew Brown.
The sixth full-length release for the Seattle indie rock band led by Jake Snider is its first without drummer Erin Tate.
The Brighton trio's gloom-and-doom melodies are a mix of post-rock and experimental gothic blues, menacing interludes, and dark, hypnotic vocals.
The second full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by John Leckie.

Released two years after the international breakthrough hit Only by the Night, Come Around Sundown continues Kings of Leon's journey into the upper echelon of mainstream pop/rock, with super-sized choruses and guitar heroics thrown in for good measure.
Britney tries for another comeback with her sixth album, which features 'Womanizer,' her first Billboard Hot 100 number-one single since '...Baby One More Time.'
The third full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Burna Boy, Calvin Harris, Labrinth, Demi Lovato, and Normani.
Nicki Minaj and M.I.A. guest on Madonna's 12th studio album that includes production from Martin Solveig, Benny Benassi, and William Orbit, who also worked on 1998's Ray of Light.
The Montreal band releases its third album on its new label Arts & Crafts.

The latest full-length release for the British trio of Terry Hall, Lynval Golding and Horace Panter features covers of 12 protest songs originally recorded by such artists as Leonard Cohen, Bob Marley, The Staple Singers, Talking Heads, and Frank Zappa.
The first release of new material in nine years for the British hard rocker was produced by Trevor Horn with Greg Kurstin working the boards on two songs.
The second full-length release for the Nickelodeon actress feature guest appearnces from A$AP Ferg, Big Sean, Cashmere Cat, Childish Gambino, Iggy Azalea, The Weeknd, and Zedd.
The 18-track lo-fi debut release for Brighton-based Rose Keeler-Schäffeler includes a remix from R. Stevie Moore.

The debut release for the musican/producer better known for being a member of Massive Attack features vocals from Cate Le Bon, Karima Francis, Emi Green, Low Roar, Sandie Shaw, Claire Tchaikowski and Stephonik Youth.

recordauthor: Someone Still Loves You Boris Yeltsin
description: The latest release for the indie pop band was recorded at the same location as its debut release: the attic of guitarist Will Knauer's parent's house.
This is the debut full-length release for the British electronic duo of Andy Harber and Richard Roberts.
The third release for the Canadian indie pop band led by Mat Klachefsky was produced by Ryan McVeigh.

recordname: Trouble Man: Heavy Is the Head
description: The eighth full-length studio album for the Atlanta rapper includes guest appearances from such artists as Akon, Andre 3000, ASAP Rocky, Cee Lo Green, R. Kelly, Lil Wayne, Meek Mill, and Pink.
This is the second full-length release for the Brooklyn indie pop duo of Paul Hammer and Deidre Muro.
This is the second album for the Brooklyn duo.
The sequel to the rapper's 2004 release "The Hunger for More" features such guests as 50 Cent, Styles P, Raekwon, Tony Yayo, Kanye West, Swizz Beatz, Ryan Leslie, and Fabolous.
The latest album for the singer-songwriter was produced by the Decemberists' Chris Funk.
The duo take a break from their own Ersatz Audio label with this six-song mini-album for Thrill Jockey, which features slightly more human-sounding vocals from Nicola Kuperus.
The first studio album for the band since 1992's "Good Stuff" was produced by Steve Osborne.
The final album in the ¡Uno! ¡Dos! ¡Tré! trilogy for the punk rock band.

recordname: See You On The Other Side
description: The Matrix co-produced the band's first album since 2003.
The latest album for the artist was produced by Rob Cavallo and features such guests as American Idol judge Kara DioGuardi, Queen's Brian May, Steve Val, The Darkness' Justin Hawkins, and Jack Black.
The sophomore album for the indie rock band based in Los Angeles.
The veteran Swedish band's sixth studio album was finally released in the U.S. in September 2006, nearly one year after it first surfaced in Europe.
This is the second release for the Brooklyn indie rock band led by Richie Follin.
The fourth full-length studio release for the Philadelphia-based indie pop band led by Alec Ounsworth features guest appearances from Kid Koala and Matt Berninger from The National.
Seal's first studio album since 2003 includes a duet with his wife Heidi Klum.
The electronia outfit's fifth studio recording features new vocalist Daisy Martey (who replaces Skye Edwards).

The third full-length release for the New York duo of Sarah Barthel and Josh Carter features contributions from Darby Cicci of the Antlers, Matt Chamberlain, Ricky Reed (aka Wallpaper), and Dan Wilson of Semisonic.
The former Take That singer releases his latest solo album produced by Trevor Horn.
The second full-length release for the Michigan rock band was recorded with producer Greg Kurstin.
The surprise release from the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from Anderson.Paak, the late rapper Juice WRLD, Q Tip, and Ed Sheeran.
The latest album for the indie rock band We Are Scientists is its first with ex-Razorlight drummer Andy Burrows.
The first album in eight years for the alternative rock band was self-produced and influenced by their California roots.
The sophomore release for the Strokes guitarist was recorded in five weeks.
The 14th full-length studio release for the British pop rock band features guest appearances from Jonas Bjerre, John Frusciante, Kiesza, Lindsay Lohan, Janelle Monáe, Mr Hudson, and Nile Rodgers.
This is the third album for the Los Angeles punk rock band.
Tim McGraw and Grace Potter guest on the 15th studio album from the country singer.
The fourth solo album for the former frontman of Suede was coproduced with Leo Abrahams.
This is Tom Jenkinson's first new album in two years, and the English electronica artist's tenth disc overall.
The latest album for the Hawaii-born singer-songwriter was self-produced.
The Brooklyn indie poppers releases its sophomore album.
The debut album for the duo of American-born Kacey Underwood and London-native Alice Costelloe was coproduced with Dean Reid.
This is the debut release for Tim Heidecker and Davin Wood, who work together on the TV show Tim and Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!
The fifth album from this Los Angeles-based band is filled with straightforward rock-and-roll anthems.
The second album on Kompakt for the Brazilian electronic music artist/producer.
This is the fourth album for the New Orleans-based trio. It is their first release on indie Beyond Music, after being dropped by Elektra for disappointing sales.

Not an official Wu-Tang Clan album (thus the shorten name), the release produced by Mathematics does feature many of its members with guest appearances by Cappadonna, Ghostface Killah, Hue Hef, Inspektah Deck, Mzee Jones, Killa Priest, Steven Latorre, Masta Killa, Method Man, R-Mean, Raekwon, Redman, RZA, Sean Price, Streetlife, and Swnkah.
The final release for the Vancouver band is its first in six years and features songs written between 2011 and 2014.
The fourth album for the indie rock band features guest appearances by Jana Hunter, Sufjan Stevens, Dawn Smithson, Scot Tuma, and Ero Gray.

The second of a planned trilogy of concept albums from the British electronic group led by James Lavelle features guest appearances from Dhani Harrison, Keaton Henson, Mick Jones, Mark Lanegan, Wil Malone, Miink, Liela Moss, Elliott Power, Philip Sheppard, and the Editors' Tom Smith.
Nigel Godrich, producer to Beck and Radiohead, heads up this debut release with Laura Bettinson, and Joey Waronker.
The first album in 14 years for the Liverpool, England, musicians who are best known in the US for the song If You Leave from the movie Pretty in Pink.
The duo of producer Grahm Zilla and rapper/singer Isis releases their debut full-length album together.
The debut full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Matt Thomson was produced by Catherine Marks.
This is the debut album for the British metal band led by Austin Dickinson, the son of Iron Maiden's Bruce Dickinson.
Recorded in New Orleans prior to Hurricane Katrina, this diverse set finds the singer-songwriter dabbling in everything from gospel to country, and folk to blues-rock.
The California-based indie rock band, which has had more luck in the UK, releases its latest album.
The second studio album for the Maynard James Keenan project was recorded in Arizona.

Formed in Oakland, California by Zach Schwartz, the indie rock band releases its fourth full-length album and its first with Cameron Jasper who replaced Patrick Abernethy (who took over for Evan Farrell when he left the band in 2007) on bass.
The second solo disc from the Old 97s frontman includes contributions from Rachael Yamagata and Jon Brion.
The second full-length solo release from the film director includes a cover of Bob Dylan's "The Ballad of Hollis Brown and a guest appearance from Lykke Li.
The eighth studio release for the Welsh indie rock band was co-produced with Jim Lowe.

recordname: In the Cool of the Day
description: Daniel Martin Moore's latest solo album includes a selection of songs influenced by classic gospel.

recordname: Where Were You When It Happened?
description: This is the debut full-length album for the Israeli rock band.
The Sacramento, Calif. noise-rock duo of Spencer Seim and Zach Hill each claim a disc to themselves on this 2-CD third album.
The latest album from the alt rock group from Scotland was produced in part by Bjorn Yttling.
Rob Schnapf produced album number three for the James Walsh-led band.
Black Alp's bassist Martin Cohen delivers his solo debut of pop music.
This is the full-length release for the French indie experimental pop trio of Fabienne Débarre, Michael Liot, and William Serfass.

The ninth studio release for the metal band led by Max Cavalera is the first with his son Zyon on drums and includes guest appearances from Clutch's Neil Fallon, I Declare War's Jamie Hanks, and Napalm Death's Mitch Harris.
The third full-length release for the duo of John Barrett and Len Clark was produced by Jacob Portrait.
This is the third album for the Utah emo-rockers.
The UK glam-punk band returns with their fourth album.
This is the Denver indie-pop band's first new album since 2000's 'The Discovery of a World Inside the Moone.'
This is the third album for the trio of Pharrell Williams, Chad Hugo, and Shae Haley.

recordname: They Were Wrong, So We Drowned
description: The New York punk outfit moves even further away from the mainstream on this sophomore effort (a concept album about witch trials), which also sees them with a new rhythm section.

Liam and Noel's sixth album is preceded by the single "Lyla." 'Truth,' produced by Dave Sardy, represents the band's second attempt at recording this album; original sessions recorded with Death In Vegas in 2003 were scrapped.
The London-based producer, Alessio Natalizias project is dreamy and symphonic, with trip hop style drum beats and chill-out grooves.
The sixth full-length release for the alternative rock band was produced by Tom Dalgety and is its first with bassist Paz Lenchantin as a full-time member.
The jazz standards release from Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga followed their collaboration on a track off Bennett's 2011 album, Duets II.
Pink and Sly & Robbie guest on the latest Spearhead offering, which was produced by Michael Franti with Mario Caldato Jr. (Beastie Boys) and mixes reggae, hip-hop and R&B.
The third full-length studio release for the British electro-pop artist features production from Com Truise, Patrick Lukens, Ariel Rechtshaid, Jas Shaw of Simian Mobile Disco, and MNDR's Pete Wade.
The fourth album for the artist also known as Savath & Savalas.
After three years, the Stockholm-based band is back with its fourth album of pure dance pop.
The Seattle-based band's debut album was produced with Scott Colburn.
The third album for the British rock group was produced with Jon Brion and Stuart Price.
The sixth studio album for the Los Angeles band was produced by Rick Rubin and Jacknife Lee.
Squeak E. Clean and DJ Zegon team up with a variety of guests on their first album together.
The third full-length release for the punk trio of Rancid's Tim Armstrong, blink-182's Travis Barker, and "Skinhead Rob" Aston, is its first in eight years.
Produced by Tony Hoffer, the Los Angeles six-piece mixes electronic music elements to its 1960s soul on its second full-length release.
The Grammy-winning Los Angeles-based group releases its latest album produced by Tony Berg.
The second album for the singer was produced by Ethan Johns.
George Evelyn's latest dubby, trip-hoppy, downtempo NoW disc was co-produced by Robin Taylor-Firth.
Missy Elliott, will.i.am, Nas, and Stevie Wonder are among the guests on the veteran rapper's first effort in four years.
The third album for the Australian singer known for her work with Zero 7.
The latest full-length release for the folk rock trio is the third installment of their ongoing Gleam series.
This is the second in a series of compilations showcasing the UK grime scene. Included here are artists such as Kano and Plan B.
The fourth full studio album for the multi-platinum superstar features appearances from Obie Trice, 50 Cent, Nate Dogg and D-12.
The sixth full-length release for the indie folk band led by Andy Cabic was produced by Thom Monahan.
Flood and Alan Moulder handled production for the popular Las Vegas band's second album.
Trans Am's Phil Manley releases his first solo album.
The second album for the Los Angeles indie-rock band was produced by Dave Cooley.
The avant-garde Los Angeles band's third album is their first without co-founder Jeff Rosenberg.
The second full-length release for the British electronic singer Ema Jolly includes a cover of Chris Isaak's "Wicked Game."
The Montreal band releases its follow-up to 2007's "Close to Paradise."
The fifth release for the New Zealand psychedelic indie rock band is 80 minutes long.

recordname: Things Go Better With RJ And Al
description: The duo of RJD2 and Blueprint return with a second collaboration.
The third album for Jack Black and Kyle Gass as Tenacious D features Dave Grohl on drums.
The 11th full-length studio release for the alternative rock band led by Rivers Cuomo features production from Jonny Coffer, Toby Gad, J.R. Rotem, and Butch Walker.
The first studio release for the indie rapper in four years features production from Alias, Buck 65, Cecil Otter, and Reanimator.
The Blink-182 drummer releases his debut solo album, featuring collaborations with RZA, Lupe Fiasco, Lil Wayne and others.
The first of six planned albums from Ex-Guided By Voices singer Robert Pollard (and his other side projects) for 2009.
The sophomore release for the band from Leeds was produced by Matt Bayles.
This is the fourth full-length studio album for the indie quartet.
The Barbados-born singer's sixth studio album features guest appearances by Calvin Harris and Jay-Z.
Credited to Neil Young & Crazy Horse (expect electric rather than acoustic), this latest offering by the 57-year-old rocker is a 10-song concept album about the lives of the fictitious Green family.

recordname: The Blueprint 2: The Gift & the Curse
description: A sequel to his critically-acclaimed 2001 album 'The Blueprint,' Jay-Z's new two-disc set is all over the map in the course of 110 minutes and 25 tracks. The roster of producers and guests includes (but is by no means limited to): The Neptunes, Lenny Kravitz, Big Boi, Dr. Dre, Timbaland, Heavy D, Rakim, Beyonce Knowles, Faith Evans, Notorious B.I.G. and Scarface.

The changing dynamics of the relationship between a small town couple when they move to the big city is the concept behind the third full-length release for the British rock band led by Harry McVeigh.
The single "Shut Up and Let Me Go" from the debut album for the British duo was used in an Apple commercial.
Nashville producer Dann Huff helmed Bon Jovi's first album-length stab at country-rock. LeAnn Rimes and Big & Rich guest.
The second release for the New York indie band was produced by Nick Stumpf.
The ninth full-length studio release for the alternative rock band was recorded in Courtney Taylor's basement on cassette before being mixed by Jim Lowe.
The second full-length release for the Seattle artist was recorded in Iceland with producer Alex Somers.
The debut album for the French indie-pop trio based in London, England.
The end of the British artist's four-year relationship was an influence on her fourth full-length release.
The debut full-length album for the Australian folk quartet was produced by Noah Georgeson.

recordname: Careless World: Rise of the Last King
description: The second album for the Compton, California, rapper features guest appearances by Busta Rhymes, Nicki Minaj, Nas, Robin Thicke, and Wale.
This is the debut full-length release from the side project of Fleet Foxes members Christian Wargo and Casey Wescott.
The third album for the indie pop band from Milwaukee (who previously were called Jail) was recorded in the basement of lead singer Vinnie Kircher.
The third full-length release for the Minnesota emo band was produced by lead singer, Erik Paulson.

The first solo release from The Band guitarist since 2011's How To Become Clairvoyant was inspired in part by his work on the score for Martin Scorsese's The Irishman and features contributions from such artists as Doyle Bramhall II, Citizen Cope, Glen Hansard, DJ Howie B, Van Morrison, and Derek Trucks.
The second release for the British electronic duo is an instrumental album inspired by Stanley Kubrick's films.

The debut full-length studio release for Houston hip-hop artist features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Justin Bieber, Chief Keef, Juicy J, Swae Lee, Quavo, Toro y Moi, The Weeknd, Kanye West, and Young Thug.
The third full-length release from indie electronic artist James Chapman was self-recorded.
This is the second full-length release for the Berlin-based Romanian techno producer.
This is the third album for the Carla Bozulich-led project under the name Evangelista.
The third studio release for the rapper features guest appearances by Bun B, Swizz Beatz, Ray J, Nicki Minaj, Pharrell, Wyclef Jean, and Estelle.
The Australian rock band formed by brothers, Joel and Ryan O'Keeffe releases its second full-length studio album.
The third album for the British four-piece group is their first on the Fiction label.
This debut for New York rapper Shawn Mims--which includes his hit single "This Is Why I'm Hot"--was produced by Miami's Blackout Movement.
