The singer wrote many of the songs appearing on 'Mimi,' and even produced one cut, with the remainder of the production duties falling to Jermaine Dupri, the Neptunes and Kanye West. Also appearing are Nelly, Twista and Snoop Dogg.

The Washington D.C.-based production duo of Rob Garza and Eric Hilton are back with their third proper LP, following 2000's 'The Mirror Conspiracy.' Like its predessor, 'Babylon' is a multicultural mix of down-tempo instrumentals and vocal tracks, with Pam Bricker, Lou Lou, Notch, Emiliana Torrini, Sleepy Wonder and Shinehead providing the voices.
Pharrell Williams returns to produce (and also guest on) the rap duo's third album.
The singer's third disc was produced by David Kahne and features an unlikely contribution on bass from Mike Watt (The Minutemen).
The 14th full-length studio release for the industrial metal band led by Al Jourgensen is its first without guitarist Mike Scaccia, who passed away in 2012.
The Seattle indie rock quartet returns with its sophomore disc less than two years after debuting its self-titled album.
The seventh album for the indie rock band.
The fourth full-length release for the British duo was self-produced and recorded in Berlin.
The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles artist Matthew Hemerlein was written and recorded while traveling between his parents house in Maryland, Nashville, Asia, and Europe.
The singer-songwriter's latest album was co-produced with Steve Jordan.
The third full-length solo release for the retro-soul singer features production from DJ Khalil, Theron Feemster, Rock Mafia, and Pharrell Williams.
Despite the title, this is the third album for the young British soul singer. Raphael Saadiq produces, with Lauryn Hill and Common guesting.
The pop-influenced second solo release for the Death from Above 1979 drummer/singer is his first in five years.
This is the full-length debut for the rock band formed by former M83 member Nicolas Fromageau.

The seven-track release from the rapper was streamed live from Wyoming and featured guest appearances from 070 Shake, DeJ Loaf, Jeremih, Kid Cudi, John Legend, Nicki Minaj, PARTYNEXTDOOR, Ty Dolla $ign, Valee and Charlie Wilson.
The legendary band's first studio album since 1982 includes a full version of their mini-opera "Wire & Glass," which was recently released (appropriately enough) as a mini-album.

The eighth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Rich Costey, Mike Elizondo, Shellback, and Timbaland. The deluxe and super deluxe editions feature alternate versions of several of the album's tracks.

The debut full-length release for the Montreal electronic producer features guest appearances from Syv De Blare, Denzel Curry, CJ Flemings, J.K. The Reaper, King Mez, Le1f, Mike Dean, Nell, Sophie, and Speng.
The British heavy metal band releases its latest album, produced with Cameron Webb.
The sixth full-length release from the Canadian folk-pop band led by Mark Andrew Hamilton was produced by Arran Fisher.

recordname: Love Is a Four Letter Word
description: The fourth album from the singer-songwriter was produced by Joe Chiccarelli.

The 14th full-length studio release for the Irish rock band was delayed after recent political changes in the world caused the band to change it from being a planned companion album to the more personal Songs of Innocence to a more political one.

The Violent Femmes' leader emerges with his very first solo release some 20 years after that band's formation. Here, Gano is joined by a star-studded cast that includes John Cale, They Might Be Giants, Mary Lou Lord, Lou Reed, Linda Perry, PJ Harvey and Frank Black.
Sheryl Crow's fourth album features guest appearances from Emmylou Harris, Don Henley, Lenny Kravitz, Liz Phair and Stevie Nicks.
The debut full-length release for Canadian artist features guest appearances from Mick Jenkins and Joey Bada$$.
The veteran "nutty" ska band's first album since their 1999 reunion disc 'Wonderful' is a collection of 13 covers, including their takes on classics "Lola" and "Israelites."
The 14th full-length studio release for the Australian pop artist features influences from country music, with three tracks recorded in Nashville and a guest appearance from Jack Savoretti.
John Leckie produced this second major-label release for the now five-member New York band led by Steve Schiltz.
The third full-length release for the British pop singer features guest appearances from such artists as Craig David, Floating Points, Four Tet, Geeneus, Kaytranada, Major Lazer, and Novelist.
Dave Fridmann produced the acclaimed indie band's second LP, which again is self-released in the U.S.
The second album for the British singer was produced with Kanye West, who also appears as a guest artist.
This is the first Kill Rock Stars release for the Berlin-based pop duo of Francoise Cactus and Brezel Goring.
The first studio release in 20 years for the Los Angeles grunge/punk band was produced by Norm Block and Nick Launay.
The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Carey.
The fourth full-length studio release for the Canadian pop singer features guest appearances from Big Sean, Diplo, Halsey, Travis Scott, and Skrillex.
The debut album for the Santa Barbara-based indie pop band was produced by Richard Swift.
The debut full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper features guest appearances from Diplo, Evander Griiim, Grace, Migos, Stefflon Don, and YG.
J Mascis formed the band in high school with Pete Cougar and Johnny Pancake, however due to unfortunate circumstances they did not record together until reunited in 2011.
The fifth full-length release for the Brooklyn experimental rock band the was self-recorded and produced.
The sixth full-length release for the Australian alternative rock band led by Craig Nicholls was funded through PledgeMusic and co-produced with Paul McKercher.
Ozzy's is a scream heard around the world. The former Black Sabbath frontman returns with his 10th studio album of menacing heavy metal.
The fourth full-length album for the producer-DJ better known to the general public as the creator of the "Mad Men" theme (an edited version of his instrumental track "A Beautiful Mine.").

Although the former Folk Implosion and Sebadoh member has recorded solo discs before under the name Sentridoh, 'Emoh' marks his first release under his own name. It includes six home-recorded tracks as well as eight new studio cuts recorded with producers Mark Nevers, Josh Schwartz and Wally Gagel.
The Brooklyn duo releases its first album under the Social Registry label.

The veteran Manchester band's latest disc was produced by Tore Johansson and John Leckie, and sees touring guitarist Phil Cunningham becoming an official full-time band member, replacing departed keyboardist Gillian Gilbert.
Tim Simenon returned after nearly 15 years to his Bomb The Bass name in 2008 and for his second album, works with Gui Boratto and features vocals from Depeche Mode's Martin Gore.
The rocker's latest solo record is the first for her new label, Ye Olde Records.

Electronica artist and producer Jimmy Tamborello (who is 1/2 of the Postal Service, 1/3 of Figurine, and 1/1 of Dntel) returns with a solo album of minimal techno under yet another name, with Erlend Oye, John Tejada and Jenny Lewis minimally guesting.
The second release for the folk band was produced by Markus Dravs.
Jay Farrar returns to Son Volt to release the band's sixth album.
The fifth full-length release for the Los Angeles alternative rock band was produced by Butch Vig.
This sophomore disc for the Southern California alt-metal outfit was produced by Robert and Dean DeLeo of the Stone Temple Pilots.

This disc compiles tracks from three previously-released EPs by the indie rock trio, who originally got their start composing music for NPR's "This American Life." Also included are three brand-new tracks.
Jamaican dancehall artist Beenie Man returns with a bid for crossover stardom, utilizing hip-hop producers such as The Neptunes, and even dueting with Janet Jackson on one track.
This is the fourth long-player for Gavin Rossdale and Bush, and was produced by Dave Sardie (Slayer, Marilyn Manson).
The second full-length release for the Detroit electronic pop duo was produced with Ben West.
Produced by Tom Biller, the third full-length release for the British singer moves toward an indie rock direction.
Singer-songwriter Ben Folds and English novelist Nick Hornby collaborate to create an album featuring the piano compositions and musical arrangements of Folds and the words of Hornby.
Mark Batson produced the third album for the Vermont-based rock group. It is the first with new members, Catherine Popper and Benny Yurco.
The fourth full-length release for the British rock band led by Justin Hawkins was produced by guitarist Dan Hawkins.
The seventh full-length studio release for the pop-punk band was produced by John Feldmann and is the first with Alkaline Trio's Matt Skiba, who replaced Tom DeLonge.
This is the debut album for the son of gospel singer Chris Falson.
The second studio album for the rock band from Utah was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.
The star of "High School Musical" releases her latest album, produced in part by JR Rotem, Dr. Luke, Tim James, and Antonina Armato.
A bit more rock-oriented than its predecessor, 'Acetate' is nevertheless another experimental effort from the now-63-year-old Cale.
The pop singer-songwriter covers country songs for her 11th full-length studio release with guest appearances from Vince Gill, Emmylou Harris, Jewel, Alison Krauss, and Willie Nelson.

The first Chic album in over 25 years features guest appearances from Cosha, Craig David, Danny L Harle, Lady Gaga, LunchMoney Lewis, Vic Mensa, Mura Masa, NAO, Philippe Saisse, Emeli Sandé, Hailee Steinfeld, and Stefflon Don.
The seventh full-length release for the Brooklyn post-punk band was recorded with Travis Harrison.
The roster of guests for the turntablists' fourth LP includes Cypress Hill, dead prez, Ghostface Killah, Black Thought (The Roots), Slug (Atmosphere) and Blue Man Group.

This U.S. debut disc for the genre-mashing Australian brother-sister duo of Chris and Vila Colonna (who appended the "81" to their name to avoid conflicts with a similarly-named children's music band) combines tracks from their EP "White Printz" and their UK single "Red Printz."
Album number five finds the singer-songwriter seemingly entering an early mid-life crisis, as she dives headfirst into commercial teen-dance-pop territory.

The fourth album from Jakob Dylan & Co. includes lead single "When You're on Top" and a bonus cover of Elvis Costello's "(What's So Funny 'bout) Peace, Love & Understanding." Long-time guitarist Michael Ward has left the group, leaving room for Pearl Jam's Mike McCready to provide some of the lead guitar on the album.

The third U.S. release for the eclectic Amsterdam-based duo (following 2001's import-only release 'Sound Shopping') contains 14 equally eclectic tunes, including highlights "Dirty Robot" and "5th Dimension."

The collaboration project from Lil Wayne features Drake, Guycci Mane, Lloyd, Tyga, Shanell, Birdman, Shawt Dawg, Nicki Minaj, T-Streets, Lil' Chuckee, Lil' Twist, Jae Millz, Gudda Gudda, and Mack Maine.
Te second full-length release for the Irish singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Mavis Staples.
The second full-length release for the British indie pop trio was produced by Brian O'Shaughnessy.
The debut full-length release for the punk trio of brothers from Missouri was produced by Ross Orton.
This is the second release for the British rock band led by Simon Critten.
The second studio album from the Canadian vocalist features Justin Bieber and Owl City.

You wouldn't know it from their album covers, or their music, but this indie-rock four-piece hails from Athens, Georgia, not Tokyo. 'Tomorrow' is their third full-length and first in five years (four, if you include their collaboration with Bedhead).
The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was funded from a Kickstarter campaign.
The fourth full-length release for Atlanta-based chillwave producer Ernest Greene was mixed by Ben H. Allen.
The fourth full-length album for the New York City-based band features reworkings of some of its previously released songs.
Joe Henry returns as producer for the second jazz/blues release for actor-singer Hugh Laurie.

In 2008, Maroon 5 released a remix album with the help of several different DJs and producers. The group then spent most of the following two years working with a different producer -- famous rock/country-pop architect Robert John "Mutt" Lange -- on Hands All Over, which marked the band's third studio offering of rhythmic, soulful pop songs.

The Canadian punk-pop outfit returns with a fourth LP, produced by Greig Nori. The disc is named after a UN worker (Chuck Pelletier) who helped the band escape violence in the Congo while they were there shooting a film.
The duo of Prodigy and Havoc are assisted by guests such as 50 Cent, Nate Dogg, R. Kelly, Jadakiss and Nelly on this disc co-produced by The Alchemist.
This debut disc for the South London, England quartet (originally released in the UK in 2003) was produced by Victor Van Vugt (Beth Orton) and gained a Mercury Music Prize nomination.
On her sixth studio album, the singer-songwriter works with producer John Parish (PJ Harvey) for the first time.
The latest album for the Grammy-winning singer-songwriter features Vince Gill and Alison Krauss as guest singers.
The Editors lead singer Tom Smith and former Razorlight drummer Andy Burrows team up to release an album of classic and original Christmas songs.

recordname: Here We Go Again: Celebrating the Genius of Ray Charles
description: Willie Nelson and Wynton Marsalis return to work together on this Ray Charles tribute with Norah Jones recorded in February 2009 at the Rose Theater.
The ninth album for the quartet from Pittsburg, Pa., was produced by Tony Visconti.
The second full-length release for the Brooklyn trio-turned duo of Isaac Emmanuel and Melati Malaywas was recorded while on tour.
With new drummer Leah Shapiro (who replaced Nick Jago), the rock band from San Francisco works to mix its rock side with the country/acoustic sound it revealed in 2005's Howl.
The latest album for the Bay area hip-hop artist features guest appearances by Lateet, Sam Sparro, Joyo Velarde, Trackademicks, Clyde Carson, The Gift, and Francis and the Lights.
Interpol's Paul Banks releases his debut solo album under the name Julian Plenti.

The second artist album from the acclaimed DJ and producer (Amy Winehouse, Lily Allen) is filled with covers, as Ronson takes on works by artists as diverse as Radiohead, The Smiths, Britney Spears, Coldplay and Ryan Adams. Both Winehouse and Allen guest, along with Robbie Williams, Phantom Planet and Kasabian.
This is the fourth LP for the underground rap trio of Evidence, Rakaa and DJ Babu.
Ren Harvieu is the latest British singer to release a debut album influenced by the sounds of the 1960s.
Vampire Weekend's Rostam Batmanglij and Ra Ra Riot's Wes Miles team up to release their first album together.
This is the singer's first album in three years.
The fourth album for the rock band from Tennessee was produced by Angelo Petraglia and Jacquire King.
Before the October 12th release of Sufjan Steven's full length album The Age of Adz, the artist released this eight-track EP as a digital download.
Drugs, murder, and abusive relationships are some of the dark subjects of the second full-length release from the British band.
The members of Black Sabbath (without Ozzy Osboune) return as Heaven & Hell to release its first album under the name.
The California rock band releases their 10th album produced by Rick Rubin and the first since 2006 and with new guitarist Josh Klinghoffer, who replaced John Frusciante.
The third full-length studio release for the Swedish rapper was recorded in Miami and was produced by Yung Gud, Yung Sherman and White Armour.

recordname: Say Yes!: A Tribute to Elliott Smith
description: The latest tribute release to the singer-songwriter features covers of his songs by such artists as Julien Baker, Lou Barlow, Tanya Donelly, William Fitzsimmons, Swervedriver's Adam Franklin, Juliana Hatfield, Jesu/Sun Kil Moon, J. Mascis, Amanda Palmer, Wild Sun, Waxahatchee, and Yuck.
The British indie rock band returns as a trio for its second studio release after lead singer Daniel Blumberg left the band to pursue his own music.
The seventh full-length release for the Portland, Oregon-based experimental folk band is its first on the Vagrant label.
'Curse' marks the eighth studio album for Deborah Harry & co., and their first since their 1999 comeback effort 'No Exit.'
Former Sunny Day Real Estate members Jeremy Enigk, William Goldsmith and Nate Mendel make their debut as The Fire Theft with this 13-track disc, co-produced by Brad Wood.

Who is Lamya? Born in Africa, educated in England, and later residing in the U.S., she is a classically-trained opera singer who embarked on a pop career, first serving as lead vocalist for Soul II Soul and later as a backup singer for Duran Duran and David Bowie. For this solo debut, she wrote, produced, and composed each of the 12 tracks.
The duo's fourth album departs from previous outings, taking an all-instrumental (and guitar-free) approach rather than relying on guest vocalists. Think Kraftwerk and you won't be too far off.
The fourth full-length studio release for the indie choral pop band Tim DeLaughter was co-produced with Eric Drew Feldman and Tim Palmer.
The debut album for the Guillemots singer-songwriter was produced by Adam Noble .
Rilo Kiley's Blake Sennett returns with a sophomore set for his side project, The Elected. Contributors include members of Eisley and Bright Eyes, as well as Rilo Kiley bandmate Jenny Lewis.
Apparently no longer trapped in the closet, the crooner enlists Young Jeezy, Snoop Dogg, Ludacris and T.I. to help enliven this upbeat successor to 2005's 'TP.3 Reloaded.'
The sophomore album for the rock band started by Something Corporate's Andrew McMahon.
Christina Aguilera, Chris Brown, Enrique Iglesias, Jennifer Lopez, The Wanted, and Usher are some of the guests on the seventh studio album for the Miami rapper.
Eminem continues his forward momentum with confrontational, angst-ridden rap that digs deep into the psyche on his new album.
'Stand Up' is the band's first studio album in three years and finds them working for the first time with producer Mark Baston (50 Cent, Beyonce).
The ninth full-length studio release for the Welsh alternative rock band led by Kelly Jones was produced with Jim Lowe.
The second album for the Scottish rock band was produced by Ross Robinson.
Album number six is the first new release in four years for the shock-rocker, who recorded the disc with guitarist Tim Skold.
The first album for the R&B group in 15 years features the two surviving members: Tionne T-Boz Watkins and Rozonda Chilli Thomas, and a guest appearance from Snoop Dogg.
The sixth full-length studio release for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Jhené Aiko, Akon, Brandy, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne R. Kelly, Rick Ross, Trey Songz, Tyga, and Usher.
The fifth album is split in two parts, with one half produced by Gil Norton and the other half by Brian Deck.
L(ucky) Pierre is the alter-ego of former Arab Strap member Aidan Moffat, and the cinematic, instrumental 'Dip' was recorded shortly before that band's breakup.

recordname: Be As You Are (Songs From An Old Blue Chair)
description: The country singer's latest is a bit of a departure, taking the form of a concept album about, well, relaxing on a Caribbean beach.
Matt Bayles produced the concept album for the rock band led by Tim Kasher, about two twins, one evil and the other good, who are separated at birth and reunited.
Nick Raskulinecz produced the third album for the rock band that sees only singer Amy Lee as the remaining original member.

Continually redefining herself in the realm of folk-pop singer/songwriters, McLachlan's latest delivery after seven years is filled with thoughtful lyrics and impassioned vocal harmonies, making the album worth the wait.
The sophomore album for the Brazilian indie-rock band was produced by band member Adriano Cintra.
The third solo release for Los Angeles producer Jason Chung features guest appearances from Chance the Rapper, Maceo Haymes, and Whoarei.
Zooey Deschanel and M. Ward reunite for a Christmas album of classic chestnuts and a few new holiday songs.
The third album for the Australian features guest vocals by The Prodigy's Liam Howlett, Porcupine Tree's Steve Wilson, and the band In Flames.
This self-proclaimed masterpiece from the veteran rapper features production work from The Neptunes. Other guests include Nelly, Bootsy Collins, and those old hip-hop standbys, The Bee Gees.
Still going strong 15 years and 13 albums into her career (and that's not including live recordings or other compilations), Ani DiFranco returns with 12 new tracks backed by a five-piece band.

recordname: The Plain Where the Palace Stood
description: Andrea Belfi, Stefano Pilia, and C. Spencer Yeh backed the indie singer-songwriter on his sixth solo release.
The music on the latest release from the German producer was originally created with Thomas Muller for a dance performance in 2011.
This is the debut release for the Sydney-based duo of Leo Holiday and Ryan Grieve.

recordname: Peter Gabriel Tribute Album: And I'll Scratch Yours
description: The companion album to Peter Gabriel's Scratch My Back features cover songs by artists he had covered on that 2010 release.
The solo debut release from the Belle and Sebastian guitarist shows influences from 1960's pop music.
The second album for the Grammy-winning country trio was produced by Paul Worley.

The first full-length solo release for the Rage Against The Machine, Audioslave and Prophets of Rage member under his name features guest appearances from Steve Aoki, Bassnectar, Big Boi, Gary Clark Jr., K.Flay, GZA, Leikeli47, Killer Mike, Knife Party, Vic Mensa, Tim McIlrath, Marcus Mumford, Portugal. The Man, Pretty Lights, Carl Restivo, RZA, Nico Stadi, and Whethan.
The sixth solo release for the Wu-Tang Clan rapper features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, A$AP Rocky, Assassin, Busta Rhymes, Estelle, Ghostface Killah, Liz Rodrigues, Rich Ross, and Snoop Dogg.
The third full-length solo studio release for the ex-One Direction singer features guest appearances from Syd (of The Internet) and Deviln.
The actor known for his work in Twin Peaks: The Return, Get Out and Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri, releases his debut full-length album produced by Nic Jodoin.
The sixth full-length release for the California psych folk band led by Dawn McCarthy and Nils Frykdahl is their first in six years.
The third album for the British rock band was produced by Stephen Street.
The fifth album for the British pop group debuted at number one on the British Album chart.
This is the second release for the Stereolab side project featuring Laetitia Sadier.
The latest album for the electronic DJ/producer from Chicago was recorded in Belgium.
The second full-length solo release for the ex-One Direction member is said to includes songs about heartbreak from all points of view.
The seventh studio release for the pop singer features a guest appearance from John Legend.
Taking a break from his usual rap and metal musical hybrid style, Kid Rock's latest album is influenced by country-rock and blues, featuring collaborations with Zac Brown, Sheryl Crow, and others.
Sting's daughter releases her debut album with her band I Blame Coco.
The third album for the dancer-turned-diva includes contributions from Sean Paul and Missy Elliott and contains a cover of Tom Petty's "Free Fallin'."
The second full-length release for the Brooklyn duo of Jesse Cohen and Eric Emm was co-produced with Chris Taylor.
The debut full-length release for the North Carolina electronic producer features guest appearances from Breanne Düren, Imaginary Cities, Lemaitre, Amy Millan, and Urban Cone.
Don Gilmore produced the third album for the Welsh heavy-metal band.
Mike Skinner has said this fourth album would be his second-to-last album as The Streets.
Reggae and pop come together on the debut release from the Chicago-based brother-and-sister duo of Natalie and Elliot Bergman.
The fifth studio album for Garbage is its first release in over seven years.
The first album of original songs written by the British rock singer was inspired after completing and publishing his autobiography in 2012.

recordauthor: And So I Watch You from Afar
description: This is the fourth full-length release for the Belfast post-rock quartet.
The first studio release for the rapper/actor since 2010 features guest appearances from Jason Aldean, Big K.R.I.T., CeeLo Green, John Legend, Miguel, Monica, Rick Ross, and Usher.
This is the 30th studio release for the British post-punk band led by Mark E. Smith.
After scrapping some previous tracks, the electronic duo sat down and finished fourteen fresh tracks in six months for the band's first release in five years.
The English band continues without Skye Edwards, who was asked to leave the group, with several artists taking turns on lead vocals.
Nigel Godrich produced this latest set from the French duo, who are joined by guest vocalists Jarvis Cocker (Pulp) and Neil Hannon (Divine Comedy).
The dozen tracks (ten written by Knopfler, two by Harris) on the pair's first collaboration were recorded over a seven-year span.

Continually redefining herself in the realm of folk-pop singer/songwriters, McLachlan's latest delivery after seven years is filled with thoughtful lyrics and impassioned vocal harmonies, making the album worth the wait.

recordname: The Great Gatsby [Music from Baz Luhrmann's Film]
description: Overseen by Jay-Z, the soundtrack to Baz Luhrmann's adaptation of F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel features original songs from Fergie, Florence and the Machine, Gotye, Jay-Z, Nero, Sia, will.i.am, and The xx. It also includes covers of Amy Winehouse's "Back To Black" performed by Beyoncé and Andre 3000; Lana Del Rey's "Young and Beautiful" performed by Bryan Ferry; Beyoncé's "Crazy In Love" performed by Emeli Sandé; and "U2's "Love IS Blindness" performed by Jack White.

The second solo release for the Seattle rapper features guest appearances from Abir, Dan Caplen, Dave B, Skylar Grey, Kesha, King Draino, Lil Yachty, Donna Missal, Eric Nally, Offset, Reignwolf, Saint Claire, Otieno Terry, Travis Thompson, and Xperience.
Covers of John Martyn's Fairytale Lullaby and Joanna Newsom's Swansea are included in the British band's acoustic second album.
Oklahoma's Toby Keith returns with 12 new tracks, including a duet with Willie Nelson.
Former Stone Roses frontman Ian Brown returns with his third solo album, following 2000's 'Golden Greats.' The first single is "F.E.A.R."

recordname: Maybach Music Group Presents: Self Made, Vol. 1
description: The debut release from Rick Ross' new label features Meek Mill, Pill, Teedra Moses, and Wale.
The sixth release for the British singer-songwriter Mike Rosenberg was produced by Chris Vallejo.
This is the solo debut for former Destiny's Child member Beyonce Knowles.
Released on Tidal, the surprise album features songs he recorded in analog over a period of four years. [CD release: 29 Jan 2016]
The Canadian band that began as a solo project for Matthew Hart releases its fourth full length album.
The fifth studio album for the Swedish rock band was produced by Rick Rubin.
The second full-length release for the Icelandic folk rock band was produced with Rich Costey.
This is the third full-length release for the Brooklyn self-described transcendental black metal quartet.
This is the debut solo release for the solo electronic pop project of Thee Oh Sees' John Dwyer.
The Canadian electronic producer admitted on Twitter he had a love/hate thing for his eighth full-length studio release that features a guest appearance from Grabbitz.
The fifth album for the Dutch metal band was released in conjunction with a comic book and short films that illustrate the story within the concept album.
The follow-up to the band's gold album "St. Jude" was produced by Ed Buller.
This debut LP for the Liverpool band was released in the U.K. in early 2004 and made its way to the States a year later.

'Strangest Things' is the second album, and first for a major label, for Longwave, who got their big break opening for fellow New Yorkers the Strokes (although their sound veers much closer to that of 80s-influenced Interpol than the neo-garage of the Strokes). Dave Fridmann produces.
Album number two for the stadium-friendly, piano-led British trio follows two years after the unexpected mega-success of their debut 'Hopes And Fears.'
This is the eighth full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band led by Murray Lightburn and Natalia Yanchak.
The sophomore album for the American Idol winner was produced by Ryan Tedder.
This five-song EP represents the first new studio material for the once prolific English band in two years (and first since the death of longtime member Mary Hansen). A new LP awaits in early 2004.
This debut album for the British quartet was produced by The Smiths' Johnny Marr.

Brooklyn underground rappers the Arsonists are back with their self-produced second album, following their 1999 debut "As The World Burns," which was also on indie-rock label Matador. The group is now a trio, following the departures of Freestyle and D-Story.
The Chicago group's fourth full-length was produced by John Herndon (Tortoise, Isotope 217).
The rock band formed by two (barely) teenaged siblings releases its second album.
The debut release for the supergroup includes Ben Harper, Joseph Arthur, and George Harrison's son, Dhani Harrison, as well as nine acoustic tracks.

The pop-soul singer and since 2011, vocal coach/judge on NBC's The Voice releases a Christmas album featuring Christina Aguilera, The Muppets, Straight No Chaser, Rod Stewart, and Trombone Shorty as guest singers.
The latest album for the electronic artist includes an appearance by MC Grandmaster Caz of "Rapper's Delight" fame.
The debut collaboration between Todd Rundgren, Hans-Peter Lindstrom and Emil Nikolaisen was recorded in Norway.
Produced by Zombie himself, Hellbilly Deluxe 2 is a follow-up to his 1998 debut solo effort called Hellbilly Deluxe.
The Canadian singer releases her latest album, produced by Guy Sigsworth.
The third album for the rock band was produced by Phil Ek.
The Swedish power-pop band's fourth album includes a remixed version of "Jerk It Out," better known as "that song in the iPod Shuffle commercial."
The seventh full-length studio release for the British alternative rock band was produced with Robert John "Mutt" Lange.
Siblings Matt and Eleanor Friedberger are joined by their 83-year-old grandmother (!) on their latest eclectic release.
The follow-up to 2015's Vol. 1 for the Montreal band was from the same recorded session as the previous album.
Portico Quartet becomes a trio named Portico on this release that features guest appearances from Alt-J's Joe Newman, Jono McCleery and Jamie Woon.
The debut release for the Nashville-via-Brooklyn five-piece band led by Keegan DeWitt was self-released in the UK in 2012.
The second solo album from Slash features Myles Kennedy of Alter Bridge on vocals and was produced by Eric Valentine.
The Los Angeles rapper's latest album is his first on FakeFour Inc. and is self-described as avant-garde.
The London-based duo completed its second album after the death of its bassist.
The country crooner, and judge/coach on NBC's The Voice, releases his latest album.
Following the unexpected death of drummer Jimmy Sullivan, the metal band's latest release is a reflection on death and despair that fits the menacing mood, which has shaped its sound over the years.
The fourth album for the British rock band was produced by Steven Osbourne.

recordname: Walking Cloud And Deep Red Sky, Flag Fluttered And The Sun Shined
description: This third album from the Japanese instrumental post-rock outfit was recorded by Steve Albini.
The latest release from the prolific indie-rocker and artist was recorded with Sparklehorse's Mark Linkous.
This second album for the Manchester (by way of Germay) electronica/Krautrock duo features guest vocals from Brian Molko (Placebo).
This is the third (non-soundtrack) solo album for the Dire Straits leader, and finds him in a somewhat acoustic, American roots style.
The fifth full-length studio release for the New Jersey rock band was produced by Mike Crossey.
Yelawolf's debut album on Eminem's record label features Kid Rock, Gangsta Boo, and Lil John.
The second release for the Northern Irish indie rock trio was produced by Jacknife Lee.
Eric Clapton, Stevie Wonder, and Diana Krall contributed to Paul McCartney's collection of classic vocal standards produced by Tommy LiPuma.
The Omaha, Nebraska indie pop band returns with a more rock oriented sound for its fourth release.
The fourth album for the alternative rock band from Oklahoma was produced by Greg Wells.
Vincent Frank's debut album was coproduced with Stuart Price.
The third full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter features songs co-written with such artists as Steve Mac, Ryan Tedder and Jessie Ware.

Following acclaimed, sample-driven efforts 'Endtroducing' and 'The Private Press,' 'The Outsider' detours DJ Shadow into more conventional hip-hop, with rappers such as David Banner and Q-Tip guesting.
The latest full-length release for the electronic artist features contributions from Apollo Jane, Boogie, Mindy Jones, Linton Kwesi Johnson, and Dead Kennedys drummer D.H. Peligro.
Sebastien Grainger, the Ex-Death from Above 1979 singer/drummer, releases his debut solo album.

N.E.R.D.'s fourth album takes a new direction by adding psychedelic rock influences to their mad-scientist mix of hip-hop, along with the addition of a new female vocalist to the original Virginia trio.
The second full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Felix Bush was produced by Neil Comber and features a guest appearance by Wolf Alice's Ellie Rowsell.

DJ Khaled's sixth album features appearances from 2 Chainz, Ace Hood, Big K.R.I.T., Big Sean, Birdman, Chris Brown, J. Cole, DJ Premier, French Montana, Future, Jadakiss, Kirko Bangz, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne, Mack Maine, Mavado, Meek Mill, Nicki Minaj, Nas, Plies, Rick Ross, Scarface, T.I., T-Pain, Tyga, Wale, Kanye West, and Wiz Khalifa.
The first album of new material in more than 15 years in the US for the Welsh singer was produced by Future Cut.
Yellowcard's follow-up to 2006's "Lights and Sounds," again produced by Neal Avron.
Nope, it's neither of those things. The anticon rapper's third LP is a studio recording from the East Bay, with Odd Nosdam providing the beats.

After releasing Planet Earth for free in the United Kingdom, the singer-songwriter's three albums (one by new artist Bria Valente) are packaged together as a Target store exclusive in the United States. As the title implies, it contains some of the funk rock sounds he created.
This is the debut full-length album for the British indie pop quintet.
The surprise release from the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from Joyner Lucas, Jessie Reyez, Royce 5'9", and Def Jam Records president Paul Rosenberg.
The debut album for the Seattle folk rock band was self-released in June 2010 before Sub Pop rereleased a remastered version in 2011.
After the loss of two members, the Las Vegas-based rock duo returns with its third studio album of rough-edged emo pop.
The seventh album for the artist was produced by Dennis Herring.
The second full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Rich Cooper.
The seventh full-length studio release for the rock band was produced by Markus Dravs.
The third full-length studio release for the psychedelic rock band was produced with Dave Fridmann
The fourth full-length studio release for the R&B singer features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Beyonce, Big Sean, Mary J. Blige, Gary Clark Jr., Fabolous, Jay-Z, Pusha T, and Kelly Rowland.
The second full-length release for the British indie-pop band was recorded in Los Angeles with Rich Costey.
The fifth album for the group features world-music artists Femi Kuti, Seu Jorge, Anushka Shankar, and Jana Andevska.

recordname: Nightfreak And The Sons Of Becker [EP]
description: This limited edtion 11-song low-fi mini-album was recorded with producer Ian Broudie over the course of a week.
Mars Volta's Omar Rodriguez Lopez releases his first Spanish-only solo album.
The sixth album for the London-based rock trio was produced by Dave Bottrill and is the band's first album with new drummer, Steve Forrest (original drummer Steve Hewitt parted company in 2007).
The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from P!nk.
This New York indie-rockers return with a follow-up to 2005's 'Collisions.'
The rock trio led by Jess Scott releases its debut album.
Known for being Brooklyn-based party starters, Matt & Kim have infused their new album with club beats, pop, and disco-punk to create a dynamic dance party sound.
The band's sophomore disc includes guest appearances by Wilco and Scott McCaughey (Minus 5).
Guests on the Rolling Stones frontman's fourth solo album include Bono, Lenny Kravitz, Wyclef Jean, Pete Townshend, Rob Thomas, and Joe Perry.
The Los Angeles-based funk-metal band returns with a follow-up to 1999's 'Make Yourself.' Scott Litt (R.E.M.) returns as producer.
The EP contains six songs from the "Jukebox" recording sessions.
The debut full-length studio album for the Chicago rapper includes guest appearances from such artist as 50 Cent, French Montana, Lil Reese, Rick Ross, Wiz Khalifa, and Young Jeezy.
The British noise-rock band had artists as Andy Bell, Factory Floor, Hookworms and Mogwai's Stuart Braithwaite remix its 2015 debut release, Dying.
The first American Idol winner returns with her fifth album.
Film director David Lynch releases a solo album of electro-pop featuring Karen O of the Yeah Yeah Yeahs as a guest singer on one track.
The Portland art rockers release their latest album of improvisational, experimental space-y jams.
Jeremy Lemos worked on the third album for the Denmark band.
The full-length debut for the New York singer features the single Video Games, which appeared on the CW TV series Ringer.
This is the latest album for the British post-punk band led by Mark E. Smith.
This is the debut full-length album for the Brooklyn-based band led by Kyle Wilson.
The Italian goth-metal outfit fronted by Cristina Scabbia attempts to make it big in the U.S. with this fourth album.
The second full-length album for the Athens, Georgia-based alternative rock band was produced by John Agnello and features Dinosaur Jr.'s J. Mascis as a guest artist.
The Arizona country singer releases his fourth studio album with Capitol Nashville.
Disc #2 for the Irish band was produced by Dave Sardy (Marilyn Manson), with Peter Buck and Van Dyke Parks helping on a track apiece.
This is the full-length debut for the new duo of Death From Above 1979's Jesse Keeler and that band's producer, Al-P.

The Latin tribute album to Creedence Clearwater Revival features songs covered by such artists as Enrique Bunbury, Andres Calamaro, El Tri, Juan Gabriel, Los Lobos, Los Lonely Boys, Ozomatli, ZZ Top's Billy Gibbons and La Santa Cecilia's La Marisol.

The hip hop artist's first studio release since 2002's Eve-Olution includes guest appearances from Missy Elliott, Juicy J, Chrisette Michele, Pusha T, Dawn Richard, and Gabe Saporta from Cobra Starship.

recordname: From the Top of Willamette Mountain
description: The third release for the folk singer was produced by Richard Swift.
This is the first Christmas album for the singer and proceeds will be donated to the charities, Feeding America, The World Food Programme, and Crisis UK.
The soul singer's first album in four years includes production work from will.i.am and Justin Timberlake and appearances by Fergie, Nas and Natalie Cole.
The Los Angeles-based California-rock outfit led by Darren and Ann Do Rademaker returns with a third album.

This is the solo debut for Melissa Auf der Maur, who served as bassist for both Smashing Pumpkins and Hole. Chris Goss produced the disc, which also features appearances from Josh Homme (Queens of the Stone Age), Brant Bjork (Kyuss) and James Iha (Smashing Pumpkins).
Second only to Bob Marley in number of total reggae albums sold, international superstar Shaggy returns with his second album for MCA.
The Chicago alt-metal band follows their 2 million-selling debut, 'The Sickness,' with this sophomore effort, working once again with producer Johnny Z.
The ever-changing Washington D.C. outfit dives completely into the realm of 80s-style electro-synth pop (complete with vocals) for this, their sixth album.
The debut album for the British rock quartet from Camden shows influences from The Pixies, Britpop, and '90s alternative rock.
Jessica Simpson's younger sister releases her third album produced by Timberland, The Neptunes' Chad Hugo, Kenna, and Jack Joseph Puig.

recordname: The Portrait Is Finished & I Have Failed To Capture Your Beauty...
description: The debut album for Dan Bejar's other side project (Destroyer being the first) with his girlfriend, Sydney Vermont.

The third full-length studio release for the California psych rock band formed by Sam France and Jonathan Rado features contributions from such artist as Wayne Coyne, Of Montreals Kevin Barnes, Tim Presley of White Fence, and Bleached.
The debut full-length release for the British pop artist features a guest appearance from Marshmello.
The fifth full-length release for the indie quartet was recorded on tape before being mixed by Graham Marsh and Yoni Wolf.
The Missouri band that helped put emo on the map in the mid-'90s is back with its fifth studio album of its distinctive, emotionally driven rock sound.
The Brooklyn experimental rock trio releases its sixth studio album.
The third solo release for the Wu-Tang Clan member features guest appearances from Kurupt and Ol' Dirty Bastard (posthumously).
The fifth full-length release for the British indie rock band includes a near seven-minute track.
The latest release for the singer-songwriter is her first independent album after ending her contract with Epic Records.
Berlin-based noiseman Marco Haas' third album as T Raumschmiere features vocals by Ellen Allien.
The seventh full-length studio release for the pop artist features a guest appearance by Eminem.
The third full-length release for the indie rock band and its second since lead singer Daniel Blumberg left in 2013 was self-produced.

A companion CD to Sting's 2010 world tour, this album pairs the artist's greatest hits with new symphonic arrangements. Multiple conductors lend their help to the project, which also includes orchestral versions of Police songs.
The electronic duo from Germany release their fourth studio album.
The New Zealand rock band returns with a third album.
The four-piece post-rock outfit now based in Philadelphia continue to fill out their sound on this follow-up to 'We Fight Til Death.'
The fourth full-length release for the rock band led by Jared Leto was co-produced with Steve Lillywhite.

recordname: The Less You Know, The Better
description: The fourth studio album for the hip hop producer/electronic artist features guest appearances by Afrikan Boy, Posdnuos, Talib Kweli, Tom Vek, and Yukimi Nagano of Little Dragons.

recordname: This Is What the Truth Feels Like
description: The third full-length solo studio release for the pop singer features a guest appearance from Fetty Wap and production from Greg Kurstin, Mattman & Robin, JR Rotem and Stargate.
The Swedish band releases its sixth album of electro-punk, featuring such guest artists as Cee Lo and the B-52s.
Colin McIntyre returns with his third album in as many years, like its predecessors a bit, well, strange.
The dance-pop diva, still going strong at 35, returns with a new album.
The Wu-Tang producer returns to his RZA moniker with this latest solo release, after two previous albums under the "Bobby Digital" name.
This long-awaited follow-up to 2000's 'Hybrid Theory' contains 12 new tracks co-produced by Don Gilmore.

This long-awaited follow-up to the Los Angeles alternative-electronica band's 1997 debut, 'Vegas,' features guest appearances from members of Rage Against The Machine and Stone Temple Pilots as well as Jon Brion.

The Aerosmith frontman goes country on his first solo release features production from T Bone Burnett, Dan Huff, Marti Frederiksen, Cadillac Threes Jaren Johnston as well as a cover of "Janie's Got a Gun."
This debut artist album from the veteran Montreal-based DJ includes a cover of Talking Heads' "Burning Down The House."
The Australian singer's sixth album features a duet with Mandy Moore.
This is the second album for the trio of Brian Chase (Yeah Yeah Yeahs), Zach Max (Ex Models) and Jeannie Kwon.
The fifth full-length release for the British rock band led by Paul Smith was self-produced with additional production from The Invisibles Dave Okumu and from Field Musics David and Peter Brewis.
This is the third album for the Seattle-based singer-songwriter. Ed Harcourt guests on one track.

The sixth full-length release for the pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from BEAM, benny blanco, Burna Boy, Chance The Rapper, Daniel Caesar, Giveon, Dominic Fike, Khalid, and The Kid LAROI.
The two-disc compilation album features three new tracks.
The debut full-length release for Amanda Warner was produced by Peter Wade.
The seventh full-length solo release for the former The Stone Roses frontman was self-produced.
The soulful singer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist releases her sophomore album.
The third studio album for the British indie rock band was coproduced by lead singer Richard Archer with Grey Kurstin, Alan Moulder, and Stuart Price.
The third album for the English electronica artist and producer.
The fifth full-length release for the indie electronic band led by Dan Whitford was produced by Ben Allen.
The ninth full-length release for the Japanese post-rock band was produced by Steve Albini.
The seventh album for the hip-hop outfit introduces Latin and reggae elements into their sound. Guests include Prodigy (Mobb Deep) and Tim Armstrong (Rancid).
Produced by Jörgen Elofsson and Peter Nordahl, the ABBA singer returns with her fifth (English language) solo release.
Originally completed in 2010, the last album for the country singer on Curb Records features Ne-Yo as a guest.
This is the debut album for the Spokane, Washington, artist discovered by Peanut Butter Wolf.
The third solo album for the ex-Destiny's Child singer features songs attributed to her alter ego Sasha Fierce.
The sixth studio release for the D.C. psychedelic rock/stoner rock trio sees the return of drummer Mark Laughlin, who had left the band in 2002.
The British singer-songwriter--who has the best-selling album ever in Ireland--returns with a double album of hits, his ninth studio effort featuring previously unreleased material.
The latest album for the indie-rock band that began with the name Free Beer.
Rob Cavallo produced the album with Kid Rock.
The third album from the Los Angeles-based underground hip-hop outfit features Kanye West on one track.

The first new album for the English electronic outfit in six years sees the band heading in a completely new direction, away from their dark electronica in favor of a more organic, psychedelic rock vibe. Surprisingly (for a FSOL album), there's guitar, vocals, strings, and harmonica, and trippy song titles such as "The Mello Hippo Disco Show."
The debut full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by Mark Rankin, Chris Hughes, and Oli Bayston.

The latest full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Big Sean, Jay Rock, Adam Levine, Lil Baby, Lil Twist, O.T. Genasis, Takeoff, The-Dream, and XXXTentacion.
The third full-length studio release for French techno producer Pascal Arbez was produced by Stephane Alf Briat.
The Scottish rock band returns from its 2009 hiatus with its fourth studio release produced by Tony Hoffer.
The solo debut release for the Foxygen member includes contributions from Tim Presley of White Fence.
Rick Rubin produced this fourth album for the Swedish quartet, which features contributions by Billy Preston and Ash's Charlotte Hatherley.
The Australian rockers reunite with producer Dave Sardy for this second album.
The latest solo album for the R&B singer features Keri Hilson, Rock City, Tyrese, Robin Thicke, and The-Dream as guest singers.
The second album for the folk rock band led by Alex Ebert was self-produced.
The third full-length release for George Lewis Jr. as Twin Shadow features guest appearances from Lily Elise and D'Angelo Lacy.
The second full-length release for the Oklahoma indie rock band led by Cameron Neal was produced by Thom Monahan.
Jesse Hughes from Eagles of Death Metal releases his debut solo album.
This is the debut full-length release for the British neo-R&B singer-songwriter.

recordname: Sing Along To Songs You Don't Know
description: This is the fifth album for the Icelandic group.
Fourteen tracks by the late French songwriter Serge Gainsbourg are covered (in English) by the likes of Franz Ferdinand, Portishead, Placebo, Tricky, Jarvis Cocker and Cat Power.
The Atlanta-based metal band releases its first live album, which was recorded at Chicago's Aragon Ballroom October 17, 2009.

Think of 'Suit' as 'The Love Below' to 'Sweat's 'Speakerboxxx.' Where 'Sweat' is the more party-oriented of the two discs simultaneously released by Nelly, 'Suit' showcases the rapper's gentler side, and includes collaborations with Snoop Dogg, Tim McGraw (!), Mase and Pharrell Williams.

After frontman Zack de la Rocha left Rage Against the Machine in 2000, the remaining members of that Los Angeles band enlisted former Soundgarden leader Chris Cornell, and together they formed Audioslave. This is their debut release.
A five-track EP from the band featuring Christopher Ewen and the Magnetic Fields' Stephin Merritt and Claudia Gonson. Like all previous FBH releases, it features a mix of the song "Hopeless."
The Canadian band's third studio album.
The second full-length release for the indie pop duo of Lizzy Plapinger and Max Hershen was recorded in Los Angeles and New York.
This is the follow-up to her 2009 Mercury Music Prize-winning self-titled debut album.

The first new studio release in nearly a decade for the French house duo features guest appearances from the Beastie Boys' Mike D, Portugal. The Man's John Gourley, Jaw, Cat Power, Ryan Tedder, and Pharrell Williams.
The fourth album for the rapper is finally released and features appearances by Eminem, Ne Yo, Lloyd Banks, and R. Kelly.
The fourth album for the New York rapper features guests such as Ludacris, Ryan Leslie, Juelz Santana, and NOE.
The debut full-length solo album for the Why? band member was written after his 11-year relationship ended and he left California.

Tool frontman Maynard James Keenan tackles a variety of covers on this latest from his side project, A Perfect Circle, including versions of songs by Depeche Mode ("People Are People"), Devo ("Freedom Of Choice") and Marvin Gaye ("What's Going On"). Also included are two originals.
The El Paso, Texas four-piece (featuring those members of At The Drive-In who didn't join the Mars Volta) return with a second full-length, produced by Mike Major.
Scotland-born Nick Currie recorded this latest collection of strange pop tunes in his new home of Tokyo, then handed them off to John Talaga (Super Madrigal Brothers) for remixing.

The sophomore effort for the New York turnablists (following 1997's 'X-Pressions') features 20 tracks of scratching and DJ wizardry, coupled with live drums and guitar and vocals from guests such as the Large Professor.
The latest album from the electronic group features guests Steve Hillage, Eric Walker, Aki Omori, Andy Caine, and Juliet Roberts.
The Los Angeles-based New Zealand pop artist Pip Brown re-recorded material for her third release as she felt the songs were too dark and "didn't feel like" her anymore.
The seventh full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter features influences from hip hop and reggae.
The latest album for indie group Of Montreal was recorded with a group of session musicians at Kevin Barnes' studio in Athens, Georgia.
Frankmusik produced the first studio album for the synth-pop duo in over four years.
The legendary singer, and bewitching front-woman for Fleetwood Mac, collaborates with Eurythmics Dave Stewart and Glen Ballard for her first solo album release in over a decade.

The artist currently known as Diddy's first release in five years features production by will.i.am, Pharrell, Just Blaze and Kanye West, with a huge roster of contributors including Christina Aguilera, Brandy, Jamie Foxx, Big Boi, Nas, Mary J. Blige, and Fergie.
The British folk-pop duo of Olly Knights and Gale Paridjanian return for a third album.
The follow-up to the rapper's debut album "Mail On Sunday," features the number one single 'Right Round.'

recordname: The Best Little Secrets Are Kept
description: This is the debut full-length for the bawdy San Diego, Calif. rock outfit led by Jason Hill and Brian Karscig.
The 10th album for the Georgia jam band is the first featuring new guitarist Jimmy Herring.
The debut album for the Seattle indie rock trio was recorded at their home.

recordname: The Good Feeling Music of Dent May & His Magnificent Ukulele
description: Signed to Animal Collective's Paw Tracks label, the artist releases his first full-length album.
They may sound like Brit rockers (Oasis comes to mind), but this four-piece led by singer Adrian Barrera comes from Atlanta. Owen Morris (Oasis) produced this debut disc.

Rapper 50 Cent's backing posse attempts to capitalize on the runaway success of their leader's 'Get Rich or Die Tryin' with this, their own debut LP (which does indeed feature 50 Cent on each and every track).

Championed (and signed) by the White Stripes' Jack White, this spare, Michigan-based keyboard-bass-drums trio has been labeled by Rolling Stone as this generation's Devo. White produced this debut LP, which was mixed by Mercury Rev's Dave Fridmann. And why the album title? According to the band's website, "We all love rabbits."

Giant Sand's Howe Gelb returns with his second solo album for Thrill Jockey. Recorded half in Denmark and half in his native Arizona, 'The Listener' features appearances by members of Calexico and Handsome Family.
The 21-year old DJ turned-international R&B superstar from England returns with his second LP.
This is the Danish singer-songwriter's second full-length album.
Brendan O'Brien produced this second album for the New York band.
As one of the most well-known West Coast MCs, Ice Cube's ninth studio album heralds his love of California and his hometown of Compton.

The second full-length release for the rapper features guest appearances from A Boogie wit da Hoodie, Ashanti, Future, jetsonmade, London On Da Track, Megan Thee Stallion, Quavo, Roddy Ricch, and YoungBoy Never Broke Again.
The third full-length release for the indie rock band was self-recorded and produced.
The Brooklyn rock trio worked on its album for only one month with producer Tony Berg.

recordname: Free Your Mind And Win A Pony
description: The debut album for the duo from Baltimore and Sweden.
This is the debut album for the four-piece garage-rock band fronted by Kpt.Michi.Gan's Michael Beckett.
The latest album for the British singer-songwriter was produced by the artist himself.
The ukulele is absent from the second album for the singer-songwriter from Mississippi.

recordname: I Am Not a Dog on a Chain
description: The 13th full-length solo release for The Smiths frontman was produced by Joe Chicarelli.
The remix album of the electronic artist's 2009 album features production by such artists as Animal Collective, Four Tet, and Moritz Von Oswald.
The fourth full-length album by Marina Diamand is the first with her shortened name (previously under Marina And The Diamonds) features a collaboration with Clean Bandit and Luis Fonsi.
This is the second album from the French electronic artists.
One half of The Moldy Peaches returns with her latest album of funny children's tunes.

Yes, well, she does have a lot to be thankful for, doesn't she. This hit debut album is a direct result of the singer's victory on the first installment of Fox TV's "American Idol" talent competition in 2002. Judging from the album's credits, just about every musician and producer in the industry seemingly worked on the disc, although Clarkson did manage to co-write four out of the dozen songs.

Why yes, yes we do. His real name is Tom Jenkinson, he dabbles in experimental electronica (a la Aphex Twin, who signed him to his first record deal), and this is his sixth album. Included among the seven new tracks here (totaling just 35 minutes) is an unexpected cover of Joy Division's "Love Will Tear Us Apart."
The fourth album for east coast rapper sees Black Key and DMX himself taking over the production reins from Swizz Beatz on all but two tracks.

recordname: Wake Up And Smell The Coffee
description: Yes, apparently they ARE still around. This is the Irish group's sixth album since 1993, and their first with original producer Stephen Street in some time.
The collaborative release from Brian Eno and Karl Hyde was produced by Eno and Fred Gibson.
The second studio release for the British singer was produced by Nellee Hooper and Jake Gosling.
James Chapman releases his follow up to his Mercury Music Prize-nominated album, "We Can Create."
The band's thrid album, "Tonight" is dub remixed by producer Dan Carey.
The 11th full-length studio release for the alternative rock band was produced by the band's frontman, Billy Corgan.
The Austin, Texas group known more for its live performances releases its third album.

Ben Bridwell of Band Of Horses and Iron & Wine collaborate on a covers albums that includes songs originally sung by JJ Cale, El Perro del Mar, Bonnie Raitt, Ronnie Lane, Marshall Tucker Band, Sade, Pete Seeger, Spiritualized, Talking Heads, Them Two, and Unicorn.
Recordings made by the actor/comedian between 1977 to 1979 were edited and compiled by Rodney Ascher and Vernon Chatman with narration by Bill Hader.
The second full-length solo release for the former Girls frontman was recorded with producer Doug Boehm.
The third full-length release from the Brooklyn-based indie rock band that is now a duo of Jonny Pierce and Jacob Graham after Connor Hanwick left in late 2012.
The 11th album for the Anton Newcombe-led rock band features the return of bassist/guitarist Matt Hollywood, who left the group in 1999.
The debut album on the Epitaph label for the pop-punk band from Florida is also their first studio album in nearly three years.
Fans of the Grammy-winning band have waited three years for them to return with a second album, which returns Dave Fortman as producer but no longer includes guitarist-songwriter Ben Moody.
Neil Young releases his latest album inspired in part by the Lincvolt Project, which is biodiesel pioneer Jonathan Goodwin's idea to produce an electric power system for cars.
The debut full-length studio release for the daughter of Neneh Cherry includes production from MNEK, Steve Mac, and Fraser T Smith.
The seventh full-length studio release for the British indie rock band was produced with Ben H. Allen and Andrew Wells.
The second full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Clever, Brent Faiyaz and Young Thug.
The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from First Aid Kit.
This is the fourth full-length release for the British synth-pop duo of Theo Hutchcraft and Adam Anderson.
The eighth studio release from the rapper features guest appearances from Mary J. Blige, Mariah Carey, Cee Lo Green, John Legend, Nas, DJ Premier, and The-Dream.
This is the second full-length release for the Irish rock quartet was produced by Charlie Russell and Bradley Spence.
The seventh full-length release for the Welsh post-hardcore band was produced by Lewis Johns.
The Detroit rapper returns with an album of new songs from artists on the Shady label including Bad Meets Evil, D12, Obie Trice, Slaughterhouse, and YelaWolf.
The debut full-length release for British pop singer Lauren Henson was produced by John Beck.
Dylan Ross of Cursive joins the Los Angeles electronic group formed by Danny and Tiffany Preston on their second full-length release.
The 11th album for the German experimental electronic band is only seven tracks long.
The eight-track album follows the Scottish trio's third album, Have Some Faith In Magic, released earlier this year.
The second full-length album for Julie Ann Baenziger as Sea of Bees was written after a breakup.
The British duo's seventh album continues its move toward electronic and rock music.

The long delayed 21-track album for the Los Angeles rapper features guest turns from Dr. Dre, Kendrick Lamar, Snoop Dogg, Lil Wayne, Sly, Drake, Rick Ross, Beanie Sigel, Young Jeezy, Big Boi, E-40, Lloyd, Mario, Wale. Chris Brown, Nelly Furtado, and Tyler, the Creator.
The debut full-length release for the indie band from Australia was recorded in Nashville with producer Joe Chiccarelli.
The last album for the British singer-songwriter who passed away in 2009 includes one song written by Phil Collins.
The latest project for actor Adam Goldberg is the first under this name. He previously released an album under the LANDy name.
The second solo album for the lead singer of the band Idlewild sees his music move a bit further away from the traditional Scottish folk music of his past two releases.
This is the debut album for the English rock quartet who share the same last name.
The British band self-produced its follow-up to its 2007 debut "Fantastic Playroom."
The latest album for the Chicago band led by Tim Kinsella.
The fourth album for the singer is a release of cover songs produced by Diane Gentile.
His first album in five years, Steve Winwood's ninth studio effort features nine songs, including one with guitar work by Eric Clapton.
The American Idol runner-up releases his debut album.
Red Hot Chili Peppers guitarist John Frusciante guests on the prog-rock band's third studio disc, which features eight tracks clocking in at an epic total of 76 minutes.
Wyclef's fourth solo disc finds Patti LaBelle, Missy Elliott, Buju Banton, Redman, Carlos Santana (among others) making contributions.
The fourth album for the Bay Area band finds them once again in light, summertime pop mode.
The third album for the English indie rock quintet.
The husband-and-wife duo releases its debut full-length album of African and Middle Eastern-influenced music.
Brendan Lynch produced this debut for the English blues-rock band, who are named after a Skip James song.
This is the first full-length studio release in 16 years for the band led by Gordon Gano and Brian Ritchie with Dresden Dolls' Brian Viglione taking over on drums from Victor de Lorenzo.

recordname: I Had the Blues But I Shook Them Loose
description: The debut album for the British rock quartet was produced by Jim Abbiss.
The L.A. psych-rock band's third disc was produced by Tom Rothrock (Beck).
One of two Prince albums released on the same day, it features the all-female trio 3rdEyeGirl.
The sixth full-length studio release for the alternative rock band led by Chris Martin was influenced in part by Martin's relationship with Gwyneth Paltrow.
This is the debut full-length release for the New York trio of Kelly Zutrau, Joe Valle, and Marty Sulkow.
The full-length debut release for the British pop artist features contributions from Babydaddy, Amanda Ghost, Robin Hannibal, Emile Haynie, Dev Hynes, John Legend, and Johnny Rockstar.
The seventh studio release for the pop singer features Chris Brown, Eminem, Future, and David Guetta as guests with No I.D., Nicky Romero, StarGate, and The-Dream contributing to production.
The sophomore album for the indie rock quartet from Minnesota was produced by Dave Fridmann.
The R&B singer's 12th full-length studio release features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Ludacris, Kelly Rowland, and Young Jezzy.

recordname: How to Get To Heaven From Scotland
description: This is the debut album for the rock quartet led by Aidan Moffat.
This is the second solo outing for the former Verve frontman.
This covers album from the former American Music Club leader includes versions of songs by everyone from Culture Club ("Do You Really Want To Hurt Me?") to Glen Campbell ("Gentle on My Mind").
Morissette's third studio album is the first one the 27-year-old Canadian songwriter has produced herself.
The band's first studio LP in 30 years features the most recent touring lineup of original members Alex Chilton and Jody Stephens with Posies Jon Auer and Ken Stringfellow.
The singer from Hawaii returns with his latest album, which was recorded on solar-powered equipment.

recordname: The Difference Between Houses And Homes: Lost Songs And Loose Ends 1995-2001
description: This disc compiles 10 tracks from the Tim Kasher-led band's early 7-inch singles, and adds two previously unreleased cuts.
The third full-length release from the band led by Alex Ebert was partially recorded at the same time as 2012's Here.

recordname: A List of the Burning Mountains
description: The 12th full-length studio release for the Brooklyn rock group consists of two nearly 20-minute long tracks.

This greatest hits/mix disc by the German DJ/producer includes two previously unreleased tracks. The accompanying DVD, culled from over 40 hours of footage, is part travelogue and part behind-the-scenes documentary of Van Dyk in action.

recordname: The Sound of the Life of the Mind
description: The fourth studio album for the indie rock band is its first release of new music in 13 years.
Money Mark guests on this all-instrumental, post-punk-influenced, 12-track set for the veteran hip-hop outfit.
This is the sophomore album for the Scottish indie rock band.

The Hawaiian-born producer's move to making pop music as a solo artist has proven successful, as his new album is an innovative mix of tribal beats, reggae, and club-worthy jams that show his range as a songwriter.
Robert Wratten (Field Mice) is joined by singers Beth Arzy and Anne Mari on this fifth TBS release.
The 12th studio release for the British band led by Ian McCulloch was produced by Youth.
The fourth full-length release for the Australian hard rock band led by Andrew Stockdale was produced by Brendan O'Brien.

The ninth studio release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from such artists as Far East Movement, French Montana, Ghetts, Kano, Lethal Bizzle, Ms D, Emeli Sandé, Tinchy Stryder, and Tulisa.
Howard Benson returns to produce the third full-length album for the band led by former American Idol contestant, Chris Daughtry.
Described by Moby himself as a "soundtrack for empty cities at 2 a.m.," the electronic artist's 10th album was recorded while on tour.
The second full-length album for the New York experimental rock band.

This is the fourth album for house music producer Brian Transeau, who has faded from the limelight a bit since his heyday in the mid-to-late 1990s, although has produced hits for the likes of Britney Spears and *NSync. Collaborators here include Rose McGowan, Scott McCloud (Girls Against Boys), and Guru (Gang Starr).
Janet Jackson's 10th album features Ne-Yo and Missy Elliot.
Johnny Marr guests on the singer-songwriter's first album in three years and her first disc for the Young God label.
The debut solo release for the Fun. frontman was produced by Jeff Bhasker and Emile Haynie.
Four Tet's Kieren Hebden and drummer Steve Reid team up for the fourth time on this album about New York City.
The Pennsylvania band releases the EP in advance of a full studio album in the fall.

recordname: Primus & the Chocolate Factory with the Fungi Ensemble
description: The tribute to the 1971 film Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory from the San Francisco Bay Area-based band sees the return of Tim Alexander on drums.

Executive produced with Mike Will Made It, the hip-hop-influenced fourth studio release (and her first on the RCA label) for the former Disney star features guest appearances from Big Sean, French Montana, and Britney Spears.

After releasing Planet Earth for free in the United Kingdom, the singer-songwriter's three albums (one by new artist Bria Valente) are packaged together as a Target store exclusive in the United States.

recordname: We'll Live and Die in These Towns
description: Formally known as The Bridges, the British band returns with a label, a new name, and a new album.
Ken Thomas (Sigur Ros) produced this sophomore effort for the anthemic UK rockers.

Can he do it again? Coming a full three years after his surprise megahit 'Play,' this new album from Richard Melville Hall attempts to repeat that disc's success with (surprise) 18 new tracks, including collaborations with Angie Stone, Sinead O'Connor, Azure Ray and MC Lyte.
Originally conceived as a solo project for Cursive's frontman Tim Kasher, the Omaha band now releases its fourth album.
The sixth overall release from the 60s' British psychedelic rock band is its second since reforming in 2011 and was funded via Pledge Music.
Cannibal Ox's Vast Aire releases his latest solo album.
Britney newest release includes tracks written by T-Pain and Pharrell Williams.
This is the third album for the actress/pop star.
The fourth solo disc for the former Stone Roses singer includes a collaboration with Noel Gallagher.
Stephen Street produced the British band's second album, which follows their acclaimed 2005 debut 'Employment.'
The debut album for the English singer, who attended the BRIT school (other famous alumni include Amy Winehouse, Leona Lewis, and Adele.)
The 13th full-length studio release for the electronic artist is the first credited under the name Moby & The Void Pacific Choir.
The LA-based band releases its sophomore full-length of noise-driven, psychedelic rock.
The fourth album for the Portland duo of Lisa Molinaro and Kevin O'Connor is the first on Isaac Brock of Modest Mouse fame's label.
This is the debut full-length studio release for the Chicago rapper.
The fourth album for the New York indie-pop band was produced with Peter Katis and Dave Fridmann.
The second full-length album for the Danish band was produced by Peter Katis.
The follow-up to 2009's Chamber Music, the album is a compilation of Wu-Tang and affiliates, minus GZA.

recordname: Screamworks: Love in Theory and Practice
description: Finnish goth-rock outfit, HIM returns with its seventh studio album on Sire Records.
The San Francisco band's fourth studio album was produced by Brendan O'Brien and includes a cover of Sugar's "If I Can't Change Your Mind."
Trent Reznor along with his wife Mariqueen Maandig and Atticus Ross join to release their debut album as the band How To Destroy Angels.
The first album in 11 years for the Southern California band led by Gwen Stefani features Busy Signal and Major Lazer as guests on the title track.
The fifth album from the New Orleans black metal band was produced by Erik Rutan.
The Black Eyed Peas' will.i.am guests on the dancehall star's sixth studio album.
'Dying' once again finds the country star backed on record by his touring band, the Dancehall Doctors.

Picture a white man singing R&B. Picture a white man singing R&B while stripping down to his underwear. Picture an average-looking, slightly pudgy white man singing R&B while stripping down to his underwear. That's Har Mar Superstar, and this is his second album.
The English trip-hop outfit's fourth studio album features unlikely guest vocal appearances from rapper Slick Rick and Lambchop's Kurt Wagner.

Indie rock legend Bob Mould (Hüsker Dü, Sugar) returns with his fifth solo album, and first for his brand new record label (Granary Music). In another first, Mould delves into electronica for the first time as well, abandoning traditional instruments for synths and computers on half of the album.
The debut full-length album for the New Zealand quartet was produced by Bernard Butler.

recordname: Later...When the TV Turns To Static
description: The third full-length release for Scottish indie rock quartet was produced by frontman James Allan.
The debut full-length album for the rap duo from Florida was produced by Hard Feeling UK.
The long-delayed fifth album for the rapper features guests such as Akon, Ashanti, Chuck D, Fergie, L.L. Cool J, R. Kelly, T.I., Rick Ross, and Snoop Dogg.
The debut album for the Australian band formed by The Sleepy Jackson's Luke Steele and Pnau's Nick Littlemore.
The debut full-length release for the indie rock band was produced by Bernard Butler.
Dave Grohl produced this fourth album for the emo-rockers.
This is the '80s alternative rock-influenced debut disc for the Northampton, England band.
Nashville duo Jake and Jamin Orrall release their eighth album on their own label, Infinity Cat.
The third full-length release for the British duo was produced by Jonas Quant.
The 18th solo studio release for the Beatle features contribnutions from Steve Lukather, Todd Rundgren, Gregg Rolie, Richard Page, Wally Palmer and Gregg Bissonette.
The band's first new album since 2004 finds them without singer/guitarist Andy Taylor and featuring guests Timberland and Justin Timberlake.
The tenth studio release for the Detroit singer was self-produced.

recordname: The Orbserver in the Star House
description: Electronic producers, The Orb teams up with reggae producer Lee "Scratch" Perry on this release.
Tom Morello's latest release as his folk alter ego is his third solo album, accompanied by a fully electrified band called The Freedom Fighters Orchestra.
This is the second album for the Grammy-nominated rock band from Colorado.
The sophomore album for the Michigan-born musician includes a song cowritten by ex-Wilco member Jay Bennett.

recordname: One Monkey Don't Stop No Show
description: Cee-Lo has left for a solo career, but the remaining members of the Atlanta-based hip-hop outfit return for their first album in five years, produced by Organized Noize.

The debut country/bluegrass-inspired release for this Primus frontman's project with Bryan Kehoe includes the title track original, songs from Les Claypool's other projects/bands, and covers such as the Bee Gee's "Stayin' Alive."

The self-titled debut for Jasmine van den Bogaerde features covers of songs by such artists as The National, Francis & the Lights, Bon Iver, the xx, Naked & Famous, Fleet Foxes, Postal Service, and James Taylor.
The Norwegian electronic duo's follow-up to last year's Junior was recorded during the same sessions as that release.
The live album contains recordings from the rapper's New York City show on September 24, 2009.
The second full-length release for the Texas rapper with guest appearances from Childish Gambino, Amber Coffman, Mac Miller, Mike Posner, Slim Thug, and Paul Wall as well as production from Diplo.
The second album for the Swedish electronic artist was produced with Johan Agebjorn.
The third full-length studio release for the Canadian rock band led by Luke LaLonde was produced by Roger Leavens.
The latest album for the rapper features such guests as Brandy, The Dream, R. Kelly, Pharrell, and Soulja Boy.
The U.K. pop-funk outfit led by Jay Kay returns with a sixth album.
The actor best known for his roles on the TV shows House and Jeeves and Wooster releases his debut album of blues music produced by Joe Henry.
The third full-length release from the South African duo of Ninja and Yo-Landi features a guest appearance from DJ Muggs.
The first solo release for Dave Matthews (that's right, it's not the Dave Matthews Band this time out) finds him working with artists such as Tim Reynolds and Trey Anastasio (Phish).

The latest from Tom Petty is a concept album (or diatribe, if you will) about/against the domination of popular music by large, greedy corporations. It was released on October 8, 2002 by a large, greedy corporation.

recordname: The Carnivorous Lunar Activities Of Lupine Howl
description: Featuring former members of Spiritualized (who were fired by Jason Pierce before the recording sessions for 'Let It Come Down'), Lupine Howl offers up nine tracks on this debut album, including previously-released singles "Vaporizer" and "125."
This is actor-singer Sisqo's sophomore effort, following his 1999 debut 'Unleash The Dragon.' (Sense a pattern here?) Teddy Riley produced the lead single, "Can I Live."
The sixth album for the British indie-rock band was produced with Brian Deck.
The latest release for the experimental electronic project is said to not involve Dean Blunt and Inga Copeland.
The second full-length solo release for the prolific film and television composer was written during the COVID-19 pandemic.

The 10th full-length studio release for the rapper/producer features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Beyoncé, Justin Bieber, Big Sean, Chance the Rapper, Drake, Fat Joe, Future, Calvin Harris, Jadakiss, Jay Z, Alicia Keys, Kodak Black, Lil Wayne, Migos, Nicki Minaj, PARTYNEXTDOOR, Pusha T, Quavo, Raekwon, Rihanna, Rick Ross, T.I., Travis Scott, Bryson Tiller, Yo Gotti, and Young Thug.
This 26-minute disc is the first solo album for the Run-D.M.C. M.C., who is better known these days as the Run in MTV's reality show "Run's House."

The third studio release for the dance pop artist features guest appearances from R. Kelly, T.I., Too Short and Twista as well as production from David Guetta, Infected Mushroom, Madeon, Rick Rubin, DJ White Shadow, will.i.am, Zedd, and Zisis.
This is the second release for the Brooklyn duo of Alex Frankel and Nick Millhiser.
The rapper's first release in five years features guests such as Mary J. Blige, Nas, Styles P, Ghostface Killah, Raekwon, Ne Yo, Lil Wayne, Young Jeezy, Pharrell, and Faith Evans.

recordname: Winter Women / Holy Ghost Language School
description: This double album marks the first solo release for the "brother" half of the brother-sister duo Fiery Furnaces. While the 'Holy Ghost' disc is as bizarre and experimental as recent Furnaces releases, 'Winter Women' marks a detour into more accessible pop.

The debut full-length release for the British indie pop band led by Heather Baron-Gracie was co-produced by The 1975's Matty Healy and George Daniel (as well as Jonathan Gilmore and the band's drummer Ciara Doran).
The Brooklyn-based rapper makes his major-label debut, with producers Dave Sitek and John Hill.
Joan Jett and Steven Van Zandt guested on Joey Ramone's second posthumously released solo album that includes demos and unreleased recordings.
This is the debut album for the side project of David Heumann, lead singer of Arboretum and Lungfish's bass player Nathan Bell.
Kool Keith's second Dr. Octagon album follows a full decade after his first, with production this time handled by One Watt Sun.
The fourth album for the Britpop band includes a track ("Gravity") co-written by Coldplay's Chris Martin.
The Seattle-based punk band returns with their third album.
