The second full-length release from the Denver band formed by Andy Rauworth and Craig Nice was produced by Jacob Portrait.
The dance group, comprising three Canadians and a Brit, releases its debut album stateside.
The London-based producer/singer-songwriter who worked with such artists as Omar, Sugababes, Cheryl Cole, Kesha, McFly, and Kylie Minogue releases his second album.
The 11th full-length studio release for the metal band features four different drummers (Joey Castillo, Johnny Kelly, Karl Rockfist and Dirk Verbeuren).
The Australian avante-garde group release a fourth album of inventive and diverse dance-punk merged with an indie-pop sound.
The singer follows the lead of her Azure Ray bandmate Maria Taylor (whose '11:11' came out in May) with this solo debut, co-produced by Andy LeMaster (Now It's Overhead).
Produced by Dave Catching, the third album from San Francisco psychedelic rock band is its first since Rachel Fannan left the group.
This is the debut full-length album for Swervedriver's Adam Franklin and Interpol's Sam Fogarino.

The Canadian singer-songwriter's concept album about the dangers of the business practices of the Monsanto Company (especially genetically modified seeds) features the band Promise of the Real with Willie Nelson's sons Lukas and Micah.
The debut full-length release for British pop singer-songwriter Louisa Rose Allen, who won a Grammy for her work on Zedd's Clarity.

recordname: Tim Robbins and the Rogues Gallery Band
recordauthor: Tim Robbins & the Rogues Gallery Band
description: The Oscar-winning actor and his backing band release an album of folk rock tunes.
The first album released on their new label Blank.wav was written and produced by the band.
The fifth studio album for the Atlanta rapper includes Alfamega, Busta Rhymes, Jay-Z, Eminem, and Nelly as guests.
The fourth studio release for the pop singer includes production from Dr. Luke, Greg Kurstin, Max Martin, StarGate, and Greg Wells.
Yes, for those of you keeping score at home, Alex Paterson is indeed still recording as The Orb, with 'Bicycles' marking the once trailblazing electronica group's sixth studio release.
Yes, you'll see the word "Coldplay" in nearly every review for this debut disc, but the UK trio stand out from the crowd with their unconventional lineup of vocals, drums, and piano.
Just when you feared the New Jersey hair band would never release another album, they did. Oh joy.

Procuded by Mo'Wax label head James Lavelle (U.N.K.L.E.), the debut album from London's South mixes electronica and indie rock, drawing comparisons to everyone from the Stone Roses and Happy Mondays to Badly Drawn Boy and DJ Shadow.
The fifth album from the British rockers is their first U.S. release in five years.
The sophomore solo album for Rage Against the Machine's Tom Morello was produced with Brendan O'Brien.
This is the full-length debut release for the Adelaide, Australian indie pop band.
The first release in four years for the Australian electro-pop duo of Julian Hamilton and Kim Moyes.
The electronic duo's new album includes guests such as Josh Homme (Queens of the Stone Age), Ian Astbury (The Cult), The Duke Spirit, and Autolux.

The sixth full-length studio release for the Canadian rapper features guest appearances from 21 Savage, Future, Giveon, JAY-Z, Kid Cudi, Lil Baby, Lil Durk, Lil Wayne, Project Pat, Rick Ross, Tems, Travis Scott, Ty Dolla $ign, and Young Thug.

recordname: He's Got the Whole This Land Is Your Land in His Hands
description: The latest release for the Chicago indie rock band led by Tim Kinsella was self-produced by the band.

The five-track EP for the band led by Ruban Nielson is an acoustic release with three songs from its second full-length album and two cover songs: Dirty Projectors' "Swing Lo Magellan" and Beck's "Puttin' It Down."
Drake and Jay-Z appear as guests on the second half of The 20/20 Experience project co-produced with Timothy Mosley and Jerome "J-Roc" Harmon.
The debut album for the British pop singer was produced by Dan Carey.
This second Dntel LP for Jimmy Tamborello (also of the Postal Service and Figurine) features guest vocalists Jenny Lewis, Conor Oberst, Mia Doi Todd, and members of Lali Puna and Fog.
The Los Angeles punk band led by Greg Graffin releases a nine-track Christmas album.
The fourth full-length release for the British rock band was produced by Inflo, a British hip-hop producer.
This concept mini-album consists of nine tracks performed by a mysterious quartet named Shobaleader One.
The fifth album for the Detroit rock band features a reference to its 2003 hit 'Gay Bar.'

recordname: Everything Is Boring & Everyone Is a F--king Liar
description: Naeem Juwan returns as Spank Rock, and his second album features such guests as Santigold, Big Freedia, and Pharrell Williams.

Apart from demonstrating that his addition skills are as poor as Radiohead's, 'One Plus One' finds Damon Gough returning to the more low-key, lo-fi sound of his earlier work after the much glossier 'Have You Fed The Fish?' failed to win the British singer-songwriter new fans in 2002.

If declining sales and waning critical support are any indication, then yes, Tricky is probably feeling quite vulnerable at this stage of his career. But that didn't stop him from releasing this seventh LP, which includes covers of The Cure's "Love Cats" and XTC's "Dear God."

recordname: The Art of Love and War
description: The fourth album for Stone was recorded at Marvin Gaye's original LA studio.
Personal relationships influenced the lyrics on the fifth album produced with Rick Rubin for the alternative rock band.
The soundtrack features songs from the first season of the TV show.
The New York duo's third album was produced with Jeff Saltzman.
The second self-titled release for the alternative rock band is the first to features former The X Factor contestant Jeff Gutt as its lead singer.
The fifth studio album for the metal band is its first in nearly five years and its third release to debut at number one on the Billboard 200 chart.
The surprise release from the pop singer was a collaboration with the Flaming Lips' Wayne Coyne.
The Chicago-based outfit led by Neil Rosario and Mark Henning return with a Prince-esque sophomore set.
The first new full-length studio release in more than 20 years for the artist known as Queen of Motown was produced with Jack Antonoff.

recordname: Peaceful, The World Lays Me Down
description: This is the debut album for the British quartet led by Charlie Fink.
The fifth solo album for the Moldy Peaches member.

The largely Spanish-language Latin release from the guitarist features guest appearances from such artists as ChocQuibTown, Lila Downs, Gloria Estefan, Juanes, Los Fabulosos Cadillacs, Ziggy Marley, Miguel, Niña Pastori, Pitbull, Samuel Rosa, Wayne Shorter, Soledad, and Diego Torres.
This is the debut full-length studio album for the Canadian electronic artist.

The second album from Nicki Minaj focuses on her male alter ego Roman Zolanski and features guest appearances from 2Chainz, Chris Brown, Beenie Man, Bobby V, Cam'ron, Drake, Lil Wayne, Nas, Rick Ross, and Young Jeezy.
'Calamity' is the first full length for Chris Cohen's new full-time project since leaving experimental rockers Deerhoof.
The Grammy-winning singer-songwriter's sophomore effort comes a full three years after her debut, 'Whoa, Nelly!'
Manson's fifth album finds the shock-rocker turning to the glory days of vaudeville and burlesque for inspiration.
The third solo disc for Wyclef Jean includes remakes of Bob Dylan's "Knockin' on Heaven's Door" and Tom Jones' "What's New, Pussycat?" (featuring Jones on guest vocals) among its 22 eclectic tracks.
The Norwegian electronic producer's latest release is the first album to include his own vocals.
The band return with their first new material in 28 years.
The 11th studio release for the electronic artists features guest appearances from Inyang Bassey, Cold Specks, Wayne Coyne, Skylar Grey, Damien Jurado, and Mark Lanegan.

Fans were allowed to customize a 10-track album from a list of 20 songs when it was first released in the UK under the name The Future Is Medieval. The US album's tracklisting has a new name with four different tracks from the band-selected album released in the UK.

recordauthor: Everybody Was In The French Resistance...Now
description: The latest concept album from Art Brut's Eddie Argos and Blood Arm's Dylan Valdes consists of 12 pop responses, such as "Billie's Genes," where a grown-up child responds to Michael Jackson's "Billie Jean."
The Black Eyed Peas return to release its first studio album in five years.
The second album for the British duo was produced by Paul Epworth.
This is the second album for English rock quartet and its first with its new bass player.
Formerly known as the Xerox Teens until the copy company came calling, the British quintet releases their first full-length.
The British soul singer releases her second set of soul covers produced with Steve Greenberg.
The emo rock band from New Jersey releases its seventh studio album, the first without guitarist David Soloway.
Chris Carrabba & co.'s long-delayed fourth album was produced chiefly by Don Gilmore, after sessions with Daniel Lanois were largely scrapped. Counting Crows' Adam Duritz guests.
The Georgia quintet releases a five-song EP of indie-folk, recorded during the False Priest album sessions.
The ninth studio release for the British post-punk band (with Andy Gill the only remaining original member) features guest appearances from Gail Ann Dorsey, Alison Mosshart, and Herbert Gronemeyer.
The sixth full-length release for the R&B artist was produced by Dr. Luke and features guest appearances from Candice, David Guetta, Jeezy, Charisse Mills, Schoolboy Q, and T.I.
Produced by John Fields (Andrew W.K., Switchfoot) is Rooney's followup to their self-titled debut.
Hatfield moves toward a more acoustic sound for her self-produced 10th studio release.
This is the seventh album for these Orange County alt-rockers.

Recorded direct to two-track, 'Black Letter Days' features a stripped-down sound for the former Pixie and his current band. And if the 18 new tracks here (including not one but two covers of Tom Waits' "The Black Rider") aren't enough for you, there's even more on the companion release, 'Devil's Workshop.'
The band's first album on the Fueled By Ramen label was produced by Jeff Bhasker and features Janelle Monae on its single We Are Young.
Brian Higgins produced the fifth album for alternative rock band led by Beth Ditto.
This is album number three for the side project band for Animal Collective's Dave Portner (aka Avey Tare) and Black Dice's Eric Copeland.
'Breaking Up' is the English trio's debut album.
The sophomore studio album for the artist best known for the theme song from the TV series "One Tree Hill."
Executive produced by Ricky Reed, the second full-length major studio release for the pop singer-songwriter feature guest appearances from LunchMoney Lewis and Yo Gotti.
The latest solo album for the Beatles drummer features Paul McCartney on the track "Walk With You," as well as guest vocals from Joss Stone, Ben Harper, and Richard Marx.
This is the first release for the new project from blink-182's Travis Barker and Mark Hoppus.
The second full-length release for the Welsh alternative rock band was produced by Dave Sardy.

The singer-songwriters latest full-length release features some musical and jazz standards from such shows as Breakfast at Tiffanys, Brigadoon, Guys and Dolls, Oklahoma!, and Show Boat as well as songs made famous by Billie Holiday and Glenn Miller.

British visual artist David Shrigley's words were turned into music by Arab Strap co-founder Malcolm Middleton in this collaboration that also features Bridget McCann, Gavin Mitchell, and Scott Vermeire.
The deluxe two-disc set from the singer-songwriter features one disc with a 92-piece orchestra and choir plus a disc of solo versions of the same songs.

Delayed from its planned November 2018 release, this 10-song set marks the first collaborative album from the new "supergroup" consisting of British musician Labrinth, singer-songwriter Sia, and proudcer Diplo.
A collection of ten covers and seven original songs from the pop singer's 2011-12 orchestral tour.
Patience is indeed a requirement for fans of the former Wham! member, as this is just his fourth solo album of original material and first in eight years.
X marks the veteran English arena-rock band's tenth album.
The French electronica duo Rinocerose gained notice for their 1999 debut 'Installation Sonore.' This sophomore effort features 12 new tracks of guitar-infused house.
Gorky's Zygotic Mynci frontman Euros Childs makes his solo debut with this 14-song effort.

The Grammy-nominated (for producing M.I.A.'s "Paper Planes") DJ Wesley "Diplo" Pentz releases his latest remix album, featuring works from a variety of indie-rock bands such as Bloc Party, CSS, and Spank Rock.
The second album for the British singer was produced by Flood.
The third studio release for the British pop singer was produced by DJ Dahi, Greg Kurstin, and Shellback.
The rock band latest album is the second in a planned triology.
The first album for the electronic duo in four years features Dave Grohl and James Rushent as guest musicians.
The second full-length release fro the Las Vegas rock band was produced with Alex Da Kid.
The eighth studio release for the pop group is its first with Kevin Richardson since he left the group in 2006 and also includes production from Max Martin, Morgan Taylor Reid, and Martin Terefe.
The hip-hop producer attempts a "pop" album for the first time on this third release, utilizing all live instrumentation and even singing on almost all of the tracks.
The British duo of Theo Keating and Simon Lord releases their first full-length album together.
The Australian band's second album was produced by Wayne Connolly (The Vines) and includes their cover of Alphaville's "Forever Young."
The rapper's sixth album includes production work from Scott Storch and Swizz Beatz.

The multimedia collective known as the Blue Man Group, who can be seen and heard in ongoing theatrical productions in several cities, in television commercials for Intel, and even on a previous instrumental album 'Audio,' have released here something akin to a real rock'n'roll album. Their assortment of invented instrumentation is now accompanied by more traditional instruments, and vocals are provided by an array of guests, including Dave Matthews, Spalding Gray and Tracy Bonham. Included also are covers of "White Rabbit" and "I Feel Love."

One of two simultaneous releases (Black Letter Days being the other), Devil's Workshop is perhaps the more straightforward of the pair, although like its companion it was recorded direct to 2-track, representing a back-to-basics approach for Black and Co.

Not quite the next Linkin Park album, 'Reanimation' is instead a remix of their entire debut album, 'Hybrid Theory' (actually, a remix of the Japanese version, which contained extra tracks). The 19 songs here have been reinvented by an array of alternative and hip hop musicians and producers, including members of Korn, Jurassic 5, Orgy, and Staind, and given cryptic new titles such as "Rnw@y" and "My{Dsmbr." (You'd think with all the money they're making they could at least buy a vowel.)
This is the third album for project that began as a spin-off from At The Drive-In but has since lost founding guitarist Paul Hinojos (who is replaced for this album with Denali's Keeley Davis).
The debut album for the indie pop band from California.
The sixth full-length studio release for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Missy Elliott and Pitbull (as well as Joe Jonas on the Deluxe edition).

recordname: Satellite Flight: The Journey to Mother Moon
description: Originally an EP, the 10-track album was a surprise midnight release for the hip hop artist.
Black Francis and Reid Perry worked together on an album produced by Jon Tiven.
The latest album for the multiple award-winning country singer features guest appearances by Dave Matthews, Mac McAnally and Willie Nelson.
The debut album for the British quartet was produced by Stephen Street.
Kanye West, Pharrell Williams and Timbaland are among the producers on the rapper's fifth disc, which also includes appearances by Nelly and R. Kelly.
This is the third album for the band led by Sonic Youth's Kim Gordon and Pussy Galore's Julie Cafritz.
This is the debut full-length debut for the New York duo of Lizzy Plapinger and producer Max Hershenow.
The Nashville country music trio releases their third studio album.

recordname: We Sing, We Dance, We Steal Things
description: The third album for the San Diego-based singer-songwriter includes songs that first appeared on three EPs.
This is the sophomore album for the British indie pop rock band led by Fyfe Dangerfield.
Dan Gtech produced the fourth studio album for the British rock quartet that sees the band returning to emotional, piano-based songs.

'Space Settings' is the debut from the hip-hop side project for Jimmy Tamborello (Postal Service, Dntel), who along with Plug Research artists Allen Avanessian, Daedelus and John Tejada (plus Thomas Fehlmann), provides the musical backdrop for an array of MCs that includes Beans and Rocmon.
This is the full-length debut from the four-piece consisting of Dismemberment Plan bassist Eric Axelson, former Promise Ring members Davey von Bohlen and Dan Didier, and Jawbox founder J. Robbins.
The Louisville, KY retro-electronica outfit, who drew numerous Daft Punk comparisons with their 2002 EP 'Le Funk,' have transitioned into a dance-punk sound with this full-length debut.
The second Christmas album for the pop singer includes four new songs and a rerecording of her 1994 Christmas song "All I Want for Christmas is You."
The sixth full-length studio release for the rap group was executive produced by RZA and is its first in seven years.
The third full-length release from the now Northern-California-based singer-songwriter was produced by Benny Sagittarius and Clams Casino.
This is the second release for the Canadian indie rock duo of Tom Dobrzanski and Zach Gray.
This is the second album for the artist under the Matthew Herbert Big Band name.
The 11th full-length studio release for the experimental pop band is an audiovisual album developed in collaboration with Coral Morphologic and is its first without Panda Bear.
Sean Tillmann's fifth full-length release was co-produced with Jim Eno and recorded with a full band.
Alexis Taylor of Hot Chip fame leads this group of innovative, improvisational electro-pop on their second release.
The third album for the Atlanta, Georgia singer features guest appearances by Missy Elliot, Justin Timberlake, The-Dream, Ludacris, Chris Brown, and Young Jeezy.
The second full-length release for the Chicago quintet includes production from Dave Sitek, Chris Coady, and Jim Abbiss.
The singer's second solo disc includes six tracks co-written with Linda Perry as well as a cover of Don Henley's "Dirty Laundry."

recordname: The Adventures Of Ghosthorse And Stillborn
description: The experimental folk-rock duo of Brooklyn-based sisters Sierra and Bianca Casady return with a third album.

recordname: Talking To You, Talking To Me
description: Hailing from Los Angeles by way of Kentucky, Chandra and Leigh Watson--aka the Watson Twins--follow up 2008's "Fire Songs" with "Talking to You, Talking to Me." It features members of Everest and My Morning Jacket's Bo Koster.
Chris Thomas (U2, Pulp) produced this brief, self-titled follow up to the Johnny Borrell-led band's 2004 debut 'Up All Night.'
The band's first major release since 1996's 'Factory Showroom' features 17 new recordings (including some songs that originally appeared on 1999's self-released 'Long Tall Weekend.').
This is the major-label debut for the San Francisco adult alternative band.
A thematic departure from his 2004 double album, TP.3 includes appearances from Snoop Dogg, The Game, Twista and Nivea.
Marc Bianchi's latest album of electronica-infused indie-pop was recorded in "extreme isolation" in California.
This is the first and final album for the DJ/producing duo of Vita Deluca and Stephen Fasano. Aeroplane became a solo project for Deluca after Fasano's amicable departure in June.
The Beatle was commissioned by the New York City Ballet to compose the score for the romance between a water princess and a land-based prince.
No, it's not a folk album, but Westerberg does handle all of the instruments himself on this latest solo release. (We suppose that it's hard to find replacements for The Replacements.)
The French-based sister duo releases its first album on Sub Pop records after the previous three were released by Touch and Go Records.
The Florida rapper's sophomore album includes guest appearances by Jay-Z, R. Kkelly, Nelly, Lil Wayne, and T-Pain.
Don Gilmore returns to produce the fourth studio release from the Welsh metal band.
The former frontman of Simply Red pays tribute to American 1960s soul music with this 12-track covers release.
The second full-length album for the group led by Dhani Harrison features guest appearances from Ben Harper, The Black Knights, Throunn Antonia, Holly Marilyn, and RZA.
The UK metal legends return to their roots on their ninth album, which takes a dark mythic tale of demons and doom and turns it into haunting black metal musical configurations.
Alan Moulder produces the British alternative rock trio's second album.

The rapper's 12th studio album (released five days early to Samsung mobile device owners via an app) features Rick Ross, Justin Timberlake, Beyonce Knowles, and Frank Ocean, with production from Timbaland, Jerome "J-Roc" Harmon, and others.
Yes, this is indeed LL Cool J's tenth album, which includes guest appearances from P. Diddy, Amerie, and Dru Hill, and production from The Neptunes and Trackmasters.
This is the third album for the now-23-year-old singer (and former Cinderella). Rodney Jerkins handles most of the production chores on this 17-track disc.

The fifth album for Pennsylvania alt-rockers features a guest appearance from Tricky. "Forever May Not Be Long Enough," the theme song from this summer's "The Mummy Returns," also appears on the album.
The ninth studio album from the rapper features special guests such as Drake, T-Pain, and Rick Ross.
The R&B singer's first album in three years was produced by Missy Elliott.
The eighth full-length studio release for the Scottish rock band features a guest appearance by Josephine Oniyama.
The 13th full-length studio release for the R&B artist features guest appearances from his 17-year-old daughter Ariirayé, Jhené Aiko, Jeremih, Juicy J, Lil Wayne, Tinashe, and Ty Dolla $ign.
The eighth studio album for the Welsh rock band was produced by Chris Sheldon and lead singer Grant Nicholas.
Carly Simon releases her latest album on the Starbuck's new music label, Hear Music.
The Black Eyed Peas member releases his third solo album, which features Snoop Dogg on one track.
Omaha, Nebraska multi-instrumentalist Joe Knapp returns with his second Son, Ambulance full-length, now backed by a full band.

The legendary Brazilian artist makes a Santana-style comeback for his first album in eight years, teaming with the Black Eyed Peas' will.i.am and a variety of pop, hip-hop and R&B stars, including Erykah Badu, Justin Timberlake, Jill Scott, Black Though, John Legend and more.
Brendan O'Brien produced this third release for the Chris Cornell-led band.
This is the full-length debut collaboration between Dresden Dolls' Amanda Palmer and The Legendary Pink Dots' Edward Ka-Spel.
The third album for the R&B artist features a guest appearance by Lil Wayne.
Martin Gore and members of The Libertines guest on the electro-pop duo's second effort.

recordname: You Gotta Go There To Come Back
description: The Welsh band self-produced this fourth studio album.
Madonna's second collaboration with French electronic producer Mirwais includes the lead single title track as well as her recent James Bond theme, "Die Another Day."
The London-based electronica duo move toward a darker, dirtier, more electroclash-oriented sound on this third studio album.

This is the debut solo release for former Jane's Addiction/Porno For Pyros frontman Perry Farrell. Many of the tracks are more electronic in nature than his previous output with the two bands. Dave Navarro, Jon Brion, and the Mad Professor are among the guest contributors.

The seventh full-length studio release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Rik Simpson and Stargate with guest appearances from Beyoncé, Merry Clayton, Noel Gallagher, Tove Lo, Gwyneth Paltrow, and Annabelle Wallis.
The second full-length release for the Brooklyn synth-pop band led by Josh Kolenik was self-produced.
The first album on the Universal Motown label for the rapper features guest artists such as Lil Wayne, Jadakiss, T. Pain, Pharell, Akon, T.I., Estelle, Mary J Blige, J. Foxx, J. Legend, and Common.

recordname: Love Hate And Then There's You
description: The third studio album for the band is its first on the Majordomo label.
The multiple-award winning singer-songwriter works with producer John Shanks on her latest album, which also features vocals from Joss Stone and Natasha Bedingfield.
The first full-length album for the punk pop rock band that includes members from the indie pop band Magic Bullets.

The fourth full-length studio release for the Disney actress/singer is her first as a solo artist and includes contributions from The Cataracs, Desmond Child, Ester Dean, Mike Del Rio, Dreamlab, David Jost, The Monsters and the Strangerz, Rock Mafia, and Stargate.
The fourth album for the California-born artist features solo piano pieces.
The 11th full-length solo release for the British indie rock singer-songwriter was produced by Joe Chiccarelli.
The sixth full-length release from French filmmaker/electronic producer Quentin Dupieux features guest appearances from Boys Noize, Charli XCX, Mocky, Peaches, Phra, Siriusmo, Skrillex, and Tetanos.

The third album for the radio-friendly San Francisco-based alt-rockers is almost a concept album about breaking up with Charlize Theron, which--lest you think the band was getting wacky all of a sudden--band leader Stephan Jenkins actually did do recently.

recordname: Deathsentences of the Polished & Structurally Weak
description: Part book, part CD, this latest effort from the Bay Area collective was inspired by a trip to an auto junkyard. The jokes, satire, and subversion found in previous releases is absent this time around, instead replaced by a collection of letters and writings found in the auto wrecks presented in a 64-page full-color book, and, on the CD, a lyric- and melody- free noise assault that, as the band suggests, is the sound of their studio being destroyed in a car crash.
This is the second full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Harry Koisser.
Produced by Mark Verbos, the second full-length release for Shaun Kilfoyle became a solo project after Amalie Bruun left to join Ex Cops.
Sexual themes continue to dominate the third release for the Detroit producer/photographer/electronic artist.
The debut from the Pittsburgh rapper features the biggest-selling hip-hop single of 2010, Black and Yellow--a track that became the unofficial anthem for the Steelers in Super Bowl XLV.
The seventh full-length studio release for the R&B singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Jhené Aiko, Camper, Gary Clark Jr., Koffee, and Rapsody

The 11th full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from 070 Shake, 21 Savage, J Balvin, Beyoncé, Justin Bieber, Big Sean, Buju Banton, Chance the Rapper, Chris Brown, Cardi B, Future, Gunna, Jay-Z, Jeremih, Jeezy, John Legend, Lil Wayne, Lil Baby, Mavado, Meek Mill, Nas, Nipsey Hussle, Post Malone, Quavo, Rick Ross, Travis Scott, Sizzla, and SZA.
The third full-length release for the indie rock project from Stina Tweeddale was produced by John Congleton.
The first acoustic album for the Scottish rock band features a guest appearances from KT Tunstall.

The 11th full-length studio release for the British pop singer features songs written with such artists as Brandon Flowers, Serge Gainsbourg, Jewel, The Killers' Dave Keuning, Ed Sheeran, and Rufus Wainwright.
Janet Jackson, Nate Dogg and R. Kelly guest on the St. Louis rapper's second album.
Originally self-released in March 2003, 'Land Air Sea' returns in 2004 in a resequenced and remixed version (on Epitaph) for this side project from members of Weezer and Rocket From The Crypt.

The Detroit hip-hop trio returns with a sophomore LP, following a well-received 2000 debut album. Founding member Jay Dee is no longer with the group (and has been replaced by rapper Elzhi), although he guest produces three tracks.
The singer-songwriter's third album contains 12 new studio tracks and two bonus live tracks.
Redman's long-delayed fifth album was produced by Erick Sermon and features 23 new tracks. Guests include George Clinton, Missy "Misdemeanor" Elliott, Method Man, and Scarface.
This is the third full-length for the Brooklyn, New York, indie-rock band.
The first release in 12 years for the Washington DC rock quartet led by Travis Morrison was produced by the band's guitarist, Jason Caddell.
The sixth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Brian Higgins.

recordname: Something for the Rest of Us
description: The Goo Goo Dolls worked with several producers--including Butch Vig, Tim Palmer, John Fields, and Rob Cavallo--on the ninth studio album for the rock band from Buffalo, New York.
Young Jeezy and the Three 6 Mafia guest on the R&B singer's third album.
'New Danger' is the second solo hip-hop album (and Geffen debut) for the rapper and actor.
The fifth studio release for the rock band was produced by Ben H. Allen III and is its first without Nick Hodgson who left in December 2012 (Vijay Mistry takes over on drums).
The second release with new lead singer Duncan Campbell for the reggae band includes covers of country classics as well as five original tracks.
The sixth full-length release for the Seattle rock band is its first in over five years and its debut on the Kill Rock Stars label.
Stephen Street produces the first album for the Irish rock band since 2001's Wake Up and Smell the Coffee.
This is the debut album for the rock band formed by three members of New Order, Jake Evans, and Blur's Alex James appears as a guest.
Sid 'n Susie (Matthew Sweet and Susanna Hoffs) team up together once again to cover the music of the 1970s.
Rob Halford leads the metal band's latest release, a concept album based on the prophet Nostradamus.
The sophomore album for MTV's "Making the Band 3" group features Missy Elliot on one track.
The second album from the UK duo.

recordname: Everyday I Said A Prayer For Kathy And Made A One Inch Square
description: The Massachusetts band--now down to the duo of Scott Levesque (vocals, guitars) and Brendan Harney (drums)--returns with their first album in four years.
This is the artist/producer's first solo album in six years. Finley Quaye and the Sugababes guest.
This is the fourth album from the successful West Coast rapper.
Released after a string of successful singles and albums (including 2000's 'Rule 3:36' LP), 'Pain Is Love' features contributions from Jennifer Lopez, Missy Elliott, and 2Pac.

Originally due in August 2001, Mariah Carey's debut for Virgin Records was delayed due to the singer's recent hospitalization, stemming from a nervous breakdown. It is her first album since 1999's 'Rainbow,' and it serves as the soundtrack to the movie of the same name (a 1980s period-piece also starring Carey). The disc includes two covers: "I Didn't Mean To Turn You On" and "Last Night a DJ Saved My Life."
The fourth full-length studio release for the British folk rock band was produced by Paul Epworth.
The fourth release for Brooklyn duo was self-produced and recorded in their former apartment in New York.
The album of songs that grew from unused demos from his previous works was produced by Ade Fenton.

The debut full-length release for the British quartet known for its fusion of classical and electronic music features guest appearance from artists such as Jess Glynne, Love Ssega, Stylo G, and Elisabeth Troy.

The second full-length release for the hip hop duo features guest appearances from such artists as Anderson .Paak, Leon Bridges, Chance The Rapper, DJ Premier, Idris Elba, KRS-One, Kool Moe Dee, and Ed Sheeran.
The third album for the Athens, Georgia rock band was produced with Ben Allen and features new bassist Tim Deaux.
The debut full-length release for the Grammy-winning electronic artist includes guest appearances from Chance the Rapper, Diplo, Ragga Twins, and Alvin Risk.
Written while serving his nearly year-long stint in federal prison, the Atlanta rappers seventh studio album features contributions from Kanye West, Drake and others stars.
The eighth studio album from Marilyn Manson was produced with Chris Vrenna.
The (we hope) ironically-titled 'America's Sweetheart' marks the solo debut for the former Hole leader, who co-wrote this album with Linda Perry and Elton John lyricist Bernie Taupin.

The Depeche Mode songwriter's second solo album is just like his first (1989's 'Counterfeit'): all covers. Here, he tackles Brian Eno's "By This River," The Velvet Underground's "Candy Says" (oh my), Nick Cave's "In My Time of Dying," Iggy Pop's "Tiny Girls," and seven other works by your favorite artists.
The newly-reformed Teddy Riley creation returns with its fourth album.

The Glasgow band's fifth album serves as the soundtrack to the Todd Solondz film of the same name--in theory, that is, as only a few minutes of this new material is actually used in the movie (in fact, much of the album was recorded after the movie was released). However, as with a typical soundtrack album, expect snatches of dialogue and numerous instrumental tracks interspersed with fully-developed songs.
This is the U.K. rapper's second album.
The debut album for Perry Farrell's new band includes contributions from Peter Hook, Fergie, Thievery Corporation, Flea and John Frusciante.
The Canadian band's latest includes two originals and nine covers, including versions of songs by U2, Bob Dylan and Bruce Springsteen.
The fifth full-length release for the British indie pop band led by Luke Pritchard was produced by Brandon Friesen and Chris Seefried.
The latest release from the Canadian electronic producer features guest appearances from Cypress Hill, Wolfgang Gartner, Imogen Heap, Chris James, and Gerard Way of My Chemical Romance.
The Swedish post-rock band blends ambient melodies with orchestral-like arrangements on its third release.
Ringo returns to Capitol Records to work with long-time producer Mark Hudson. But after a falling out, David A. Stewart, formerly of the Eurythmics, ends up finishing the record.
This is the debut LP for the Toronto indie-rap collective (excuse us, the "positive hardcore dance-rap band") led by Matt Collins.

The fourth studio release for the British singer-songwriter was co-produced with her brother Rolo Armstrong and includes contributions from such artists as Brian Eno, Greg Kurstin, Kendrick Lamar, and Rick Nowels.
The third full-length release for the British indie singer-songwriter features three songs co-produced with Jacknife Lee.
This debut album is the collaboration between Ben Chasny of Six Organs of Admittance and Elisa Ambrogio of Magik Markers.

The first full-length solo release for the Wu-Tang rapper in nine years features guest appearances from Carlton Fisk, Donny Cacsh, Chedda Bang, Dro Pesci, Eazy Get Rite, Hanz On, Hue Huf, Inspectah Deck, iNTeLL, Kash Verrazano, Killa Sin, Masta Killa, Mack Wilds, Raekwon, Redman, Streetlife, and Uncle Murda.
The emo-pop-punk-with-violin outfit expands their sound for their second major-label release. The Dixie Chicks' Natalie Maines guests.
The UK singer-songwriter releases her fifth studio album of soulful songs, produced by Dave Stewart.
The Los Angeles quintet release their second album of indie folk rock.
Produced by Dennis Herring, the third studio release for the New York indie band shows a more synth pop sound on its first album without cellist Alexandra Lawn.
The fifth album for the Los Angeles-based rock band was produced by Rod Cervera.
This is the debut album for the Manchester quartet.

Now together over 20 years as a band, the duo of Johns (Linnel and Flansburgh) return with their 10th studio album (their first for adults in three years), reuniting with producer Pat Dillett (who worked on the pair's 1990 album 'Flood').
The fourth full-length studio release for the Las Vegas rock band features production from Alex Da Kid, John Hill, Joel Little, Mattman & Robin, Jorgen Odegard, and Ido Zmishlany.
The rapper-turned-actor-turned-rapper's first album in six years features contributions from Scott Storch, Swizz Beatz and Snoop Dogg.

The second release since the Brazilian psychedelic band reunited under original guitarist Sergio Dias in 2006, features a different lineup (Ani Cordero and Amy Crawford replaced Dinho Leme and Henrique Peters) than the one seen on 2009's Haih Or Amortecedor.
This is the second full-length release for the British electro-pop duo of Theo Hutchcraft and Adam Anderson.
This is the debut full-length release for the London-based dubstep quartet.
The latest album for the Welsh rock band was produced with Jim Abbiss.
The second solo album for Asa Osborne, the Lungfish guitarist, was recorded in his house on cassette tape.

Alison Mosshart (The Kills), Warren Ellis (Nick Cave & the Bad Seeds), and Will Sergeant (Echo and the Bunnymen) guest on the band's first album in four years, which ditches the aggressive, electronic elements of their previous two outings in favor of a more traditional blues-rock homage.
This is the third album for the alt-metal band fronted by David Draiman.
The Detroit rapper returns with his first album in five years, which features guest appearances by 50 Cent and producer Dr. Dre.
The second solo effort for the Stone Temple Pilots singer was produced with Doug Green and Steve Albini.
This is the Liverpool trio's second album of eccentric indie rock.
The debut full-length album for the British synth-pop band led by producer Guy Connelly.
This is the first full-length album in over 25 years for the all-girl punk rock band.
The fourth album from the Bay Area indie rockers (led by singer-guitarist Carlos Forster) is their first in three years.
The London-based collective is joined this time out by the likes of Simon Raymonde (Cocteau Twins), John Grant (The Czars) and Paul Anderson (Tram).
This is the first new album in three years for the country superstar.
The rap artist releases his first solo album in ten years.
The American Idol contestant returns with his band's follow-up to its Grammy-nominated self-titled debut.
This is the debut LP for the Atlanta-based singer best known for his work with OutKast and as a member of the Organized Noize crew.
The fourth album for Henry Binns and Sam Hardaker features a new singer, Eska Mtungwazi (longtime contributor Sia has branched off to her own solo career).
The Smashing Pumpkins/Zwan leader's solo debut includes a cover of the Bee Gees' "To Love Somebody." Jimmy Chamberlin and Robert Smith guest.
The latest album for the indie rock band was produced by Youth.
Some of the third studio album for the former star of Sonny With A Chance and the Camp Rock movies was recorded after she sought treatment for self-harm and bulimia.
The Brazilian band releases their third album of party pop and electronic rock.

The third full-length studio release for the British/Irish pop quintet is said to be more "rockier" and features songs written by the band as well as with such artists as Tom Fletcher, Danny Jones & Dougie Poynter of McFly, Jacknife Lee, Gary Lightbody of Snow Patrol, and Ryan Tedder of OneRepublic.
The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was influenced in part by his marriage, the birth of his daughter and the death of a friend.
The British rock band releases its EP featuring K'Naan and Tigarah as guest artists, as well as one song with the band's Tim Rice-Oxley on lead vocals.

recordname: In This Light & On This Evening
description: The third album for the British rock band was produced by Flood.
The second album for the "X Factor" winner features production help from a variety of people including Justin Timberlake, Ryan Tedder, John Shanks, and Max Martin.

recordname: The Deadbeat Bang of Heartbreak City
description: The fourth full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock band led by James Alex features contributions from former Replacements bassist Tommy Stinson.
The debut full-length album for Philadelphia-based rapper who is also involved with the groups Spank Rock and Sweatheart.

The debut full-length release (not to be confused with herr 2014 EP of the same name) for the pop singer-songwriter who gained fame with her single "All About That Bass," features guest appearances from John Legend and Shy Carter (on the deluxe edition).
The funky and soul-filled Welsh singer's second album blends soft ballads with upbeat pop tracks, revealing a range of influences from the retro 1960's to modern day disco sounds.
The second release for the band led by Liam Gallagher was produced by Dave Sitek.
The California-born singer's follow-up to his 2006 record was produced by No Doubt guitarist Tom Dumont.

recordname: Remind Me Where The Light Is
description: The second album for the Los Angeles indie-rock duo was produced with Michael Patterson and Nic Jodoin.
The duo of D.A. Wallach and Max Drummey release their debut album on Pharrell Williams' label after a bidding war by Kanye West's and Jermaine Dupri's own labels.
The typically prolific Black returns with a 27-song, two-disc set produced by Jon Tiven. Among the many musicians lending a hand are Spooner Oldham and Levon Helm (The Band).
The debut release for the Liverpool-based singer-songwriter was self-produced.
The second full-length release for the Orange County psych-rock band was produced by Hanni El Khatib and Johnny Bell of Crystal Antlers.
The third full-length release from the Manchester indie rock band adds dance elements to their sound.
The indie pop band from San Francisco releases another album of catchy, lo-fi tunes.
The debut album for the Swedish all-girl indie pop band.
The Northern California alt-metal band returns with a third album.

Known as the frontman for Las Vegas-based rock group, The Killers, Brandon Flowers ventures out on his own with a solo debut that sounds achingly similar to the melodic, Vegas-themed music of his band but with a more self-conscious approach.
The debut album for the Scottish-born musician, who most recently worked on Kylie Minogue's comeback album.
Produced by Stephen Street, the third full-length studio release from the indie rock band led by Pete Doherty is its first release since 2007's Shotter's Nation.
This is the second studio full-length album for the New York collective.
Seal sings some classic soul songs on his sixth album produced by David Foster.
The debut full-length album for the Los Angeles-based indie duo of Asa Taccone (co-writer/producer of "Dick in a Box") and Matthew Compton was produced by Danger Mouse.
The third full-length release for the Swedish indie-pop quartet is its first in five years and was produced with Daniel Lissvik.
Joe Jackson tribute album to Duke Ellington includes guest appearances by such artists as Iggy Pop, Sharon Jones, Regina Carter, ?uestlove, Christian McBride, and Steve Vai.

recordname: You Have No Idea What You're Getting Yourself Into
description: This is the debut album for the electronic rock quartet from Reading, England.
This is the singer-songwriter's first album with new backing band The Lonely Astronauts.

Attempting to duplicate the unexpected mega-success of 1999's 'Supernatural,' the rock veteran returns with the formula intact, loading this disc with numerous guests from various musical genres to appeal to as many potential fans as possible. The list of contributors reads like the introductions to some televised awards show: Michelle Branch, Nickelback's Chad Kroeger, Seal, Macy Gray, Musiq, Placido Domingo, Ozomatli, Dido and P.O.D. (What, no Ozzy Osbourne?)
Following 2000's 'We Love The City,' the self-produced 'Dead Media' is the UK band's fifth album in just four years.
The fifth full-length solo release for the British rock artist was produced with Jon Kelly and Emre Ramazanoglu.
The seventh full-length release for the Chicago pop-punk band features a guest appearance from Burna Boy.
The fifth full-length release for the Danish project of Jannis Noya Makrigiannis features a variety of influences including Danish pop, hip-hop, R&B, and techno.
The sixth full-length release for the R&B singer features guest appearances form 2 Chainz, Kendrick Lamar, Pharrell, and T.I.
The Smashing Pumpkins return from a seven year hiatus with their latest album. Best Buy, Target, and iTunes will each have CDs with different tracks from those available at other retailers.
This is the second album for the duo of Emma Anderson (Lush) and Lisa O'Neill. Mark Van Hoen returns as producer.

recordname: With a Little Help from My Fwends
description: The Wayne Coyne-led band covers The Beatles' 1967 album Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band, with guest appearances from such artists as Julianna Barwick, Black Pus, Miley Cyrus, Dr. Dog, Electric Würms, Foxygen, J Mascis, Moby, My Morning Jacket, Phantogram, and Tegan and Sara.
The second release from the British indie dance trio includes influences from R&B and hip hip.
This fifth album for the Brit rockers was produced by Youth.
The Danish group returns with its second album on new label Polydor.
The Azure Ray singer self-produced her fourth solo album.

The third album for the Los Angeles-based electronica duo of Ken Jordan and Scott Kirkland includes guest appearances by Wes Borland (Limp Bizkit), Lisa Vennum-Kekaula (The BellRays), Jon Brion and Milla Jovovich.

They may not be easy to look up in search engines, but this very-much-rock quartet from Leeds, England could be found in all the UK music magazines, thanks to a much sought-after EP and this debut album.
This is Iggy Pop's first album since 1999's poorly-received 'Avenue B.'
The sixth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles rock band led by Adam Levine features guest appearances from ASAP Rocky, LunchMoney Lewis, Julia Michaels, and SZA.
The debut album for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Diplo and Switch.
Postponed from its October 2014 release due to pneumonia, the 12th full-length studio release from the Canadian jazz singer features songs that inspired her and was produced by David Foster.
The debut album for the Scottish alternative folk band was produced by Thomas McNeice (they originally worked with Jim Abbiss).
The debut album for the for the "American Idol" finalist features Ludacris, T-Pain, and Fantasia as guests.
The debut full-length album for the Pittsburgh rapper follows the release of his 2010 mixtap K.I.D.S.
The Utah emo band's third disc is their first since the departure of drummer Branden Steineckert.
The fifth full-length for the Welsh metal band was produced by Carl Bown and Colin Richardson
The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter who won the 2015 Brits Critics' Choice award was produced by Jacquire King.

The latest full-length release for Atlanta rapper 2 Chainz features guest appearances from 42 Dugg, Beatking, Jacquees, Swae Lee, Lil Baby, Lil Durk, Major Myjah, Moneybagg Yo, Roddy Ricch, Sleepy Rose, Stove God Cooks, Symba, and YoungBoy Never Broke Again.
The debut album by actress Scarlett Johansson was produced by TV on the Radio's Dave Sitek.
Mike Patton's latest solo album is a tribute to Luciano Berio's Laborintus II, created in 1965 to celebrate the 700th anniversary of the birth of Dante's Alighieri.
The second album from the alternative rock band from Glasgow was produced by Flood.
The Toronto duo's latest album feature guests such as E-40, Ghostface Killah, and John Legend.

The 12th full-length studio release for the hip-hop artist features guest appearances 21 Savage, A Boogie Wit da Hoodie, Justin Bieber, Big Sean, Bounty Killer, Buju Banton, Capleton, Cardi B, DaBaby, Drake, James Fauntleroy, H.E.R., Jay-Z, Jeremih, Lil Baby, Lil Durk, Lil Wayne, Meek Mill, Megan Thee Stallion, Migos, Nas, Post Malone,, Puff Daddy, Roddy Ricch, Rick Ross, Bryson Tiller, and Justin Timberlake.
The Libertines/Dirty Pretty Things singer releases his debut solo album.
The fifth full-length release for the Canadian country singer-songwriter is her first studio album in 15 years.
The third full-length studio release for the British indie rock band was inspired by trips to Los Angeles.
The 15th and final full-length studio release from the British rock band features unreleased music from its 1993 Division Bell sessions.
Also known as the Dirty Dozen, D-12 consists of six (yes--we know that's not a dozen) Detroit-based rappers, including Eminem. 'Devil's Night' is their debut full-length, produced in part by Dr. Dre.
The seven-track release for the New York rap artist was produced by Kanye West.
The live album features a recording of Squarepusher's September 2007 performance in Paris' Cite de la Musique, where he used only a bass and a small amp.
This is the debut full-length electronic release for guitarist Rob McAndrews, best known for his work with James Blake.
The third full-length release for the British indie trio features production from Erol Alkan, Gorgon City, James Murphy, and Tom Rowlands of The Chemical Brothers.
The British dubstep and grime producer Liam McLean releases his full-length debut on the 4AD label.
The debut album for the British rock band led by Dan Devine includes influences from heavy metal and hard rock bands.
The band led by Kimya Dawson and Jeffrey Lewis releases its first album, which features songs they wrote for a compilation released in 2002.

Oops, she did it a third time. The Pepsi spokesperson's third LP features 12 new tracks produced by the likes of Rodney Jerkins, Max Martin and the Neptunes, including a cover of Joan Jett's "I Love Rock N Roll."
The sixth full-length studio release for the pop singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Dolly Parton.
The first studio album in four years for the British rock band was produced with John McLaughlin and Simon Perry.
The sixth full-length studio release for the pop artist includes contributions from The Monsters & Strangerz, Charlie Puth, and Stargate.
The debut full-length release for the New York-based band led by Welsh native Matt Hitt includes three songs from its 2013 EP, Between Us Girls.
This is the debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter who won the 2013 BRITs Critic Choice Award.
The former pop singer goes country on her latest album, produced by Brett James and John Shanks.
The debut album for the Israel-born singer/songwriter creates beats with the help of effects pedals and the guitar.
The hardcore rapper returns with his fifth studio album, hoping to duplicate the #1 success of each of his four previous LPs.
The sophomore LP for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter is similar in sound to his 2001 debut 'Musicforthemorningafter.'

recordauthor: I Am The World Trade Center
description: The synth-pop duo of Amy Dykes (vocals) and Dan Geller (music) are best known for two things: (1) recording all of their music on a laptop computer, and (2) well, their name, which (understandably) attracted some attention post-September 11 and was briefly changed and then restored. This is the band's second full-length release, and includes covers of the Stone Roses' "Shoot You Down" and Blondie's "Call Me."
This is the fifth album for the UK outfit, led by Stevie Wonder soundalike Jason Kay.
Ian Brown's fifth album features Sinead O'Connor, Sex Pistols Paul Cook and Steve Jones, Happy Mondays' Paul Ryder, and The Smiths' Andy Rourke.
The full-length debut release for indie rock singer-songwriter Dan Smith includes influences from folk, hip-hop, indie, and pop music.
The mellow singer-songwriter re-teams with producer Mario Caldato Jr. for this follow-up to 'On And On.'
This live set from the neo-prog outfit was recorded on the road between May 2004 and May 2005.
The seventh full-length studio release for the Chicago heavy metal band led by David Draiman was produced by Kevin Churko.
The debut full-length release from the British indie pop trio was produced by Luke Smith [Ed Macfarlane of Friendly Fires produced "Tonight"].
The seventh album for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Brandy, Mary J. Blige, and Wale.
This is the second album for the 80s New Wave-influenced outfit fronted by Shawn Christensen.
The second full-length release for the indie pop band led by Mark Foster was produced by Paul Epworth.

A bit more "rock" than her older sister Jessica, the 19-year-old former ("7th Heaven") and current (her own MTV reality show) TV star makes her recording debut with these 11 tracks produced by John Shanks.
The third full-length studio release for the producer-rapper features guest appearances from A$AP Rocky, Michael Bolton, Haim, Father John Misty, King Chip, Kendrick Lamar, RZA, and Too Short.

The sixth album for the Northern Ireland alternative rock band was recorded in California and features Lissie, R.E.M.'s Michael Stipe, and Queens Of The Stone Age guitarist, Troy Van Leeuwen as guests.

recordname: Live: Uurop VIII-XII/Places in Sun & Winter, Son
description: The 12th live release for the band contains tracks from its European tours between 2008-2012.
The latest album from the British metal band and its first on Roadrunner Records.

Legendary producer/remixer/DJ Paul Oakenfold (Happy Mondays, Perfecto Records) has finally gotten around to releasing an album as an artist. Vocals on this 11-track set come from the likes of Hunter S. Thompson, Nelly Furtado, Tricky, Perry Farrell, Grant Lee Phillips, and Emiliana Torrini.
The first release from the D.C. band since they became the first group signed to Marilyn Manson's Posthuman Records. Includes a cover of the Beatles' "Eleanor Rigby."
There's at least one guest vocalist on each of the 18 tracks on this latest solo outing from electronic producer Roni Size.
Twiggy Ramirez returns to the band on its seventh studio album, produced with Sean Beavan and Chris Vrenna.
Known as "Baby Timberlake," this Duke University student is a pop singer who stands on his own, going from a dorm-room mixtape to potential stardom with his new album.
A divorce and two-year break left Lavigne with plenty to ponder, and her newest album is one of her most personal and introspective albums to date.
The debut album for the indie rock band from California was produced with Joe Chiccarelli.
The latest album for the Chris Carrabba-led band was produced by Butch Walker and Adam Schlesinger.
The second collection of unreleased tracks from the rapper's last four albums features guest appearances from Keyon Harrold, Al Jarreau, J. Myers, David Ranier, RaVaughn and Swizz Beatz.
The second full-length release for the R&B artist features guest appearances from John Mayer and SAFE.
The rapper's first album in two years includes appearances by Eminem, Justin Timberlake, and Mary J. Blige and production from Timbaland and Dr. Dre.
The fifth full-length release for the British band led by Crispian Mill is its first in six years.
Produced by Andy Wright, Mick Hucknall returns with the 11th studio album for the British soul-pop band.
This is the first release in eight years for the British indie rock band led by Danny McNamara.
Produced by Guy Chambers, the swing covers and duets album from the British pop singer features guest appearances from Lily Allen, Michael Bublé, Kelly Clarkson, Olly Murs, and Rufus Wainwright.
The second release for the British trio influenced by Spanish, Mexican, and African music was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.
This is the first album in more than a decade for the English trio.
The first studio album in nearly 10 years for the Grammy winner features Imelda May, Olivia Safe, and Joss Stone as guest singers.
The American Idol runner-up releases his debut album.
The sophomore album for the indie rock band from England headed up by ex-Libertines guitarist Carl Barat.
This double-disc live set was recorded during the band's 2005 world tour.

recordname: A Hyperactive Workout For The Flying Squad
description: The seventh album for the British rockers includes appearances by Jools Holland and Paul Weller.

The surprise release from the alternative rock band that includes covers of songs made famous by a-ha, Black Sabbath, Electric Light Orchestra, The Eurythmics, Michael Jackson, Ben E. King, Tears For Fears, TLC, Toto, and The Turtles.
The second album for the German electronic duo features a track co-written by Julian Casablancas of The Strokes.
The singer's second solo set features production work by Nellee Hooper, The Neptunes, Swizz Beatz and Dave Stewart.
The third full-length release for the Utah band was influenced by the therapy sessions of lead singer, Tyler Glenn.
The legendary rapper's release is his self-proclaimed sequel to his 1993 debut, Doggystyle, and features a slew of guest artists, from Kanye West to Willie Nelson.
The Detroit band returns with a second album.
The Irish quartet returns with their first studio disc in four years, which sees them working with producer Olle Romo for the first time. Ladysmith Black Mambazo guest on the title track.
The Eminem-led collective (whose 2001 debut was a huge commercial success) returns with a second full-length, with production from the likes of Dr. Dre, Mr. Porter, Eminem and Kanye West.
Voodoo Child is the electronic dance music alter-ego for Moby, and this is his first full album under that name, after a series of singles released during the 1990s.
This is the third album for the Los Angeles alt-rock trio led by singer Max Collins (who lately is best known for an indecent exposure incident in a Pittsburgh hotel lobby).
Professional surfer-turned-rocker Jack Johnson returns with his second LP of mellow alt-rock.

This is the first album in over three years (and first for new US label Emperor Norton) for the all-girl Japanese indie-electronic-rock-pop outfit. Money Mark and John McEntire make appearances here, although Cornelius does not.
The rap duo from Oakland, California releases its latest album on the Gold Dust Media label.
Steve Lillywhite produced this second album for the singer-songwriter.
The third album for the Grammy-winning singer/producer features guest appearances by Lil Wayne, T-Pain, Young Jeezy, and Wyclef Jean.
The Killers' drummer Ronnie Vannucci releases a solo album.
JJ Cale, Chaka Khan Paul McCartney, and Steve Winwood guest on the British singer/guitarist's covers album that includes two original songs.
The fourth album from the stand-up comedian, actor, and singer features club bangers and his recognizable brand of R&B. It also guest stars Justin Timberlake, Ludacris, Soulja Boy, and others.
After a three-year hiatus, Macy Gray delivers soulful vocals, storytelling lyrics, and sparkling melodies on her latest album.

recordname: I Think We're Gonna Need A Bigger Boat
description: Norman Cook (also known as Fatboy Slim) releases his debut album under the alias The BPA.
The debut album for the duo from Manchester, England, features Kylie Minogue on one track.
The debut album for the London trio was produced by Ed Buller and Max Dingle.
The Black Eyed Peas singer's solo debut (which is produced largely by her bandmate will.i.am) includes her hit single "London Bridge."
On its 10th studio album, the West Coast nu metal band experiments with dubstep, collaborating with several on-the-rise producers, including Skrillex, Datsik, Kill the Noise, and 12th Planet.

recordname: A French Kiss In The Chaos
description: The second album for the rock band led by Jon McClure was produced by Jagz Kooner.
This is the debut album for the London-based pop-rock five-piece.
The former member of *NSync makes his solo debut with 'Schizophrenic,' working with a range of producers including Basement Jaxx.
The first album from the Manics in three years features the singles "Found That Soul" and "So Why So Sad."
The seventh full-length studio release for the emo band led by Chris Carrabba is its first in eight years.
This is the second album for the band formed in Berlin and named after the New Order song.
Andre 3000, Sean Lennon and Cee Lo guest on the first album in seven years for Canadian singer Jen-Bea Englishman.
Pavement's Scott Kannberg returns to music as Spiral Stairs after a five-year hiatus.
Art Alexakis & Co. finally return with a successor to 2000's 'Songs From An American Movie' pair of albums... but is anyone still listening?

recordname: Songs From an American Movie Vol. One: Learning How to Smile

description: The UK rockers' fifth album is the first to feature new drummer Javier Weyler.
A collaborative effort from Gucci Mane and Waka Flocka Flame falls between a mixtape and an official release.
The new solo project for the Stone Temple Pilots and Velvet Revolver singer features a new backing band called the Wildabouts.
The Jared Leto-led rock band releases its third album produced with Flood and Steve Lillywhite.

recordname: Is the World Strange or Am I Strange?
description: This is the second album for the American-born and UK-based singer-songwriter.
The British trio, known for wearing masks, releases its debut full-length album of indie dance tunes.
Occasional Saddle Creek-er Denver Dalley returns with a second Statistics album.

recordname: Korn III: Remember Who You Are
It Is Time For A Love Revolution
description: Kravitz's eighth studio album was written and produced by Lenny himself.
The second album for the California-born pop singer was produced by John Shanks and her father, Ken Caillat.
The country singer's second 2005 album is poppier than the first, although it contains just two Chesney originals.
Mos Def and the Dave Matthews Band guest on the hip-hop group's first release in four years, which finds them now working without Cut Chemist.
The singer-songwriter scrapped the original recordings for this, her sixth album, so that she could re-record them with a bit more oomph, thanks to producer Rob Cavallo (Green Day).
The debut full-length solo release for the Alt-J drummer was inspired by his life on the road with the band.
Jeff Lynne produced the first solo album in over 20 years from The Eagles' Joe Walsh.
This is the first album in over 11 years for the metal band.
Brendan O'Brien (Pearl Jam) produced this sophomore outing for the English quartet.
The fourth full-length solo release for Canadian indie R&B artist Peter Sagar was self-recorded and mixed in his apartment in Montreal.
After being pushed back several times, the sixth album for the R&B singer is finally released, featuring guest appearances from Ludacris, Nicki Minaj, T.I., and will.i.am.
The second full-length release for the Los Angeles rock quintet was produced by the band's drummer, Ryan Rabin.

recordname: When The World Was Our Friend
description: The Bay Area hip-hop producer (known to his parents as Topher Lafata) teams with vocalist Sue Cie for his second release.
The second full-length release for the rock supergroup comprised of Alice Cooper, Johnny Depp and Joe Perry features guest appearances from Jeff Beck and John Waters.
The Dutch electronic artist, known most recently for his remix of Elvis Presley's "A Little Less Conversation," releases his fifth studio album.

recordname: All Watched Over By Machines of Loving Grace
description: This is the third album for former Boo Radleys guitarist Martin Carr.
MTV darling Michelle Branch returns with an attempt to duplicate the success of her 2001 debut 'The Spirit Room' and that album's single "Everywhere," which was just that.
Scotland's Nicholas Currie (aka Momus) returns with an usual album that combines (fake) traditional folk tunes with modern electronica.
The British post-punk band's latest album title gives away the game it asks people to play with the collection of 14 rerecorded hits.
After two EPs, the dream pop of Sarah P and producer R<U+03A0><U+042F> releases its debut full-length release.
The first album in more than seven years is also the first without original keyboardist Jimmy Destri.
The Happy Mondays featured in the film "24 Hour Party People" release their first studio album since 1992

The band officially disbanded in 2002, but it's been more than 12 years since the Courtney Love-led rock band recorded "Celebrity Skin." A new lineup greets listeners as original members Eric Erlandson and Melissa Auf der Maur do not return.
This is the debut full-length pop release for Phil Jones as Dog Bite.
Broken Social Scene's Andrew Whiteman leads the indie rock trio with its third full length album.
The third album for the Swedish five-piece rock group.
The third album for the New York City-based rock band was produced by John Hill.
The Portland, Ore. band's follow-up to 'Welcome To The Monkey House' was co-produced by frontman Courtney Taylor(-Taylor) and Gregg Williams.

recordname: How to Compose Popular Songs That Will Sell
description: The fifth solo album for The Boomtown Rats singer is his first since 2001's Sex, Age & Death.
This is the second album for the guitarist-singer.
He's gone from working with Puff Daddy to working with... uh, God, but ordained minister Mase is back to the rap game (albeit with fewer references to sex and violence) after a five-year absence.
The French electronica duo's third LP is closer in sound to their first than to 2001's 'Discovery.'
The second album for the German-based band led by Kings of Convenience's Erlend Oye.

The third full-length release from the Scottish producer includes already released hit singles from Rihanna, Kelis, and Ne-Yo, as well as new tracks featuring guest artists such as Florence Welch, Dizzee Rascal, Ellie Goulding, Tinie Tempah, and Example.
The fifth studio album for the Scottish four-piece includes production work from Nigel Godrich and Brian Eno.
Lemon Jelly's Nick Franglen produced Damon Gough's fifth Badly Drawn Boy album.
From the early '80s on, this San Francisco-based band has had a slew of hits and, with the latest album, continues to experiment with vintage soul and rock.
The Houston rapper returns with his latest album, which coincidently is named Suite 420 and was released on April 20th.

The fourth full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from 50 Cent, A Boogie wit da Hoodie, Justin Bieber, Camila Cabello, Cardi B, Chance the Rapper, Dave, Eminem, H.E.R., J Hus, Khalid, Paulo Londra, Ella Mai, Bruno Mars, Meek Mill, PnB Rock, Travis Scott, Skrillex, Chris Stapleton, Stormzy, Yebba, and Young Thug.
The Matchbox 20 frontman's first solo outing includes appearances by John Mayer and Robert Randolph.
The 29th full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter follows 2013's Time with another album of originals songs (except for a cover of Steve Harley's "A Friend for Life").
Furtado's first album after a six-year absence, The Spirit Indestructible was produced by Rodney "Darkchild" Jerkins and features a cameo appearance by Nas.

Named after the setting of the 1985 film "The Goonies," 'So Long Astoria' is the major-label debut (and fourth studio LP) for the power-pop five-piece. Included here is a cover of Don Henley's "Boys of Summer."
Glen Ballard produced the band's eighth studio album.

The latest solo studio release for the Beach Boy was produced with Joe Thomas and features guest appearances from Blondie Chaplin, Peter Hollens, Mark Isham, Al Jardine, David Marks, Kacey Musgraves, Nate Ruess, Sebu Simonian, and She & Him.
The Mercury Prize-nominated singer-songwriter releases his first album on the Cooking Vinyl label.
The British rapper releases her second album on her own label, Midget Records.
Har Mar's third disc features contributions from Northern State and members of the Yeah Yeah Yeahs and was produced by John Fields (Andrew WK).
The heiress and reality television semi-star covers Rod Stewart's "Do Ya Think I'm Sexy" (answer: no) and duets with Jadakiss on her recording debut.
The third solo release for the Slaughterhouse rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Lloyd Banks, Fabolous, French Montana, Lil Wayne, Omarion, Royce Da 5'9", Twista, and Wiz Khalifa.

The first full-length studio release in nearly five years from the Canadian pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Clever, Kehlani, Lil Dicky, Post Malone, Quavo, Travis Scott, and Summer Walker.
The alternative rock band returns with its first full-length studio album in ten years.
The debut album for the band comprised of Taylor Hanson of Hanson fame, Cheap Trick's Bun E. Carlos, Fountains of Wayne's Adam Schlesinger and ex-Smashing Pumpkin James Iha.
Doughty's second studio album was produced by Dan Wilson, who cowrote songs with the Dixie Chicks.

Lou Barlow (Sebadoh) is still the heart of The Folk Implosion, but on the lo-fi band's fourth full-length release, his supporting cast has changed. Gone is co-founder and writing partner John Davis; in his place are Sebadoh drummer Russ Pollard and Alaska guitarist Imaad Wassif.
The hugely successful rapper returns with another Irv Gotti-produced effort, with guest appearances from Ashanti, Nas and Bobby Brown.

The fourth full-length studio release for the Scottish DJ/EDM producer features guest appearances from All About She, Big Sean, Ellie Goulding, Haim, Theo Hutchcraft of Hurts, John Newman, Gwen Stefani, and Tinashe.
Soundgarden's first live release was recorded during their tour for Down on the Upside, shelved until their 2010 reunion.
The covers album from the former Smiths frontman was produced by Joe Chiccarelli with guest appearances from Billie Joe Armstrong, Ed Droste, Ariel Engle, Sameer Gadhia, Petra Haden, and Lydia Night.
Yoko Ono collaborates with Sonic Youth's Kim Gordon and Thurston Moore on this avant-garde release.

The third full-length solo release for the former frontman of The Rascals features songs co-written with fellow The Last Shadow Puppets member Zach Dawes, Jamie T, Lana Del Raye, and Mini Mansions' Tyler Parkford.
The latest album for the California rock band features a guest appearance by Lil Wayne.
The third and final album from Bun B's Trill trilogy features such guests as Drake, Gucci Mane, Twista, Trey Songz, T-Pain, and Young Jeezy.
The South African trio releases its second studio album on its own label, Zef Recordz, after leaving Interscope over the direction of its music.
The first full-length solo release of original songs from the Atlanta artist in five years features a tribute to the late Robin Williams.
The tenth full-length studio release for the alt-rock band led by John Rzeznik was produced with Gregg Wattenberg, Rob Cavallo, John Shanks, and Greg Wells.
The debut full-length release for the California indie pop band includes four tracks from their 2012 self-titled EP.
The "Pimp My Ride" host returns to rapping after a two-year layoff, but without long-time producer Dr. Dre.

You may remember him as Australia's youngest rock star, but Ben Lee is a bit older (well, he's 26) and wiser (well, he's smart enough to date Claire Danes) now for his sixth album, produced (like his debut) by Brad Wood. Rilo Kiley's Jenny Lewis guests.
The second album for Marina and the Diamonds includes production from Greg Kurstin, Rick Nowels, Dr Luke, and Liam Howe.
The Chicago rapper returns with his third album of slick, electronic beats and rhythms, featuring appearances by Skylar Gray and Trey Songz.
The rapper returns to release his latest solo album after working with DJ Quik on BlaQKout.
The Christmas album from the British guitarist features one new original song and an electronic-inspired version of "Jingle Bells" dedicated to Avicii.
The latest solo studio release for the Hawaiian-based Pennsylvania producer/musician features influences from electronic, rock, and soul music.
The fifth album for the rapper includes Akon, Chris Brown, Chamillionaire, Lil Wayne, Snoop Dogg, UGK, and Yung Joc as guests.

recordname: Songs in the Key of Animals
description: The second full-length release for the North Carolina singer-songwriter was recorded over a two year period.

The Detroit rap-rocker may be feeling a bit like his album title after his previous effort, 1998's 'Devil Without a Cause,' went platinum. (Actually, he was feeling like that even before that happened.) Snoop Dogg and Sheryl Crow guest on a track apiece on this, his fifth album of new material.
The sixth-studio album from the Chicago-area rock band was produced by Ian Kirkpatrick.
This is Joe Ely's first album since 2007's Happy Songs From Rattlesnake Gulch.
This debut album for the New York-based electro-rock group is led by Heloise Williams and released on Elijah Wood's label.
Recorded over four days, the 37th full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter features Jim Keltner on drums and Paul Bushnell on bass.
Byron Gallimore and Dann Huff produced the country singer's follow-up to 2002's "Cry."
The big-selling indie emo band from Dayton, Ohio returns with a second album.
The seventh full-length studio release for the alternative rock trio was produced by Adam Noble.
The second solo disc from former Audioslave and Soundgarden frontman Cornell was produced by Steve Lillywhite and includes a cover of Michael Jackson's "Billie Jean."
The Canadian singer-songwriter returns with ten new songs, co-produced by Morissette with John Shanks and Tim Thorney.
Juliette Lewis goes solo with this record produced by Omar Rodriguez-Lopez.
The debut album for the quartet from California-based indie rockers who met at New York University was produced by Emery Dobyns.
The latest album for the rapper includes guest appearances by Lil Wayne, Pitbull, Lily Allen, Wiz Khalifa, Chris Brown, and Ne-Yo.
The fifth studio album for the Welsh hard rock band was produced by Ken Andrews.
The seventh full-length release for the Britihs R&B singer features guest appearances from Bastille, Chase & Status, JP Cooper, Goldlink, Ella Mai, and AJ Tracey.
The leader of the now-defunct Washington, D.C. outfit The Dismemberment Plan makes his solo debut with this disc, produced by Death Cab For Cutie's Chris Walla. John Vanderslice guests.
The third album for the all-girl Canadian metal band was produced by Steve Thompson (Anthrax, Korn).
Mainly consists of Spanish-language versions of the songs from her hit debut album.
This is the 10th full-length studio release for the Portland, Oregon alternative rock band.
The Southern California group's self titled is their fourth album.
The sixth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Juicy J, Rico Love, Courtney Noelle, Sebastian, Travis Scott, Chevy Woods, and Ty Dolla $ign.
The 10th studio release for the country singer features guest appearances from Emmylou Harris and Carrie Underwood.
The debut album for the new project led by Tom Morello of Rage Against the Machine/Audioslave and Boots Riley of The Coup.
The Clash's Mick Jones produced this debut LP for the new band from The Libertines' Pete Doherty.
2 Chainz, Cam'ron, Juicy J, Courtney Noelle, Pharrell, and The Weeknd guest on the second release on Atlantic Records from the Pittsburgh rapper.
Carly Simon rerecords some of her classic songs and includes two new tracks.
The pop group's fourth album features Miley Cyrus, Common, and Jonny Long.
The third full-length studio release for the indie pop band is said to be influence by psychedelic and 1960s sounds.
The fourth studio album for the Los Angeles duo features guest artists such as Jon Brion, Peter Hook, Justin Warfield, Emily Haines, and Jason Lytle.
The second full-length album for the Canadian band from Edmonton.
The Memphis rap group's latest album boasts appearances by Akon, Good Charlotte, DJ Unk, Lyfe Jennings, UGK, Al Kapone, Eightball, and MJG.
The third album for the Scottish singer sees the Britain's Got Talent winner singing contemporary songs as well as classic standards.
Rick Rubin co-produced the band's third album, which is the result of over a year spent in the studio and represents a move away from their established rap-rock sound.
Singer Adam Baker wrote, recorded, and produced his band's latest EP in its North Carolina recording studio.
'Sun' is the 13th studio disc for R.E.M., who are joined here by frequent collaborators Ken Stringfellow and Scott McCaughey. Q-Tip also guest raps on "The Outsiders."
The English quintet's debut album was produced by Bernard Butler.
The English rockers release their seventh studio album of a 15-year career spanning genres, from rock to country to blues.
The debut full-length studio release for the Australian rapper features guest appearances from Charli XCX, Mavado, Rita Ora, and T.I.
This is the debut full-length release from the duo formed by former Titus Andronicus member Amy Klein and Catherine Tung.
'The Hard Way,' co-produced by Kanye West, is the first disc for the trio of Snoop Dogg, Warren G. and Nate Dogg.
Rapper Kool Keith's ninth album (second as Dr. Dooom) was produced with KutMasta Kurt.
The third full-length release for the Los Angeles band features even more electronic influences with production from Jesse Shatkin, Joel Little and Ricky Reed.
The third full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, De La Soul, Ariana Grande, Nicki Minaj, and Lindsey Stirling.
The debut full-length release for the Scottish singer-songwriter was produced with Iain Archer and Jake Gosling.
The first album in six years for the rap group features Audioslave/Rage Against The Machine's Tom Morello and Linkin Park's Mike Shinoda as guest artists.

recordname: These Are The Good Times People
recordauthor: The Presidents Of The United States Of America
description: The first album in four years for the alternative rock band and the first with Andrew McKeag on the guitbass.
Guitarist Wasif, who has performed with alaska!, Folk Implosion and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs, makes his solo debut.
Never one for original album titles, Seal returns with just his fourth LP in his 12+ year recording career. Trevor Horn produces.
The all-girl metal band's sophomore effort (and no, we're not referring to their high school class) includes a cover of Pink Floyd's "Run Like Hell."

recordname: Live at the Mark, Tom & Travis Show (The Enema Strikes Back)

description: The debut solo album for the Velvet Revolver/ex-Guns N' Roses guitarist was produced by Eric Valentine and features guest appearances by Chris Cornell, Adam Levine, Dave Grohl, Kid Rock, Iggy Pop, and Fergie, as well as former Guns N' Roses members, Izzy Stadlin, Duff McKagan, and Steve Adler.
The first full-length studio release since 2012 for the Southern California punk band led by Dexter Holland was produced by Bob Rock.

Who are Dirty Vegas? Chances are you have heard one and only one song from this UK poptronica trio: the track "Days Go By," used as the soundtrack to an overplayed Mitsubishi car commercial. This debut album features that song (twice) and ten others which have yet to appear on the telly.
