The rock band's fourth album produced by Matt Squire, is the first with new drummer, Dan Whitesides.
The debut album for the 23-year-old rapper from the suburbs of Philadelphia.

The first of a planned trilogy of albums for the rapper features guest appearances from Big K.R.I.T., Gizzle, Victoria Monet, Rondo, Rick Ross, RXMN, Salim, Simon Sayz, Bianca Sings, Jake Torrey, and Ty Dolla $ign.
The third full-length album for the Colorado alternative rock band was produced by Brendan O'Brien.
The latest album from the rock band was produced with Chris Hansen. Three of the songs were released on the three-part The Threep EPs released between November 2009 and March 2010.
Cee Lo Green and Blake Shelton, co-judges on The Voice guest on the pop singer's latest studio release that also includes production from Alex da Kid, Jayson DeZuzio, Max Martin, and Shellback.

The debut solo release for the Spinal Tap bass player features guest appearances from Jeff "Skunk" Baxter, Gregg Bisonnette, Larry Carlton, David Crosby, Donald Fagen, Taylor Hawkins, Jim Keltner, Danny Kortchmar, Russ Kunkel, Michael League, Steve Lukather, Jane Lynch, Judith Owen, Phil X, Joe Satriani, Paul Shaffer, Chad Smith, The Snarky Puppy Horns, Steve Vai, Richard Thompson, Waddy Wachtel, Rick Wakeman, and Dweezil Zappa.
The band's sixth album is their first since the death of bassist Bobby ("Brooklyn Bob") Sheehan and serves as a tribute to him.

Feisty and futuristic, the platinum-blond pop singer's first album in four years features collaborations with Sia, Le Tigre and Ladytron, as well as other indie artists, to create a sonic landscape of sound unlike anything she's done before.

recordname: If I Kill This Thing We're All Going to Eat for a Week
description: Produced by Toshi Kasai, the debut full-length solo release for Foo Fighters/Sunny Day Real Estate bassist Nate Mendel features contributions from Sunny Day Real Estate's Jeremy Enigk, Helmet's Page Hamilton, The Head and the Heart's Josiah Johnson, Modest Mouse's Joe Plummer, and Foo Fighters' Chris Shiflett.
This is the debut album for the singer-songwriter who wrote songs for a variety of artists, such as Cassie, Danita Kane, Lil Mama, and Sean Kingston.
The second full-length release for the Australian indie quartet was produced by Dan Grech-Marguerat.

The French producer/DJ releases his fifth album which includes guest appearances from such artists as Flo Rida, Nicki Minaj, Taio Cruz, Ludacris, Usher. will.i.am, Chris Brown, Lil Wayne, Akon, Timbaland, Jennifer Hudson, Jessie J, and Sia.
the 10th full-length studio release for the folk-rock band was produced by Rick Rubin.

recordname: At The End Of Paths Taken
description: The veteran Canadian band led by songwriter Michael Timmins and singer Margo Timmins return with an 11-track disc of originals.
The artist's latest album with the band Spearhead continues his melding of hip-hop, reggae, and rock music.
With the addition of Woody Shortridge and Tak Takemura, the second release finds the band led by Phil Jones expanded to a quartet.
This collection of unreleased songs recorded by the band during the past 15 years was released the same day as the rerelease of 1996's Pinkerton.
The follow-up to the Colorado quartet's twice-platinum debut album was produced by Aaron Johnson and Mike Flynn.
The sixth studio album does not include Kevin Richardson, who left the group.
The latest album from the London electronic group features Josh Homme, Gavin Clark, Joel Cadbury, Philip Sheppard, Black Mountain, and Abel Ferrara as guest artists.
The second full-length album from the Australian indie rock band was produced by Tony Hoffer.
'Bleed' marks Shirley Manson and Butch Vig's first Garbage album since 2001. Dave Grohl guests on one track.
The witty Canadian band with a devoted fanbase is back with their first album since the poorly-received 'Maroon.' Ron Aniello (Guster, Lifehouse) produces.
The second solo effort from Blur guitarist Graham Coxon, following 1998's 'The Sky Is Too High.'
While waiting for the Strokes to return to the recording studio, bassist Nikolai Fraiture formed a side project and released this band's debut album.
This is the second album from the punk trio which features members of blink-182 (Travis Barker) and Rancid (Tim Armstrong).
This is the tenth studio release for the British rock band led by Steve Craddock.

The 22-year-old pop star's second English-language album includes 20 new tracks, most penned by Aguilera herself, although suddenly ubiquitous Linda Perry assists on four songs. Guests include Alicia Keys, Redman, and Dave Navarro.
This is the sophomore major-label release for the New England alt-metal band.
Gil Norton (Pixies) produced this debut album for the New York-based punk/new wave outfit.
The debut disc for the duo of Odd Future DJ Syd tha Kid and Matt Martians incorporates jazz, hip-hop, and R&B.
The Massachusetts nu-metal band release their seventh studio album.
Glen Ballard produced the nu-metal band's fifth album.
'Headlights' includes songs first written by Greg Dulli (Afghan Whigs, Twilight Singers) in 2002. Petra Haden guests.
The 1980s-alt-rock-influenced, Diego Garcia-led band returns with a second album.
The first new full-length release in five years for the Canadian electronic duo of Jesse F. Keeler and Al-P guest vocals from Chain And The Gang's Ian Svenonius.
The fifth full-length release for the Los Angeles rock band features a guest appearance from Gwen Stefani.
The latest full-length release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Max Martin and features guest appearances from BTS, Jacob Collier, Selena Gomez, and We Are KING.

The sixth full-length studio release for Machine Gun Kelly was produced by Travis Barker features guest appearances from Landon Barker, blackbear, Bring Me The Horizon, Iann Dior, Gunna, Lil Wayne, Willow, and Young Thug.

recordname: Mount Ninji and Da Nice Time Kid
description: The fourth full-length studio release for the South African rave-rap trio features guest appearances from Jack Black, Lil Tommy Terror, Sen Dog, and Dita Von Teese.
The fifth full-length solo studio release for the pop artist features guest appearances from Alicia Keys and Chris Stapleton.
The first full-length studio release in over five years for the Canadian pop-rock artist features a guest appearance from Nicki Minaj.

The 19th full-length studio solo release for the former Beatles drummer features guest appearances by fellow bandmate Paul McCartney on bass on two tracks, ELO's Jeff Lynne, Greg Leisz, Eagles' Joe Walsh, and Don Was.
The Canadian singer-songwriter emerges from a period of inactivity with her first album of new material since 1997's 'Surfacing.' Frequent collaborator Pierre Marchand returns as producer.
Black Crowes frontman Chris Robinson takes leave from his band for this debut solo release.
The third full-length release for the Los Angeles rapper features guest appearances from Bricc Baby Shitro, Chris Brown, Dej Loaf, R. Kelly, Migos, Tinashe, Trey Songz, Usher, and Young Thug.
The third release for the indie rock band led by Jon McClure was produced by James Dring and Youth.
This is the third solo album for Jonathan Levi as Pop Levi.
This concise fourth album finds the New York band working with a new producer, Jagz Kooner (Sabres of Paradise).

The Georgia rapper formerly known as Tity Boi releases his debut album on Def Jam and it features guest appearances from Drake, John Legend, Lil Wayne, Nicki Minaj, Mike Posner, Scarface, The-Dream, and Kanye West.
Kele Okereke and Russell Lissack return with a new line-up for the indie rock band's fifth full-length release.
The fifth full-length studio release from the indie rock band led by Nathan Willett is its first with new drummer, Joe Plummer.

The Dave Pirner-led band's first album in eight years includes tracks recorded with the group's late bassist Karl Mueller as well as The Replacements' Tommy Stinson (who, yes, served as a replacement).
The Christmas album from the Australian pop artist features three originals and guest appearances from James Corden, Iggy Pop, and (with some technological help) Frank Sinatra.
This is the debut full-length release for the Nottingham indie pop quintet.
Emeli Sandé and Tinie Tempah appear as guests on the debut release from producer Timothy McKenzie.
The Scottish rock band's second album was produced by Gil Norton.
On its third album, Long Beach's indie rock quartet takes a more personal approach lyrically and gets a little more blues oriented musically--all while retaining its modern-rock sound.

The second album produced by John Goodmanson for Jaguar Love finds the band now just a duo comporised of ex-Blood Brothers/Pretty Girls Make Graves band members Johnny Whitney and Cody Votolato after J. Clark left the band in 2009.

These thirteen tracks mark just the third solo disc for the former Beach Boys songwriter, and include songs that Wilson has written over the past two decades. Paul McCartney, Eric Clapton and Elton John guest. (Sorry, no Snoop Dogg or Missy Elliott.)
Now backed by 50 Cent and his G-Unit, the duo of Prodigy and Havoc return with a follow-up to 2004's 'Amerikaz Nightmare.'
The fourth major label studio release for the Grammy-winning band includes influences of rock, hip-hop, gospel, and big band with guest appearances from Sara Bareilles and Chris Cornell.
'Darkel' marks the solo debut for Air's JB Dunckel.
The veteran British rockers take a detour into reggae on their latest release.
The first album in four years for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Guy Sigsworth and Joe Chiccarelli .
The singer's first album in five years finds her once again collaborating with producer Nicky Ryan and lyricist Roma Ryan, and includes three songs in her new made-up language Loxian.
The alternative rock group returns with its first album since 2003's Strays, with Dave Sitek joining the three original members on the Rich Costey-produced release.

This "lost album" from Modest Mouse was originally recorded in 1994 to be the band's debut album, but was eventually shelved. This release contains additional tracks recorded during the same time period as the original 'Sad Sappy Sucker.'
The latest project for Super Furry Animals' Gruff Rhys has him teaming up with Brazilian artist Tony Da Gatorra. The making of the album is the subject of the documentary, Seperado.
Lebanon-born, London-based 23-year-old singer-songwriter Michael Holbrook Penniman makes his debut with this campy LP produced by Greg Wells.
The second album for the alt-rock band was recorded in analog.
The fourth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Jacquire King and is its first without guitarist Chris Urbanowicz.
The latest solo release for the former guitarist of the Red Hot Chili Peppers was recorded at the same time as his collaboration with the Black Knights.

This is the fifth studio album for the one-time superstars, who now retain only the brothers Gallagher from their original lineup. Former Ride guitarist Andy Bell and Heavy Stereo bassist Gem Archer make their first studio appearances as members of the band, and in an Oasis first, all four members share in the songwriting.

The full-length studio debut for the Bronx rapper includes guest appearances from such artists as Ace Hood, Birdman, Diddy, Drake, DJ Khaled, Lil Wayne, Nicki Minaj, Ne-Yo, Rick Ross, Scarface, and Snoop Dogg.
The singer's second effort finds her teamed with Third Eye Blind leader (and current beau) Stephan Jenkins.

The first solo full-length studio release in over 30 years for the EDM music pioneer features guest appearances from Charli XCX, Mikky Ekko, Foxes, Kelis, Matthew Koma, Kylie Minogue, Sia, and Britney Spears.
The 10th full-length release for the Pittsburgh punk band and its first on Spinefarm Records.
This is the debut album from the British post-punk quartet.
Everclear leader Art Alexakis produced the band's first studio disc in three years, which finds him backed by four new band members and without a major-label contract.
The singer-songwriter's debut album finally hits the U.S. after making a stir internationally in 2005, propelled by the hit single "Bad Day." Mitchell Froom co-produced.

Liz Phair left Capitol Records in 2008. She released her latest batch of songs on the Internet in July 2010. The CD release includes the Girlysound Tapes, which are some of her earliest cassettes recordings.
The youngest brother of the Jonas Brothers, with the help of a backing band that comprises members from Prince's New Power Generation, releases his solo side project.
The sophomore album for the group led by the former singer/guitarist of Blink-182 and Box Car Racer, Tom DeLonge.
With such guests as Rick Ross and Chris Brown featured on her album, the R&B songstress's sophomore album contains both club hits and seductive ballads.
Natalie Imbruglia's second album is a follow-up to her 1998 international hit debut, 'Left Of The Middle.' Ian Stanley and Pascal Gabriel are among the producers working on this disc.
The Hives, Fall Out Boy, Elton John, Justin Timberlake and Nelly Furtado are among the guests on the prolific hip-hop producer's latest solo disc.
After the critical lashing for her previous pop-oriented album, the singer-songwriter enlisted John Alagia (Dave Matthews Band, John Mayer) to produce this follow-up set.
The debut album for the singer who appeared on the Flo Rida single "Right Round."
The born-again Christian rap-metal band returns with a follow-up to their 2001 hit 'Satellite.' Jason Truby replaces departed guitarist Marcos.
The latest album from the rapper Flo Rida features guest appearances by Georgi Kay, LMFAO, Sia, and Jennifer Lopez.
The Swedish dance-rock band brings the brilliance of new-wave revivalism to its new album.

The fourth full-length studio album for the rock pop band led by Adam Levine includes production from Benny Blanco, Max Martin, J.R. Rotem, Shellback, Ryan Tedder, Brian West, and a guest appearance by rapper Wiz Khalifa.
The third album for the multi-award winning country singer was again produced by Mark Bright.

Karen O, Tinted Windows bandmate Adam Schlesinger, Television guitarist Tom Verlaine, the Cardigans' Nina Persson, Tegan and Sara's Sara Quin, and Yeah Yeah Yeahs' guitarist Nick Zinner are some of the gust musicians on the former Smashing Pumpkins guitarist's follow-up to his 1998 solo debut, Let it Come Down.
The British psychedelic rock band's third album was produced by Tchad Blake and Chris Sheldon.
The debut album for the rapper includes such guests as Lil Wayne, T-Pain, Timbaland, and will.i.am.

The B.I.G. soundalike has managed to generate a great deal of buzz for his second solo disc, chiefly by being behind bars, where he's serving out a ten-year prison term resulting from a bad night on the town with P Diddy. The vocals on one track were literally phoned in from prison, while production is handled by Kanye West, Swizz Beatz, Just Blaze and more.
This mellow, soulful effort features backing from Booker T & the MG's as well as a single track with Crazy Horse.
The Britains Got Talent runner-up releases her debut album produced by Steve Mac.
The third album for the UK band was produced by Flood and Paul Hartnoll.
The third full-length studio release for the British folk rock band was produced by James Ford.
The second studio album by the British rapper features appearances by Ed Drewett, Fink, Emile Sande, and others.
The Welsh-born singer releases her follow-up to her 2004 debut, "Finally Woken."
The sixth full-length release for the country singer was produced by Michael Knox.

The fifth full-length studio release for the Grammy-nominated rapper features guest appearances from Curren$y, Ghost Loft, Juicy J, Nicki Minaj, Nas, Project Pat, Rick Ross, ScHoolboy Q, Snoop Dogg, Ty Dolla $ign, and Chevy Woods.
This double-disc live album was recorded on the band's farewell tour in Manchester in 2001. Among the 22 tracks are most of the group's hits, including "Sit Down," "Laid," and "Born of Frustration."
This is the second release for the Mike Skinner and The Music's Rob Harvey collaboration.

The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Tom Morello, Tim Commerford and Brad Wilk of Rage Against The Machine, Chuck D and DJ Lord of Public Enemy and B-Real of Cypress Hill was produced by Brendan O'Brien.
The second album for the British indie pop band is its first with a new lineup, which consists of Gwenno and Ani Saunders.
The seventh album for the California-based band.
This religion-themed concept album is the artist's first official release in 10 years under the Prince name.
The metal band's first studio album since 2000's "New Tattoo" includes the album title song, which is available for use in the game Rock Band.

Only guitarist Elliot Easton and keyboardist Greg Hawkes return from the Old Cars (well, actually, just the Cars), with frontman duties falling to Todd Rundgren after Ric Ocasek (wisely) said no. The album itself features three new studio tracks and a slew of re-recorded Cars classics.

The seventh studio release for the rapper and his second in 2014, features guest appearances from Boosie Badazz, Big K.R.I.T., Jay-Z, K. Michelle, Project Pat, R. Kelly, Snoop Dogg, Whole Slab, and Yo Gotti.

The brother-sister duo of Kellin and Taryn Manning was signed to a major-label deal in part on the strength of Taryn's burgeoning acting career, which has seen her in roles on TV's "Boston Public" as well as "crazy/beautiful" and "8 Mile."

Available in two different versions, the latest from Lou Reed is based on the writings of Edgar Allen Poe. The 2-CD set includes tracks with readings of Poe by various actors (such as Willem Dafoe, Steve Buscemi and Amanda Plummer), backed by Reed, while the single-disc set pulls only the more song-oriented pieces from the longer version. Hal Willner produces.
The English indie rock band return after a three-year hiatus with a new album.
Produced by David Sitek, the fourth full-length release for the Brazilian indie band is its first without bassist Adriano Cintra, who left the band in late 2011.
The hugely successful R&B group's first Arista release is typical Boyz II Men, meaning plenty of vocal harmonies and ballads.
The Northern Ireland rock band releases its first album in North America after featuring a track on the video game Guitar Hero: World Tour.
Carrie Underwood and Johnny Depp appear as guests on the rock band's first studio album of new music in 11 years.
The fourth release for the indie pop band led by Ryan McPhun was written after breaking up with his girlfriend and was inspired by the winter in Norway.
After several delays, the ninth full-length studio release for the rapper is set to be released on the same day as his concert film of the same name.
The debut album for the Miami-based artist features Lil Wayne, Nas and Rick Ross as guests.

recordname: The Chronicles Of Life And Death
description: The twentysomething pop-punkers attempt to move past their past TRL success with a more mature follow-up to 2002's 'Young And The Hopeless.'
The nipple-baring superstar's first album in three years features production from Dallas Austin, Babyface, Kanye West, and Jimmy Jam & Terry Lewis.
The trance DJ duo return with a two-disc mix set.
Exclusively released on Tidal, the album co-produced by Joshua A. M. Welton features guest appearances from Curly Fryz and The Voice contestant Judith Hill.
The second full-length release for the Los Angeles rock quintet led by Jesse Rutherford was produced by Justyn Pilbrow.
With the help of three of the surviving Funk Brothers, Phil Collins recorded some Motown favorites for his first studio album in nearly 10 years.
This debut album for the Los Angeles-based '80s revivalists will give your favorite indie rock critics another excuse to practice typing "Gang of Four."
This is the second full-length album for the Minnesota-born electronic artist.
The sophomore album for the crunk- and snap-influenced rapper features Arab and I-15.
The 13th full-length studio release (and sixth self-titled) for the Los Angeles alternative rock band was produced by Dave Sitek.
Staind returns with its sixth album, produced by Johnny K.
The debut full-length release for the Michigan rock band was recorded by Marlon Young, Al Sutton and Herschel Boone in Nashville and Michigan.
The fifth full-length release for the pop artist features guest appearances from Skip Marley, Migos, and Nicki Minaj.
The neo-soul singer-songwriter's belated third album includes a cover of Don Henley's "The Heart of the Matter."
The third album for the New York-based reggae artist was produced by David Kahne.
Executive produced by Diplo and Major Lazer, the debut release for rapper Snoop Dogg under his new name was influenced by reggae and dancehall.
The sophomore effort for the English quartet includes two tracks produced by the legendary (and allegedly homicidal) Phil Spector, with the remainder handled by John Leckie and Danton Suppie.
This is the debut acoustic album for Sean Lennon and his girlfriend Charlotte Kemp Muhl.
'Nightbird' marks the first disc of original songs from the duo of Andrew Bell and Vince Clarke in five years.

Three years after their sensational debut (and we don't use that adjective in the way that means "outstanding"), it turns out that they aren't schoolgirls, and they aren't lesbians. But what the Russian duo does have on this second album is Sting. Now that's edgy!

William Orbit, Mark Ronson, Lily Allen and the Pet Shop Boys are among the collaborators on Williams' eclectic seventh studio disc, which finds him experimenting (never a good sign) with electronica and even hip-hop.
The first post-Blink-182 recording for Tom DeLonge finds the singer-guitarist in a new group with members of The Offspring and The Distillers.

'Business Casual' is the debut LP for the dance-oriented Nebraska four-piece, who are frequently compared to some combination of Wire, XTC and Gang Of Four and don't sound an awful lot like any of the other bands on Saddle Creek's roster, save for maybe The Faint.
The nu-metal Florida quintet releases its sixth studio album; the first in more than a decade with the original lineup.
The English singer wrote half of the songs while at Ibiza.
UK pop star Robbie Williams follows the success of Sing When You're Winning with this, his fifth and most adult-sounding LP.
The legendary English prog-rock band releases its 21st studio album, the first to feature Canadian singer Benoit David.

The second posthumous release for the rapper features guest appearances from 21 Savage & 42 Dugg, Beam, Bizzy Banks, Chris Brown, Future, Kid Cudi, Kodak Black. Dua Lipa, Pharrell, Pusha T, Quavo, Rah Swish, Rick Ross, Takeoff, The-Dream, TRAVI, and Kanye West.
The latest solo release for the rock singer/producer was recorded on a laptop and integrates electronic music elements to rock and soul music.
The unfortunately-named Agoura Hills, Calif. rockers--now down to a trio after losing their bassist--return with a third album.
The Baltimore via North Carolina duo release their latest album.
Damon Albarn and Bootsy Collins guest on Norman Cook's fourth Fatboy Slim album, which includes a cover of "The Joker" by the Steve Miller Band.
The Grammy-winning artist follows her 2000 hit 'I Am Shelby Lynne' with ten new tracks produced by Glen Ballard (Dave Matthews Band, Alanis Morissette), including a cover of John Lennon's "Mother."
The 10th full-length release for the rapper was originally announced to be released in July 2020.
Produced by Roy Thomas Baker, this is the latest release from the progressive rock band with its new lead singer, Jon Davison.
The fourth album for the British pop singer features guest appearances by Armin van Buuren, Freemasons, and Junior Caldera.
The debut album from the British singer was produced by Jim Abbiss.

recordname: Animal Ambition: An Untamed Desire to Win
description: The first album in five years for the rapper features guest appearances from Guardan Banks, Jadakiss, Kidd Kidd, Mr. Probz, Prodigy, Schoolboy Q, Styles P., Trey Songz, and Yo Gotti.
Titled after his birth-given name, Soulja Boy's third album is filled with catchy hooks and speaker-busting beats, keeping him one of the most ringtone-ready recording artists in the rap game.
The British singer's fourth album features a song sampling David Bowie's 'Let's Dance.'

Once one of the top dance/electronica acts in the world, The Prodigy topped the UK charts in 1997 with 'The Fat of the Land' and then... nothing. Until now. After their 2002 comeback single "Baby's Got A Temper" flopped, Prodigy leader Liam Howlett scrapped the album in progress, jettisoned vocalists Keith Flint and Maxim Reality, and took a second stab at recording, enlisting Liam Gallagher, Twista and Juliette Lewis to sing, rap, and howl over what eventually became 'Always Outnumbered.'
Bring on the Comets is the third album from the Louisville, Kentucky natives.
The rapper's eighth album features Pharrell Williams, Cee-Lo Green, and Kanye West as guests.
The latest album for the singer features Brandy, Bun B, Missy Elliott, and Timberland as guests.

The Smiths' guitarist takes a turn at the microphone for the first time, handling vocal duties for his new band, The Healers. The lineup also includes Zak Starkey (son of Ringo Starr) on drums and Kula Shaker bassist Alonza Bevan.
Stung by a drug arrest and nasty rumors over the last few years, the diva finally emerges with her first album of new material in four years.
Her first English-language album since 2003 includes songs written by the Eurythmics' David A. Stewart, Linda Perry, and Ne-Yo.
The debut album for the band previously known as the Morning Benders was produced by Andrew Dawson.
The supergroup made up of the producer/DJs Axwell, Sebastian Ingrosso, and Steve Angello releases its first album together.
The Pope's prayers and speeches in English, Italian, Spanish, and Portuguese are set to a variety of music styles.
This is the first major label album for the winner of the eighth season of American Idol.
The second release in 2018 for the Atlanta rap artist features guest appearances from Cardi B, Kevin Gates, Gunna, Juice WRLD, Lil Baby, Offset, Playboi Carti, Trippie Redd, and Young Nudy.
The fifth album for Adam Young features guest appearances from Carly Rae Jepsen and Blink-182's Mark Hoppus.

recordname: Bat Out Of Hell III: The Monster Is Loose
description: This is the Loaf's third (and hopefully final) installment in his three-decade Bat Out Of Hell series.
The death of his father was an influence on the third album for the British singer and was produced by Bernard Butler.
Rick Rubin produced album number five for the Rivers Cuomo-led band.
The New Jersey rock band releases its latest album produced with John Shanks.
This is the third solo album for the former Verve frontman.
Kenny Chesney guests on '72 & Sunny,' the third solo disc for the Kid Rock protege.
The third album for the British quartet was produced by Mike Crossey.
The guitarist's first album of original material in four years includes collaborations with John Mayer, Steve Winwood and Billy Preston.
The second album for the British duo was written on tour and recorded in Spain and Germany.
The Northern California band's fifth album in ten years includes a cover of Bread's "Guitar Man."

Actress/singer J.Lo returns with 12 new tracks, including "Jenny from the Block," featuring guest appearances from Jadakiss and Styles. Lopez is also planning her first-ever tour in support of the album in 2003.
The 80s star returns with his first album in a dozen years.

The female UK synth pop duo of Client A and Client B (we presume those are pseudonyms, but one never knows) make their debut with this self-titled effort, the first release for the new record label from Depeche Mode's Andy Fletcher.
Mick Jagger, Joss Stone, Dave Stewart, Damian Marley, and A.R. Rahman make up this rock supergroup, showcasing a wide range of musical genres.
Singer-songwriters Jennifer Nettles and Kristian Bush make up the country music duo, and their fourth studio album is influenced by the "steampunk movement" in science fiction.
The 28-track release from Northern Irish singer-songwriter features songs about such topics as social media and the COVID-19 lockdown.
After the Spanish-only album "Como Ama Una Mujer" earlier this year, Jennifer Lopez returns with her latest English-language album.
The metal band returns after a seven-year recording hiatus with this new disc, produced by band leader Page Hamilton (the only original member here) with Jay Baumgardner and Charlie Clouser.
'Astronaut' marks first album by Duran Duran's original lineup since 1983's 'Seven And The Ragged Tiger.' Dallas Austin and Don Gilmore are among the producers.
The fifth full-length studio release for the Brooklyn indie-pop duo is their first on Harvest Records.
The actor's second solo album (and first in over a decade) finds him joined by Mary J. Blige, Common, Timbaland, Snoop Dogg, Twista, The Game, and more.
Jermaine Dupri co-produced the latest studio disc for his current girlfriend, the most-assuredly-not-20-year-old Janet Jackson. Nelly guests.
The fourth album for the R&B singer is her first album of new songs since 2004's "Concrete Rose."
Nelly returns with his sixth album, which is titled 5.0 in acknowledgement of his love of the Ford Mustang; it features collaborations with the Neptunes, Jermaine Dupri, Akon, and several others.
The second album from the Los Angeles-based power trio (coming a full six years after their 1995 debut, 'Magnosheen').
This is the first U.S. release for the popular Finnish goth-rock band (the initials stand for His Infernal Majesty) fronted by Ville Hermani Vallo.

recordname: Rise And Fall, Rage And Grace
description: The first album in over four years for the California punk band was produced by Bob Rock.

One-half of the superstar production duo The Neptunes, Pharrell steps into the limelight with this long-delayed solo debut, which mixes both rap and R&B and includes collaborations Kanye West, Gwen Stefani, and Jay-Z.
This is the first solo album for the former member of Luscious Jackson and Kostars.
The fourth album for the British indie rock band was produced by Tom Rothrock.

The singer known for being constantly steeped in controversy turns the spotlight back on music with up-tempo R&B on his latest 13-track release, cowriting the majority of the record and incorporating a synth-pop sound.
Despite her burgeoning solo career, Beyonce Knowles has rejoined bandmates Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams for the first Destiny's Child album in 3 years.
The Grammy Award-nominated singer's sophomore release is full of pop-rock gems and features guest appearances from Snoop Dogg and Rivers Cuomo.
Big Boi, Timbaland and Rodney Jerkins are among the producers for J.Lo's first album in three years. Other guests include Fat Joe, Fabolous and Marc Anthony.

Best known as the co-creator of MTV's cult hit sock puppet show "Sifl and Olly," Liam Lynch has also studied music at Paul McCartney's academy and is a published writer. 'Fake Songs,' his first album, includes "United States of Whatever" (the most popular song from S&O and now a minor alternative radio hit) and such tracks as "Fake David Bowie Song," "Fake Pixies Song," and "Fake Depeche Mode Song."
This is the full-length debut for the London band led by 22-year-old Dominic Masters.
The album of songs about a rocky love affair was recorded in 2006 (before Scarlett's 2008 covers album).
The second album for the tongue-in-cheek rock duo of Jack Black and Kyle Gass serves as the soundtrack to their movie of the same name.
The second full-length release for the Irish rock quartet was produced by Jacknife Lee.
Fourteen years since their last studio record, the Kids are back with their newest album on the Interscope label.

recordname: Come Home the Kids Miss You
description: The second full-length studio release for Kentucky rapper Jack Harlow features guest appearances from Drake, Lil Wayne, Justin Timberlake, and Pharrell Williams.
The Irv Gotti-created superstar returns with a quick follow-up to her hit 2002 self-titled debut.
The sophomore release for the Brooklyn rapper features appearances by the ubiquitous Missy Elliott, Ashanti, M.O.P., Mary J. Blige and Snoop Dogg.
The King of Pop's first full album of new material since 1992's 'Dangerous' features 16 tracks.
The fourth album for the Miami-based rapper is his first on J Records and features such guests as Akon and Lil Jon.
The third album for the Quebecois punk-pop band was produced by Dave Fortman, Danjahandz, and Max Martin.
The fifth full-length release for the British grime rapper features guest appearances from Bun B, Jessie J, Sean Kingston, Tinie Tempah, will.i.am, and Robbie Williams.
This is the solo debut for the former frontman of Suede and The Tears.

The debut release for the British singer/rapper who appeared on the 2010 UK version of the X Factor show was produced by RedOne. The US edition has two songs that are different than the UK 2011 release.
Drummer Terry Bozzio only features in half of the tracks on Korn's eighth album, which ends their current contract with Virgin.
Mary J. Blige, Ginuwine, Juelz Santana, Timbaland, Pharrell, and other stars guest on the latest release from the veteran rapper known to his parents as James Todd Smith.
The New York indie four-piece team up with, of all people, producers The Matrix on this follow-up to 'Electric Sweat.'

Liz Phair left Capitol Records in 2008. She released her latest batch of songs on the Internet in July 2010. The CD release includes the Girlysound Tapes, which are some of her earliest cassettes recordings.

The sixth full-length studio release for the French DJ/producer features guest appearances from Afrojack, Ladysmith Black Mambazo, John Legend, Magic!, Sam Martin, Nicki Minaj, Nico & Vinz, Bebe Rexha, Emeli Sandé, The Scipt, Sia, and Ryan Tedder.
The R&B singer's first album in four years was produced by Gregg Pagani (LeAnn Rimes, Will Smith).
Chris "Frenchie" Smith produces the Australian hard rock band's third album.
The ninth full-length studio album for the punk rock band was produced by Bob Rock.
The first tribute collection of Kinks covers featuring participation from the leader who penned the pop hits himself -- Ray Davies.

Looper's third album (and first for Mute Records) finds Stuart David & co. adopting a darker tone for these ten tracks, which are closely integrated with the band's new live show and promotional materials to tell the story of two characters named Evil Bob and Peacock Johnson.
The English post-grunge group release their fifth studio album, produced by Bob Rock.
The second full-length release for the rapper features guest appearaces from 21 Savage, G-Eazy, Swae Lee, Nicki Minaj, Ty Dolla $ign, and YG.
The American Music Club frontman's latest solo release, like 2001's 'Invisible Man,' finds him dabbling with electronica.
The debut album for the 10th season American Idol winner was produced by Mark Bright.

recordname: I Am Not a Human Being II
description: 2 Chainz, Drake, Future, Soulja Boy, and Trina are some of the guests on the 10th full-length studio release for the New Orleans rapper.

Little LeAnn Rimes, the former 13-year-old country sensation, has been remade as a teen pop star with this latest release, thanks to a new team of producers and songwriters. But will the teen pop buyers of the world accept the new LeAnn Rimes? If only we had the time to worry about such things.

A double album of previously unreleased tracks from the late rapper Tupac Shakur, bringing his total of posthumous releases to four (with a fifth planned for Fall 2001). The songs were recorded during the sessions for 1996's 'Makaveli.'
The 13th album from the group formed in San Francisco is its first in more than four years.
The second full-length studio release from the British grime artist features guest appearances from Katy B, Diane Birch, Etta Bond, Chasing Grace, Ed Sheeran, and Wretch 32.
Producer Mutt Lange returns to produce the Canadian hard rock band's seventh release, having previously worked on its 2008 album Dark Horse.
The Essex-born pop singer, Jessie "J" Cornish, makes her debut and has already created a buzz as the the recent Brit's "Critics Choice" winner.
The fourth full-length solo release for the former Verve lead singer was co-produced with Chris Potter.
The full-length debut for the Athens, Georgia, indie rock band named after a character from the animated series Rugrats was produced by Ben H. Allen.
The British rock band's third album was produced by Justin Gerrish.
The debut album for the British singer/actress has already spawned a number one single in the UK.
The sophomore album for the dance pop group includes guest appearances by Snoop Dogg, R Kelly, Missy Elliot, and Polow da Don.
The Omaha, Nebraska alt-rockers return with an eighth album.

Wu Tang Clan's Clifford Smith (aka Method Man) interrupts his budding acting career to return with his first solo disc in five years (and fourth overall). The guest roster includes Missy Elliott, Ludacris, Snoop Dogg, Ghostface, Redman, Busta Rhymes and RZA.
This second solo disc for the G-Unit rapper includes contributions from 50 Cent, Young Buck and Mobb Deep.
Working once again with producer Rob Schnapf (Beck, Guided By Voices, Elliot Smith), the Aussies return with a second LP.

The guitarist for the legendary Manchester outfit The Stone Roses emerges with his very first solo album (after the breakup of his less successful second band, the Seahorses). It also marks the first appearance of Squire as a vocalist, as he sings on each of these 10 tracks.
'Lions' continues to build on the sound established in 1999's 'By Your Side,' with this outing produced by Don Was.
The latest solo release from the Fiery Furnaces musician was inspired by the low-budget films made by smaller Hollywood studios between the 1920s and the 1950s.

The second full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Jban$2Turnt, K$upreme, Lil Baby, Lil Pump, Offset, PnB Rock, Quavo, Tee Grizzley, Trippie Redd, Ugly God, and YoungBoy Never Broke Again.
The actress' second album rocks a bit more than her first, and includes covers of songs by Cheap Trick and Stevie Nicks.
The actor and MC reunites with DJ Jazzy Jeff for several tracks on his ninth album, which also includes appearances from Mary J. Blige, Timbaland and Snoop Dogg.
This is the third album for the two sets of brother and sisters produced Romeo Stodart with Valgeir Sigurosson.
The ninth full-length studio release for the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from Beyonce, Skylar Grey, Alicia Keys, Kehlani, Phresher, Pink, Ed Sheeran, and X Ambassadors.

recordname: More Than You Think You Are
description: Still lowercase, the alt-rock band led by Rob Thomas (who is perhaps more famous for "Smooth" on Santana's 1999 album) returns with their third album, the first on which the band shared songwriting duties as a unit.
Fraser T. Smith produced the debut album from the British singer who was discovered on MySpace.
The former Blondie lead singer releases her fifth solo album.
The eighth studio album for the alternative rock band The Dandy Warhols was produced with Jeremy Sherrer.
The debut album for the rock project from Kid Cudi and producer Dot da Genius features Empire of the Sun as special guests.
Going on 15 years of recording, the once-popular Ed Kowalczyk & co. return with a follow-up to 2003's 'Birds Of Pray.'

This ten-track release (officially, an E.P.) contains remixes drawn from the French duo's 2001 album '10,000 Hz. Legend.' There are three versions each of "Don't Be Light," "People In The City," and "How Does It Make You Feel," as well as the previously unreleased "The Way You Look Tonight."
The sixth studio album from these pop-punk rockers reveals more than their typical teen-angst-ridden side, with topics ranging from married life to ballads about fatherhood.
Stephen Street produced this more ska-oriented sophomore release for the Brighton, England outfit.
The Boston-based punk-metal outfit returns with a third studio LP, produced by David Botrill (Tool).
The fourth album for the metal band from Illinois was produced by Dave Fortman.
This self-released follow-up to '99 Cents' finds the German group joined by Spain's The No Heads.
The eighth studio release for the pop singer includes guest appearances from her sister Jamie Lynn, T.I., and will.i.am.
The 12th studio release for the New Jersey rock band was produced with Jon Shanks.

Originally intended as an underground mixtape, this Eminem-curated disc--which includes 7 songs performed by Mr. Mathers himself, as well as cuts featuring 50 Cent, Lloyd Banks, Obie Trice and Bizarre--wound up with an official release.
Ed Kowalczyk & co. return for their sixth album, produced by Jim Wirt (Incubus, Something Corporate).

The band that gave us alt-radio hit "6 Underground" returns with a third album, although their second (1999's 'Splinter') failed to secure U.S. distribution. Guitarist Chris Corner now handles lead vocals, replacing the departed Kelli Dayton.
The third solo album for the producer features appearances by Brandy, Miley Cyrus, Chris Daughtry, Drake, The Fray, Keri Hilson, Chad Kroeger, Katy Perry, and Justin Timberlake.
The third studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from such artist as 2 Chainz, Chris Brown, Jadakiss, Lil Wayne, Rick Ross, Game, and Wiz Khalifa.

recordname: The Bridge: Concept of a Culture
description: The first studio album from the rapper in over 20 years features guests such as Big Daddy Jane, Busta Rhymes, KRS One, Q-Tp, and Snoop Dogg.
The punk pop band releases its fifth studio album.

This unusual double-disc set pairs two albums with almost identical tracklistings. One (the "Dublin Sessions") is an acoustic set, while the second disc ("London Sessions") was recorded with a full band.

The fourth solo studio release for the Black Eyed Peas members includes guest appearances from Justin Bieber, Chris Brown, Miley Cyrus, Skylar Grey, Nicole Scherzinger, Eva Simons, and Britney Spears.

recordname: Chocolate Starfish and the Hot Dog Flavored Water

description: The Canadian rock band releases its sixth album produced with Mutt Lange.
The Detroit party-rockers return with a third album.
The third studio album from Adam Young's Minnesota-based one-man band is melodic synth-pop laptop electronica.
The singer-songwriter (formerly of The Moldy Peaches) follows his acclaimed set 'Friends Of Mine' with this disc produced by Dan Myers.
Backed by a three-piece band called Zazou, the debut release for the former Razorlight frontman was recorded in France before receiving more production work Trevor Horn.
The seventh full-length studio release for the R&B singer was dedicated to his wife, Paula Patton.
The debut full-length release for the rapper features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, $teven Cannon, Diplo, and YG.
The debut full-length collaboration between Sting and Shaggy features contributions from DJ Agent Sasco, Aidonia, Morgan Heritage, Dominic Miller, and Robbie Shakespeare.

recordname: Take A Look In The Mirror
description: The California nu-metal band offers a back-to-basics approach on this sixth LP.
The debut album from the new singer was packaged together with two albums by her producer, Prince.
The New York rapper's second album features guest appearances by former Destiny's Child member LeToya Luckett, Ky-Mani Marley, Tech N9ne, J. Holiday, and Nice & Smooth.
The fourth full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter includes production from Steve Mac, Tom Rothrock, Ryan Tedder, and Martin Terefe.
This is the first full-length album for the San Francisco-based duo of Will Schwartz and Tomo Yasuda.
Miley breaks free from her role as Hannah Montana on Disney with a third CD of big ballads and dance beats.
This is the debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie rock quintet led by Jesse Rutherford.
Eminem, 50 Cent, and Nate Dogg are among the guests on the Detroit rapper's second release.
This third album for the Brooklyn five-piece post-punk/dance-punk outfit was produced by Max Heyes (Ocean Colour Scene, Doves).

recordauthor: Faith Evans and the Notorious B.I.G.
description: Busta Rhymes, Jadakiss, Lil' Kim, Mama Wallace (Biggie's mother), Snoop Dogg, Styles P, and Jamal Woolard are some of the guests on the Faith Evans album that integrate some of the late rapper's material from previously released tracks into the 25-track release.
Guests on the R&B outfit's latest include Jack Johnson, Justin Timberlake and James Brown.
The Boulder, Colorado-based duo's third album of house party hits and pulsating electro-pop features Ke$ha as a special guest.

It's been three years since Uffie took the electro underground music scene by storm with her beats and rhymes. Her much anticipated new album promises to deliver even more modern dance club music and dubstep jams.
The ex-Bush frontman returns with his first solo album produced by Bob Rock.

Executive produce by Rick Rubin, artists such as Baauer, Bonobo, Flying Lotus, Galantis, Kaskade, Royksopp and Rustie include sounds and/or dialogue from the Star Wars films on 15 tracks for this electronic compilation.
The California band releases its sixth full-length studio album of soulful alternative rock.
The third album from the UK group was self-produced by the band.
The veteran singer jams through covers of songs by the likes of Neil Young, Bob Dylan, and, er, Sister Sledge.
The band's fifth album was produced by David Bottrill (Tool).
The debut solo pop release for the Glee actress includes production from Chris Braide, Kuk Harrell, Anne Preven, John Shanks, and Stargate.

The seventh full-length release for the Los Angeles pop-rock band led by Adam Levine features guest appearances from Bantu, blackbear, H.E.R., Juice WRLD, Megan Thee Stallion, Stevie Nicks, Nipsey Hussle, and YG.

The Long Beach ska rock band, which disbanded in 1996 after the death of Bradley Nowell, returns with a new lead singer in Rome Ramirez on the debut album for newly renamed trio produced by Paul Leary of the Butthole Surfers.
The 14th studio album for the rock band features Tim McGraw on one track.
The third full-length release for the Las Vegas rock band features production from Alex da Kid, Jayson DeZuzio, John Hill, Joel Little, and Mattman & Robin.
The rapper from Brooklyn releases her much-delayed follow-up to 2001's "Broken Silence."
The album following The E.N.D., The Beginning is the sixth studio album from the hip-hop, dance-pop quartet.
The dance pop duo are back with their sophomore album of party anthems.
The New Zealand rockers return with a second album, produced by Led Zeppelin's John Paul Jones.
The Canadian rock band releases their fifth album of catchy punk songs and even some crossover pop jams.
This is the first album-length collaboration for the married duo of Animal Collective's Avey Tare and Mum's Kria Brekkan. No, you are not crazy; every song is indeed (intentionally) played backwards.

recordname: Everybody Wants To Be On TV
description: Andy Green returns as producer for the second album for the British indie rock band.
Once upon a time a Christian rock singer, the now-pop singer releases her second album, produced by the likes of Butch Walker, Dr. Luke, Max Martin, Dave Stewart, and Greg Wells.
Rooney's third album is its first on the band's own label and the last with bassist Matt Winter, who left the band to pursue a career in medicine.
The fifth album for the rock band from Illinois, who's single 'Hey There Delilah' (off their 2005 album "All That We Needed" and re-released as a single in 2007) was nominated for a Grammy in 2008.
The sophomore album for the Southern California-based group.
This third album for the Murder Inc. singer includes an appearance from Ja Rule.
This long-delayed fourth album sees the New York garage rockers jumping to a new label.
The first new studio album for the rock band led by Tom Scholz in 11 years includes three songs (2 are remixed songs from 2002's Corporate America) from the late-Brad Delp.
The spastic, Michigan electro-rock trio returns with a second, slightly more accessible, full-length.
This is the debut full-length release for the Irish rock quartet.

What could possibly be more relevant in 2003 than an 80s band covering their favorite hits of the 60s, 70s, and 80s? Tracks here include Peter Gabriel's "Solsbury Hill," Buddy Holly's "Everday," and The Buggles' "Video Killed the Radio Star."
The latest from the New York-based techno guru eschews samples for live instrumentation and vocals (by the bald one himself), and is backed by a second disc of ambient works.
Margins is the solo debut from Maximo Park frontman Paul Smith. Spirited.
This is the second album for the South London four-piece.
Jennifer Lopez returns after twins with a deeply personal seventh album, featuring collaborations with The-Dream and Tricky Stewart, Pitbull, and RedOne.

The actor/rapper's first release in four years features guest appearances from such artists as Travis Barker, Bootsy Collins, Chuck D, Monica, Tom Morello, Brad Paisley, Seal, Snoop Dogg, Eddie Van Halen, and Charlie Wilson.
The Welsh band's sixth album was coproduced by Kelly Jones and Jim Lowe.
The first album in eight years for the punk rock group was produced by Ed Stasium.
The sixth album for the Portland, Oregon, rockers includes guest appearances by Dire Strait's Mark Knopfler and the Heartbreakers' guitarist Mike Campbell.

The country-inspired release from the DJ/producer features guest appearances from Danielle Bradbery, Blanco Brown, Zac Brown, Ben Burgess, Cam, Clever, Noah Cyrus, Jonas Brothers, Julia Michaels, Orville Peck, Thomas Rhett, Morgan Wallen, and Young Thug.
The first album in three years from the always bizarre Texans includes about two-thirds of the tracks from their unreleased 1998 effort "After The Astronaut."
The seventh full-length release for the rock band features guest appearances from Kiiara, Pusha T and Stormzy.
The second full-length release for Miami rapper features guest appearances from the 2 Chainz, Lil Uzi Vert, Lil Wayne, Offsett, Quavo, Smokepurpp, Kanye West & YG.
This EP of remixed and extended versions of songs from the album Burst Apart features guest spots from Neon Indian, Bear in Heaven, and Nicole Atkins.
The London-based pop singer's debut album.
Lou Reed and Metallica collaborated on this two-disc set of music based on Frank Wedekind's LuLu plays.

Kanye West and Pharrell Williams are among the producers for the rapper's follow-up to 2004's 'The New Danger.' This version of the album is no longer officially available for sale; a second version with new artwork and a new tracklisting will be released in the spring of 2007.
The majority of the songs on Carlos Santana's first album on the Starfaith label is instrumental.

recordname: Guitar Heaven: The Greatest Guitar Classics of All Time
description: Chris Cornell, Scott Weiland, Rob Thomas, India.Aire, Chris Daughtry, Nas, Chester Bennington, Joe Crocker, Gavin Rossdale, Pat Monahan, Yo-Yo Ma, Johnny Lang, Ray Manzarek and Jacoby Shaddix guest on the Clive Davis-produced covers album featuring Santana.
The third studio album (under the Billy Talent name) for the Canadian band was produced by Brendan O'Brien.
The UK's singer-songwriter returns with an album of crooning love-tinged lyrical gems sung over melodious piano chords and guitars.
The eigth studio release for the pop singer features guest appearances from French Montana, Iggy Azalea, Pitbull, Rick Ross, and T.I.
Superstar of the early MTV era, Cyndi Lauper is still a girl who just wants to have fun on her new album, featuring her unique style of sultry singing and guest appearances by BB King and Jonny Lang.
'Blood' represents the New York rapper's attempt to lash back at 50 Cent, who has spent the better part of the past year targeting Rule.
The sophomore album for the New York rap group features Young Buck.

Why change a successful formula? Once again, the guitarist finds himself paired with a variety of all-star guests, including Michelle Branch, Joss Stone, Sean Paul, Aerosmith's Steven Tyler, Big Boi and Mary J. Blige.
The eighth full-length studio release for the Southern California alternative rock band was co-produced by Dave Sardy and Sonny John Moore (aka Skrillex), who also mixed the album.
"How A Woman Loves," J.Lo's first Spanish-language disc, is co-written and co-produced by her husband, Marc Anthony.
This limited-edition release from the Blur frontman consists of 14 original solo demos (recorded in hotel rooms during a recent tour) spread over four sides, each one clearly a work in progress.
Twins Joel and Benji Madden lead the Maryland pop-punk outfit through 13 tracks on this delayed fourth album.
The 12th album for rock singer/actor Meat Loaf was produced by Paul Crook and features guest appearances by Chuck D, Lil John, Mark McGrath, John Rich, and Patti Russo.
The D12 member's debut set features appearances by Big Boi, Raphael Saadiq, Erick Sermon and Obie Trice and production from Eminem and Hi Tek.
The fourth album for the Australian band is their first on the Ivy League Records label.
The posthumous release for the controversial Florida rapper features a guest appearance from Kanye West.
Guy Blakeslee who originally recorded under the name Entrance, with Derek W. James and Paz Lenchantin contributing, they now credit themselves The Entrance Band.
The fourth album for the Jamaican artist was produced by Stephen "Di Genius" McGregor.
'Weirdness' is the first album for the legendary rock band--which, yes, includes frontman Iggy Pop--since 1973. The remaining original lineup is supplemented by Minutemen bassist Mike Watt.
The debut full-length solo release for the One Direction member features guest appearances from A Boogie Wit da Hoodie, J. Balvin, Jonas Blue, Cheat Codes, Rita Ora, Quavo, Lennon Stella, and Zedd.
This is the second album for the London-based electronica duo.
After proving that all that Glitters is not gold, can the best-selling female artist of the 1990s manage a hit in the 21st century?
The legendary rappers' first album since 1993's 'Down With The King' includes guest appearances from Limp Bizkit's Fred Durst, Third Eye Blind's Stephen Jenkins and Sugar Ray.
Brad Wood returns to produce the Australian singer's seventh studio album.
The debut full-length release for the electronic duo of Alex Pall and Drew Taggart features guest appearances from Jhené Aiko, Coldplay, Florida Georgia Line, Louane, and Emily Warren.
The second album by "singer" Ashlee Simpson was produced by John Shanks.
Kravitz handled virtually all of the instruments for this seventh album, which features a guest appearance from Jay-Z on the track "Storm."
The latest solo album for the singer/guitarist was produced by Timberland and Jerome "J-Roc" Harmon.
This is the second album for the Birmingham, England-based rock band.

recordname: It Had to Be You... The Great American Songbook
description: With a title like that, you pretty much know what to expect from Mr. Stewart on this outing, which includes standards such as "They Can't Take That Away from Me" and "I'll Be Seeing You." To make matters worse, Dave Koz and Arturo Sandoval guest.
The follow-up to Souljboytellem.com was produced with producer Mr. Collipark and Polow Da Don.
The debut album for Paul Rogers as the lead singer is Queen's first album of new material in more than 10 years.
The Oakland rapper's debut full-length studio release features such guest artists as 2 Chainz, Diplo, and Kid Cudi.
The first release of new material from the punk band founded by Greg Ginn since 1985 includes Ron Reyes and new drummer Gregory Amoore.
Timbaland, Jermaine Dupri, and Kwame are among the producers on the rapper's third album, which also includes an appearance by Three 6 Mafia.
The first release away from Roadrunner Records for the metal band led Dave Mustaine was produced by Johnny K.
The Canadian alt-metal outfit returns with a self-produced fourth album.
The alt-metal band returns with a follow-up to their 2001 megahit, 'Break The Cycle.'
'A Lively Mind' is the second artist album for the veteran DJ, producer and remixer. Guest vocalists include actress Brittany Murphy, Pharrell Williams and Grandmaster Flash.
This is the first album in five years for the boy- er... man-band.

The far-from-prolific singer-songwriter's fourth album finds a 36-year-old Liz Phair trying to be... Avril Lavigne? Yes, her sound has changed quite a bit since her acclaimed 1993 debut 'Exile in Guyville,' taking on a glossy pop sheen on this release, thanks to production by the Matrix (as well as Michael Penn and Pete Yorn, we might add--but the Matrix????).

To celebrate the 10th anniversary of her debut, 'Jagged Little Pill,' the Canadian singer-songwriter has re-recorded all of that album's songs using acoustic instruments. (It's certainly easier than writing new songs!)
The third album for the R&B singer features Game, Lil Wayne, Lupe Fiasco, Plies, Swizz Beatz, Trey Songz, Eva Simons, and Tank as his guest singers.
This is the debut album for the collaboration between Atlanta rapper Gucci Mane and Bay Area-based V-Nasty.
The British band, formed by former Verve frontman Richard Ashcroft, features production by hip-hop virtuoso No ID and crosses musical genre borders.
Three former members of Jane's Addiction--including guitarist Dave Navarro--are joined by singer Steve Isaacs for this new project.

The debut full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from A Boogie wit da Hoodie, Anuel AA, Gunna, Tory Lanez, Lil Baby, Nicki Minaj, Murda Beatz, Bobby Shmurda, DJ Spinking, TrifeDrew, and Kanye West.
The fifth album for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Sabrina Antoinette, Big Sean, Nas, Kevin McCall, Sevyn, and Wiz Khalifa.
The Nirvana-esque four-piece returns with a follow-up to their 2001 major-label debut 'Come Clean.'
The sophomore album for the quartet from San Diego.
The debut full-length release for the pop singer-songwriter who co-wrote the Wiz Khalifa song See You Again, features guest appearances from Selena Gomez and Meghan Trainor.
On his seventh album called Rebirth, Lil Wayne fuses rock with his rap lyrical flow and features guest appearances from Eminem, Shanell (aka SNL), Kevin Rudolf, Nicki Minaj, and others.
The UK dance trio returns with a sophomore release, adding more guitars into the mix in the process.
Phil Collins returns with his first album of new material in six years, but will anyone care other than the guys on South Park?
The debut album for the British pop rock band, which was originally known as Brother, was produced by Stephen Street.

The critics were not kind to this follow-up to 'Chocolate Starfish...,' which sees the band with a new guitarist (who won the slot in a competition held at various Guitar Centers!) replacing the departed Wes Borland.
Now that Britney has dumped him, all he has is his music. Ouch.
